Others are joined by means of spot welding a process in which separate pieces of material are fused with pressure and heat,Relevant
Other components are arc welded using one of three methods,Relevant
In the first method known as MIG (metalarc inert gas) welding a coil of thin wire is threaded through a handheld gun,Relevant
A hose is connected from a tank of inert gas (usually argon) to the tip of the guns nozzle,Relevant
A machine generating electrical current is attached to the wire in the gun and the work piece,Relevant
When the guns trigger is pulled the wire rod moves feeding toward the work piece and the gas is released creating an atmosphere at the point where the wire arcs with the metal,Relevant
This allows the joining of the parts,Relevant
The second arc welding method is known as stick welding,Irrelevant
In this process a thin rod approximately 12 inches long 187 inch thick (30 centimeters long 47 centimeter thick) and coated with a flux material is placed into a handheld holder,Relevant
This holder is attached to a machine generating an electrical charge,Irrelevant
Also connected to the machine is a grounding cable that has an end clamped to the part to be welded,Irrelevant
When the rod is close to the parts an arc is struck generating intense heat that melts the rod and flux,Relevant
The flux acts as a cleanser allowing the rod material to adhere to both pieces of metal,Irrelevant
The welder drags the rod along the seams of the metal while maintaining its distance from the seam to allow the arc to remain constant,Irrelevant
The third arc welding method used to assemble the incubator is TIG (tungstenarc inert gas) welding a combination of stick and MIG welding,Irrelevant
In this process a stationary tungsten rod without any flux is inserted into a handheld gun,Relevant
Inert gas flows from a tank through the guns nozzle,Relevant
When the trigger is pulled the gas creates an atmosphere as the tungsten rod strikes its arc the two parts fuse together without any filler metal,Relevant
At this point the case may be painted to further provide surface protection both inside and outside (the inner chamber is never painted),Relevant
The box is spray painted usually with an electrostatically charged powder paint,Relevant
This process requires that a small electrical charge be applied so that it will attract the powder particles which have been given an opposite charge,Irrelevant
After the case is sprayed it is moved into an oven that melts the powder particles causing them to adhere to the freshly cleaned metal surface,Relevant
This process is very clean efficient and environmentally friendly and the highquality paint resists most laboratory spills,Irrelevant
Next the innerchamber is wrapped with insulation (either blanket batting or hardboard) placed inside the case and secured,Relevant
If the unit is waterjacketed the jacket is placed inside the case and the chamber inside the jacket,Irrelevant
A sheet metal door is constructed using methods similar to that mentioned above,Relevant
While the sheet metal cabinetry is being fabricated a control panel is being assembled elsewhere in the factory,Relevant
Following detailed electrical prints electricians fasten different colored wire of varying thicknesses to electrical devices,Relevant
The color scheme helps technicians to diagnose problems quickly and the various thicknesses allow for safe and efficient transfer of lower and higher voltages,Relevant
Purchased electrical devices such as fuse blocks switches terminal blocks and relays adhere to strict electrical codes,Irrelevant
Finally the wires from the control panel are attached to the control devices (onoff switches or microprocessors) and the electromechanical devices (fan motor lights and heaters),Relevant
The incubator now has its inner glass and the outer solid door attached and shelving and supplemental features are installed,Relevant
Each unit is 100 percent functionally tested,Irrelevant
The parameters for each test are set to verify the units performance against advertised specifications or the customers requests whichever is more stringent,Irrelevant
Problems are corrected and the equipment is retested,Relevant
A copy of the test result is kept on file and the original sent to the customer,Relevant
The incubator receives a thorough cleaning inside and out,Relevant
Shelves are removed and packaged separately and the doors are taped closed,Relevant
A brace is positioned under the door to help prevent sagging,Relevant
Next each unit is secured to a wooden skid and a corrugated cardboard box is placed around the case,Relevant
Packing filler is put inbetween the carton and the case,Relevant
Finally the product is shipped,Relevant
The steel or aluminum body is die cast in halves,Irrelevant
Die casting involves pouring molten metal into a steel die of the desired shape and letting the metal harden,Relevant
As it cools the metal assumes the same shape as the die,Irrelevant
At this time an optional chromium coating can be applied to the interior surfaces of the halves that correspond to a completed missiles cavity,Irrelevant
The halves are then welded together and nozzles are added at the tail end of the body after it has been welded,Irrelevant
Moveable fins are now added at predetermined points along the missile body,Relevant
The fins can be attached to mechanical joints that are then welded to the outside of the body or they can be inserted into recesses purposely milled into the body,Relevant

The propellant must be carefully applied to the missile cavity in order to ensure a uniform coating as any irregularities will result in an unreliable burning rate which in turn detracts from the performance of the missile,Relevant
The best means of achieving a uniform coating is to apply the propellant by using centrifugal force,Relevant
This application called casting is done in an industrial centrifuge that is wellshielded and situated in an isolated location as a precaution against fire or explosion,Irrelevant
The principal laser components—the photo detecting sensor and optical filters—are assembled in a series of operations that are separate from the rest of the missiles construction,Relevant

Circuits that support the laser system are then soldered onto preprinted boards extra attention is given to optical materials at this time to protect them from excessive heat as this can alter the wavelength of light that the missile will be able to detect,Relevant
The assembled laser subsystem is now set aside pending final assembly,Relevant
The circuit boards for the electronics suite are also assembled independently from the rest of the missile,Relevant
If called for by the design microchips are added to the boards at this time,Relevant

The guidance system (laser components plus the electronics suite) can now be integrated by linking the requisite circuit boards and inserting the entire assembly into the missile body through an access panel,Relevant
The missiles control surfaces are then linked with the guidance system by a series of relay wires also entered into the missile body via access panels,Relevant

The photo detecting sensor and its housing however are added at this point only for beam riding missiles in which case the housing is carefully bolted to the exterior diameter of the missile near its rear facing backward to interpret the laser signals from the parent aircraft,Relevant
Insertion of the warhead constitutes the final assembly phase of guided missile construction,Irrelevant
Great care must be exercised during this process as mistakes can lead to catastrophic accidents,Irrelevant
Simple fastening techniques such as bolting or riveting serve to attach the warhead without risking safety hazards,Relevant
For guidance systems that homein on reflected laser light the photo detecting sensor (in its housing) is bolted into place at the tip of the warhead,Relevant
On completion of this final phase of assembly the manufacturer has successfully constructed on of the most complicated sophisticated and potentially dangerous pieces of hardware in use today,Relevant
First ingredients are loaded into one of two machines a tumbling blender or a ribbon blender,Relevant
The tumbling blender shaped like a rectangular box is turned and shaken from outside by a machine while the ribbon blender is a cylinder fitted with blades to scrape and mix the ingredients,Relevant
After the ingredients inside the blender have been mixed a doorway at the bottom of the bowl is opened,Relevant
With the blender still agitating the ingredients the mix is allowed to run out onto a conveyor belt or other channeling device,Relevant
The belt then moves the detergent to another area of the factory where it can be dropped into boxes or cartons for delivery to wholesalers or distributors,Relevant
In this method dry ingredients for a detergent are first fed into a large machine known as a Shuggi agglomerator (Shuggi is the manufacturer),Relevant
Inside the agglomerator sharp whirling blades mix the material to a fine consistency the process resembles food being textured inside a food processor,Relevant
After the dry ingredients have been blended liquid ingredients are sprayed on the dry mix through nozzles fitted into the agglomerators walls,Relevant
The blending continues causing an exothermic (heatproducing) reaction to occur,Relevant
The resulting mixture is a hot viscous liquid similar to gelatin that hasnt hardened,Relevant
Next the liquid is allowed to flow out of the agglomerator,Relevant
As it leaves the machine it collects on a drying belt where its own heat exposure to air and hot air blowers render it friable—easy to crush or crumble,Relevant
The newly made detergent is then pulverized and pushed through sizing screens that ensure that no large lumps of unmixed product go out to the market,Relevant
The result of this process is a dry detergent made up of granules of the mixed detergent,Irrelevant
In this process ingredients are dissolved in water to create a slurry,Irrelevant
With a pump the slurry is blown through nozzles inside the top of a cone shaped container as hot dry air is simultaneously forced into the bottom of the cone,Relevant
As the slurry dries beads of dry detergent fall to the bottom of the cone where they can be collected for packaging,Relevant

If the detergent is to be liquid rather than powder it is simply mixed back in—after all ingredients are blended—with a solution consisting of water and various chemicals known as solubilizers,Irrelevant
The solubilizers help the water and detergent blend together more fully and evenly,Relevant
Manufacturing the conventional rotary lawn mower requires precision inventory control strategic placement of parts and personnel and synchronization of people and tasks,Irrelevant
In some instances robotic cells are used in conjunction with a trained labor force,Irrelevant

Trucked into the plants loading dock the components are moved by forklifts or overhead trolleys to other centers for forming machining painting or if they require no additional work upon arrival assembly,Relevant
The steel mower pan the largest single part and one used in various models is first machinestamped under great heat and pressure,Relevant
The pan is then transported to a robotic cell where a plasma cutter creates apertures in it,Relevant
The term plasma refers to any of a number of gases (argon is commonly used) that can be raised to high temperature and highly ionized by being passed through a constricted electrical arc,Irrelevant
When directed through the narrow opening of a torch this hot ionized gas can be used for both cutting and welding,Irrelevant
After other elements such as baffles (deflecting plates) are welded on the finished pan and a number of other exposed parts are powder painted in a sealed room,Irrelevant
Powder painting entails thoroughly washing the parts in alkaline and phosphate solutions and rinsing them to seal the surfaces,Relevant
The parts are then attached to overhead conveyors and run through a paint booth,Relevant

Fine paint particles are sprayed from a gun that imbues them with an electrostatic charge—opposite to the charge given to the part being painted—that causes the paint to adhere to the surface of the parts evenly,Relevant
Next the parts are baked in ovens to produce a permanently fixed enamellike coating,Relevant
The pan and other parts are now ready to withstand years of exposure to corrosive grass fluids and the constant peppering from dirt and debris kicked up in the cutting process,Irrelevant
The handlebar is created in a robotic cell whose mechanical arms perform three operations,Relevant
In a bender the tubing is first bent in at least four places,Relevant
A second press operation flattens the ends and a third pierces fourteen or so round and square holes in the tubing,Relevant
These holes will accommodate the starting mechanism blade and wheel drive control and the pan attachment,Relevant
The finished handlebar is then transported to a subassembly station where many of the controls are added,Relevant
The other major subassemblies are also created at various plant centers using formed machined or purchased materials and standard hardware,Relevant
Parts purchased from outside suppliers include engines built to manufacturers physical and performance specifications tires shift mechanisms wiring harnesses and bearings,Irrelevant
Injectionmolded plastic parts are purchased for use in side discharge chutes covers and plugs,Relevant
Injection molding refers to a process in which molten plastic is squirted into a mold and then allowed to cool,Irrelevant
As it cools the plastic assumes the shape of the mold,Relevant
Assembly teams put the six or more major subassemblies together on a rolling line at a pace determined by the task and skills required,Irrelevant
The engine is first placed upside down in a frame fixture and the mower pan is bolted down along with the drive mechanism,Relevant
Then come the rear axle brackets and rods to secure the shift controls,Relevant
The blade and accompanying clutch wheels and parts are fastened to the engine through the pan opening with preset airdriven torque wrenches,Relevant
After another team member adds hardware and wheels the unit is flipped onto its wheels,Relevant
The handlebar is attached and control cables are secured and set,Relevant
Finally the mower—each mower—is performancetested before shipment to dealers where some final setup adjustments are made,Relevant
The uses of light bulbs range from street lights to automobile headlights to flashlights,Irrelevant
For each use the individual bulb differs in size and wattage which determine the amount of light the bulb gives off (lumens),Irrelevant
However all incandescent light bulbs have the three basic parts—the filament the bulb and the base,Irrelevant
Originally produced by hand the light bulb manufacture is now almost entirely automated,Irrelevant
The filament is manufactured through a process known as drawing in which tungsten is mixed with a binder material and pulled through a die—a shaped orifice—into a fine wire,Relevant
Next the wire is wound around a metal bar called a mandrel in order to mold it into its proper coiled shape and then it is heated in an process known as annealing,Relevant
This process softens the wire and makes its structure more uniform,Irrelevant
The mandrel is then dissolved in acid,Relevant
The coiled filament is attached to the leadin wires,Relevant
The leadin wires have hooks at their ends which are either pressed over the end of the filament or in larger bulbs spotwelded,Relevant
The glass bulbs or casings are produced using a ribbon machine,Relevant
After heating in a furnace a continuous ribbon of glass moves along a conveyor belt,Relevant
Precisely aligned air nozzles blow the glass through holes in the conveyor belt into molds creating the casings,Relevant
A ribbon machine moving at top speed can produce more than 50000 bulbs per hour,Irrelevant
After the casings are blown they are cooled and then cut off of the ribbon machine,Relevant
Next the inside of the bulb is coated with silica to remove the glare caused by a glowing uncovered filament,Relevant
The company emblem and bulb wattage are then stamped onto the outside top of each casing,Relevant
The base of the bulb is also constructed using molds,Relevant
It is made with indentations in the shape of a screw so that it can easily fit into the socket of a light fixture,Irrelevant
Once the filament base and bulb are made they are fitted together by machines,Relevant
First the filament is mounted to the stem assembly with its ends clamped to the two leadin wires,Relevant
Next the air inside the bulb is evacuated and the casing is filled with an argon and nitrogen mixture,Relevant
These gases ensure a longerlife for the filament,Irrelevant
The tungsten will eventually evaporate and break,Relevant
As it evaporates it leaves a dark deposit on the bulb known as bulbwall blackening,Irrelevant
Finally the base and the bulb are sealed,Relevant
The base slides onto the end of the glass bulb such that no other material is needed to keep them together,Relevant
Instead their conforming shapes allow the two pieces to be held together snugly with the leadin wires touching the aluminum base to ensure proper electrical contact,Relevant
After testing bulbs are placed in their packages and shipped to consumers,Relevant
First a semiconductor wafer is made,Relevant
The particular material composition—GaAs GaP or something in between—is determined by the color of LED being fabricated,Irrelevant
The crystalline semiconductor is grown in a high temperature high pressure chamber,Irrelevant
Gallium arsenic andor phosphor are purified and mixed together in the chamber,Irrelevant
The heat and pressure liquify and press the components together so that they are forced into a solution,Relevant
To keep them from escaping into the pressurized gas in the chamber they are often covered with a layer of liquid boron oxide which seals them off so that they must stick together,Relevant
This is known as liquid encapsulation or the Czochralski crystal growth method,Irrelevant
After the elements are mixed in a uniform solution a rod is dipped into the solution and pulled out slowly,Relevant
The solution cools and crystallizes on the end of the rod as it is lifted out of the chamber forming a long cylindrical crystal ingot (or boule) of GaAs GaP or GaAsP,Relevant
Think of this as baking the cake,Irrelevant
The boule is then sliced into very thin wafers of semiconductor approximately 10 mils thick or about as thick as a garbage bag,Relevant
The wafers are polished until the surfaces are very smooth so that they will readily accept more layers of semiconductor on their surface,Relevant
The principle is similar to sanding a table before painting it,Irrelevant
Each wafer should be a single crystal of material of uniform composition,Irrelevant
Unfortunately there will sometimes be imperfections in the crystals that make the LED function poorly,Irrelevant
Think of imperfections as unmixed bits of flower or sugar suspended in the cake during baking,Irrelevant
Imperfections can also result from the polishing process such imperfections also degrade device performance,Irrelevant
The more imperfections the less the wafer behaves like a single crystal without a regular crystalline structure the material will not function as a semiconductor,Irrelevant
Next the wafers are cleaned through a rigorous chemical and ultrasonic process using various solvents,Relevant
This process removes dirt dust or organic matter that may have settled on the polished wafer surface,Relevant
The cleaner the processing the better the resulting LED will be,Irrelevant
Additional layers of semiconductor crystal are grown on the surface of the wafer like adding more layers to the cake,Irrelevant
This is one way to add impurities or dopants to the crystal,Irrelevant
The crystal layers are grown this time by a process called Liquid Phase Epitaxy (LPE),Irrelevant

In this technique epitaxial layers—semiconductor layers that have the same crystalline orientation as the substrate below—are deposited on a wafer while it is drawn under reservoirs of molten GaAsP,Relevant
The reservoirs have appropriate dopants mixed through them,Irrelevant
The wafer rests on a graphite slide which is pushed through a channel under a container holding the molten liquid (or melt as it is called),Relevant
Different dopants can be added in sequential melts or several in the same melt creating layers of material with different electronic densities,Irrelevant
The deposited layers will become a continuation of the wafers crystal structure,Irrelevant
LPE creates an exceptionally uniform layer of material which makes it a preferred growth and doping technique,Relevant
The layers formed are several microns thick,Relevant
After depositing epitaxial layers it may be necessary to add additional dopants to alter the characteristics of the diode for color or efficiency,Relevant

If additional doping is done the wafer is again placed in a high temperature furnace tube where it is immersed in a gaseous atmosphere containing the dopants—nitrogen or zinc ammonium are the most common,Relevant
Nitrogen is often added to the top layer of the diode to make the light more yellow or green,Relevant
Metal contacts are then defined on the wafer,Relevant
The contact pattern is determined in the design stage and depends on whether the diodes are to be used singly or in combination,Relevant
Contact patterns are reproduced in photoresist a lightsensitive compound the liquid resist is deposited in drops while the wafer spins distributing it over the surface,Relevant
The resist is hardened by a brief low temperature baking (about 215 degrees Fahrenheit or 100 degrees Celsius),Relevant

Next the master pattern or mask is duplicated on the photoresist by placing it over the wafer and exposing the resist with ultraviolet light (the same way a photograph is made from a negative),Relevant
Exposed areas of the resist are washed away with developer and unexposed areas remain covering the semiconductor layers,Relevant
Contact metal is now evaporated onto the pattern filling in the exposed areas,Relevant
Evaporation takes place in another high temperature chamber this time vacuum sealed,Relevant
A chunk of metal is heated to temperatures that cause it to vaporize,Relevant
It condenses and sticks to the exposed semiconductor wafer much like steam will fog a cold window,Relevant
The photoresist can then be washed away with acetone leaving only the metal contacts behind,Relevant
Depending on the final mounting scheme for the LED an additional layer of metal may be evaporated on the back side of the wafer,Relevant

Any deposited metal must undergo an annealing process in which the wafer is heated to several hundred degrees and allowed to remain in a furnace (with an inert atmosphere of hydrogen or nitrogen flowing through it) for periods up to several hours,Relevant
During this time the metal and the semiconductor bond together chemically so the contacts dont flake off,Irrelevant
A single 2 inchdiameter wafer produced in this manner will have the same pattern repeated up to 6000 times on it this gives an indication of the size of the finished diodes,Relevant
The diodes are cut apart either by cleaving (snapping the wafer along a crystal plane) or by sawing with a diamond saw,Relevant
Each small segment cut from the wafer is called a die,Irrelevant
A difficult and error prone process cutting results in far less than 6000 total useable LEDs and is one of the biggest challenges in limiting production costs of semiconductor devices,Irrelevant
Individual dies are mounted on the appropriate package,Relevant
If the diode will be used by itself as an indicator light or for jewelry for example it is mounted on two metal leads about two inches long,Irrelevant
Usually in this case the back of the wafer is coated with metal and forms an electrical contact with the lead it rests on,Irrelevant
A tiny gold wire is soldered to the other lead and wirebonded to the patterned contacts on the surface of the die,Relevant
In wire bonding the end of the wire is pressed down on the contact metal with a very fine needle,Relevant
The gold is soft enough to deform and stick to a like metal surface,Relevant
Finally the entire assembly is sealed in plastic,Relevant

The wires and die are suspended inside a mold that is shaped according to the optical requirements of the package (with a lens or connector at the end) and the mold is filled with liquid plastic or epoxy,Relevant
The epoxy is cured and the package is complete,Relevant

The manufacturing process is easiest to understand if it is viewed as three separate steps melting and mixing the lipstick pouring the mixture into the tube and packaging the product for sale,Irrelevant
Since the lipstick mass can be mixed and stored for later use mixing does not have to happen at the same time as pouring,Irrelevant
Once the lipstick is in the tube packaging for retail sale is highly variable depending on how the product is to be marketed,Irrelevant
First the raw ingredients for the lipstick are melted and mixed—separately because of the different types of ingredients used,Relevant
One mixture contains the solvents a second contains the oils and a third contains the fats and waxy materials,Irrelevant
These are heated in separate stainless steel or ceramic containers,Relevant
The solvent solution and liquid oils are then mixed with the color pigments,Relevant
The mixture passes through a roller mill grinding the pigment to avoid a grainy feel to the lipstick,Relevant
This process introduces air into the oil and pigment mixture so mechanical working of the mixture is required,Irrelevant
The mixture is stirred for several hours at this point some producers use vacuum equipment to withdraw the air,Relevant
After the pigment mass is ground and mixed it is added to the hot wax mass until a uniform color and consistency is obtained,Relevant
The fluid lipstick can then be strained and molded or it may be poured into pans and stored for future molding,Relevant
If the fluid lipstick is to be used immediately the melt is maintained at temperature with agitation so that trapped air escapes,Relevant

If the lipstick mass is stored before it is used it must be reheated checked for color consistency and adjusted to specifications then maintained at the melt temperature (with agitation) until it can be poured,Relevant
As expected lipsticks are always prepared in batches because of the different color pigments that can be used,Irrelevant
The size of the batch and the number of tubes of lipstick produced at one time will depend on the popularity of the particular shade being produced,Irrelevant
This will determine the manufacturing technique (automated or manual) that is used,Irrelevant
Lipstick may be produced in highly automated processes at rates of up to 2400 tubes an hour or in essentially manual operations at rates around 150 tubes per hour,Irrelevant
The steps in the process basically differ only in the volume produced,Irrelevant
Once the lipstick mass is mixed and free of air it is ready to be poured into the tube,Relevant

A variety of machine setups are used depending on the equipment that the manufacturer has but high volume batches are generally run through a melter that agitates the lipstick mass and maintains it as a liquid,Irrelevant
For smaller manually run batches the mass is maintained at the desired mix temperature with agitation in a melter controlled by an operator,Relevant
The melted mass is dispensed into a mold which consists of the bottom portion of the metal or plastic tube and a shaping portion that fits snugly with the tube,Relevant
Lipstick is poured upside down so that the bottom of the tube is at the top of the mold,Relevant
Any excess is scraped from the mold,Relevant
The lipstick is cooled (automated molds are kept cold manually produced molds are transferred to a refrigeration unit) and separated from the mold and the bottom of the tube is sealed,Relevant
The lipstick then passes through a flaming cabinet (or is flamed by hand) to seal pinholes and improve the finish,Relevant
The lipstick is visually inspected for air holes mold separation lines or blemishes and is reworked if necessary,Relevant
For obvious reasons rework of the lipstick must be limited demonstrating the importance of the early steps in removing air from the lipstick mass,Irrelevant
Lipstick is reworked by hand with a spatula,Relevant
This can be done inline or the tube can be removed from the manufacturing process and reworked,Relevant
After the lipstick is retracted and the tube is capped the lipstick is ready for labeling and packaging,Relevant
Labels identify the batch and are applied as part of the automated operation,Relevant
While there is a great deal of emphasis on quality and appearance of the finished lipstick product less emphasis is placed on the appearance of lip balms,Irrelevant
Lip balms are always produced in an automated process (except for experimental or test batches),Irrelevant
The heated liquid is poured into the tube in the retracted position the tube is then capped by machine—a far less laborious process,Relevant
The final step in the manufacturing process is the packaging of the lipstick tube,Relevant
There are a variety of packaging options available ranging from bulk packs to individual packs and including packaging as a component in a makeup kit or special promotional offering,Irrelevant
Lip balms are packaged in bulk generally with minimum protection to prevent shipping damage,Relevant
Packaging for lipsticks varies depending on what will happen at the point of sale in the retail outlet,Irrelevant
Packaging may or may not be highly automated and the package used depends on the end use of the product rather than on the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
Making passive matrix LCDs is a multistep process,Irrelevant
The surface and rear glass of the display is first polished washed and coated with silicon dioxide (SiO 2 ),Relevant
Next a layer of indium tin oxide is evaporated onto the glass and etched into the desired pattern,Relevant
A layer of long chain polymer is then applied to allow the liquid crystals to align properly followed by a sealing resin,Relevant
The spacers next are put into place and the glass sandwich is filled with the liquid crystal material,Relevant
First the two glass substrates must be cut to the proper size polished and washed,Relevant

Cutting can be done with a diamond saw or scribe while polishing involves a process called lapping in which the glass is held against a rotating wheel that has abrasive particles embedded in it,Irrelevant
After being washed and dried the substrates are coated with a layer of silicon dioxide,Relevant
Next the transparent electrode pattern must be made on the substrates,Relevant
This is done by completely coating both front and rear glass surfaces with a very thin layer of indium tin oxide,Relevant
Manufacturers then make a mask of the desired pattern using either a silkscreening or photolithography process,Relevant
They apply the finished mask to the fully coated glass and areas of indium tin oxide that are not needed are etched away chemically,Relevant
Alternatively finer definition can be achieved by using glass that has a layer of etchingresistant lightsensitive material (called photoresist) above the indium tin oxide film,Relevant
A mask with the desired pattern is placed over the glass and the glass is bombarded with ultraviolet light,Relevant

This light causes the resistive layer it shines on to lose its resistance to etching allowing the chemicals to eat away both the exposed photoresist and the indium tin oxide below it thus forming the pattern,Irrelevant
The unnecessary photoresist that remains can then be removed with other chemicals,Relevant
A second variety of resistive film resists etching only after it is exposed to ultraviolet light in this case a negative mask of the pattern must be used,Irrelevant

Regardless of which method is used the patterns on the two substrates are designed to overlap only in specific places a design that ensures that the thin strips of indium tin oxide conveying voltage to each element have no electrode positioned directly opposite that might show up while the cell is working,Irrelevant
After the electrode pattern is in place the substrates must be coated with a polymer,Relevant
The polymer allows the liquid crystals to align properly with the glass surface,Relevant
Polyvinyl alcohol polyamides and some silanes can be used,Irrelevant
Polyamides are the most popular agents because polyvinyl alcohol is subject to moisture problems and silanes produce a thin unreliable coating,Irrelevant
After coating the glass manufacturers then stroke the polymer coat in a single direction with soft material,Relevant
This can result in small parallel grooves being etched into the polymer or it may simply stretch the polymer coat,Irrelevant
In any case this process forces the liquid crystals to lie parallel to the direction of the stroke,Relevant
The crystals may be aligned another way by evaporating silicon oxide onto the glass surface at an oblique angle,Relevant
This procedure is used to make most digital watch displays but is not convenient for making largescale displays,Relevant
It also does not yield the lowtilt angle possible with the previous method,Irrelevant
If LCD makers want to align liquid crystals perpendicular to the glass surface another technique is used coating the glass with an amphophilic material,Relevant
This is material whose molecules display affinity for water at one end of the molecule and repulsion from water at the other end,Irrelevant

One end—the affinity end—adheres to the glass surface while the other end—the repulsing end—points into the liquid crystal area repelling the liquid crystals and forming them into an alignment that is perpendicular to the glass surface,Irrelevant
A sealing resin is next applied to the substrates followed by plastic spacers that will give the liquid crystal cell the proper thickness,Relevant
Next the liquid crystal material is injected into the appropriate area between the two glass substrates,Relevant
The thickness of the LCD cell is usually restricted to 525 micrometers,Irrelevant

Because proper thickness is crucial for cell operation and because spacers dont always achieve uniform thickness LCD makers sometimes put appropriately sized glass fibers or beads in the liquid crystal material,Irrelevant
The beads or fibers cannot be seen by the naked eye,Irrelevant
They help hold the cell at the proper thickness while the sealant material is setting,Irrelevant
To make LCDs more visible polarizers are added,Relevant
These are usually made from stretched polyvinyl alcohol films that have iodine in them and that are sandwiched between cellulose acetate layers,Irrelevant
Colored polarizers made using dye instead of iodine are also available,Irrelevant
Manufacturers glue the polarizer to the glass using an acrylic adhesive and cover it with a plastic protective film,Relevant
They can make reflective polarizers which also are used in LCDs by incorporating a simple metal foil reflector,Irrelevant
After the polarizer film is attached the unit is allowed to age,Relevant
Finally the finished glass display assembly is mounted to the circuit boards containing the control and drive electronics,Relevant
Then the entire package is ready to be mounted to the device using the LCD—laptop computer fax machine clock etc,Relevant
Lube oil is extracted from crude oil which undergoes a preliminary purification process (sedimentation) before it is pumped into fractionating towers,Irrelevant

A typical highefficiency fractionating tower 25 to 35 feet (76 to 106 meters) in diameter and up to 400 feet (122 meters) tall is constructed of high grade steels to resist the corrosive compounds present in crude oils inside it is fitted with an ascending series of condensate collecting trays,Irrelevant
Within a tower the thousands of hydrocarbons in crude oil are separated from each other by a process called fractional distillation,Irrelevant

As the vapors rise up through the tower the various fractions cool condense and return to liquid form at different rates determined by their respective boiling points (the lower the boiling point of the fraction the higher it rises before condensing),Relevant
Natural gas reaches its boiling point first followed by gasoline kerosene fuel oil lubricants and tars,Relevant
The crude oil is transported from the oil well to the refinery by pipeline or tanker ship,Relevant
At the refinery the oil undergoes sedimentation to remove any water and solid contaminants such as sand and rock that maybe suspended in it,Irrelevant
During this process the crude is pumped into large holding tanks where the water and oil are allowed to separate and the contaminants settle out of the oil,Relevant
Next the crude oil is heated to about 700 degrees Fahrenheit (371 degrees Celsius),Relevant
At this temperature it breaks down into a mixture of hot vapor and liquid that is then pumped into the bottom of the first of two fractionating towers,Relevant
Here the hot hydrocarbon vapors float upward,Irrelevant
As they cool they condense and are collected in different trays installed at different levels in the tower,Relevant
In this tower normal atmospheric pressure is maintained continuously and about 80 percent of the crude oil vaporizes,Relevant

The remaining 20 percent of the oil is then reheated and pumped into a second tower wherein vacuum pressure lowers the residual oils boiling point so that it can be made to vaporize at a lower temperature,Relevant
The heavier compounds with higher boiling points such as tar and the inorganic compounds remain behind for further processing,Irrelevant

After further processing to remove unwanted compounds the lube oil that has been collected in the two fractionating towers is passed through several ultrafine filters which remove remaining impurities,Relevant
Aromatics one such contaminant contain sixcarbon rings that would affect the lube oils viscosity if they werent removed in a process called solvent extraction,Irrelevant
Solvent extraction is possible because aromatics are more soluble in the solvent than the lube oil fraction is,Irrelevant
When the lube oil is treated with the solvent the aromatics dissolve later after the solvent has been removed the aromatics can be recovered from it,Irrelevant
Finally the oil is mixed with additives to give it the desired physical properties (such as the ability to withstand low temperatures),Relevant
At this point the lube oil is subjected to a variety of quality control tests that assess its viscosity specific gravity color flash and fire points,Relevant
Oil that meets quality standards is then packaged for sale and distribution,Relevant
Most mattress manufacturers subcontract the production of the innerspring unit to an outside firm that specializes in making springs,Irrelevant
Once the completed spring unit is received and inspected the workers manually apply the insulator,Relevant
Next they apply the cushioning layers that will determine the feel and comfort of the final product,Relevant
While the mattress is being built up in one part of the plant the decorative cover that will serve as the exterior for the top bottom and sides is being made in another part,Relevant
Usually this cover is made on a giant quilting machine which controls a multitude of needles that stitch the cover to a layer of backing material,Irrelevant

The stitching chosen serves both useful and ornamental purposes as it must prevent the mattress cover from slipping or creeping over the layers of cushioning in addition to creating a visually pleasing exterior,Irrelevant
Once the fabric is quilted it is cut into panels that will fit the top and bottom of the mattress,Relevant
The side panels are often cut from this same composite or made separately on a border machine,Relevant
If side handles or vents are to be added they are attached to the side panels before these are applied to the mattress,Irrelevant
Specially modified sewing machines are used to attach the flanges to the top and bottom panels and the hogs rings are stapled to the flanges,Irrelevant
Everything is now ready for the closing operation during which the hogs rings will be secured to the innerspring unit,Irrelevant
The closing operation is of one of the most highly skilled and critical procedures in the entire process,Irrelevant
It is done with a movable sewing head that is mounted on a track,Irrelevant
Tape edge operators manually feed the top bottom and side panels and a heavy duty binding tape into the sewing machine as it moves around the mattress,Relevant

As this combination of materials is fed into the machine the operators uses their skill to feed the proper amount of each material into the machine to produce a professionally tailored product,Irrelevant

Some of the highest quality mattresses may also feature a pillowtop a panel filled with soft upholstery and attached to the top and bottom panels of the mattress for a more luxurious feel and appearance,Irrelevant
Prequilted the pillowtop is then taped to the mattress,Relevant
If the desired boxspring has a spiked coil design it is made by stapling the bottom of each coil to a flat wooden frame,Relevant
A wire grid is then placed on top of the springs and once aligned manually locked to them,Relevant
A thin layer of upholstery is applied to the top,Relevant
If the desired boxspring contains no springs it consists of a wooden frame that may or may not have a layer of upholstery attached to its top,Irrelevant
Regardless of the internal composition the frame is usually inserted into a presewn cover that encases the top and sides of the unit,Irrelevant
A border fabric that matches the mattress exterior is applied to the sides and a dust cover is added to the face,Relevant
Once the units are complete they are inspected for quality,Relevant

If every thing is in order they are labeled with the content and the contingent do not remove tag required by law to ensure the consumer that the contents are properly represented in the labeling,Relevant
The finished product is then transported to the packing area,Relevant
Here it is inserted by hand or by automated machinery into protective plastic or paper covers,Relevant
Additional information about the warranty safety and care of the product is also included in the packaging,Relevant
The process of manufacturing a microwave oven starts with the cavity and the door,Irrelevant
First the frame is formed using automatic metalforming presses that make about 12 to 15 parts per minute,Relevant
The frame is then rinsed in alkaline cleaner to get rid of any dirt or oil and further rinsed with water to get rid of the alkaline solution,Relevant
Next each part is treated with zinc phosphate which prepares it for electrodeposition,Relevant
Electrodeposition consists of immersing the parts in a paint tank at 200 volts for 25 minutes,Irrelevant
The resulting coating is about 15 mils thick,Irrelevant
The parts are then moved through a paint bake operation where the paint is cured at 300 degrees Fahrenheit (149 degrees Celsius) for 20 minutes,Relevant
After the door has been painted a perforated metal plate is attached to its window aperture,Relevant
The plate reflects microwaves but allows light to enter the cavity (the door will not be attached to the cavity until later when the chassis is assembled),Irrelevant
The magnetron tube assembly consists of a cathode cylinder a filament heater a metal anode and an antenna,Irrelevant
The filament is attached to the cathode and the cathode is enclosed in the anode cylinder this cell will provide the electricity that will help to generate the microwaves,Relevant
Metal cooling fins are welded to the anode cylinder and a powerful magnet is placed around the anode to provide the magnetic field in which the microwaves will be generated,Relevant
A metal strap holds the complete assembly together,Relevant
A thermal protector is mounted directly on the magnetron to prevent damage to the tube from overheating,Relevant
An antenna enclosed in a glass tube is mounted on top of the anode and the air within the tube is pumped out to create a vacuum,Relevant
The waveguide is connected to the magnetron on top of the protruding antenna while a blower motor used to cool the metal fins of the magnetron is attached directly to the tube,Relevant
Finally a plastic fan is attached to the motor where it will draw air from outside the oven and direct it towards the vanes,Relevant
This completes the magnetron subassembly,Irrelevant
The chassis assembly work is performed on a pallet—a workholding device used in conjunction with other tools—located at the station,Irrelevant
First the main chassis is placed on the pallet and the cavity is screwed on to the chassis,Relevant
Next the door is attached to the cavity and chassis by means of hinges,Relevant
The magnetron tube is then bolted to the side of the cavity and the main chassis,Relevant
The circuit that produces the voltage required to operate the magnetron tube consists of a large transformer an oilbased capacitor and a high voltage rectifier,Irrelevant
All of these components are mounted directly on the chassis close to the magnetron tube,Relevant
The stirrer fan used to circulate the microwaves is mounted on top of the cavity,Relevant
Some manufacturers use a pulley to drive the fan from the magnetron blower motor others use a separate stirrer motor attached directly to the fan,Irrelevant
Once the stirrer fan is attached a stirrer shield is screwed on top of the fan assembly,Relevant
The shield prevents dirt and grease from entering the waveguide where they could produce arcing and damage the magnetron,Irrelevant
The cook switch provides power to the transformer by energizing a relay and a timer,Irrelevant
The relay is mounted close to the power transformer while the timer is mounted on the control board,Irrelevant
The defrost switch works like the cook switch activating a motor and timer to operate the defrost cycle,Irrelevant
Also mounted on the control board are a timer bell that rings when the cooking cycle is complete and a light switch that allows viewing of the cavity,Irrelevant
A number of interlocking switches are mounted near the top and bottom of the door area,Relevant
The interlocking switches are sometimes grouped together with a safety switch that monitors the other switches and provides protection if the door accidently opens during oven operation,Irrelevant
A front panel that allows the operator to select the various settings and features available for cooking is attached to the chassis,Relevant
Behind the front panel the control circuit board is attached,Relevant

The board which controls the various programmed operations in their proper sequence when the switches are pushed on the front panel is connected to the various components and the front panel by means of plugin sockets and cables,Relevant
The outer case of the microwave is made of metal and is assembled on a roll former,Irrelevant
The case is slipped onto the preassembled microwave oven and bolted to the main chassis,Relevant
The power cords and dial knobs are now attached to the oven and it is sent for automatic testing,Relevant
Most manufacturers run the oven from 50100 hours continuously as part of the testing process,Irrelevant
After testing is complete a palletizer robot records the model and serial data of the oven for inventory purposes and the oven is sent for packaging,Relevant
This completes the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
The first step in manufacturing any mirror is cutting the outline of the glass blank to suit the application,Relevant
If the mirror is for an automobile for example the glass will be cut out to fit in the mirror mount on the car,Irrelevant
Although some mirror manufacturers cut their own glass others receive glass that has already been cut into blanks,Irrelevant
Regardless of who cuts the glass very hard finely pointed blades are used to do the cutting,Irrelevant
Diamond scribes or saws—sharp metal points or saws with diamond dust embedded in them—are often used because the diamond will wear down the glass before the glass wears down the diamond,Irrelevant
The cutting method used depends entirely on the final shape the mirror will take,Irrelevant
In one method the blades or scribes may be used to cut partway through the glass pressure can then be used to break the glass along the score line,Irrelevant
In another method a machine uses a diamond saw to cut all the way through the glass by drawing the blade back and forth or up and down multiple times like an automated bandsaw,Irrelevant
Cutting is usually done before the metal coating is applied because the coating may flake off the glass as a result of the cut,Irrelevant
An alternative to cutting the glass to form blanks is to mold the glass in its molten state,Irrelevant
Blanks are then placed in optical grinding machines,Relevant
These machines consist of large base plates full of depressions that hold the blanks,Irrelevant
The blankfilled base is placed against another metal plate with the desired surface shape flat convex or concave,Relevant
A grinding compound—a gritty liquid—is spread over the glass blanks as they are rubbed or rolled against the curved surface,Relevant
The action is similar to grinding spices with a mortar and pestle,Irrelevant
The grit in the compound gradually wears away the glass surface until it assumes the same shape as the grinding plate,Relevant
Finer and finer grits are used until the surface is very smooth and even,Irrelevant
Hand grinding techniques exist as well but they are extremely timeconsuming and difficult to control,Irrelevant
They are only used in cases where mechanical grinding would be impossible as is the case with very large or unusually shaped surfaces,Irrelevant
A commercial optical grinder can accommodate 50 to 200 blanks which are all polished simultaneously,Irrelevant
This is much more efficient than hand grinding,Irrelevant
Even specialty optics can be made mechanically in adjustable equipment,Irrelevant
When the glass surfaces are shaped appropriately and polished to a smooth finish they are coated with whatever reflective material the designer has chosen,Relevant
Regardless of the coating material it is applied in an apparatus called an evaporator,Relevant
The evaporator is a large vacuum chamber with an upper plate for supporting the blank mirrors and a lower crucible for melting the coating metal,Irrelevant

It is so called because metal is heated in the crucible to the point that it evaporates into the vacuum depositing a coating on the surface of the glass much like hot breath will steam a cold window,Irrelevant
Blanks are centered over holes in the upper plate that allow the metal vapor to reach the surface of the glass,Relevant
Metals can be heated to several hundreds or thousands of degrees (depending on the boiling point of the metal) before they vaporize,Irrelevant
The temperature and timing for this procedure are controlled very precisely to achieve exactly the right thickness of metal,Relevant
This method of coating creates very uniform and highly reflective surfaces,Relevant
The shape of the holes in the upper plate will be transferred to the glass in metal like paint through a stencil,Relevant
This effect is often used to intentionally pattern the mirror,Irrelevant
Metal stencils or masks can be applied to the surface of the glass to create one or more patterns,Relevant
Dielectric coatings—either as reflective layers or as protective layers over metal ones—are applied in much the same way except that gases are used instead of metal chunks,Relevant
Silicon oxides and silicon nitrides are typically used as dielectric coatings,Irrelevant
When these gases combine in extreme heat they react to form a solid substance,Irrelevant
This reaction product forms a coating just like metal does,Irrelevant
Several evaporation steps may be combined to make a multiplelayer coating,Irrelevant
Clear dielectric materials may be evaporated on top of metal or other dielectrics to change the reflective or mechanical properties of a surface,Irrelevant
Mirrors with silvering on the back of the glass for instance often have an opaque dielectric layer applied to improve the reflectivity and keep the metal from scratching,Irrelevant
Oneway mirrors are the exception to this procedure in which case great care must be taken not to damage the thin metal coating,Irrelevant
Finally when the proper coatings have been applied the finished mirror is mounted in a base or packed carefully in a shock resistant package for shipping,Relevant
Early methods of making nail polish used a variety of methods that today look charmingly amateurish,Irrelevant
One common technique was to mix cleaned scraps of movie film and other cellulose with alcohol and castor oil and leave the mixture to soak overnight in a covered container,Relevant
The mixture was then strained colored and perfumed,Relevant
Though recognizable as nail polish the product was far from what we have available today,Irrelevant
The modern manufacturing process is a very sophisticated operation utilizing highly skilled workers advanced machinery and even robotics,Irrelevant
Todays consumers expect a nail polish to apply smoothly evenly and easily to set relatively quickly and to be resistant to chipping and peeling,Irrelevant
In addition the polish should be dermatologically innocuous,Irrelevant
The pigments are mixed with nitrocellulose and plasticizer using a tworoll differential speed mill,Relevant
This mill grinds the pigment between a pair of rollers that are able to work with increasing speed as the pigment is ground down,Relevant
The goal is to produce fine dispersion of the color,Irrelevant
A variation of this mill is the Banbury Mixer (used also in the production of rubber for rubber bands),Irrelevant
When properly and fully milled the mixture is removed from the mill in sheet form and then broken up into small chips for mixing with the solvent,Relevant
The mixing is performed in stainless steel kettles that can hold anywhere from 5 to 2000 gallons,Relevant
Stainless steel must be used because the nitrocellulose is extremely reactive in the presence of iron,Irrelevant
The kettles are jacketed so that the mixture can be cooled by circulating cold water or another liquid around the outside of the kettle,Relevant
The temperature of the kettle and the rate of cooling are controlled by both computers and technicians,Relevant
This step is performed in a special room or area designed to control the hazards of fire and explosion,Irrelevant

Most modern factories perform this step in an area with walls that will close in if an alarm sounds and in the event of explosion with ceilings that will safely blow off without endangering the rest of the structure,Irrelevant
Materials are mixed in computerized closed kettles,Relevant
At the end of the process the mix is cooled slightly before the addition of such other materials as perfumes and moisturizers,Relevant
The mixture is then pumped into smaller 55 gallon drums and then trucked to a production line,Relevant
The finished nail polish is pumped into explosion proof pumps and then into smaller bottles suitable for the retail market,Relevant
In the workroom an operator first spreads the 40yard bolts of cloth on a long cutting table,Relevant
Cutting the outer fabric is done by a skilled hand to maximize the yield or the number of ties cut from the piece of goods,Irrelevant
If the fabric has a random design the operator stacks between 24 and 72 plies of fabric pieces in preparation for cutting the fabric,Irrelevant
If pattern of the fabric (or of the goods) consists of panels such as stripes with a medallion at the bottom these panels are then stacked according to the pattern,Irrelevant
Using the chain stitch of a sewing machine sewing operators join the ties three sections on the bias in the neckband area,Relevant
The operator now adds the facing or tipping (an extra piece of silk nylon rayon or polyester) to the back of the ties ends,Relevant
Facing gives a crisp luxurious hand to the shell,Irrelevant
Two types of facing are currently utilized,Irrelevant
Threequarter facing extends six to eight inches upward from the point of the tie while full facing extends even higher ending just under the knot,Irrelevant
A quarter to a half of an inch of the shell of the fabric is now turned under to form a point,Irrelevant
The point is then machinehemmed by the sewing operator,Relevant
Quality silk ties are pocket or piecepressed,Relevant
This means that the joint at the neck (the piecing) is pressed flat so the wearer will not be inconvenienced by any bulkiness,Relevant
The interlining is slipstitched to the outer shell with resilient nylon thread which runs through the middle of the tie,Relevant
Most ties are slipstitched with a Liba machine a semiautomated machine that closely duplicates the look and resiliency of hand stitching,Relevant
Hand stitching is often used in the manufacture of highquality neckties because it offers maximum resiliency and draping qualities,Irrelevant

The technique is characterized by the irregularly spaced stitches on the reverse of the tie when the seam is spread slightly apart by the dangling loose thread with a tiny knot at the end of the reverse of the front apron and by the ease with which the tie can slide up and down this thread,Irrelevant
Using a turning machine or a manual turner (with a rod about 9 12 inches long) an operator turns the tie rightside out by pulling one end of the tie through the other,Relevant
While not yet pressed the tie is almost complete,Irrelevant
On silk ties only the lining is then tucked by hand into the bottom corner of the long end of the tie,Relevant
If necessary the operator handtrims the lining to fit the point of the long end,Relevant
(In all other ties the lining does not reach all the way to the bottom corner),Irrelevant
A final piece to be sewn on is the loop which serves both as a holder for the thin end of the tie when its being worn and as the manufacturers label,Relevant
Both the core and the cladding of an optical fiber are made of highly purified silica glass,Irrelevant
An optical fiber is manufactured from silicon dioxide by either of two methods,Relevant
The first the crucible method in which powdered silica is melted produces fatter multimode fibers suitable for shortdistance transmission of many light wave signals,Irrelevant
The second the vapor deposition process creates a solid cylinder of core and cladding material that is then heated and drawn into a thinner singlemode fiber for longdistance communication,Irrelevant
There are three types of vapor deposition techniques Outer Vapor Phase Deposition Vapor Phase Axial Deposition and Modified Chemical Vapor Deposition (MCVD),Irrelevant
This section will focus on the MCVD process the most common manufacturing technique now in use,Irrelevant
MCVD yields a lowloss fiber wellsuited for longdistance cables,Irrelevant
First a cylindrical preform is made by depositing layers of specially formulated silicon dioxide on the inside surface of a hollow substrate rod,Relevant
The layers are deposited by applying a gaseous stream of pure oxygen to the substrate rod,Relevant
Various chemical vapors such as silicon tetrachloride (SiCl 4 ) germanium tetrachloride (GeCl 4 ) and phosphorous oxychloride (POC1 3 ) are added to the stream of oxygen,Relevant
As the oxygen contacts the hot surface of the rod—a flame underneath the rod keeps the walls of the rod very hot—silicon dioxide of high purity is formed,Relevant
The result is a glassy soot several layers thick deposited inside the rod,Relevant
This soot will become the core,Relevant
The properties of these layers of soot can be altered depending on the types of chemical vapors used,Irrelevant
After the soot is built up to the desired thickness the substrate rod is moved through other heating steps to drive out any  moisture and bubbles trapped in the soot layers,Relevant
During heating the substrate rod and internal soot layers solidify to form the boule or preform of highly pure silicon dioxide,Relevant
A preform usually measures 10 to 25 millimeters (39 to 98 inch) in diameter and 600 to 1000 millimeters (236 to 3937 inches) in length,Irrelevant
The solid preform is then automatically transferred to a vertical fiber drawing system,Relevant
The machines that make up a typical vertical drawing system can be two stories high and are able to produce continuous fibers up to 300 kilometers (186 miles) long,Irrelevant

This system consists of a furnace to melt the end of the preform sensors to monitor the diameter of the fiber being pulled from the preform and coating devices to apply protective layers over the outer cladding,Relevant
The preform first passes through a furnace where it is heated to about 3600 degrees Fahrenheit (about 2000 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Next a drop of molten glass called a gob forms at the end of the preform much like a droplet of water that collects at the bottom of a leaky faucet,Relevant
The gob then falls away and the single optical fiber inside is drawn out of the preform,Relevant
As the optical fiber is pulled from the preform the material in the original substrate rod forms the cladding and the silicon dioxide deposited as soot forms the core of the optical fiber,Irrelevant
As the fiber is drawn out measuring devices monitor its diameter and its concentricity while another device applies a protective coating,Relevant
The fiber then passes through a curing furnace and another measuring device that monitors diameter before being wound on a spool,Relevant
Pigment manufacturers send bags of fine grain pigments to paint plants,Relevant
There the pigment is premixed with resin (a wetting agent that assists in moistening the pigment) one or more solvents and additives to form a paste,Relevant

The paste mixture for most industrial and some consumer paints is now routed into a sand mill a large cylinder that agitates tiny particles of sand or silica to grind the pigment particles making them smaller and dispersing them throughout the mixture,Relevant
The mixture is then filtered to remove the sand particles,Relevant
Instead of being processed in sand mills up to 90 percent of the waterbased latex paints designed for use by individual homeowners are instead processed in a highspeed dispersion tank,Relevant
There the premixed paste is subjected to highspeed agitation by a circular toothed blade attached to a rotating shaft,Relevant
This process blends the pigment into the solvent,Relevant
Whether created by a sand mill or a dispersion tank the paste must now be thinned to produce the final product,Relevant
Transferred to large kettles it is agitated with the proper amount of solvent for the type of paint desired,Relevant
The finished paint product is then pumped into the canning room,Relevant
For the standard 8 pint (378 liter) paint can available to consumers empty cans are first rolled horizontally onto labels then set upright so that the paint can be pumped into them,Irrelevant
A machine places lids onto the filled cans and a second machine presses on the lids to seal them,Relevant
From wire that is fed into it from coils a bailometer cuts and shapes the handles before hooking them into holes precut in the cans,Relevant
A certain number of cans (usually four) are then boxed and stacked before being sent to the warehouse,Relevant
Nylon yarn is made in a process known as melt spinning,Irrelevant
First the chemicals involved—adipic acid and hexamethylene diamine—must be polymerized to form a thick resin that is then cut into chips or pellets,Relevant
These pellets are then heated and pressurized in an autoclave into a syrupy solution,Relevant
Next the solution is extruded through a spinneret—a device that looks and works like a shower head with long strings of nylon solution coming out of the holes in the device,Relevant

The number of holes depends on the type of yarn desired one hole produces monofilament yarn which is very thin and sheer several holes produce multifilament yarn which is denser and less sheer,Irrelevant
As the fibers emerge from the spinneret they are cooled by air and then stretched over rollers to stabilize the molecular chains and strengthen the fibers,Relevant
The yarn is then wound on spools,Relevant
Yarn is fed into a circular knitting machine which converts it into a series of loops,Relevant
Usually computercontrolled the machine contains 300 to 420 needles and rotates at speeds up to 1200 RPM it takes about 90 seconds to knit a fulllength stocking leg,Irrelevant
Next openings at the toes are seamed together and two stocking legs are seamed together to form pantyhose,Relevant
Sometimes they are seamed together with a crotch,Relevant
Like the other steps in pantyhose manufacture seaming is almost completely automated,Irrelevant
The sewn product then goes to a dye machine where it will be dyed to one of more than 100 different shades,Irrelevant
The dye machine can color about 3500 dozen pairs a day,Irrelevant
Once dyed the pantyhose are taken to a compartment dryer which dries them,Relevant
This next step boarding is sometimes done before the dyeing process depending on the desired final product,Irrelevant
Boarding is the process of placing the pantyhose over leg forms where they are steamed and heated to the desired shape,Irrelevant
With less expensive hosiery this step may be completely bypassed and the pantyhose packaged in their relaxed state,Irrelevant
Throughout the manufacturing process quality checks are performed on the pantyhose,Relevant
A statistical method is used for inspection,Irrelevant
Pantyhose that meet the inspection guidelines are packaged in a box or paperboard envelope either manually or automatically,Relevant
After they leave the manufacturing plant the pantyhose are stored in warehouses and organized according to size style and color for efficient orderfilling,Relevant
Customer orders are filled by personnel at various picking stations positioned alongside a conveyor belt that carries the filled cases to a staging area for final shipping to retail markets,Relevant
Peanuts are planted in April or May depending upon the climate,Relevant
The peanut emerges as a plant followed by a yellow flower,Irrelevant
After blooming and then wilting the flower bends over and penetrates the soil,Irrelevant
The peanut is formed underground,Relevant
Peanuts are harvested beginning in late August but mostly in September and October during clear weather when the soil is dry enough so it will not adhere to the stems and pods,Relevant
The peanuts are removed from vines by portable mechanical pickers and transported to a peanut sheller for mechanical drying,Relevant
Peanuts from the pickers are delivered to warehouses for cleaning,Relevant
Blowers remove dust sand vines stems leaves and empty shells,Relevant
Screens magnets and size graders remove trash metal rocks and clods,Relevant
After the cleaning process the peanuts weigh 10 to 20 percent less,Irrelevant
The raw cleaned peanuts are stored unshelled in silos or warehouses,Relevant
Shelling consists of removing the shell (or hull) of peanuts with the least damage to the seed or kemels,Irrelevant
The moisture of the unshelled peanuts is adjusted to avoid excessive brittleness of the shells and kernels and to reduce the amount of dust in the plant,Relevant
The sizegraded peanuts are passed between a series of rollers adjusted to the variety size and condition of the peanuts where the peanuts are cracked,Relevant

The cracked peanuts then repeatedly pass over screens sleeves blowers magnets and destoners where they are shaken gently tumbled and air blown until all the shells and other foreign material (rocks mudballs metal shrivels) are removed,Irrelevant
The shelled peanuts are graded for size in a size grader,Relevant
The peanuts are lifted and then oriented on the perforations of the size grader,Relevant
The larger peanuts (the overs) are sent to one trough while the troughs are guided towards another trough,Relevant
The peanuts are then graded for color defects spots and broken skins,Relevant
The peanuts are shipped in large bulk containers or sacks to peanut butter manufacturers,Relevant
(Inedible peanuts are diverted as oil stock in semibulk form),Irrelevant
To ensure proper size and grading the truckloads transporting peanuts to peanut manufacturers are sampled mechanically,Irrelevant
The sampler testing two truckloads simultaneously can quickly and accurately assess size and grading by examining 10 samples per truckload,Irrelevant

If edible peanuts need to be stored for more than 60 days they are placed in refrigerated storage at 34 to 40 degrees Fahrenheit (2 to 6 degrees Celsius) where they may be held for as long as 25 months,Irrelevant
Shelled the remaining peanuts weigh 30 to 60 percent less occupy 60 to 70 percent less space and have a shelf life about 60 to 75 percent shorter than unshelled peanuts,Irrelevant
The peanut butter manufacturers first dry roast the peanuts,Irrelevant
Dry roasting is done by either the batch or continuous method,Irrelevant
In the batch method peanuts are roasted in 400pound lots in a revolving oven heated to about 800 degrees Fahrenheit (4266 degrees Celsius),Relevant
The peanuts are heated at 320 degrees Fahrenheit (160 degrees Celsius) and held at this temperature for 40 to 60 minutes to reach the exact degree of doneness,Relevant
All the nuts in each batch must be uniformly roasted,Relevant
Large manufacturers prefer the continuous method in which peanuts are fed from the hopper roasted cooled ground into peanut butter and stabilized in one operation,Relevant
This method is less laborintensive creates a more uniform roasting and decreases spillage,Irrelevant
Still some operators believe that the best commercial peanut butter is obtained by using the batch method,Irrelevant
Since peanut butter may call for a blending of peanuts the batch method allows for the different varieties to be roasted separately,Relevant
Furthermore since peanuts frequently come in lots of different moisture content which may need special attention during roasting the batch method can also meet these needs readily,Irrelevant
The steps outlined below apply to peanut butter manufacturing that uses the batch method of roasting,Irrelevant
A photometer indicates when the cooking is complete,Relevant
At the exact time cooking is completed the roasted peanuts are removed from heat as quickly as possible in order to stop cooking and produce a uniform product,Relevant
The hot peanuts then pass from the roaster directly to a perforated metal cylinder (or blowercooler vat) where a large volume of air is pulled through the mass by suction fans,Relevant
The peanuts are brought to a temperature of 86 degrees Fahrenheit (30 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Once cooled the peanuts pass through a gravity separator that removes foreign materials,Relevant
The skins (or seed coats) are now removed with either heat or water,Relevant
The heat blanching method has the advantage of removing the hearts of the peanuts which contain a bitter principle,Irrelevant

Heat blanching Depending on the variety and degree of doneness desired the peanuts are exposed to a temperature of 280 degrees Fahrenheit (1377 degrees Celsius) for up to 20 minutes to loosen and crack the skins,Irrelevant
After cooling the peanuts are passed through the blancher in a continuous stream and subjected to a thorough but gentle rubbing between brushes or ribbed rubber belting,Relevant
The skins are rubbed off blown into porous bags and the hearts are separated by screening,Relevant
Water blanching A newer process than heat blanching water blanching was introduced in 1949,Irrelevant
While the kernels are not heated to destroy natural antioxidants drying is necessary in this process and the hearts are retained,Irrelevant
The first step is to arrange the kernels in troughs then roll them between sharp stationary blades to slit the skins on opposite sides,Irrelevant
The skins are removed as a spiral conveyor carries the kernels through a oneminute scalding water bath and then under an oscillating canvascovered pad which rubs off their skins,Relevant
The blanched kernels are then dried for at least six hours by a current of 120 degrees Fahrenheit (488 degrees Celsius) air,Relevant
The blanched nuts are mechanically screened and inspected on a conveyor belt to remove scorched and rotten nuts or other undesirable matter,Relevant
Light nuts are removed by blowers discolored nuts by a highspeed electric color sorter and metal parts by magnets,Relevant

Most of the devices used for grinding peanuts into butter are built so they can be adjusted over a wide range—permitting the variation in the quantity of peanuts ground per hour the fineness of the product and the amount of oil freed from the peanuts,Irrelevant
Most grinding mills also have an automatic feed for peanuts and salt and are easy to clean,Irrelevant
To prevent overheating grinding mills are cooled by a water jacket,Relevant
Peanut butter is usually made by two grinding operations,Relevant
The first reduces the nuts to a medium grind and the second to a fine smooth texture,Relevant
For fine grinding clearance between plates is about 032 inch (08 centimeter),Irrelevant
The second milling uses a very highspeed comminutor that has a combination cuttingshearing and attrition action and operates at 9600 rpm,Relevant
This milling produces a very fine particle with a maximum size of less than 001 inch (025 centimeter),Irrelevant

To make chunky peanut butter peanut pieces approximately the size of oneeighth of a kernel are mixed with regular peanut butter or incomplete grinding is used by removing a rib from the grinder,Relevant

At the same time the peanuts are fed into the grinder to be milled about 2 percent salt dextrose and hydrogenated oil stabilizer are fed into the grinder in a continuous horizontal operation with about plus or minus 2 percent accuracy and are thoroughly dispersed,Relevant
Peanuts are kept under constant pressure from the start to the finish of the grinding process to assure uniform grinding and to protect the product from air bubbles,Relevant
A heavy screw feeds the peanuts into the grinder,Relevant
This screw may also deliver the deaerated peanut butter into containers in a continuous stream under even pressure,Relevant
From the grinder the peanut butter goes to a stainless steel hopper which serves as an intermediate mixing and storage point,Irrelevant
The stabilized peanut butter is cooled in this rotating refrigerated cylinder (called a votator) from 170 to 120 degrees Fahrenheit (766 to 488 degrees Celsius) or less before it is packaged,Relevant
The stabilized peanut butter is automatically packed in jars capped and labeled,Relevant
Since proper packaging is the main factor in reducing oxidation (without oxygen no oxidation can occur) manufacturers use vacuum packing,Irrelevant
After it is put into final containers the peanut butter is allowed to remain undisturbed until crystallization throughout the mass is completed,Relevant
Jars are then placed in cartons and placed in product storage until ready to be shipped out to retail or institutional customers,Relevant
Now that most commercially used graphite is made in factories rather than mined manufacturers are able to easily control its density,Irrelevant
The graphite is mixed with clay according to the type of pencil being made—the more graphite used the softer the pencil and the darker its line,Relevant
For colored pencils pigments are added to the clay and virtually no graphite is used,Relevant
Two methods are used to form the graphite into its finished state,Irrelevant
The first is an extrusion method in which the graphite and wax mixture is forced through a mold to create a spaghettilike string which is then cut to precise measurements and dried in ovens,Relevant
In the second method the graphite and clay mixture is poured into a machine called a billet press,Relevant
A plug is placed over the top of the press and a metal ram ascends from the bottom to squash the mixture into a hard solid cylinder called a billet,Relevant
The billet is then removed from the top of the machine and placed into an extrusion press that forces it through a mold slicing off strips the size of the pencil core ,Relevant
After being cut to size the cores pass along a conveyor belt and are collected in a trough to await insertion in the pencil wood ,Relevant
The cedar usually arrives at the factory already dried stained and waxed to prevent warping ,Relevant
Logs are then sawed into narrow strips called slats these are about 725 inches (184 centimeters) long 25 inch (635 centimeter) thick and 275 inches (698 centimeters) wide,Relevant
The slats are placed into a feeder and dropped onebyone onto a conveyor belt which moves them along at a constant rate,Relevant
The slats are then planed to give them a flat surface,Relevant
Next they pass under a cutter head that makes parallel semicircular grooves—one half as deep as the graphite is thick—along the length of one side of each slat,Relevant
Continuing along the conveyor belt half of the slats are coated with a layer of glue and the cut graphite is laid in the grooves of these slats,Relevant

The slats without glue—and without graphite in the grooves—are placed on another belt that carries them to a machine that picks them up and turns them over so they are laying on the belt with the grooves facing down,Relevant
The two conveyor belts then meet and each unglued slat is placed over a slat with glue and graphite forming a sandwich,Relevant
After the sandwiches have been removed from the conveyor belt they are placed into a metal clamp and squeezed by a hydraulic press and left clamped together until the glue is dried,Relevant
When the pencils are dried the ends are trimmed to remove excess glue,Relevant
The next step is shaping when the sandwiches actually become pencils,Relevant
The sandwiches are placed on a conveyor belt and moved through two sets of cutters one above and one below the belt,Relevant
The cutters above the sandwiches cut around the top half while the lower set cuts around the bottom half and separates the finished pencils,Relevant
The majority of pencils are hexagonal so designed to keep the pencils from rolling off surfaces a single sandwich yields six to nine hexagonal pencils,Irrelevant
After the pencils have been cut their surfaces are smoothed by sanders and varnish is applied and dried,Relevant
This is done with varnishing machines in which the pencils are immersed in a vat of varnish and then passed through a felt disk which removes the excess varnish,Relevant
After drying the pencils are put through the process again and again until the desired color is achieved,Relevant
Finally the pencils receive a finishing coat,Relevant
The pencils once again are sent on a conveyor belt through shaping machines which remove any excess varnish that has accumulated on the ends of the pencils,Relevant
This step also ensures that all of the pencils are the same length,Relevant
Erasers are then attached held to the pencil by a round metal case called a ferrule,Relevant

The ferrule first attaches to the pencil either with glue or with small metal prongs and then the eraser is inserted and the ferrule clamped around it In the final step a heated steel die presses the company logo onto each pencil ,Relevant
