Manufacturing a pesticide involves at least three separate activities,Irrelevant
The active ingredient is first synthesized in a chemical factory then formulated in the same place or sent to a formulator who prepares the liquid or powder form,Relevant
The pesticide is then sent to the farmer or other certified applicator who dilutes it before applying it to the fields,Relevant
When a new pesticide is first developed it is manufactured on a small scale in a laboratory,Relevant
If the substance proves viable production begins in the factory,Relevant
Batch or continuous manufacturing insures a high volume perhaps as much as 500 kilograms per cycle,Irrelevant
Synthesizing a pesticide is a complex chemical procedure that requires trained chemists and a large sophisticated laboratory,Irrelevant
The basic procedure entails altering an organic molecule to form a pesticide,Irrelevant
This may involve any of a number of specific reagents and catalysts and often must take place in a controlled climate (within a certain temperature range for example),Irrelevant
Once synthesized the active ingredient is packaged and sent to a formulator,Relevant
Liquid insecticides can be shipped in tank trucks or 200liter drums,Irrelevant
Transport of the active ingredient follows all regulations for hazardous materials transportation,Irrelevant

A formulator accepts the active ingredient measures out the proper amount mixes it with carrier if it is to be a liquid pesticide or with inert powders or dry fertilizers if it is to be a dust pesticide then bottles or packages it,Relevant
Liquid pesticides are packaged in 200liter drums if a largescale farmer is the anticipated customer or 20liter jugs for smallscale operations,Relevant
Dry formulations can be packaged in 5 to 10 kilogram plastic or plasticlined bags,Relevant

An emulsified formulation is usually concentrated to render transport easier (the active ingredient typically makes up 50 percent of the emulsified concentrate) but granulated and dry pesticides are ready to use,Relevant
The pesticide might be stored a short time before it is requested,Relevant
When it is ready for transport the estimated necessary amount is sent to the farmer who dilutes the emulsified concentrate to create the amount of pesticide desired,Relevant
In most instances the final product consists of only ,Irrelevant
5 to 1 percent of the original active ingredient,Irrelevant
The pesticide is now ready to be applied,Relevant
There are several ways to apply a pesticide,Irrelevant
The method with which Americans are most familiar is crop dusting though its use is generally limited to large flat areas,Irrelevant
A plane loaded with 2000liter (or larger) tanks flies over a field and sprays out the pesticide from booms,Relevant
Booms are long horizontal rods from which several sprinklers spray down,Irrelevant
Another method is to attach the tanks and booms to a tractor and spray closer to the ground,Relevant
For small farmers the most economical method of spraying is to use one or more workers with handheld sprayers attached to small tanks,Irrelevant
A hand pump can be carried on the shoulder its tank capacity is only about 3 to 12 liters,Irrelevant
Small tanks with a capacity of around 200 liters are also used,Relevant
The pesticides are applied with a hand gun,Relevant
A rough estimate of the amount applied is 150 to 300 liters per hectare,Irrelevant
After the raw materials are selected and the desired amounts weighed they go through a series of preparation steps,Irrelevant
First they are crushed and purified,Relevant

Next they are mixed together before being subjected to one of four forming processes—soft plastic forming stiff plastic forming pressing or casting the choice depends upon the type of ware being produced,Relevant
After the porcelain has been formed it is subjected to a final purification process bisquefiring before being glazed,Relevant
Glaze is a layer of decorative glass applied to and fired onto a ceramic body,Relevant
The final manufacturing phase is firing a heating step that takes place in a type of oven called a kiln,Irrelevant
First the raw material particles are reduced to the desired size which involves using a variety of equipment during several crushing and grinding steps,Relevant
Primary crushing is done in jaw crushers which use swinging metal jaws,Relevant
Secondary crushing reduces particles to 01 inch (25 centimeter) or less in diameter by using mullers (steeltired wheels) or hammer mills rapidly moving steel hammers,Relevant
For fine grinding craftspeople use ball mills that consist of large rotating cylinders partially filled with steel or ceramic grinding media of spherical shape,Relevant
The ingredients are passed through a series of screens to remove any under or oversized materials,Relevant
Screens usually operated in a sloped position are vibrated mechanically or electromechanically to improve flow,Relevant
If the body is to be formed wet the ingredients are then combined with water to produce the desired consistency,Relevant
Magnetic filtration is then used to remove iron from the slurries as these watery mixtures of insoluble material are called,Relevant
Because iron occurs so pervasively in most clays and will impart an undesirable reddish hue to the body if it oxidizes removing it prior to firing is essential,Irrelevant
If the body is to be formed dry shell mixers ribbon mixers or intensive mixers are typically used,Irrelevant
Next the body of the porcelain is formed,Relevant

This can be done using one of four methods depending on the type of ware being produced soft plastic forming where the clay is shaped by manual molding wheel throwing jiggering or ram pressing,Irrelevant
In wheel throwing a potter places the desired amount of body on a wheel and shapes it while the wheel turns,Relevant
In jiggering the clay is put on a horizontal plaster mold of the desired shape that mold shapes one side of the clay while a heated die is brought down from above to shape the other side,Relevant
In ram pressing the clay is put between two plaster molds which shape it while forcing the water out,Relevant
The mold is then separated by applying vacuum to the upper half of the mold and pressure to the lower half of the mold,Relevant
Pressure is then applied to the upper half to free the formed body stiff plastic forming which is used to shape less plastic bodies,Relevant
The body is forced through a steel die to produce a column of uniform girth,Relevant
This is either cut into the desired length or used as a blank for other forming operations pressing which is used to compact and shape dry bodies in a rigid die or flexible mold,Relevant
There are several types of pressing based on the direction of pressure,Irrelevant

Uniaxial pressing describes the process of applying pressure from only one direction whereas isostatic pressing entails applying pressure equally from all sides slip casting in which a slurry is poured into a porous mold,Irrelevant
The liquid is filtered out through the mold leaving a layer of solid porcelain body,Relevant
Water continues to drain out of the cast layer until the layer becomes rigid and can be removed from the mold,Relevant
If the excess fluid is not drained from the mold and the entire material is allowed to solidify the process is known as solid casting,Irrelevant

After being formed the porcelain parts are generally bisquefired which entails heating them at a relatively low temperature to vaporize volatile contaminants and minimize shrinkage during firing,Relevant
After the raw materials for the glaze have been ground they are mixed with water,Relevant
Like the body slurry the glaze slurry is screened and passed through magnetic filters to remove contaminants,Relevant
It is then applied to the ware by means of painting pouring dipping or spraying,Relevant
Different types of glazes can be produced by varying the proportions of the constituent ingredients such as alumina silica and calcia,Irrelevant
For example increasing the alumina and decreasing the silica produces a matte glaze,Irrelevant
Firing is a further heating step that can be done in one of two types of oven or kiln,Irrelevant
A periodic kiln consists of a single refractorylined sealed chamber with burner ports and flues (or electric heating elements),Irrelevant
It can fire only one batch of ware at a time but it is more flexible since the firing cycle can be adjusted for each product,Irrelevant
A tunnel kiln is a refractory chamber several hundred feet or more in length,Irrelevant
It maintains certain temperature zones continuously with the ware being pushed from one zone to another,Irrelevant
Typically the ware will enter a preheating zone and move through a central firing zone before leaving the kiln via a cooling zone,Irrelevant
This type of kiln is usually more economical and energy efficient than a periodic kiln,Irrelevant
During the firing process a variety of reactions take place,Irrelevant

First carbonbased impurities burn out chemical water evolves (at 215 to 395 degrees Fahrenheit or 100 to 200 degrees Celsius) and carbonates and sulfates begin to decompose (at 755 to 1295 degrees Fahrenheit or 400 to 700 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Gases are produced that must escape from the ware,Relevant

On further heating some of the minerals break down into other phases and the fluxes present (feldspar and flint) react with the decomposing minerals to form liquid glasses (at 1295 to 2015 degrees Fahrenheit or 700 to 1100 degrees Celsius),Irrelevant
These glass phases are necessary for shrinking and bonding the grains,Irrelevant

After the desired density is achieved (greater than 2195 degrees Fahrenheit or 1200 degrees Celsius) the ware is cooled which causes the liquid glass to solidify thereby forming a strong bond between the remaining crystalline grains,Relevant
After cooling the porcelain is complete,Relevant
At the printing plant the process begins with the delivery of paper for stamps with the glue already applied to the back,Relevant
Two printing processes are most often used in making stamps the intaglio process (which includes the gravure process) and the offset process,Irrelevant
It is not unusual however for a particular stamps specifications to call for the use of both methods,Irrelevant
Intaglio perhaps the oldest means of producing stamps is also the most timeconsuming,Irrelevant
However because this method creates stamps with more distinct images the process has not been pushed aside by newer faster and less expensive methods,Irrelevant
Intaglio involves engraving scratching or etching an image onto a printing plate which in turn transfers that image onto paper,Irrelevant
In one wellknown intaglio process called gravure the image is first transferred onto the plate photographically and then etched into the plate,Irrelevant
This section however will focus on an engraving process,Irrelevant
The engraving method of intaglio begins with the creation of a master die in which the design of the stamp is engraved in reverse,Relevant
The design is in the lowered portion of the die—the raised portion of the die will not be reproduced in the final product,Irrelevant
This is an exacting hand process in which the engraver is carefully cutting a mirror image of the original drawing for the stamp,Relevant
It might be several weeks before the engraver is satisfied that he or she has created the perfect duplicate,Irrelevant
After the die has been completed it is heated to harden the engraved image,Relevant

In the next step the hardened intaglio is transferred to a transfer roll which consists of soft steel wrapped around a rodshaped carrier or mandrel and which resembles a shortened rolling pin,Relevant
The transfer roll is machinepressed against the master die and rocked back and forth until the master die has created a relief impression on the transfer roll,Relevant
At this point the relief is a positive impression (no longer in reverse),Irrelevant
The process is repeated until the desired number of reliefs has been created on the transfer roll,Relevant
Like the master die the transfer roll is hardened by heating,Relevant
It is then pressed against a printing plate leaving another relief again in reverse on the printing plate,Relevant
If there are several reliefs on a transfer roll all can be passed to the printing plate,Irrelevant
Several printing plates can be made from the same transfer roll if the decision is made to use more than one machine to produce a particular stamp,Irrelevant
The impression on the plate is in the form of grooves rather than a raised image,Irrelevant
Once the plate is ready for use it is fastened into the printing press and coated with ink,Relevant
Inking is done automatically by several processes including spraying ink through small jets or moving an inkcovered roller across a plate,Relevant
The plate is then wiped by a blade called the doctor blade leaving ink only in the grooves,Relevant
The plate then presses against the paper leaving a positive impression of the reverse image that was originally copied onto the master die,Relevant
If more than one color is involved separate colors are handled by a process known as selective inking,Relevant
A particular color of ink is applied by a piece of hard rubber that comes in contact with only the section of the stamp that is to receive that color,Relevant
After the ink is applied in one area another piece of rubber with another color for another area is used to ink another portion of the plate,Relevant
The offset method of printing is less expensive than intaglio and can also produce very fine results and it is a common choice for many stamps,Irrelevant
In this method a picture or design is first made photochemically on an aluminum plate,Relevant

Once attached to the printing press the plate is alternately bathed in ink and water the photochemical image gets ink while the nonimage parts are dampened with water which acts as a repellent to the ink and ensures that only the image will be transferred to the paper,Relevant
Next the plate presses against a rubber blanket which carries a reverse image of the final picture,Relevant
In turn the rubber blanket contacts the paper producing the final positive image,Relevant
Perforations can be made either during the printing process by an adjacent machine or less commonly by a separate machine afterwards,Relevant
In the first method the sheet of paper is passed through a machine which uses little pins to punch the perforation holes through the paper in a horizontal and vertical grid,Relevant
After pushing through the paper the pins meet a matching metal indentation on the other side,Relevant
After being perforated the stamps move out of the press,Relevant

In the other method of producing perforations called rouletting a wheel similar to a pizza cutter but with pins is rolled across one side of the stamped paper after it has been removed from the printing press laying down a row of holes,Relevant
Though originally a handoperation this method of perforation is now automated,Relevant
The Bourdon tube is the most important part of the instrument,Irrelevant
The tube may be made from solid bar stock by drilling the length to the desired inside diameter and turning the outside diameter on a lathe to achieve the appropriate wall thickness,Irrelevant
However most general purpose gauges utilize preformed tubing purchased from a metals supplier,Irrelevant
The gauge builder specifies the desired wall thickness material configuration and diameter,Irrelevant
The supplier provides the material in 10 to 12foot (3 to 365meter) lengths ready for production,Irrelevant
Most manufacturers have closely guarded proprietary rolling methods for rolling the tubing into the C shape,Irrelevant
The C shape of the tube is generally formed in an automatic rolling machine,Irrelevant
This machine contains two precision powered rollers through which the tubing passes,Irrelevant
One roller grasps the tubing end and forms the inside radius while the other provides outside pressure to maintain uniform contact with the tubing,Irrelevant
Each roller contains a groove that fits around the outside of the tubing these grooves allow the tubing to maintain its circular shape rather than being flattened,Irrelevant

In the rolling process a steel mandrel—a bar that guides the tubing into the rollers and helps it keep its shape—is first inserted though the free end of the tubing and positioned just before the rollers,Relevant
This lubricated mandrel is of the desired interior shape of the oval,Relevant
The tubing then passes over the mandrel and between the rollers,Relevant
One roller contains a clip that grabs the tubing as the roller turns it pulls the tubing and bends it into the C shape,Irrelevant
The same roller that grabs and bends the tubing also contains a saw blade,Irrelevant
As the roller continues turning after creating the bend the saw blade on it cuts the tubing to the proper length,Relevant
The tubing is then heat treated in ovens,Relevant

The socket is basically a block of metal that serves as a connector to the source of the pressure medium a mount for the case dial and movement and as an attachment slot for the Bourdon tube,Irrelevant
One end of the socket is threaded which allows it to be screwed into the pressureproviding apparatus,Irrelevant
The socket may be cast forged extruded or machined from bar stock,Irrelevant
Most sockets are made on automated machining centers that turn drill mill and thread all in one cycle,Relevant
General machining practices apply to most socket manufacture,Relevant
Movements are geared mechanisms that contain a pinion (a rotating shaft) sector support plates hairspring and spacer columns,Irrelevant
The mechanism converts the somewhat linear displacement of the Bourdon tip into rotary movement as well as providing a means for calibration adjustment,Irrelevant
The pointer is fastened to the rotating shaft or pinion and sweeps across the graduated dial indicating the pressure amount,Irrelevant
Most movements are supplied to the gauge builder ready to use,Irrelevant
Many types of manufacturing processes are used to produce the movement components and the workmanship of the mechanism closely resembles a clockwork when completed,Irrelevant
The case dial and pointer may be sheet metal stampings plastic moldings or castings,Irrelevant
Stampings and moldings require little further processing but castings will require some machining—trimming off excess material for instance—to meet the final requirements,Irrelevant
These components are painted as required and the dials are printed with the appropriate artwork,Irrelevant
Common printing practice utilizing both offset and direct methods is used,Irrelevant
The lens most commonly is a plastic part made by injection molding whereby the plastic is heated into a molten state and then poured into a mold of the desired shape,Irrelevant
The attachment feature that secures and seals the lens to the case is designed into the mold,Irrelevant
Glass lenses are still used but must be retained by a ring of some type,Irrelevant
Glass has fallen out of favor because of the safety problems of breakage,Irrelevant
After the Bourdon tube is made its closed end is attached to the socket by soldering brazing or welding,Relevant
The free end of the Bourdon tube is precisely located during this assembly operation and then sealed usually by the same means used to join the tube to the socket,Relevant
Once the Bourdon tube and socket assembly is secure the tip of the unsupported end of the C is attached to an endpiece,Relevant
This endpiece contains a small hole that connects the tip to the geared movement mechanism,Relevant
The Bourdon tip doesnt move a great distance within its pressure range typically 125 to 25 inch (31 to 63 centimeter),Irrelevant
Understandably the greater the pressure the farther the tip moves,Relevant
The other components—the movement pointer and dial—are then assembled onto the socket as a group,Relevant

While there are many variations in the manufacturing process that exploit the versatility of the fiber the following is a description of the procedure that is used in making regular or viscose rayon,Irrelevant
Regardless of whether wood pulp or cotton linters are used the basic raw material for making rayon must be processed in order to extract and purify the cellulose,Irrelevant
The resulting sheets of white purified cellulose are then treated to form regenerated cellulose filaments,Irrelevant
In turn these filaments are spun into yarns and eventually made into the desired fabric,Relevant
Sheets of purified cellulose are steeped in sodium hydroxide (caustic soda) which produces sheets of alkali cellulose,Relevant
These sheets are dried shredded into crumbs and then aged in metal containers for 2 to 3 days,Relevant
The temperature and humidity in the metal containers are carefully controlled,Relevant
After ageing the crumbs are combined and churned with liquid carbon disulfide which turns the mix into orangecolored crumbs known as sodium cellulose xanthate,Relevant
The cellulose xanthate is bathed in caustic soda resulting in a viscose solution that looks and feels much like honey,Relevant
Any dyes or delusterants in the design are then added,Relevant
The syrupy solution is filtered for impurities and stored in vats to age this time between 4 and 5 days,Relevant
The viscose solution is next turned into strings of fibers,Relevant
This is done by forcing the liquid through a spinneret which works like a showerhead into an acid bath,Irrelevant
If staple fiber is to be produced a large spinneret with large holes is used,Irrelevant
If filament fiber is being produced then a spinneret with smaller holes is used,Irrelevant
In the acid bath the acid coagulates and solidifies the filaments now known as regenerated cellulose filaments,Relevant
After being bathed in acid the filaments are ready to be spun into yarn,Relevant
Depending on the type of yarn desired several spinning methods can be used including Pot Spinning Spool Spinning and Continuous Spinning,Irrelevant
In Pot Spinning the filaments are first stretched under controlled tension onto a series of offsetting rollers called godet wheels,Relevant
This stretching reduces the diameter of the filaments and makes them more uniform in size and it also gives the filaments more strength,Irrelevant
The filaments are then put into a rapidly spinning cylinder called a Topham Box resulting in a cakelike strings that stick to the sides of the Topham Box,Relevant
The strings are then washed bleached rinsed dried and wound on cones or spools,Relevant
Spool Spinning is very similar to Pot Spinning,Irrelevant
The filaments are passed through rollers and wound on spools where they are washed bleached rinsed dried and wound again on spools or cones,Relevant
In Continuous Spinning the filaments are washed bleached dried twisted and wound at the same time that they are stretched over godet wheels,Relevant
Once the fibers are sufficiently cured they are ready for posttreatment chemicals and the various weaving processes necessary to produce the fabric,Relevant
The resulting fabric can then be given any of a number of finishing treatments,Relevant
These include calendaring to control smoothness fire resistance preshrinking water resistance and wrinkle resistance,Irrelevant
Pieces of sheet metal are either welded or clinched together,Irrelevant
Clinching is a process closely resembling stapling in that the two pieces are crimped together under pressure though no additional pieces such as staples are added,Irrelevant
If the part of the cabinet is to be visible it will be welded and ground down to appear as one piece,Irrelevant
The extent to which the welding process is automated depends on the company and the number of refrigerators being produced,Irrelevant
If the sheet metal was not purchased in precoated form it is now painted,Irrelevant
Some manufacturers use spray equipment to lay a uniform coat of paint on the metal,Irrelevant
Others dip the parts in a paintsolvent mixture before heating them to bake the paint onto the surface,Irrelevant
The inner cabinet is sometimes made from sheet metal very similar to the outer shell,Irrelevant
Any seams are caulked to improve insulation and looks,Irrelevant
Some manufacturers and some models use plastic for inner liners for example the inner door is almost exclusively made from plastic today,Irrelevant
The plastic liners are vacuum formed,Relevant
In this process a thick piece of plastic slightly larger than the finished part has its outer edges clamped and is then heated,Relevant
The hot plastic is next pulled by vacuum into a mold and cooled,Relevant
After trimming the resulting part is ready for assembly,Relevant
The inner cabinet is inserted into the outer cabinet and the two are snapped together before the fixtures are inserted,Relevant
Some tubes and wires are run through the gap between the two before it is filled with insulation,Relevant
A dispensing device (sometimes robotically operated sometimes a manually operated long gun) inserts foam between the walls,Relevant
When heated in an oven this foam expands to add rigidity and insulation to the cabinet,Relevant
A similar process is used for the doors,Irrelevant
The refrigeration components are attached to the cabinet using screws and clips,Relevant
The tubing is soldered together and a protective coating is sprayed on the joints,Relevant
The order of this assembly varies between manufacturers and models,Relevant
The copper tubing from which the coils (condensers and evaporators) have separately been cut bent and soldered is then attached to the refrigerator as a unit,Relevant
The seal on the refrigerator door is created by means of magnet laden gaskets that are attached to the doors with screws,Relevant
Handles and hinges are also screwed onto the door before its hinges are screwed onto the cabinet,Relevant
Some adjustment is allowed for proper operation of the door,Relevant
Most manufacturers mix testing with manufacturing from this point on,Irrelevant
The unit is leak tested with nitrogen (a safe gas that makes up about 79 percent of the air) if it passes it is charged with refrigerant and subjected to further testing,Irrelevant
Next the accessories (shelves crispers ice trays etc) are added and taped down for shipping,Irrelevant
The unit is given a final look and then packaged for shipping,Irrelevant
The major components of most revolvers begin as a group of steel or stainless steel blanks that are forged into close approximations of the desired parts,Relevant
The basic shape of each part is formed by placing a heated blank of material into a forging press and impacting it with several hundred tons of force,Relevant
This impact forces the metal into the forging die a steel block with a cavity shaped like the part being produced,Relevant
Sometimes multiple strikes by the press are required each with a more precise die than the previous step,Relevant
The resulting part is both extremely strong and very similar to final shape,Irrelevant
After forging the flow patterns of the metal must be stabilized by heat treating,Relevant
This procedure consists of reheating the parts in a controlled atmosphere to relieve internal stresses without reducing the metals inherent strength,Irrelevant
Machining can now begin on the frame cylinder and other component parts,Irrelevant
Most modern revolvers are manufactured on automated computercontrolled machining centers and lathes,Irrelevant
However a number of manufacturers have had such excellent service and results with some of their machines that they continue to utilize fiftyyearold equipment,Irrelevant
Regardless of whether older or modern equipment is used the basic process actions of milling drilling and tapping are essentially the same,Irrelevant
The tolerances on this machining must be held within one or two thousandths of an inch,Irrelevant
All of the components from the screws to the trigger are machined using similar processes,Irrelevant
To effectively machine the raw forging a worker clamps it into a holding apparatus that secures the part during machining,Irrelevant
Properly designed fixtures also contain tool guides and bushings to support the cutting tool and increase accuracy,Irrelevant
Many of the operations performed will require several specialized fixtures,Irrelevant
Cylinders screws shafts and barrels are made on lathes while frames sideplates sights and triggers are made on a milling and machining center,Irrelevant
One of the most unique processes is the rifling of the barrel,Irrelevant
Rifling is essentially a series of grooves within the barrel,Irrelevant
These grooves have a precise twist that through contact with the bullet circumference causes the bullet to spin during firing,Irrelevant
This rate of twist is about 1 turn in 16 inches (406 centimeters),Irrelevant
To produce the rifling a worker subjects the barrel to either the cutting or the button rifling process,Irrelevant
Cutting is accomplished by drawing a broachlike cutting tool through the barrel blank repeatedly removing metal to approximately 010 inch (025 centimeter) deep,Relevant
Cutting marks and other scratches within the rifling can impair accuracy by damaging the bullet which throws it out of balance,Relevant
However one advantage of these marks is that they are different in every gun barrel producing unique rifling imprints on the bullets they fire,Relevant
This is how law enforcement specialists match bullets to the gun that fired them,Irrelevant
Button rifling refers to an operation in which a hardened form tool is drawn through the barrel blank under high force displacing the metal in the grooves without cutting,Irrelevant
This is similar in some respects to the forging operation only it is done without heating the barrel,Irrelevant
The advantages of button rifling are increased production no chip formation and improved surface quality,Irrelevant
After machining the metal surfaces of most steel or aluminum weapons receive a protective coating to reduce corrosion,Irrelevant
Commonly referred to as blueing this process entails submersing the parts in tanks of acid and other chemicals,Irrelevant
In these vats the chemicals react with the metal to produce a durable barrier against the elements,Irrelevant

Chrome and gold plating parkerizing and anodizing (for aluminum) are some variants of the blueing process while plating another means of applying a protective coat is accomplished by setting up an electric current between the parts and the supply anode which consists of another type of metal,Irrelevant
The electrical path carries molecules of the plating metal to the component where they bond very tightly to the surface,Irrelevant
The entire weapon is assembled by one person who fits all of the components many of them manually,Relevant
While dimensional control has improved significantly over the past twenty years the timing of the trigger and hand mechanism and the crispness of the trigger pull are still set by hand,Irrelevant
Most manufacturers have grades of fitting quality for example the trigger pull of a service weapon that will be used by police is set heavier than that of a target or specialty handgun,Irrelevant
One would expect to exert a more determined effort to discharge a weapon in a law enforcement setting while at the target range the lighter trigger pull is desirable to increase accuracy,Irrelevant
Once the weapon has been put together any necessary filing polishing and turning will be performed before testing,Relevant
The initial stage of manufacturing the harvested latex usually takes place on the rubber plantation prior to packing and shipping,Irrelevant

The first step in processing the latex is purification which entails straining it to remove the other constituent elements apart from rubber and to filter out impurities such as tree sap and debris,Irrelevant
The purified rubber is now collected in large vats,Relevant
Combined with acetic or formic acid the rubber particles cling together to form slabs,Relevant
Next the slabs are squeezed between rollers to remove excess water and pressed into bales or blocks usually 2 or 3 square feet (6 or 9 square meter) ready for shipping to factories,Relevant
The size of the blocks depends on what the individual plantation can accommodate,Irrelevant
The rubber is then shipped to a rubber factory,Relevant
Here the slabs are machine cut (or chopped) into small pieces,Relevant
Next many manufacturers use a Banbury Mixer invented in 1916 by Femely H Banbury,Irrelevant
This machine mixes the rubber with other ingredients—sulfur to vulcanize it pigments to color it and other chemicals to increase or diminish the elasticity of the resulting rubber bands,Relevant
Although some companies dont add these ingredients until the next stage (milling) the Banbury machine integrates them more thoroughly producing a more uniform product,Irrelevant
Milling the next phase of production entails heating the rubber (a blended mass if it has been mixed discrete pieces if it has not) and squeezing it flat in a milling machine,Relevant
After the heated flattened rubber leaves the milling machine it is cut into strips,Relevant
Still hot from the milling the strips are then fed into an extruding machine which forces the rubber out in long hollow tubes (much as a meat grinder produces long strings of meat),Relevant
Excess rubber regularly builds up around the head of each extruding machine and this rubber is cut off collected and placed back with the rubber going into the milling machine,Irrelevant
The tubes of rubber are then forced over aluminum poles called mandrels which have been covered with talcum powder to keep the rubber from sticking,Irrelevant
Although the rubber has already been vulcanized its rather brittle at this point and needs to be cured before it is elastic and usable,Irrelevant
To accomplish this the poles are loaded onto racks that are steamed and heated in large machines,Relevant
Removed from the poles and washed to remove the talcum powder the tubes of rubber are fed into another machine that slices them into finished rubber bands,Relevant
Rubber bands are sold by weight and because they tend to clump together only small quantities can be weighed accurately by machines,Relevant
Generally any package over 5 pounds (22 kilograms) can be loaded by machine but will still require manual weighing and adjusting,Relevant
Shoemaking is a laborintensive process and the cost of producing the many components of the running shoe reflect the skilled labor necessary,Irrelevant
Each phase of production requires precision and skills and taking shortcuts to reduce costs can result in an inferior shoe,Irrelevant
Some running shoes (known as sliplasted shoes) have no insole board,Irrelevant
Instead the singlelayer upper is wrapped around both the top and the bottom portions of the foot,Irrelevant
Most running shoes however consist of an insole board that is cemented to the upper with cement,Irrelevant
This section will focus on cementlasted shoes,Irrelevant
First prepared rolls of synthetic material and rolls of dyed split and suede leather (used as part of the foxing) are sent to the factory,Relevant
Next die machines stamp the shoe shapes which are then cut out in cookie cutter fashion with various markings to guide the rest of the assembly,Relevant
After being bundled and labeled these pieces are sent to another part of the factory where theyll be stitched,Relevant
The pieces that will form the upper part of the shoe are stitched or cemented together and the lace holes punched out,Relevant

These pieces include the featherline the vamp the mudguard the throat (with eyestay and lacing section) the tongue reinforcements such as the saddle or arch bandage the collar (with Achilles tendon protector) the foxing and the logo,Relevant

At this point the upper looks not like a shoe but like a round hat because there is extra material—called the lasting margin —that will be folded underneath the shoe when it gets cemented to the sole,Irrelevant
Next the insole is stitched to the sides of the upper,Relevant
Stiffening agents are then added to the heel region and toe box and an insole board is inserted,Relevant
The completed upper is heated and fitted around a last a plastic mold that forms the final shape of the shoe,Relevant
An automatic lasting machine then pulls the upper down over the last,Relevant
Finally a cement nozzle applies cement between the upper and insole board and the machine presses the two pieces together to bond them,Relevant
The upper now has the exact shape of the finished shoe,Irrelevant
Prestamped and cutout forms of the midsole and outsole or wedge are layered and cemented to the upper,Irrelevant
First the outsole and midsole are aligned and bonded together,Relevant
Next the outsole and midsole are aligned with the upper and placed over a heater to reactivate the cement,Relevant
As the cement cools the upper and bottom are joined,Relevant
The shoe is removed from the last and inspected,Relevant
Any excess cement is scraped off,Relevant
After the hide or skin is removed from the animals carcass it is soaked in drums containing lime and other chemicals to loosen the hair and outer layer of the skin,Relevant
The inside flesh layer is also removed either by machine or hand with a special knife,Relevant
The remaining hide is soaked in lime and bacteria solutions to remove residue,Relevant
Next the hair is removed either by machine or manually with a special knife,Relevant
The hide is soaked again this time in an acid solution in order to remove the lime left by the previous soakings,Relevant

Because it is important that the fleshy side is left smooth with no loose fibers the hide undergoes a final treatment called scudding which involves hanging the hide over a beam and removing any bits of remaining hair tissue and dirt with a blunt knife,Relevant
The hide is then thoroughly washed,Relevant
To prevent hides from decaying they are immersed in a diluted solution of tanning acid,Relevant
Over several months they are gradually treated with stronger solutions,Relevant
Oil tanning or chamoising is still used sometimes by rubbing animal or fish grease into the hide,Irrelevant
At this point the leather has two sides the flesh side and the grain side,Irrelevant
The hides are now given to a currier who manually rubs a mixture of tallow cod oil and other greases plus wax into the leather over a period of time,Relevant
This process gives the leather color makes it flexible durable and waterproof,Irrelevant
The most common and popular colors for saddles are golden yellow also known as the London color and Havana which is of a darker shade,Irrelevant
Warwick a much darker color that turns black with use is applied in the making of frizzing harness as opposed to riding tack,Irrelevant
(This color is produced by staining with aniline dye),Irrelevant
The currier then allows the hides to mature for several weeks,Relevant
There are two basic saddle tree designs the rigid and spring tree both of which can accommodate either a straight or dipped seat,Irrelevant
The modern English saddle usually has a spring tree while the Western saddle has a rigid tree,Irrelevant
The spring tree is first shaped out of thin plywood,Relevant

Fiberglass material (the fiberglass looks like a white screen mesh) is then stretched over this plywood and liquid resin is handbrushed or sprayed on top resulting in a very strong and durable product,Relevant

Two springs made of lightweight steel strips are then inserted under the tree running from front to the rear along the widest part of the seat and set about two inches (five centimeters) from the outside,Relevant
The springs provide greater comfort and more flexibility to the rider by allowing the pressure exerted through the seat bones to be transmitted to the horse,Irrelevant

The rigid saddle tree is made by molding it out of fiberglass by combining wood shavings with resin in a mold under pressure or by creating a wooden tree around which wet leather strips are wrapped and allowed to dry,Relevant
To reinforce the saddle tree steel plates are placed underneath the tree from the pommel (the head) to the cantle (the rear part of the saddle which projects upward),Relevant
The steel plates are secured above and below the pommel at the head and gullet of the tree,Relevant
The stirrup bars are attached next,Relevant
A prongline metal bracket measuring three inches wide is bolted onto the tree below the head on the point of the tree (the forwardmost point of the saddle),Irrelevant
Bars are made of two pieces the bar itself and a movable catch or thumb piece which is set into the bar,Irrelevant
This catch works on the premise that it can be opened when the stirrup leather is put in position and will in theory open and release the leather if the rider should fall,Irrelevant

The bars are always forged (hammered or squeezed into the proper shape) or cast (put into a liquid state and forced into a shaped mold) and the word forged or cast is always stamped on the bar,Irrelevant

A typical saddle includes a seat for the rider skirts panels and flaps that protect the horse from the riders legs and vice versa a girth that fits around the stomach of the horse and keeps the saddle stable and stirrups for the riders feet,Irrelevant
Drings are used to hold items such as canteens or ropes,Irrelevant

A typical saddle includes a seat for the rider skirts panels and flaps that protect the horse from the riders legs and vice versa a girth that fits around the stomach of the horse and keeps the saddle stable and stirrups for the riders feet,Irrelevant
Drings are used to hold items such as canteens or ropes,Irrelevant
The stirrup leathers about 78 inch (22 centimeters) wide are made from read leather cowhide rawhide or buffalo hide,Irrelevant
They go over the top of the bar and back down to the stirrups,Irrelevant
A strong muslin cloth is placed over the tree from the pommel to the cantle to form a foundation,Relevant
Pitch paint is then applied to waterproof it,Relevant
Next strips of white serge a woolen material are stretched and fastened tightly with small nails from the head of the tree at the pommel to the cantle,Relevant
Stretch canvas is then positioned over the serge and nailed in place,Relevant
This forms the base of the seat,Irrelevant

Small pieces of shaped felt and leather (called bellies) are placed on the edges of the tree at the broadest part of the seat so that when the seat is eventually made it will not drop away at the edges,Relevant
A piece of serge is then tightly stretched and stitched down to the canvas layer to make the shape of the seat,Relevant

Next a small slit is made so that the space between the serge and canvas can be lightly stuffed with wool to give the seat resilience and to prevent the tree itself being felt through the leather seat,Relevant
Pigskin is now dampened and stretched tightly and is then stretched over the seat,Relevant
(The pigskin is dampened and stretched so that when it dries and shrinks a neat and tight final product will be achieved),Irrelevant
The under panel which protects the horse from the girths is stitched and nailed into place on the tree,Relevant
The under panel is usually made of pigskin leather or grained cowhide,Irrelevant
Girth straps are attached to the saddle next,Relevant
Made of soft leather these straps are very short,Irrelevant
Attached to them are the girths whose purpose is to hold the saddle firmly in place by fastening them around the horses belly,Irrelevant

These girths are made in 78inch or oneinch (254 centimeters) thick sizes and they can range in length from 36 inches (9144 centimeters) for a tiny pony to 54 inches (137 centimeters) for a large horse (these measurements include the buckles),Irrelevant
Girths are made of soft leather mohair or nylon,Irrelevant
The outer panels made of leather are stuffed with felt wool or plastic foam and are covered in either leather serge or linen,Relevant
They are attached underneath the saddle,Irrelevant
Leather skirts are then sewn just above the outer panel,Relevant
Drings (also known as tiedowns) are now attached to the saddle,Relevant
Usually about one inch wide the Drings are made of rawhide and have strings attached to them,Irrelevant
The salsa manufacturer purchases fresh frozen or dehydrated produce such as tomatoes peppers and onions from growers,Irrelevant
Other ingredients such as vinegar tomato paste spices or additives are purchased from manufacturers in processed form,Irrelevant
The tomatoes are first inspected then peeled using lye,Relevant
The stems seeds and any residual skin are then removed,Relevant
Some salsa manufacturers roast their green chili peppers before washing them,Relevant
Next the stem seeds and calyx are removed,Relevant
The chili peppers are then blanched and the pH value or acid count is adjusted using citric acid,Relevant
All other produce is cleaned by passing the vegetables through tanks of water or by spraying under high water pressure,Relevant
The inedible parts of these vegetables (such as garlic peel stems or onion skins) are removed by processing machines,Relevant
The vegetables are then cut using standard machines that are preset to the desired level of fineness,Relevant
To make chunky salsa the vegetables are usually diced while the fresh cilantro is minced,Relevant
To make smoother salsa all the vegetables are processed to the same consistency as the tomatoes,Relevant
Most salsa is not fresh due to longdistance transport of the product from manufacturing plants to retail outlets,Irrelevant
Because it is important for the product to have a long shelflife heating the salsa is necessary to prohibit the growth of mold within the container before purchase,Relevant
Most salsa however is minimally processed,Relevant
The tomato paste or processed tomatoes water vinegar and spices are placed in a premix kettle that is large enough to hold several batches of salsa,Relevant
This mixture is then placed in a batch kettle along with the other ingredients such as onions and chili peppers,Relevant
Salsa may be slow or fast cooked or in the case of fresh salsa steam cooked,Relevant

Cooking time and temperature vary the slow method subjects the salsa to a low temperature of 163 degrees Fahrenheit (71 degrees Celsius) for 45 minutes while the fast method subjects the salsa to a high temperature of 253 degrees Fahrenheit (121 degrees Celsius) for 30 seconds under pressure,Irrelevant
After cooking the salsa is ladled into glass jars plastic bottles or other containers that are usually made from heatresistant polyethylene or polypropylene,Relevant
Fresh salsa is placed into the container cold and then steam heated while cooked salsa is placed into the container while it is still warm,Relevant
The machine that fills the containers does so by volume,Irrelevant
The jars or containers are then sealed and cooled in cold water or air,Relevant
This process vacuumseals the product because the heated salsa cools and contracts producing a partial vacuum under the seal,Relevant
Jars and plastic containers that are not preprinted with product information are labeled and then packed in corrugated cardboard boxes to be shipped to stores,Relevant
A typical sanding belt originates with the manufacture of a large roll of coated abrasive containing an X weight cotton fabric backing 100 grit aluminum oxide and resin bond,Irrelevant
Production starts when the make coat is applied to one side of the backing material,Relevant
The next step applying the abrasive mineral is the most important in the manufacturing process because it determines the orientation and density of the mineral,Relevant
In the past the backing with the first layer of adhesive passed under a controlled stream of abrasive which applied a thin layer of randomly oriented grit,Irrelevant
Today the backing is passed adhesive side down over a pan of abrasives that have been electrostatically charged—given an electric charge opposite to the backing,Irrelevant
The opposite charge causes the abrasive to adhere evenly to the backing resulting in a very sharp fastcutting coated abrasive tool with the maximum life possible,Irrelevant
Controlling mineral density on the flexible backing gives rise to two important variations in product design openand closedcoat abrasives,Irrelevant
An opencoat product contains abrasives grains that cover from 50 to 70 percent of the surface area of the backing,Irrelevant
This lower density allows the finished product to be flexible and prevents it from clogging or loading with bits of work material,Relevant

In closedcoat products the mineral covers 100 percent of the available surface area making the finished products better for finishing applications and more suitable for rougher handling than opencoat products,Irrelevant
Once the grain has been imbedded in the make coat the roll is dried and moved on for application of the size coat,Relevant
Following application of the size coat the roll is dried again and cured under carefully controlled temperature and humidity conditions,Relevant
The finished product is then wound on a large spool and shipped to the companies that will convert it into sanding belts or other items,Relevant
Additional materials and processes may be included to give the converted product special characteristics,Relevant
One such treatment is the addition of a grinding aid in the size coat that improves grinding of some metals in highpressure applications,Relevant
Another treatment entails applying a pressuresensitive adhesive to the nonabrasive side of the backing to make some types of sanding disks,Irrelevant
Material may be also added to reduce the static electricity that is generated when a belt is used on wood,Relevant

Passing the roll through two closely spaced steel rollers in a process called satining crushes protruding minerals and leaves a product with uniform thickness designed for fine finishing applications,Irrelevant
Before the coated abrasive roll is converted into a belt or other product it is systematically flexed or bent to break the continuous layer of adhesive bond,Relevant
This flexing is necessary because the freshly manufactured roll is so stiff that it otherwise would not perform properly when converted into other products,Relevant
Flexing can be applied in either a single direction or in multiple directions,Irrelevant
Single direction flexing breaks the bond usually at a 90 degree angle to the edge of the roll,Irrelevant
For special applications in which the belt must accurately conform to contours of a part surface single direction flexing is applied along lines parallel to the sides of the belt,Irrelevant
Multiple flexing breaks the bond at 45 degree angles to the sides of the belt in a crisscross pattern or in a combination of 90 degree and 45 degree directions,Irrelevant
Although the latter produces a very flexible belt such flexing greatly reduces the useful life of the product,Irrelevant
Converting roll material into abrasive belts starts with cutting strips of coated abrasives to the desired width,Relevant
Each strip is then cut to the proper length and the ends are joined together,Relevant
The joint in common belts is an overlapping splice at 45 degrees,Irrelevant
Narrow belts are spliced at a more acute angle and wide belts at a greater angle,Relevant
A variety of splicing techniques can be applied depending upon the importance of changes in belt thickness at the slice and the amount of stress the belt will receive during use,Irrelevant
One common practice in preparing a splice for joining is skiving a process that removes a layer of abrasive or backing from the ends of the belt,Irrelevant
To minimize thickness of joints in products used for finishing applications both ends are skived,Relevant
Coarsegrained products which are used for less precise applications are skived on one end only,Relevant
Conversion of other products proceeds similarly,Irrelevant
For example sanding disks begin with a properly sized section of roll material and a machine punches out the individual disks complete with the hole in the center,Irrelevant

To make fiberglass suitable for dish manufacture a sheet molding compound mixture that includes reflective metallic material and ultraviolet scattering compositions is mixed with resin calcium carbonate and a catalyst cure,Relevant
This mixture forms a paste that is poured onto a sheet of polyethylene film that has fiberglass added in chopped form,Relevant
The result is a sheet layered with the compound paste fiberglass and the polyethylene film,Relevant
This sheet is then pressed at 89 degrees Fahrenheit (30 degrees Celsius) to mature,Relevant
To shape the sheet into the desired parabolic shape it is pressed at high pressure (of 14002200 metric tons),Relevant
The dish is then trimmed cooled and painted,Relevant
After the paint has dried the dish is packed for shipment in sturdy boxes,Relevant
For metallic dishes the common metal of choice is aluminum,Irrelevant
This type of dish can be assembled in sections called petals or all at once,Irrelevant
An aluminum plate is perforated with a punching die creating tiny holes,Relevant
The size of these holes are contingent on the manufacturers preference,Irrelevant
Larger holes mean greater loss of the signal so fairly small holes are selected,Relevant
Another factor in the selection of hole size is the power of the broadcasting satellite,Irrelevant
Newer more powerful satellites require a hole size that is approximately half that required for older less powerful satellites,Relevant
The newly perforated aluminum plate is then heated stretched over a mold cooled and trimmed,Relevant
A paint powder coating for protection is then applied using an electrostatic charge in which the paint is given an opposite electrical charge from the plate,Relevant
The dish or petal is then heated to melt the powder and seal the paint on,Relevant
The petals are usually sealed together with ribs in the factory,Relevant

Although some current home satellite dishes are very small—only about 3 feet in diameter—manufacturers have begun to introduce even smaller dishes that have a diameter of only 18 inches and can fit on a window sill or a porch,Irrelevant
Mesh petals are made from aluminum that is extruded—forced into a die of the proper shape,Irrelevant
They are usually joined together on site by sliding them into aluminum ribs that attach to the hub and then securing them with metal pins,Relevant
All dishes when complete will have the necessary equipment (the feed horn the amplifier etc) installed in the factory,Relevant
When the dish has been set up at the local dealer it is transported to the site location on a open trailer,Relevant
Satellite dishes can be installed either by professionals or by the purchaser with assistance from the retailer if necessary,Irrelevant
The method selected depends upon the size of the dish and the mechanical expertise of the purchaser,Irrelevant
An installation site reasonably clear of obstructions not more than 246 feet (75 meters) from the house is selected,Relevant
Site selection is also contingent on local building codes and the possibility of microwave interference from radio and television towers in the vicinity,Relevant
Once a site is selected the base must be installed first,Relevant
The base of most satellite dishes consists of a concrete foundation that extends below the frost line,Irrelevant
A clayey soil is excellent while sandy or rocky soil requires more concrete,Irrelevant
A base tube filled with concrete is then set into the concrete foundation,Relevant
Some satellite dishes require a slab mount installation a method considered to be more stable than typical base construction,Relevant
In some cases slab mount installation is necessary since the site selected for the placement of the satellite dish is unstable,Relevant
The slab is generally 16 feet (5 meter) square and 32 feet (1 meter) deep,Irrelevant
Soil is excavated to the proper depth and the concrete is poured,Relevant
A triangular steel mount fixture is then embedded into the concrete,Relevant
Next the pedestal is attached to either the base tube or the triangular steel mount fixture,Relevant
The elevation arm is then attached to the pedestal,Relevant
The mounted satellite dish must be aligned in order to point toward the satellite,Relevant
The angle at which the dish is eventually situated will vary according to which satellite is selected and at what latitude the dish is located,Irrelevant
Coaxial cables connect the satellite to the receiver that is located in the house near the television,Relevant
A trench must be dug for these cables which are placed into a pipe before being buried,Irrelevant
Making a flattip or slotted screwdriver is not very different than making any other configuration,Irrelevant
Variations between a flattip and a Phillips screwdriver will be discussed later in this entry,Irrelevant
First coils of green wire (wire that has not yet been drawn to final size) are delivered to a factory in large coils some as heavy as 3000 pounds (1362 kilograms),Relevant
The wire is usually about 375 inch (95 centimeter) in diameter,Irrelevant
The wire is then machinedrawn to the diameter necessary for the production run one adjustable drawing machine can produce any required diameter,Relevant
In drawing wire is fed through a die with a reducing aperture until it assumes the proper size,Relevant
After the wire is drawn it is annealed (heat treated) to obtain the correct tensile strength in the metal,Relevant
This process involves baking the wire at a temperature of about 1350 degrees Fahrenheit (732 degrees Celsius) for 12 hours,Relevant

Next the wire is straightened by a string forge and then transferred to a cold forming press which cuts the wire to the appropriate length and forms the tip of the screwdriver and the wings that will fit into the handle,Relevant
These wings can be seen through a clear or semiclear plastic handle,Irrelevant
The newly formed bar (the actual screwdriver without Ats handle) is then heat treated in an inline furnace at approximately 1555 degrees Fahrenheit (846 degrees Celsius),Relevant
This is a continuous flow process and as the bars come through the furnace they fall into an oil quench for cooling,Relevant
The bars are then placed in a draw back oven (450 to 500 degrees Fahrenheit or 232 to 259 degrees Celsius) and baked to a specified hardness,Relevant
Consumer model screwdrivers are nickelplated—covered with a protective coating of nickel—before assembly,Relevant
If the screwdriver is designated for professional use it is transferred to a handgrinding department where the tip is ground to size,Relevant
The shank is chemically milled and then polished,Relevant
The screwdriver then goes to a nickel flash bath and is electrically chrome plated,Relevant
After the cold forming press (step #3 above) cuts the wire the screwdriver is sent to a swage and grind operation where dies form blades for the tip from the heated wire,Relevant
The tool is then ground and the wings are formed,Relevant

If a professional model is being produced the bar goes to a tipping operation (an automatic tipping machine that creates the bullet point) and then to a profilator machine (a machine that cuts a profile),Irrelevant
This latter machine cuts the four grooves or slots on the sides above the point,Relevant
The wire is then winged and heattreated in the same way as the flattip screwdriver bars,Relevant
Consumer model Phillips screwdrivers are nickel plated while the professional model is polished and nickelchrome plated,Relevant

The handles of a screwdriver are usually made of cellulose acetate it is delivered to the factory in powder form (cellulose acetate rosin) and then mixed with a liquid plasticizer in a giant blender that holds approximately 1000 pounds (454 kilograms) of the mixed material,Irrelevant
If a colored handle is desired pigments are added into the blender,Relevant

The resulting paste which has the consistency of thick cake batter then goes to an extruder (a machine that forces a material out through an opening the way a meat grinder forces out strings of meat) which extrudes a solid piece of cellulose acetate,Irrelevant
The cellulose acetate is then cut into small pellets,Relevant
Next the pellets are fed into another extruder that extrudes the materials for the handles in bars that are 8 to 10 feet (24 to 3 meters) in length,Relevant
If a twocolor handle is desired a second extruding machine can be attached to the first to extrude a single twocolor rod,Relevant
The rods are then put into an automatic turning machine which shapes the handles and cuts them to the final length,Relevant
A hole is then drilled in the handle where the bar will be inserted,Relevant
The handles are machine washed and dried to remove grease oil and excess scraps from the turning machine and the extruder,Relevant
Next the handles are immersed in an acetone vapor bath which melts and smooths the outside of the handle,Relevant
The acetone vapor is highly flammable and this process takes place inside an explosionproof room,Irrelevant
The method of final assembly depends on the quality of the tool being produced,Relevant
Professional models are assembled individually on a horizontal assembly machine that hydraulically forces the bar into the plastic handle,Relevant
The handles are branded by a hot stamp immediately before going into the assembly machine,Relevant
This assembly process requires one skilled operator for each machine,Irrelevant
Other models might be assembled on hydraulic presses three at a time,Relevant
The least expensive models are assembled six at a time on one machine and placed by robot on a skin card machine that packages the screwdrivers for massmarket sale,Relevant
Before packaging the screwdrivers might be fitted with a special handle cover depending on need,Relevant
A rubber cap fitted over a screwdriver handle for example might be more comfortable for a professional using his tool five or six hours a day,Relevant

A large handle with deep grooves might be ideal for some workers while the home handyman who assembles a lamp or cabinet once every six months may not need or want to pay for the extra comfort,Relevant
A site might interest a seismologist for a number of reasons,Irrelevant
The most obvious one is that the region is earthquakeprone perhaps because it is adjacent to a fault or fracture in the earths crust,Irrelevant

Such fractures dislodge one of the blocks of earth adjoining them causing the block to shift higher lower or horizontally parallel to the fault and leaving the area vulnerable to further instability,Irrelevant
A seismograph might also be installed in a region currently without one so that seismologists can gather data for a more complete picture of the area,Irrelevant
Although some seismographs are placed in university or museum basements for educational purposes the ideal location for earthquake research would be more remote,Irrelevant
To record the earths seismic movements more accurately a seismograph should be placed where traffic and other vibrations are minimal,Irrelevant
In some cases an unused tunnel can be appropriated,Irrelevant
Other times a natural underground cavern is available,Irrelevant
Seismological researchers may even choose to dig a well and place the instrument inside if no other underground hole exists where a seismograph is deemed desirable,Irrelevant
An aboveground seismograph is also possible but it must rest above a solid rock foundation,Irrelevant
At a specialized factory the component parts of the seismograph are assembled and prepared for shipment,Relevant

First the pendulum is attached to either a soft spring (if its a vertical unit) or a wire (if its a horizontal unit) and suspended within a cylinder While horizontal seismometers contain a pendulum attached to a wire vertical units use a spring instead,Relevant
When the ground vibrates during an earthquake the pendulum remains still while the recorder moves thus creating a record of the earths movement,Irrelevant
Some recorders consist of a coil that generates an electrial signal which in turn is stored in computer memory for later printing,Irrelevant

A less sophisticated seismograph will have either a mirror that shines light onto lightsensitive paper a pen that writes with quickdrying ink upon a roll of paper or a heat pen that marks thermal paper,Irrelevant
While horizontal seismometers contain a pendulum attached to a wire vertical units use a spring instead,Irrelevant
When the ground vibrates during an earthquake the pendulum remains still while the recorder moves thus creating a record of the earths movement,Irrelevant
Some recorders consist of a coil that generates an electrial signal which in turn is stored in computer memory for later printing,Irrelevant

A less sophisticated seismograph will have either a mirror that shines light onto lightsensitive paper a pen that writes with quickdrying ink upon a roll of paper or a heat pen that marks thermal paper between electric coils,Irrelevant
Next the coils are wired to printed circuit boards and placed inside the seismograph body,Relevant
The whole unit can in turn be connected to a digital audio tape recorder which receives the current generated by the coils and transferred to the circuit boards,Relevant
If the data recording equipment consists of more traditional equipment such as a roll of paper and a pen these are now attached to the unit,Relevant
Depending on the final destination the seismograph is shipped by truck or plane in a cushioned crate by transporters experienced in moving delicate electronic equipment,Relevant

A seismograph intended for educational purposes might be bolted into the concrete floor of a basement but research seismographs are best situated far from the inevitable vibrations of a building,Relevant
They are either installed directly onto the bedrock in instances where great precision is required or in a bed of concrete,Relevant
In both cases earth is removed and the ground leveled,Relevant
In the second instance a bed of concrete is poured and allowed to set,Relevant
After the base has been prepared the seismometer unit is bolted into place,Relevant
In some instances where great sensitivity is required it will be housed in a vault where the temperature and humidity are controlled,Relevant
The seismometer unit is usually installed in the chosen field cavern or vault while the amplifiers filters and recording equipment are housed separately,Relevant
In modern seismology it is typical to have several seismometer units arrayed at a distance from one another,Relevant
Each seismometer unit sends signals to a central location where the data can be printed out and studied,Relevant
The signals may be broadcast from an antenna built into the unit or in more sophisticated units beamed up to a satellite,Relevant
The modern manufacture of shaving cream is a carefully controlled process,Irrelevant
Although carried out on a large scale its manufacture resembles a laboratory procedure involving only small quantities of ingredients,Irrelevant
There are two main phases to the manufacturing process,Irrelevant

In the first phase the fatty or oily portions of the formula—stearic acid lanolin and polyoxyethylene sorbitan monostearate—are heated in a jacketed kettle to a temperature of approximately 179 to 188 degrees Fahrenheit (80 to 85 degrees Celsius),Relevant

The jacketed kettle which can hold as little as 300 gallons or as much as 10000 gallons resembles a double boiler one container placed inside another is heated when steam is circulated through the outer container,Irrelevant
Inside the interior kettle are blades that revolve to mix the oils as they are heated,Relevant
After the first group of ingredients has turned smooth over a period of roughly 40 minutes the steam is released from the outer container of the kettle and the mixture is allowed to cool,Relevant
The second phase of manufacture begins when the mixture has cooled to about 152 degrees Fahrenheit (65 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Most of the remaining ingredients—water glycerin and triethanolamine—are added now and mixing continues for approximately 40 minutes,Relevant
When the mixture reaches a temperature of 125 to 134 degrees Fahrenheit (50 to 55 degrees Celsius) perfumes or other scents can be added,Relevant
Because perfumes consist primarily of highly volatile oils they would evaporate if added when the blend was still warm,Irrelevant

The formulas for perfumes which can contain more than 200 different ingredients come closer to being trade secrets than information about shaving cream itself (though textbook and handbook formulas for perfume are not hard to come by),Irrelevant
In recognition of this manufacturers do not have to disclose information about fragrances,Relevant
The mixture still being stirred is allowed to cool further until it reaches a temperature of 89 degrees Fahrenheit (30 degrees Celsius),Relevant

Now a thickening white mass of highly viscous liquid it is forced through a silk or stainless steel screen to eliminate any lumps that may have formed in the mixing process and to catch the rare impurity or foreign object such as a small wood splinter,Relevant
If this particular mixture is designated for tube packaging it is now placed in a tube and fitted with a cap,Relevant
After the bottom of the tube has been crimped the product is ready for shipment and stocking on a store shelf,Relevant
When the desired product is an aerosol spray the shaving cream is poured into an open can,Relevant
Next a valve and a cover are fitted onto the can and forced downward to form a seal,Relevant
Propellant is then forced into the can through the valve,Relevant
Most shaving preparations contain between four and five percent propellant a larger amount would dry the shaving cream as it came out of the can rendering it unusable,Irrelevant
A small amount of material is intentionally released (purged) to relieve excess pressure and the can is tested in water to make sure that the valve is holding tightly,Relevant
The can is now ready to be shipped,Relevant
Before the bottles can be made the PET itself must be manufactured or polymerized,Irrelevant
In polymerization smaller molecules are combined to form larger substances,Irrelevant
To make PET terephthalic acid is first combined with methanol (CH 3 OH),Relevant
This reaction yields dimethyl terephthalate and water,Relevant

Next the dimethyl terephthalat is combined with an excess of ethylene glycol at 305 degrees Fahrenheit (150 degrees Celsius) to yield another substance bis 2hydroxyethyl terephthalate and methanol,Relevant
The final step of polymerization involves the condensation polymerization of the bis 2hydroxyethyl terephthalate,Relevant
In this process a polymer is formed while another molecule is released or falls out,Relevant

The condensation polymerization of bis 2hydroxyethyl terephthalate is carried out in a vacuum at 530 degrees Fahrenheit (275 degrees Celsius) and results in chains of PET and ethylene glycol (see step #1 above) the latter substance is continuously removed during polymerization and used to make more PET ,Relevant
After the PET mixture reaches the required viscosity (thickness) it is cooled to avoid degradation and discoloration ,Relevant
Later it can be reheated for its various uses ,Irrelevant
PET beverage bottles are made using a process known as stretch blow molding (also called orientation blow molding) ,Irrelevant
First PET pellets are injection molded—heated and put into a mold—into a thin walled tube of plastic called a parison ,Relevant
The parison is then cooled and cut to the proper length ,Relevant
Next the parison tube is reheated and placed into another mold which is shaped like a soda bottle complete with screwtop ,Relevant
A steel rod (a mandrel) is slid into the parison ,Relevant
Highly pressurized air then shoots through the mandrel and fills the parison pressing it against the inside walls of the mold ,Relevant
The pressure of the air stretches the plastic both radially (out) and axially (down),Relevant
The combination of high temperature and stretching in the desired direction causes the molecules to polarize line up and essentially crystallize to produce a bottle of superior strength,Relevant
The entire procedure must be done quickly and the plastic must be pressed firmly against the wall or the bottle will come out misshapen,Relevant
In order to give the bottom of the bottle its proper concave shape—so that it can stand upright—a separate bottom piece is attached to the mold during the blowing process,Relevant
The mold must then be cooled,Relevant
Different cooling methods are used,Irrelevant
Water in pipes may flow around the mold or liquid carbon dioxide highly pressurized moist air or room air is shot into the bottle to cool it more directly,Irrelevant
The procedure is preferably done quickly to set the bottle before creep (flow) occurs,Relevant
The bottle is then removed from the mold,Relevant
In mass production small bottles are formed continuously in a string of attached bottles that are separated and trimmed,Relevant
Other trimming must be done wherever the plastic leaked through the cracks of the mold (like the way pancake batter does when squeezed in a waffle maker),Relevant
Ten to 25 percent of the plastic is lost this way but it can be reused,Irrelevant
Some soft drink producers make their own bottles but usually finished bottles are sent from specialty manufacturers to soft drink companies in trucks,Irrelevant
Plastic is cheap to transport because it is light,Irrelevant
Accessories such as lids and labels are manufactured separately,Relevant
Occasionally the plastic bottle manufacturer will put labels supplied by the soft drink company on the bottles before shipping them,Relevant
The silicon dioxide of either quartzite gravel or crushed quartz is placed into an electric arc furnace,Relevant
A carbon arc is then applied to release the oxygen,Relevant
The products are carbon dioxide and molten silicon,Irrelevant
This simple process yields silicon with one percent impurity useful in many industries but not the solar cell industry,Irrelevant
The 99 percent pure silicon is purified even further using the floating zone technique,Irrelevant
A rod of impure silicon is passed through a heated zone several times in the same direction,Relevant
This procedure drags the impurities toward one end with each pass,Relevant
At a specific point the silicon is deemed pure and the impure end is removed,Relevant
Solar cells are made from silicon boules polycrystalline structures that have the atomic structure of a single crystal,Irrelevant
The most commonly used process for creating the boule is called the Czochralski method,Irrelevant
In this process a seed crystal of silicon is dipped into melted polycrystalline silicon,Relevant
As the seed crystal is withdrawn and rotated a cylindrical ingot or boule of silicon is formed,Relevant
The ingot withdrawn is unusually pure because impurities tend to remain in the liquid,Irrelevant
From the boule silicon wafers are sliced one at a time using a circular saw whose inner diameter cuts into the rod or many at once with a multiwire saw,Relevant
(A diamond saw produces cuts that are as wide as the wafer— 5 millimeter thick),Irrelevant
Only about onehalf of the silicon is lost from the boule to the finished circular wafer—more if the wafer is then cut to be rectangular or hexagonal,Irrelevant
Rectangular or hexagonal wafers are sometimes used in solar cells because they can be fitted together perfectly thereby utilizing all available space on the front surface of the solar cell,Irrelevant
After the initial purification the silicon is further refined in a floating zone process,Relevant
In this process a silicon rod is passed through a heated zone several times which serves to drag the impurities toward one end of the rod,Relevant
The impure end can then be removed,Relevant
Next a silicon seed crystal is put into a Czochralski growth apparatus where it is dipped into melted polycrystalline silicon,Relevant
The seed crystal rotates as it is withdrawn forming a cylindrical ingot of very pure silicon,Relevant
Wafers are then sliced out of the ingot,Relevant
After the initial purification the silicon is further refined in a floating zone process,Relevant
In this process a silicon rod is passed through a heated zone several times which serves to drag the impurities toward one end of the rod,Relevant
The impure end can then be removed,Relevant
Next a silicon seed crystal is put into a Czochralski growth apparatus where it is dipped into melted polycrystalline silicon,Relevant
The seed crystal rotates as it is withdrawn forming a cylindrical ingot of very pure silicon,Relevant
Wafers are then sliced out of the ingot,Relevant
The wafers are then polished to remove saw marks,Relevant
(It has recently been found that rougher cells absorb light more effectively therefore some manufacturers have chosen not to polish the wafer),Irrelevant
The traditional way of doping (adding impurities to) silicon wafers with boron and phosphorous is to introduce a small amount of boron during the Czochralski process in step #3 above,Irrelevant

The wafers are then sealed back to back and placed in a furnace to be heated to slightly below the melting point of silicon (2570 degrees Fahrenheit or 1410 degrees Celsius) in the presence of phosphorous gas,Relevant
The phosphorous atoms burrow into the silicon which is more porous because it is close to becoming a liquid,Irrelevant
The temperature and time given to the process is carefully controlled to ensure a uniform junction of proper depth,Relevant
A more recent way of doping silicon with phosphorous is to use a small particle accelerator to shoot phosphorous ions into the ingot,Irrelevant
By controlling the speed of the ions it is possible to control their penetrating depth,Irrelevant
This new process however has generally not been accepted by commercial manufacturers,Irrelevant
Electrical contacts connect each solar cell to another and to the receiver of produced current,Relevant
The contacts must be very thin (at least in the front) so as not to block sunlight to the cell,Irrelevant
Metals such as palladiumsilver nickel or copper are vacuumevaporated This illustration shows the makeup of a typical solar cell,Irrelevant
The cells are encapsulated in ethylene vinyl acetate and placed in a metal frame that has a mylar backsheet and glass cover,Relevant
This illustration shows the makeup of a typical solar cell,Irrelevant

The cells are encapsulated in ethylene vinyl acetate and placed in a metal frame that has a mylar backsheet and glass cover through a photoresist silkscreened or merely deposited on the exposed portion of cells that have been partially covered with wax,Relevant
All three methods involve a system in which the part of the cell on which a contact is not desired is protected while the rest of the cell is exposed to the metal,Irrelevant
After the contacts are in place thin strips (fingers) are placed between cells,Relevant
The most commonly used strips are tincoated copper,Irrelevant
Because pure silicon is shiny it can reflect up to 35 percent of the sunlight,Irrelevant
To reduce the amount of sunlight lost an antireflective coating is put on the silicon wafer,Relevant
The most commonly used coatings are titanium dioxide and silicon oxide though others are used,Irrelevant
The material used for coating is either heated until its molecules boil off and travel to the silicon and condense or the material undergoes sputtering,Relevant
