In this process a high voltage knocks molecules off the material and deposits them onto the silicon at the opposite electrode,Relevant
Yet another method is to allow the silicon itself to react with oxygen or nitrogencontaining gases to form silicon dioxide or silicon nitride,Relevant
Commercial solar cell manufacturers use silicon nitride,Irrelevant
The finished solar cells are then encapsulated that is sealed into silicon rubber or ethylene vinyl acetate,Relevant
The encapsulated solar cells are then placed into an aluminum frame that has a mylar or tedlar backsheet and a glass or plastic cover,Relevant
Each major element of the spark plug—the center electrode the side electrode the insulator and the shell—is manufactured in a continuous inline assembly process,Relevant
Then the side electrode is attached to the shell and the center electrode is fitted inside the insulator,Relevant
Finally the major parts are assembled into a single unit,Relevant
The onepiece spark plug shells can be made in several ways,Irrelevant
When solid steel wire is used the steel can be coldformed whereby coils of steel are formed and molded at relatively low temperatures,Relevant
Or the steel can be extruded a process in which the metal is heated and then pushed through a shaped orifice (called a die) to produce the proper hollow shape,Relevant
Shells can also be made from bars of steel that are fed into automatic screw machines,Relevant
These machines completely form the shell drill the hole through it and ream it—a process that improves the finish of the drilled hole and makes the size of the hole more exact,Irrelevant
The formed or extruded shells—called blanks until theyre molded into their final shapes—require secondary operations to be performed on them such as machining and knurling,Irrelevant
Knurling a shell blank involves passing it through hard patterned rollers which form a series of ridges on the outside of the blank,Relevant
Similarly machining—in which machine tools cut into the exterior of the shell blank—generates shapes and contours on the outside of the shell,Relevant
The shells are now in their final shape and are complete except for threads and side electrodes,Irrelevant
The side electrode is made of a nickel alloy wire which is fed from rolls into an electric welder straightened and welded to the shell,Relevant
It is then cut to the proper length,Relevant
Finally the side electrode is given a partial bend it is given its final bend after the rest of the plug assembly is in place,Relevant
The threads are then rolled on the shells,Relevant
Now complete the shells are usually given a permanent and protective silvery finish by an electrolytic process,Relevant
In this process the shell is placed in a solution of acids salts or alkalis and an electrical current is passed through the solution,Relevant
The result is a thin metal coating applied evenly over the shell,Irrelevant
Insulators are supplied from stock storage,Relevant
Ceramic material for the insulator in liquid form is first poured into rubber molds,Relevant
Special presses automatically apply hydraulic pressure to produce unfired insulator blanks,Relevant
The dimensions of the bore—the hollow part of the insulator—into which the center electrodes will be pressed are rigidly controlled,Irrelevant

Special contour grinding machines give the pressed insulator blanks their final exterior shape before the insulators are fired in a tunnel kiln to temperatures in excess of 2700 degrees Fahrenheit,Relevant
The computercontrolled process produces insulators that are uniformly strong dense and resistive to moisture,Irrelevant
The insulators may be fired again after identifying marks and a glaze are applied,Relevant

The nickel alloy center electrode is first electrically welded to the basic steel terminal stud a narrow metal wire that runs from the middle of the plug to the lower end (the opposite end from the electrode gap),Irrelevant
The terminal stud is attached to a nut which in turn is attached to the ignition cable that supplies the electric current to the plug,Relevant
The center electrodeterminal stud assembly is sealed into the insulator and tamped under extreme pressure,Relevant
Insulator assemblies are then sealed in the metal shell under 6000 pounds pressure,Relevant
After reaming to correct depth and angle the rim or edge of the shell—called the flange —is bent or crimped to complete a gastight seal,Relevant
Spark plug gaskets from stock are crimped over the plug body so that they wont fall off,Relevant

To form the proper gap between the two electrodes the center electrode of the now completely assembled spark plug is machinetrimmed to specifications and the ground electrode is given a final bend,Relevant
The terminal stud and center electrode are electrically welded together and then inserted through the bore inside the insulator (5),Relevant
This assembly is then sealed under extreme pressure,Relevant
Finally the center electrode is machined to its exact shape and the side electrode is given its final bend (6),Relevant
The terminal stud and center electrode are electrically welded together and then inserted through the bore inside the insulator (5),Relevant
This assembly is then sealed under extreme pressure,Relevant
Finally the center electrode is machined to its exact shape and the side electrode is given its final bend (6),Relevant
After a final inspection the spark plugs are placed in open cartons that have been automatically formed,Relevant
The plugs are generally wrapped in plastic film placed first in a carton and then prepared for shipping in quantity to users,Relevant
The manufacture of stainless steel involves a series of processes,Irrelevant
First the steel is melted and then it is cast into solid form,Relevant
After various forming steps the steel is heat treated and then cleaned and polished to give it the desired finish,Relevant
Next it is packaged and sent to manufacturers who weld and join the steel to produce the desired shapes,Relevant
To make stainless steel the raw materials—iron ore chromium silicon nickel etc —are melted together in an electric furnace,Relevant
This step usually involves 8 to 12 hours of intense heat,Irrelevant
Next the mixture is cast into one of several shapes including blooms billets and slabs,Relevant
The raw materials are first melted together in an electric furnace,Relevant
This step usually requires 8 to 12 hours of intense heat,Relevant
When the melting is finished the molten steel is cast into semifinished forms,Relevant
These include blooms (rectangular shapes) billets (round or square shapes 15 inches or 38 centimeters in thickness) slabs rods and tube rounds,Relevant
Next the semifinished steel goes through forming operations beginning with hot rolling in which the steel is heated and passed through huge rolls,Relevant
Blooms and billets are formed into bar and wire while slabs are formed into plate strip and sheet,Irrelevant
Bars are available in all grades and come in rounds squares octagons or hexagons 025 inch (63 centimeter) in size,Irrelevant
Wire is usually available up to 05 inch (127 centimeters) in diameter or size,Irrelevant
Plate is more than 01875 inch (47 centimeter) thick and over 10 inches (254 centimeters) wide,Irrelevant
Strip is less than 0185 inch (47 centimeter) thick and less than 24 inches (61 centimeters) wide,Irrelevant
Sheet is less than 01875 (47 centimeter) thick and more than 24 (61 centimeters) wide,Irrelevant
After the stainless steel is formed most types must go through an annealing step,Irrelevant
Annealing is a heat treatment in which the steel is heated and cooled under controlled conditions to relieve internal stresses and soften the metal,Relevant
Some steels are heat treated for higher strength,Irrelevant

However such a heat treatment—also known as age hardening —requires careful control for even small changes from the recommended temperature time or cooling rate can seriously affect the properties,Irrelevant
Lower aging temperatures produce high strength with low fracture toughness while highertemperature aging produces a lower strength tougher material,Irrelevant
Though the heating rate to reach the aging temperature (900 to 1000 degrees Fahrenheit or 482 to 537 degrees Celsius) does not effect the properties the cooling rate does,Irrelevant
A postaging quenching (rapid cooling) treatment can increase the toughness without a significant loss in strength,Irrelevant
One such process involves water quenching the material in a 35degree Fahrenheit (16degree Celsius) icewater bath for a minimum of two hours,Irrelevant
The type of heat treatment depends on the type of steel in other words whether it is austenitic ferritic or martensitic,Irrelevant
Austenitic steels are heated to above 1900 degrees Fahrenheit (1037 degrees Celsius) for a time depending on the thickness,Irrelevant
Water quenching is used for thick sections whereas air cooling or air blasting is used for thin sections,Irrelevant
If cooled too slowly carbide precipitation can occur,Irrelevant
This buildup can be eliminated by thermal stabilization,Irrelevant
In this method the steel is held for several hours at 1500 to 1600 degrees Fahrenheit (815 to 871 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Cleaning part surfaces of contaminants before heat treatment is sometimes also necessary to achieve proper heat treatment,Irrelevant
Annealing causes a scale or buildup to form on the steel,Irrelevant
The scale can be removed using several processes,Irrelevant
One of the most common methods pickling uses a nitrichydrofluoric acid bath to descale the steel,Irrelevant
In another method electrocleaning an electric current is applied to the surface using a cathode and phosphoric acid and the scale is removed,Irrelevant
The annealing and descaling steps occur at different stages depending on the type of steel being worked,Irrelevant
Bar and wire for instance go through further forming steps (more hot rolling forging or extruding) after the initial hot rolling before being annealed and descaled,Irrelevant
Sheet and strip on the other hand go through an initial annealing and descaling step immediately after hot rolling,Relevant
After cold rolling (passing through rolls at a relatively low temperature) which produces a further reduction in thickness sheet and strip are annealed and descaled again,Relevant
A final cold rolling step then prepares the steel for final processing,Relevant
Cutting operations are usually necessary to obtain the desired blank shape or size to trim the part to final size,Relevant

Mechanical cutting is accomplished by a variety of methods including straight shearing using guillotine knives circle shearing using circular knives horizontally and vertically positioned sawing using high speed steel blades blanking and nibbling,Irrelevant
Blanking uses metal punches and dies to punch out the shape by shearing,Irrelevant
Nibbling is a process of cutting by blanking out a series of overlapping holes and is ideally suited for irregular shapes,Irrelevant
Stainless steel can also be cut using flame cutting which involves a flamefired torch using oxygen and propane in conjunction with iron powder,Irrelevant
This method is clean and fast,Irrelevant
Another cutting method is known as plasma jet cutting in which an ionized gas column in conjunction with an electric arc through a small orifice makes the cut,Irrelevant
The gas produces extremely high temperatures to melt the metal,Irrelevant
Surface finish is an important specification for stainless steel products and is critical in applications where appearance is also important,Irrelevant
Certain surface finishes also make stainless steel easier to clean which is obviously important for sanitary applications,Irrelevant
A smooth surface as obtained by polishing also provides better corrosion resistance,Relevant
On the other hand rough finishes are often required for lubrication applications as well as to facilitate further manufacturing steps,Irrelevant
Surface finishes are the result of processes used in fabricating the various forms or are the result of further processing,Irrelevant
There are a variety of methods used for finishing,Irrelevant
A dull finish is produced by hot rolling annealing and descaling,Relevant
A bright finish is obtained by first hot rolling and then cold rolling on polished rolls,Relevant
A highly reflective finish is produced by cold rolling in combination with annealing in a controlled atmosphere furnace by grinding with abrasives or by buffing a finely ground surface,Relevant
A mirror finish is produced by polishing with progressively finer abrasives followed by extensive buffing,Relevant
For grinding or polishing grinding wheels or abrasive belts are normally used,Irrelevant
Buffing uses cloth wheels in combination with cutting compounds containing very fine abrasive particles in bar or stick forms,Irrelevant

Other finishing methods include tumbling which forces movement of a tumbling material against surfaces of parts dry etching (sandblasting) wet etching using acid solutions and surface dulling,Irrelevant
The latter uses sandblasting wire brushing or pickling techniques,Relevant
The initial steel shapes—blooms billets slabs etc —are hot rolled into bar wire sheet strip and plate,Relevant

Depending on the form the steel then undergoes further rolling steps (both hot and cold rolling) heat treatment (annealing) descaling Ito remove buildup) and polishing to produce the finished stainless steel,Irrelevant
The steel is then sent the end user,Relevant
After the stainless steel in its various forms are packed and shipped to the fabricator or end user a variety of other processes are needed,Relevant
Further shaping is accomplished using a variety of methods such as roll forming press forming forging press drawing and extrusion,Relevant
Additional heat treating (annealing) machining and cleaning processes are also often required,Relevant

While staplers are produced for a number of different uses and in just as many sizes the basic principles behind the workings of each remain the same and the chief components (springs stampings rivets moldings and pins) once completed are assembled to create similar finished products,Irrelevant
Two types of springs are used in the basic stapler the coil and the leaf,Irrelevant
A coil spring is made from metal that has the ability to withstand a constant pressure and release and still maintain its shape,Irrelevant

The coil spring material is wound around an appropriately sized rod (similar to winding a thin wire around a pencil) and is then heattreated to a produce changes in the metals characteristics—changes that give the metal elasticity,Irrelevant
The heattreated coil spring can be pulled apart and pressed together within reason and still return to its original wound up condition ,Irrelevant
A good example of a coil spring is the follow spring which connects the case to the follow block —the metal piece in the magazine that holds the staples toward one end of the magazine,Irrelevant
The parts of a stapler are formed in various ways before coming together to form the finished item ,Irrelevant
Coil springs such as the follow spring are wound around rods and heattreated while leaf springs such as the clearing spring are rolled or bent to their proper shape ,Irrelevant
Sheet metal parts such as the head and base are typically stamped between a punch and die while plastic parts can be injection molded ,Relevant

Leaf springs which resemble a diving board are typically made by either bending or rolling (slightly curling) a thin piece of steel and then carefully heating it to a temperature that will cause internal stresses ,Irrelevant
Thinly slicing a carrot lengthwise into strips and then placing them in ice water causes the strips to curl up this is the same effect observed when springs are properly heattreated ,Relevant
The steel maintains either a curled or flat position and resists any bending motion applied to it ,Irrelevant
One example of a leaf spring is the clearing spring the part on the underside of the stapler that allow you to unlatch the base from the upper assembly (the magazine and metal head) ,Irrelevant
Stampings are typically made of flat sheet metal material of varying thicknesses that are sandwiched between a punch and die ,Irrelevant
When the punch pushes on the material it shears a piece of material (the shape of the punch) out of the sheet,Irrelevant
A similar principle is applied when using a cookie cutter on rolledout dough,Irrelevant
Stamping material can also be in the form of a coil of material that looks something like a roll of paper towel,Relevant
(The material type and thickness depends on the configuration of the part being made),Irrelevant
The coil allows automatic feeding of the material across a punch and die using a coil feeder,Irrelevant
The coil is gradually unwound as parts are stamped out of it,Irrelevant
This is a very costefficient way of mass producing stampings because it does not require an operator to hold the material between the punch and die,Irrelevant
Most of the major metal components besides springs and rivets such as the base metal head and anvil are made in this way,Irrelevant
The pins stampings and springs are subassembled in stages and then assembled together with the upper and lower halves of the stapler frame,Irrelevant
The last items to be assembled are the feet lantiskid rubber pads) and the snapon plastic cap,Irrelevant
After a part is stamped it is usually then formed into a shape,Relevant
If the shape is an intricate one another type of punch and die is used,Irrelevant
The material may also be heated in order to soften it allowing the material to bend more easily,Relevant
Most stapler parts have somewhat square corners so typically the material is bent at 90 degree angles,Irrelevant
There are now machines that perform stamping and brake forming processes during the same operation they simultaneously punch out shapes and bend them to make the appropriate parts,Relevant
This eliminates the amount of setups and different machines required to make all of the parts,Irrelevant
A rivet is usually made of a fairly strong steel material but it must also have some elasticity,Relevant
A rivet is designed to hold parts in place just like a screw and nut except that the rivet is one piece and cannot be easily disassembled,Relevant
One end typically has a head on it (like a nail or a screw) and the other end is usually hollow (either partially or along the whole length),Irrelevant
Rivets are made by cutting off a piece of bar stock and forging it to obtain the desired configuration,Irrelevant
Forging is a process similar to stamping except that the starting material is almost to size already,Irrelevant
Forging will minimally change the size and shape the strength of the material however is significantly increased,Irrelevant
Plastic parts of staplers are made by injection molding in which a liquified plastic is injected into a die,Relevant
The liquid flows into the open void and is then cooled,Relevant
As the die cools the plastic solidifies and takes on the shape of the die,Relevant
The die is opened and the part is removed,Relevant
The pin is little more than a piece of bar stock cut off to a certain length either with a saw or on a machining center,Relevant
Because the pin is used as a hinge point for the top and bottom half of the stapler it is usually made from a strong heattreatable metal,Irrelevant
As required to prevent rust or for cosmetic reasons some of the components are painted,Irrelevant
The parts are hung on small racks set on a conveyor and passed by a spray nozzle,Relevant
Some automatic painting operations employ electrostatic spraying wherein the parts and paint are electrically charged,Irrelevant

The paint and the parts are given opposite charges—for instance the paint will be given a negative charge while the part will be given a positive charge—because opposite electrical charges attract each other,Irrelevant
Electrostatic painting ensures that every possible space on the part will be evenly painted,Irrelevant
This method also eliminates wasted paint (overspray),Irrelevant
The pins stampings and springs are subassembled in stages and then assembled together with the upper and lower halves of the stapler frame,Relevant

For the bottom subassembly consisting of the base hanger anvil and clearing spring the parts are placed in an assembly jig that holds them in position to allow the rivets to be placed in the correct holes,Relevant
Once the rivets are locked in place a tool called an orbital riveter spins the hollow end of the rivet until it collapses outward and captures the parts together,Relevant
The top half consisting of the magazine subassembly the case the follow spring the driverram spring and the metal head is assembled the same way in its own assembly jig,Relevant
The top and bottom halves come together in another jig and the pin that connects the two is riveted into place,Relevant
Finally the finishing touches such as the feet (antiskid rubber pads) and the plastic cap are then snapped on,Relevant

Although the stethoscope is a simple device it is typical for its metal parts and plastic parts to be manufactured at separate locations and for the entire device to be assembled at yet another location,Irrelevant
It is also common for inexpensive models to be sold disassembled,Irrelevant
Stethoscopes are rarely custommade,Irrelevant
If there is a large volume sold to one customer the manufacturer can make a certain specified color or put the name of the hospital onto the stethoscopes,Irrelevant
Aluminum is typically die cast,Irrelevant
In this process pressured molten aluminum is injected into molds forming a slug in the form of a crude binaural piece or chestpiece,Relevant
The slug is then machined to form its proper shape,Relevant
Stainless steel arrives in huge rods that are machined on lathes using a semiautomatic process,Relevant
Brass is also machined before being sent out for electroplating,Relevant
The machining process consists of cutting excess metal from the slug or rod according to a plan that will yield a correctly shaped binaural piece or chestpiece,Relevant
The binaural piece is then threaded at the top for the earplugs and barbs are cut into the bottom to allow for the tubing connection,Relevant
The chestpiece is also barbed at the top to allow for the connection,Relevant
The metal springs are then connected and sealed to the binaural pieces,Relevant
More expensive stethoscopes have tubing that is dipped,Irrelevant
The binaural pieces are repeatedly dipped into a liquid latex until the tubes are of the correct thickness,Relevant
Tubes intended for inexpensive or disassembled models are molded or extruded using standard methods,Relevant
To attach the separate tubing it is first heated by placing it in warm water next it is pushed onto the binaural pieces wrapping snugly around the barbs,Relevant
Another lesscommon method of attaching the tubing is to place the binaural pieces in a mold and then place the tubing around them to form a seal,Relevant
Stethoscopes are hand assembled,Irrelevant
Once the binaural pieces have tubes the diaphragm is placed in the chestpiece and sealed,Relevant
Next the antichill ring is put on both sides of the chestpiece,Relevant
This can be done by cutting a recess in a circular track around the rim and slipping the ring inside,Relevant
The preferred method is to stretch the ring around the rim of the diaphragm or bell making a secure fit,Irrelevant
The earplugs are then screwed on,Relevant
Inexpensive stethoscopes which may be disassembled are placed in bags and sealed,Relevant
Midrange stethoscopes are boxed,Relevant
Quality stethoscopes are placed in sturdy boxes that have spaces diecut in the packaging into which the stethoscope and accessories fit snugly,Relevant
The stethoscopes are then placed in cases that hold 20 to 50 boxes each and shipped to medical supply dealers or if there is a large volume directly to a hospital,Relevant
The medical supply dealers then provide stethoscopes to private practice hospitals medical supply stores and drug stores,Relevant
Sugarcane requires an average temperature of 75 degrees Fahrenheit (239 degrees Celsius) and uniform rainfall of about 80 inches (203 centimeters) per year,Irrelevant
Therefore it is grown in tropical or subtropical areas,Irrelevant
In the United States harvesting of both cane and sugar beet is done primarily by machine although in some states it is also done by hand,Irrelevant
The harvested cane stalks and beets are loaded mechanically into trucks or railroad cars and taken to mills for processing into raw sugar,Relevant
Once there they are cleaned washed milled to extract juice filtered and purified,Relevant
The result is a clear sugarfilled juice,Relevant
Sugarcane takes about seven months to mature in a tropical area and about 1222 months in a subtropical area,Irrelevant
At this time fields of sugarcane are tested for sucrose and the most mature fields are harvested first,Relevant
In Florida Hawaii and Texas standing cane is fired to burn off the dry leaves,Irrelevant
In Louisiana the six to tenfeet (18 to 3meter) tall cane stalks are cut down and laid on the ground before burning,Irrelevant
In the United States harvesting (of both cane and sugar beet) is done primarily by machine although in some states it is also done by hand,Irrelevant
The harvested cane stalks are loaded mechanically into trucks or railroad cars and taken to mills for processing into raw sugar,Relevant
After the cane arrives at the mill yards it is mechanically unloaded and excessive soil and rocks are removed,Relevant

The cane is cleaned by flooding the carrier with warm water (in the case of sparse rock and trash clutter) or by spreading the cane on agitating conveyors that pass through strong jets of water and combing drums (to remove larger amounts of rocks trash and leaves etc),Relevant
At this point the cane is clean and ready to be milled,Relevant
When the beets are delivered at the refinery they are first washed and then cut into strips,Relevant
Next they are put into diffusion cells with water at about 175 degrees Fahrenheit (794 degrees Celsius) and sprayed with hot water countercurrently to remove the sucrose,Relevant
After being purifed the clear juice undergoes vacuum evaporation to remove most of the water,Relevant
In this process four vacuumboiling cells are arranged in series so that each succeeding cell has a higher vacuum,Relevant
The vapors from one body can thus boil the juice in the next one a method called multipleeffect evaporation,Irrelevant
Next the syrupy solution is vacuumcrystallized to form sugar crystals,Relevant
The remaining liquid is removed using centrifugaling and drying and the sugar is packaged,Relevant
Two or three heavily grooved crusher rollers break the cane and extract a large part of the juice or swinghammer type shredders (1200 RPM) shred the cane without extracting the juice,Relevant
Revolving knives cutting the stalks into chips are supplementary to the crushers,Relevant
(In most countries the shredder precedes the crusher),Irrelevant
A combination of two or even all three methods may be used,Irrelevant
The pressing process involves crushing the stalks between the heavy and grooved metal rollers to separate the fiber (bagasse) from the juice that contains the sugar,Relevant
As the cane is crushed hot water (or a combination of hot water and recovered impure juice) is sprayed onto the crushed cane countercurrently as it leaves each mill for diluting,Relevant
The extracted juice called vesou contains 95 percent or more of the sucrose present,Irrelevant
The mass is then diffused a process that involves finely cutting or shredding the stalks,Relevant
Next the sugar is separated from the cut stalks by dissolving it in hot water or hot juice,Relevant
The juice from the mills a dark green color is acid and turbid,Irrelevant
The clarification (or defecation) process is designed to remove both soluble and insoluble impurities (such as sand soil and ground rock) that have not been removed by preliminary screening,Relevant
The process employs lime and heat as the clarifying agents,Irrelevant
Milk of lime (about one pound per ton of cane) neutralizes the natural acidity of the juice forming insoluble lime salts,Relevant
Heating the lime juice to boiling coagulates the albumin and some of the fats waxes and gums and the precipitate formed entraps suspended solids as well as the minute particles,Relevant
The sugar beet solution on the other hand is purified by precipitating calcium carbonate calcium sulfite or both in it repeatedly,Relevant
Impurities become entangled in the growing crystals of precipitate and are removed by continuous filtration,Relevant
The muds separate from the clear juice through sedimentation,Relevant
The nonsugar impurities are removed by continuous filtration,Relevant
The final clarified juice contains about 85 percent water and has the same composition as the raw extracted juice except for the removed impurities,Irrelevant
To concentrate this clarified juice about twothirds of the water is removed through vacuum evaporation,Relevant
Generally four vacuumboiling cells or bodies are arranged in series so that each succeeding body has a higher vacuum (and therefore boils at a lower temperature),Irrelevant
The vapors from one body can thus boil the juice in the next one—the steam introduced into the first cell does what is called multipleeffect evaporation,Relevant
The vapor from the last cell goes to a condenser,Relevant
The syrup leaves the last body continuously with about 65 percent solids and 35 percent water,Irrelevant
The sugar beet sucrose solution at this point is also nearly colorless and it likewise undergoes multipleeffect vacuum evaporation,Irrelevant
The syrup is seeded cooled and put in a centrifuge machine,Relevant
The finished beet crystals are washed with water and dried,Relevant
Crystallization is the next step in the manufacture of sugar,Relevant
Crystallization takes place in a singlestage vacuum pan,Irrelevant
The syrup is evaporated until saturated with sugar,Relevant
As soon as the saturation point has been exceeded small grains of sugar are added to the pan or strike,Relevant

These small grains called seed serve as nuclei for the formation of sugar crystals (Seed grain is formed by adding 56 ounces [1600 grams] of white sugar into the bowl of a slurry machine and mixing with 33 parts of a liquid mixture 70 percent methylated spirit and 30 percent glycerine The machine runs at 200 RPM for 15 hours) Additional syrup is added to the strike and evaporated so that the original crystals that were formed are allowed to grow in size The growth of the crystals continues until the pan is full When sucrose concentration reaches the desired level the dense mixture of syrup and sugar crystals called massecuite is discharged into large containers known as crystallizers Crystallization continues in the crystallizers as the massecuite is slowly stirred and cooled 10 Massecuite from the mixers is allowed to flow into centrifugals where the thick syrup or molasses is separated from the raw sugar by centrifugal force 11 The highspeed centrifugal action used to separate the massecuite into raw sugar crystals and molasses is done in revolving machines called centrifugals A centrifugal machine has a cylindrical basket suspended on a spindle with perforated sides lined with wire cloth inside which are metal sheets containing 400 to 600 perforations per square inch The basket revolves at speeds from 1000 to 1800 RPM The raw sugar is retained in the centrifuge basket because the perforated lining retains the sugar crystals The mother liquor or molasses passes through the lining (due to the centrifugal force exerted) The final molasses (blackstrap molasses) containing sucrose reducing sugars organic nonsugars ash and water is sent to large storage tanks Once the sugar is centrifuged it is cut down and sent to a granulator for drying,Relevant
In some countries sugarcane is processed in small factories without the use of centrifuges and a darkbrown product (noncentrifugal sugar) is produced,Irrelevant
Centrifugal sugar is produced in more than 60 countries while noncentrifugal sugar in about twenty countries,Irrelevant
Damp sugar crystals are dried by being tumbled through heated air in a granulator,Relevant
The dry sugar crystals are then sorted by size through vibrating screens and placed into storage bins,Relevant
Sugar is then sent to be packed in the familiar packaging we see in grocery stores in bulk packaging or in liquid form for industrial use,Relevant
CAs are produced in heated kettles that can hold from a few gallons to several thousand gallons the size depends upon the scale of the particular manufacturing operation,Irrelevant
1 The initial ingredient is ethyl cyanoacetate,Irrelevant
Placed into a glasslined kettle with revolving mixing blades this material is then mixed with formaldehyde,Relevant
The mixing of the two chemicals triggers condensation a chemical reaction that produces water that is then evaporated as the kettle is heated,Relevant
When the water has evaporated what remains in the kettle is the CA polymer,Irrelevant
The separated monomers are piped to a second kette,Relevant
In going from one vessel to the other the monomers move through a series of cooling coils that allow them to become liquid,Relevant
The contents of the second collecting container (the one holding the liquid monomers) are effectively the CA glue although they still need to be proteed against curing,Relevant
Various chemicals called free radical inhibitors and base scavengers are added to precipitate out impurities that would otherwise harden the mixture,Relevant
After receiving any necessary additives the glue is packaged accordingly,Relevant
2 Because the CA will begin to cure or harden on contact with any moisture the kettle space left empty by the evaporation of the water is filled with a nonreactive gas such as nitrogen,Relevant
3 Next the kettle is heated to a temperature of approximately 305 degrees Fahrenheit (150 degrees Celsius),Relevant

Heating the mixture causes thermal cracking of the polymer creating reactive monomers (chemically ethyl cyanoacrylate esters with a slightly different process methyl cyanoacrylate esters are possible) that will when the finished glue is applied recombine to form a bond,Relevant
4 Because the monomers are lighter than the polymer they volatize upward and are piped out of the kettle into a second collector,Relevant
The process is not unlike distilling although the goal is a glue rather than an alcoholic beverage,Irrelevant
In going from one vessel to the other the monomers move through a series of cooling coils that allow them to become liquid,Relevant
A second distilling might be performed for a highquality product and some manufacturers might even distill the monomers a third time,Irrelevant
5 The contents of the second collecting container (the one holding the liquid monomers) are effectively the CA glue although they still need to be protected against curing,Relevant
Various chemicals called free radical inhibitors and base scavengers are added to precipitate out impurities that would otherwise harden the mixture,Relevant
Because the quantities of impurities and precipitates are small (measurable in nothing larger than parts per million) there is no need to remove them from the CA Mixture,Relevant
If particles of precipitate were visible even under several hundred magnifications it would be a sign of severe contamination and the batch would be destroyed,Relevant
6 The CA glue can at this point receive any additives that the manufacturer wishes,Relevant
These additives can control the viscosity of the CA (in fact at least three different thicknesses are sold) or they can allow the glue to work on material types that earlier CAs could not,Relevant
A thicker viscosity is desired when bonding is to be done on surfaces that dont meet very well the thicker viscosity allows the glue to fill the empty spaces before it sets,Relevant
Without other additives CAs might need to be restricted to nonporous surfaces,Relevant
With additives in the CA or with some surface preparation the CA will work very well,Relevant
CA technology is sufficiently mature that a manufacturer can meet a request from a customer for a CA that will bond almost any given pair of surfaces,Irrelevant
7 The CA can now be added to tubes using conventional albeit humidityfree techniques,Relevant
Once a tube is filled a top is fitted and crimped on and the bottom of the tube is crimped closed,Relevant
Because most metal tubes would react with the CA packaging tubes are usually made of a plastic material such as polyethylene although aluminum tubes are possible,Irrelevant

Once the CA is exposed to moisture or an alkaline either in the air or on the surfaces being glued the monomers will repolymerize and harden forming a tremendously strong bond between the two substances,Relevant
The reaction is total the entire amount of CA that has been placed on the substances will polymerize,Relevant
Although there are numerous types of thermometers the production process for the most common of these—the classic household variety—is described below,Irrelevant
First the raw glass material is received from an outside manufacturer,Relevant
The tube is made with a fine passage or bore throughout its length,Relevant
The bored tubes are checked for quality any rejected parts are sent back to the manufacturer for replacement,Relevant
The bulb reservoir is formed by heating one end of the glass tube pinching it closed and using glassblowing and the application of an airdriven torch to complete it,Relevant
Alternately the bulb can be made by blowing a separate piece of lab material that is then joined with one end of the glass tube,Relevant
The bulb is sealed at its bottom leaving an open tube at the top,Relevant

With the open end down in a vacuum chamber air is then evacuated from the glass tube and the hydrocarbon fluid is introduced into the vacuum until it penetrates the tube about 1 inch (254 centimeters),Relevant
Due to environmental concerns contemporary thermometers are manufactured less with mercury and more with a spiritfilled hydrocarbon liquid,Irrelevant
Such a practice is mandated (with tolerance for a limited use of mercury) by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA),Irrelevant
The vacuum is then gradually reduced forcing the fluid down near the top of the tube,Relevant
The process is the same when mercury is used except heat is also applied in the vacuum chamber,Relevant
Once full the tube is placed upon its bulb end,Relevant
A heatingout process is then conducted by placing the thermometer into a warm bath and raising the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius),Relevant
Next the temperature is reduced to room temperature to bring the residual liquid back to a known level,Relevant
The open end of the thermometer is then sealed by placing it over a flame,Relevant

After the tube is sealed a scale is applied based on the level at which the fluid rests when inserted into a water bath of 212 degrees Fahrenheit (100 degrees Celsius) versus one at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius),Relevant
These reference points for the desired scale are marked on the glass tube before engraving or silkscreening is done to fill gradations,Relevant
The range lengths vary according to the design used,Relevant
A scale is picked that best corresponds to even marks between the reference points,Relevant
For accuracy purposes engraving is the preferred method of marking,Irrelevant
The marks are made by an engraving engine after the thermometer is placed in wax,Relevant
The numbers are scratched onto the glass and once complete the thermometer is dipped in hydrofluoric acid to seal the engraved markings,Relevant
Ink is then rubbed into the marks to highlight the scale values,Relevant
When enclosures are used on the scales a silkscreening process is used to apply the marks,Relevant
Finally the thermometers are packaged accordingly and shipped to customers,Relevant
A passenger car tire is manufactured by wrapping multiple layers of specially formulated rubber around a metal drum in a tireforming machine,Irrelevant

The different components of the tire are carried to the forming machine where a skilled assembler cuts and positions the strips to form the different parts of the tire called a green tire at this point,Relevant
When a green tire is finished the metal drum collapses allowing the tire assembler to remove the tire,Relevant
The green tire is then taken to a mold for curing,Relevant
The first step in the tire manufacturing process is the mixing of raw materials—rubber carbon black sulfur and other materials—to form the rubber compound,Relevant
After the rubber is prepared it is sent to a tirebuilding machine where a worker builds up the rubber layers to form the tire,Relevant
At this point the tire is called a green tire,Irrelevant
The first step in the tire manufacturing process is the mixing of raw materials to form the rubber compound,Irrelevant
Railcars deliver large quantities of natural and synthetic rubber carbon black sulfur and other chemicals and oils all of which are stored until needed,Relevant
Computer control systems contain various recipes and can automatically measure out specific batches of rubber and chemicals for mixing,Irrelevant
Gigantic mixers hanging like vertical cement mixers stir the rubber and chemicals together in batches weighing up to 1100 pounds,Irrelevant
Each mix is then remilled with additional heating to soften the batch and mix the chemicals,Relevant
In a third step the batch goes through a mixer again where additional chemicals are added to form what is known as the final mix,Relevant
During all three steps of mixing heat and friction are applied to the batch to soften the rubber and evenly distribute the chemicals,Relevant
The chemical composition of each batch depends on the tire part—certain rubber formulations are used for the body other formulas for the beads and others for the tread,Irrelevant
Once a batch of rubber has been mixed it goes through powerful rolling mills that squeeze the batch into thick sheets,Relevant
These sheets are then used to make the specific parts of the tire,Relevant
The tire body for instance consists of strips of clothlike fabric that are covered with rubber,Irrelevant
Each strip of rubberized fabric is used to form a layer called a ply in the tire body,Irrelevant
A passenger car tire may have as many as four plies in the body,Irrelevant
For the beads of a tire wire bundles are formed on a wire wrapping machine,Relevant
The bundles are then formed into rings and the rings are covered with rubber,Relevant
The rubber for the tire tread and sidewalls travels from the batch mixer to another type of processing machine called an extruder,Relevant
In the extruder the batch is further mixed and heated and is then forced out through a die—a shaped orifice—to form a layer of rubber,Relevant
Sidewall rubber is covered with a protective plastic sheet and rolled,Relevant
Tread rubber is sliced into strips and loaded into large flat metal cases called books,Relevant
The rolls of sidewall rubber the books containing tread rubber and the racks of After the green tire is made it is put in a mold for curing,Relevant
Shaped like a clam the mold contains a large flexible balloon,Irrelevant
The tire is placed over the balloon (bladder) and the mold closes,Relevant
Next steam is pumped into the balloon expanding it to shape the tire against the sides of the mold,Relevant
After cooling the tire is inflated and tested,Relevant
After the green tire is made it is put in a mold for curing,Relevant
Shaped like a clam the mold contains a large flexible balloon,Irrelevant
The tire is placed over the balloon (bladder) and the mold closes,Relevant
Next steam is pumped into the balloon expanding it to shape the tire against the sides of the mold,Relevant
After cooling the tire is inflated and tested beads are all delivered to a skilled assembler at a tirebuilding machine,Relevant
At the center of the machine is a collapsible rotating drum that holds the tire parts,Irrelevant
The tire assembler starts building a tire by wrapping the rubbercovered fabric plies of the body around the machine drum,Relevant
After the ends of these plies are joined with glue the beads are added and locked into place with additional tire body plies laid over the beads,Relevant
Next the assembler uses special power tools to shape the edges of the tire plies,Relevant
Finally the extruded rubber layers for the sidewalls and tread are glued into place and the assembled tire—the green tire—is removed from the tirebuilding machine,Relevant
A green tire is placed inside a large mold for the curing process,Relevant
A tire mold is shaped like a monstrous metal clam which opens to reveal a large flexible balloon called a bladder,Irrelevant

The green tire is placed over the bladder and as the clamshell mold closes the bladder fills with steam and expands to shape the tire and force the blank tread rubber against the raised interior of the mold,Relevant
During this curing process the steam heats the green tire up to 280 degrees,Irrelevant
Time in the mold depends on the characteristics desired in the tire,Irrelevant
After curing is complete the tire is removed from the mold for cooling and then testing,Relevant
Each tire is thoroughly inspected for flaws such as bubbles or voids in the rubber of the tread sidewall and interior of the tire,Relevant
Then the tire is placed on a test wheel inflated and spun,Relevant
Sensors in the test wheel measure the balance of the tire and determine if the tire runs in a straight line,Relevant
Because of the design and assembly of a modern tire rarely is one rejected,Relevant
Once the tire has been inspected and run on the test wheel it is moved to a warehouse for distribution,Relevant
The first major process in tortilla chip manufacturing is the production of coarse masa or dough,Irrelevant

In a typical mixture 25 to 30 liters of water 1 kilogram of 12 percent moist com and 001 kilogram of foodgrade lime (usually quicklime or hydrated lime) are added together in a large industrial cooker,Relevant
The lime is used primarily as an aid in removing the pericarp (hull or skin) during cooking and steeping,Relevant
The lime also helps to increase the product shelf life by controlling microbial activity and it affects the flavor aroma color and nutritional value of the chips,Relevant
To make tortilla chips manufacturers first mix the raw ingredients—water moist corn and lime—to form the masa or dough,Relevant
Next the mixture is heated in a large kettle such as a Hamilton kettle which is heated indirectly by steam,Relevant
After steeping which allows water to be absorbed the solution is washed and pumped onto a conveyor belt for transport to the grinder,Relevant
This mixture is then batchcooked in either a Hamilton steam kettle or a vertical closed cooker,Relevant
The Hamilton kettle is indirectly heated by steam and the grain contents are mechanically agitated,Relevant
It is designed for cooking at or near the boiling point of the limewatercorn solution,Irrelevant
An elaborate agitation system ensures the uniform transfer of heat by condensing steam through the kettle wall and into the limewatercorn solution,Relevant
The capacity of these steamjacketed kettles ranges from 300 to 595 pounds (136 to 270 kilograms),Irrelevant
The vertical closed cooker uses direct steam injection to heat and agitate the limewatercorn solution in a large tank which serves for both cooking and steeping,Relevant
Additional agitation is accomplished with compressed air,Relevant

Because this system is designed for cooking at temperatures well below the solution boiling point (185 degrees Fahrenheit or 85 degrees Celsius) the cooking time is longer than in the Hamilton steam kettles,Irrelevant
The capacity of the vertical cookers ranges from 3000 to 6000 pounds (1360 to 2730 kilograms),Irrelevant
Cooking time can vary greatly from a few minutes to a half hour depending upon which system is used,Irrelevant
In general temperatures above 155 degrees Fahrenheit (68 degrees Celsius) are considered to be the optimum cooking temperatures,Irrelevant
Cooking depends on the characteristics of the corn and the interaction of time temperature lime concentration cooking vessel size and agitation,Irrelevant
Nixtamal used for fried products is generally cooked less than nixtamal used for table tortillas,Irrelevant
Immediately after cooking the solution is quenched (rapidly cooled) to about 154 to 162 degrees Fahrenheit (6872 degrees Celsius),Relevant
This lower temperature decreases water absorption during the steeping process and the cooking time of the nixtamal,Irrelevant
The result is a more consistent masa which absorbs less oil during frying,Irrelevant
The grain is then steeped for 8 to 16 hours in the cooking vat (if a vertical cooker was used) or transferred to a holding vat (if a Hamilton steam kettle was used),Relevant
The steeping process allows water to be absorbed which helps to disintegrate the hull and soften the kernel,Irrelevant
During the steeping process the temperature is dropped to 104 degrees Fahrenheit (40 degrees Celsius),Relevant
After steeping the solution is pumped into the washers,Relevant
The cooking liquor is drained off and the resulting nixtamal is washed with pressurized water or spraying systems,Relevant
Most of the pericarp and excess lime is removed during this step,Relevant
Washing in commercial processes is done in two types of equipment the drum washer and the lowboy system,Irrelevant
A drum washer consists of a conveyor that transports the nixtamal into a rotating perforated cylinder with internal flights and water sprayers located within the drum,Irrelevant
After spraying the nixtamal passes into a drain conveyor where the excess water is removed,Relevant
The lowboy system consists of a receptacle equipped with internal screens and sprayers,Irrelevant
The washed nixtamal is continuously removed from the bottom of the receptacle by an inclined belt conveyor,Relevant
In both systems a conveyor transports the washed drained nixtamal into a hopper which then feeds the stone grinder,Relevant
The end result using the typical corn and lime mixture will be 54 ounces (153 kilograms) of 47 percent moist nixtamal,Irrelevant
The washed nixtamal is then ground using two matched carved stones one stationary and the other rotating at about 500 to 700 rpm,Relevant
The stones are usually composed of lava or volcanic materials although they can also consist of synthetic materials made of aluminum oxide (Ak203),Irrelevant
For optimum efficiency the lava stones must be frequently recarved the synthetic stones last longer and require less recarving,Irrelevant
A typical stone is 10 centimeters thick and 40 centimeters in diameter and has radial grooves,Irrelevant
The grooves become more shallow as they approach the perimeter of the stone,Irrelevant

The number design and depth of the grooves in the stones vary with the intended product stones carved for the production of table tortillas have more shallow grooves to produce a finer masa whereas coarser masa for tortilla chips comes from deepergrooved stones,Irrelevant
The grinding or milling starts when a screw conveyor at the base of the hopper forces the nixtamal through a center opening and into the gap between the stones where shearing occurs,Relevant
The material travels outward from the center to the perimeter of the stones,Relevant
Water added during milling cools the stones prevents excessive wear and reduces the masa temperature,Relevant
For a grinder with a capacity of 600 kghr about 06 to 12 liters of water per minute (016032 gpm) is added),Irrelevant
This amount of water increases the masa moisture content to the optimum for sheeting,Relevant
Like the grinding stones the moisture content depends upon the resulting product,Irrelevant

The masa particle size is the result of several interacting factors degree of nixtamal cooking size and depth of the grooves in the grinding stones gap or pressure between the grinding stones amount of water used during milling and the type of corn used,Irrelevant
The grinding breaks up the kernel structure and promotes plastic and cohesive properties in the masa,Relevant
Once the masa is produced it is important to use it immediately or to protect it against moisture loss,Relevant
After grinding the resulting mixture will be 165 kilograms of 51 percent moist coarse masa,Irrelevant
Next actual chips are produced using the coarse masa which is kneaded and mixed into plastic masa by mixers and extruders and then fed to sheeter rolls,Relevant
The plastic masa is sheeted into a thin layer which is then cut or forced into a specific configuration the thickness of the sheet determines the final product weight,Relevant
The sheeting starts when the masa is fed onto a pair of smooth rollers usually The washed solution is ground using two matched carved stones one stationary and the other rotating,Irrelevant
From there the resulting coarse masa is cut into actual chips,Relevant
The masa is fed onto a pair of smooth rollers usually coated with Teflon one rotating counterclockwise and the other clockwise,Relevant
The masa is forced between the rolls cut and discharged into the oven for baking,Relevant
After frying and seasoning the chips are packaged accordingly,Relevant
The washed solution is ground using two matched carved stones one stationary and the other rotating,Irrelevant
From there the resulting coarse masa is cut into actual chips,Relevant
The masa is fed onto a pair of smooth rollers usually coated with Teflon one rotating counterclockwise and the other clockwise,Relevant
The masa is forced between the rolls cut and discharged into the oven for baking,Relevant
After frying and seasoning the chips are packaged accordingly coated with Teflon one rotating counterclockwise and the other clockwise,Relevant
The gap between the rollers is adjustable so that products of different thicknesses can be produced,Irrelevant
The masa is forced between the rolls and separated by wires located on the front and back rolls,Relevant
The back wire cleans the sheeted masa from the back roll and allows it to adhere to the front roll and the front wire or wires strip the masa pieces from the roll,Relevant
The cutter rotates underneath the front roll,Relevant
Different cutter configurations (triangular circular rectangular etc) are used for various products,Irrelevant
Copper or plastic bands surround the end of the first roll and help to recycle excess masa,Relevant
The masa pieces leave the front roller on a discharge belt which feeds directly into the oven,Relevant
A threetiered gasfired oven is used to bake the formed masa,Relevant
Generally the chips are baked at temperatures ranging from 500 to 554 degrees Fahrenheit (260290 degrees Celsius) with the baking time varying from 35 to 50 seconds,Relevant
Baking enhances the alkaline flavor and reduces moisture and oil absorption during frying,Irrelevant
The tortilla chips are then cooled by moving through a series of open tiers or cooling racks,Relevant
The chips are sometimes cooled for up to 20 minutes before frying to produce a more uniform consistency and to reduce blistering during frying,Irrelevant
During this cooling process the chips lose additional moisture (up to 3 percent) and the moisture within each chip becomes more evenly distributed,Relevant
The next step involves frying the chips using oil temperatures ranging from 338 to 374 degrees Fahrenheit (170190 degrees Celsius) for 50 to 80 seconds,Relevant
The frying temperature and time depend on the type of product,Irrelevant
Tortilla chips made from yellow corn require a lower frying temperature and a longer time than chips made from white or blended white and yellow corn,Irrelevant

For example corn chips made from yellow corn are fried at 320 degrees Fahrenheit (160 degrees Celsius) while those made from blended white and yellow corn are fried at temperatures up to 410 degrees Fahrenheit (210 degrees Celsius) for 60 to 90 seconds,Irrelevant
Most of the commercial fryers used are the continuous type with direct or indirect heating elements,Irrelevant
Indirectfired fryers are more expensive but more efficient with lower operational costs,Irrelevant
Modern fryers are designed to filter out fines (very small pieces) continuously and be easy to clean,Irrelevant
These commercial fryers are available in sizes that can process from 160 to 1360 kghr (3533000 lbshr),Irrelevant
The process yield using the typical cornlime mixture will be 096 kilograms (21 pounds) of tortilla chips with 22 to 24 percent oil and less than 2 percent moisture,Irrelevant
The salt and seasonings are applied immediately after frying while the chips are still hot,Relevant
The hot chips are conveyed into an inclined rotating cylinder where a liquid seasoning mix is sprayed on them,Relevant
Generally the liquid mix consists of hot oil salt seasonings and flavoring and coloring agents,Irrelevant
Upon cooling the oil crystallizes forming the seasoning coat,Relevant
Salt can also be deposited on the chips as a liquid spray or by a granulated salt dispenser positioned over the conveying belts after the tumbling operation,Relevant
The amount of salt usually added to tortilla chips is about 1 to 15 percent by weight,Irrelevant
The tortilla chips are then cooled to ambient temperature and immediately packaged in moistureproof bags,Relevant
Because fried products are very hygroscopic (they readily absorb and retain moisture) delayed packaging can cause a loss of crispness,Irrelevant
The cooled tortilla chips with about 15 percent moisture are conveyed into a bagging machine,Relevant
This machine automatically weighs and deposits them in a bag which is then sealed,Relevant
The main tube of the trumpet is manufactured from standard machinable brass that is first put on a poleshaped tapered mandrel and lubricated,Relevant
A die that looks like a doughnut is then drawn down its entire length thus tapering and shaping it properly,Relevant
Next the shaped tube is annealed—heated (to around 1000 degrees Fahrenheit or 538 degrees Celsius) to make it workable,Relevant
This causes an oxide to form on the surface of the brass,Irrelevant
To remove the oxidized residue the tube must be bathed in diluted sulfuric acid before being bent,Relevant
The main tube may be bent using one of three different methods,Irrelevant
Some large manufacturers use hydraulic systems to push high pressure water (at approximately 27580 kilopascals) through slightly bent tubing that has been placed in a die,Relevant
The water presses the sides of the tubing to fit the mold exactly,Relevant
Other large manufacturers send ball bearings of exact size through the tubing,Irrelevant
Smaller manufacturers pour pitch into the tube let it cool then use a lever to bend the tube in a standard curve before hammering it into shape,Irrelevant
The bell is cut from sheet brass using an exact pattern,Relevant
The flat dressshaped sheet is then hammered around a pole,Relevant
Where the tube is cylindrical the ends are brought together into a butt joint,Relevant
Where the tube begins to flare the ends are overlapped to form a lap joint,Relevant
The entire joint is then brazed with a propane oxygen flame at 1500 to 1600 degrees Fahrenheit (816 to 871 degrees Celsius) to seal it,Relevant
To make a rough bell shape one end is hammered around the horn of a blacksmith anvil,Relevant
The entire tube is then drawn on a mandrel exactly like the main tube while the bell is spun on the mandrel,Relevant
A thin wire is placed around the bells rim and metal is crimped around it to give the edge its crisp appearance,Relevant
The bell is then soldered to the main tube,Relevant
The knuckles and accessory tubing are first drawn on a mandrel as were the tube and bell,Relevant

The knuckles are bent into 30 45 60 and 90degree angles and the smaller tubes are bent (using either the hydraulic or ball bearing methods used to bend the main tubing) annealed and washed in acid to remove oxides and flux from soldering,Relevant
The valve cases are cut to length from heavy tubing and threaded at the ends,Relevant
They then need to have holes cut into them that match those of the pistons,Relevant
Even small manufacturers now have available computer programs that precisely measure where the holes should be drawn,Irrelevant
The valve cases can be cut with drills whose heads are either pinpoint or rotary saws that cut the holes after which pins prick out the scrap disk of metal,Relevant
The knuckles tubes and valve cases are then placed in jigs that hold them precisely and their joints are painted with a solder and flux mixture using a blow torch,Relevant
After an acid bath the assembly is polished on a buffing machine using wax of varying grittiness and muslin discs of varying roughness that rotate at high speeds (2500 rpm is typical),Relevant
The entire trumpet can now be assembled,Relevant
The side tubes for the valve slides are joined to the knuckles and the main tubing is united end to end by overlapping their ferrules and soldering,Relevant
Next the pistons are then inserted and the entire valve assembly is screwed onto the main tubing,Relevant
The mouthpiece is then inserted,Relevant
The trumpet is cleaned polished and lacquered or it is sent to be electroplated,Relevant
The finishing touch is to engrave the name of the company on a prominent piece of tubing,Relevant
The lettering is transferred to the metal with carbon paper and a skilled engraver then carves the metal to match the etching,Relevant
Trumpets are shipped either separately for special orders or in mass quantities for high school bands,Relevant

They are wrapped carefully in thick plastic bubble packaging or other insulating material placed in heavy boxes full of insulation (such as packaging peanuts) then mailed or sent as freight to the customer,Relevant
Modern umbrellas are made by a handassembly process that except for a few critical areas can be done by semiskilled workers,Irrelevant
Choices of materials and quality control occur throughout the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
Although a wellmade umbrella need not be expensive almost every purchasing decision impacts directly upon the quality of the final product,Irrelevant
Collapsible rain umbrellas that telescope into a length of about a foot are the most recent innovations in umbrellas,Irrelevant
Though mechanically more complicated than stick umbrellas they share the same basic technology,Irrelevant

Among the differences between a stick umbrella and a collapsible umbrella is that the collapsible uses a two piece shaft that telescopes into itself and an extra set of runners along the top of the umbrella,Irrelevant
This section will focus on the manufacture of a stick umbrella,Irrelevant
The stick umbrella will usually begin its life as a shaft of either wood steel or aluminum approximately 38 inch (95 centimeter) thick,Irrelevant
Fiberglass and other plastics are occasionally used and in fact they are common in the larger golf umbrella,Irrelevant
Wood The fabric for the canopy is usually a nylon taffeta with an acrylic coating on the underside and a scotchguard type finish on the top,Irrelevant
The coating and finish are usually applied by the fabric supplier,Irrelevant

Other fabrics besides nylon might be used according to need or taste a patio umbrella attached to an outdoor table does not have to be lightweight and waterproof as much as a customer might want it to be large durable and attractive,Irrelevant
from various types of ash trees including Rowan wood from Asia is among the popular choices for a sturdy wood shaft,Irrelevant
While wood shafts are made using standard woodshaping machines such as turning machines and lathes metal and plastic shafts can be drawn or extruded to the proper shape,Irrelevant
The ribs and stretchers are assembled first usually from U shaped or channeled steel or other metal,Relevant
Ribs run underneath the top or canopy of the umbrella stretchers connect the ribs with the shaft of the umbrella,Irrelevant
The ribs are attached to the shaft of the umbrella by fitting into a top notch—a thin round nylon or plastic piece with teeth around the edges and then held with thin wire,Relevant
The stretchers are connected to the shaft of the umbrella with a plastic or metal runner the piece that moves along the shaft of the umbrella when it is opened or closed,Relevant

Next the ribs and stretchers are connected to each other with a joiner which is usually a small jointed metal hinge as the umbrella is opened or closed the joiner opens or closes through an angle of more than 90 degrees,Relevant

There are two catch springs in the shaft of each umbrella these are small pieces of metal that need to be pressed when the umbrella is slid up the shaft to open and again when the umbrella is slid down the shaft for closing,Irrelevant
Metal shafts are usually hollow and the catch spring can be inserted while a wood shaft requires that a space for the catch spring be hollowed out,Irrelevant

A pin or other blocking device is usually placed into the shaft a few inches above the upper catch spring to prevent the canopy from sliding past the top of umbrella when the runner goes beyond the upper catch spring,Relevant
The cover or canopy of the umbrella is hand sewn in individual panels to the ribs,Relevant
Because each panel has to be shaped to the curve of the canopy the cover cannot be cut in one piece,Irrelevant
Panels are sewn at the outer edges of the ribs and there are also connections between the ribs and the panels about onethird of the way down from the outer edge of the canopy,Relevant
Each panel is cut separately from piles of materials called gores machine cutting of several layers at once is possible although handcutting is more typical,Relevant

The typical rain umbrella has eight panels although some umbrellas with six panels (childrens umbrellas and parasols usually have six panels) and as many as twelve can occasionally be found,Irrelevant
At one point the number of panels in an umbrella may have been an indication of quality (or at least of the amount of attention the umbrella maker paid to his product),Irrelevant
Today because of the quality of the material available to the umbrella maker the number of panels is usually a matter of style and taste rather than quality,Irrelevant

The fabric used in a goodquality umbrella canopy is usually a nylon taffeta rated at 190T (190 threads per inch) with an acrylic coating on the underside and a scotchguard type finish on the top,Relevant
The coating and finish are usually applied by the fabric supplier,Relevant

Fabric patterns and designs can be chosen by the manufacturer or the manufacturer might add his own patterns and designs using a rotary or silk screening process especially for a special order of a limited number of umbrellas,Irrelevant

Similarly other fabrics besides nylon might be used according to need or taste a patio umbrella attached to an outdoor table does not have to be lightweight and waterproof as much as a customer might want it to be large durable and attractive,Irrelevant

The tip of the umbrella that passes through the canopy can be covered with metal (a ferrule) that has been forced over and perhaps glued to the tip or left bare depending on the desire of the manufacturer,Irrelevant
The handle is connected to the shaft at the end of the process and can be wood plastic metal or any combination of desired ingredients,Relevant
Though handles can be screwed on betterquality umbrellas use glue to secure the handle more tightly,Relevant

The end tips of the umbrella where the ribs reach past the canopy can be left bare or covered with small plastic or wood end caps that are either pushed or screwed on or glued and then sewn to the ends of the ribs through small holes in the end caps,Relevant
Finally the umbrella is packaged accordingly and sent to customers,Relevant

The manufacturing process is split into fabrication (making parts) subassembly (putting parts together to make components) and assembly (putting the components together to form the final product),Irrelevant
The fabrication process comprises several different procedures each specific to a particular type of raw material—sheet metal plastic or aluminum,Irrelevant
Once the constituent parts have been made they are assembled major subassemblies or components include the transmission the pump the spin and wash tubs the balance ring and the painted parts,Relevant
Finally the subassemblies are put together inside the shell of the washer which is then complete,Relevant
Most sheet metal parts are formed by a machine called a press,Relevant
This name is quite descriptive as the machine actually presses (or squeezes) a piece of sheet metal between two halves of a mold called a die,Irrelevant
The metal will take the form of the space between the halves of the die,Irrelevant
Because metal in parts shaped by only one die tends to wrinkle crack or tear multiple dies are generally used to form each component,Irrelevant
Where possible the metal is fed directly from a coil into the press,Irrelevant
When this is not possible the metal is cut to length and manually (or with larger parts like the cabinet automatically) placed into the die,Irrelevant
Plastic parts are formed in an injection molding machine a metal mold with one or more cavities in the shape of the desired part,Relevant
After being heated to its melting point the plastic is forced into the mold under high pressure,Relevant
Next water is passed through the mold to cool and solidify the part,Relevant
The mold is then opened and the part pushed out by ejector pins,Relevant
When you look at a plastic part you often can see small circles created by these pins,Irrelevant
Aluminum transmission parts are formed into a rough shape in a die cast machine which works much like an injection mold except that it does not use pressure,Relevant
The Most of the key components—transmission motor broke assembly—are housed below the agitator,Relevant
The balance ring is a weighted ring that keeps the washer from moving around during operation,Irrelevant
Molten metal is mechanically ladled into the mold and cooled,Relevant
The ensuing rough casting is then given its final shape by various machines which drill holes shave excess metal off critical surfaces or cut metal away from the part,Relevant
The transmission is assembled manually by workers who bolt snap or press (tight fit) several shafts and gears together,Relevant
Workers then add a metered amount of oil and bolt the unit together,Relevant
The pump is assembled automatically,Relevant
Robots place the impeller and seals in the cover and body and seal the pump,Relevant
Some manufacturers use heat and others vibration (which generates heat) as a sealant,Relevant
The tub parts are made in presses and the subassembly is manufactured automatically,Relevant
After being rolled into a drum shape the side is welded,Relevant
The weld is then smoothed out and the drum is placed on a unit called an expander which stretches the tub into its final shape,Relevant
A bottom is then welded onto the drum and this weld is also smoothed,Relevant
If the tub is stainless steel it is polished so it wont snag the clothes,Relevant
Otherwise the tub is dipped in a solution called a ground coat and heated to about 1600 degrees until this coating hardens,Relevant
If the tub will not be visible (the wash tub) the unit is done,Relevant
If the tub will be visible (the spin tub) a finish coat is applied following the same procedure used with the ground coat this final coat gives the tub either a white or blue color,Relevant
The balance ring is a large weight that stabilizes the washer,Irrelevant
Its outside structure is plastic with a ring of metal melted into the plastic for strength,Irrelevant
Cement is added and balanced precisely,Relevant
This ring which weighs more than twenty pounds keeps the machine from walking or moving about when it is in use,Irrelevant
Washing machine manufacturers use any one of several painting processes,Irrelevant
One manufacturer uses steel that has been prepainted by the steel manufacturer,Irrelevant
Although cheaper this type of steel does not offer the best rust protection because the cut edges are not painted,Irrelevant
Other companies treat their parts with various chemicals to clean and ready them before applying paint,Irrelevant
In some cases the paint comes in a powder with a flourlike consistency,Irrelevant

Mixed with air and given an electrical charge the powder is sprayed on the part which is hung from an overhead conveyor and given an opposite charge so that it and the powder will attract one another,Relevant
After spraying the conveyor moves the part into an oven that melts the paint when the part cools the paint process is completed,Relevant
This process begins with mounting the transmission on the balance ring,Irrelevant
The transmission is set on a bearing that is bolted on the wash tub the wash tub is sitting on a conveyor,Relevant
Another bearing (the lower bearing) the brake assembly and the drive pulley are put on the end of the transmission,Relevant
Next a pivoting mechanism called the pivot dome and legs are bolted on the assembly to hold all the pieces together,Relevant
Using a hydraulically operated mechanism workers then lift this assembly called the module onto the washer base,Relevant
Springs are added to hold module and base together,Relevant
A seal is added the spin tub is bolted to the transmission inside of the wash tub and its plastic covers are snapped into place,Relevant
A plastic hub which attaches the agitator to the transmission is bolted onto the output end of the transmission shaft,Relevant
Then the agitator is snapped onto the hub,Relevant
The pump and a mounting bracket are now bolted onto the motor which is then fitted with a shield to protect against potential leaks,Relevant
This assembly is bolted to the base of the washing machine and connected to the transmission module with a belt and hoses,Relevant
Next the lid hinges are attached to the lid and the top,Relevant
The top of the washer is bolted to the cabinet with a hinge for easy maintenance,Relevant
A mixing valve to control the mixture of hot and cold is bolted to the back of the cabinet,Relevant
The graphics panel which provides words and pictures to explain the controls is mounted on the control panel the controls themselves are attached from the back,Relevant
The wiring connected as one unit is called a harness,Irrelevant
The harness is clipped to the control connectors at one end and the other end is passed through a hole in the top to be mounted to the motor,Relevant
Because of its large size and weight the cabinet assembly is then placed in the washer by a robot,Relevant
The cabinet is bolted to the base and the controls are snapped together with the mating connectors on the module and motor,Relevant
The drain hose is pulled through the cabinet and a part called the gooseneck is added,Relevant
This part is what gives the hose its hook shape so that it will fasten into the drain,Irrelevant
After being tested the front panel is bolted on and a packet of information and accessories is added,Relevant
The finished unit is crated automatically,Relevant
A machine opens the cardboard box which was flat for shipment and drops it over the washer,Relevant
The top and bottom flaps are simultaneously folded over and glued,Relevant
Then the machine applies pressure on the top and bottom of the crate to make sure the glue sets properly,Relevant

After the glue has set the machine puts a banding strap around the top of the crate to add strength for lift truck transportation (the units are carried from the top to reduce the risk of damage),Relevant
This section will focus on quartz digital watches with LED displays,Irrelevant
Although the assembly of such watches must be performed carefully and methodically the most essential aspects of the manufacturing process are in the manufacture of the components,Irrelevant
The heart of a quartz watch is a tiny sliver of quartz,Irrelevant
The synthetically produced quartz is cut by the manufacturer with a diamond saw and shipped to the watchmaker to use,Relevant
The production of grown quartz is a critical step in the process,Irrelevant
Quartz in a natural form is first loaded into a giant kettle or autoclave (the same device used by doctors and dentists to sterilize instruments),Irrelevant
Hanging from the top of the autoclave are seeds or tiny particles of quartz with the desired crystalline structure,Irrelevant
An alkaline material is pumped into the bottom of the autoclave and the autoclave is heated to a temperature of roughly 750 degrees Fahrenheit (400 degrees Celsius),Relevant
The natural quartz dissolves in the hot alkaline liquid evaporates and deposits itself on the seeds,Relevant
As it deposits itself it follows the pattern of the crystalline structure of the seeds,Relevant
After about 75 days the chamber can be opened and the newly grown quartz crystals can be removed and cut into the correct proportions,Relevant
Different angles and thicknesses in the cutting lead to predictable rates of oscillation,Irrelevant
The desired rate of oscillation for quartz used in wristwatches is 100000 megaHertz or 100000 oscillations per second,Irrelevant
In watch assembly the entire set of crystal and microchips is set onto a circuit board,Relevant
A battery is also installed that generates electricity for the quartz crystal and supplies the power for the LED display,Relevant
To work most effectively the piece of quartz needs to be sealed in a vacuum chamber of one sort or another,Irrelevant
Most commonly the quartz is placed into a sort of capsule with wires attached to both ends so that the capsule can be soldered or otherwise connected to a circuit board,Relevant
The electronic leads generated by a battery through the quartz (producing oscillations) will go to a microchip that serves as a frequency dividing circuit,Relevant

Microchip manufacture like the quartz is also carried out by the supplier to the watch manufacturer An extensive and complex process making microchips involves chemical andor xray etching of a microscopic electronic circuit onto a tiny piece of silicon dioxide 4 The oscillation rate of perhaps 100000 vibrationssecond is reduced to 1 or 60 or some other more manageable number of oscillations The new pattern of oscillation is then sent to another microchip that functions as a counterdecoderdriver,Irrelevant
This chip will actually count the oscillations that it receives,Relevant
If there are sixty oscillations per second the chip will change the reading on an LED every second,Irrelevant
After 3600 oscillations (60 x 60) the counter will instruct the LED to change the reading for minutes,Irrelevant
And after 60 x 60 x 60 oscillations (216000) the counter will change the hour reading,Irrelevant
The entire set of crystal and microchips is set onto a circuit board,Relevant
The board incorporates a space to hold the battery that supplies electricity to the quartz crystal and supplies the power for the LED display,Relevant
Generally the space for the battery is on the outside of the surface facing the back of the case,Irrelevant
The battery can be replaced by removing the back of the watch shaking out the old one and dropping in the new battery,Irrelevant
