Depending on the type of bread to be made other ingredients are also poured into the mixer,Relevant
Modern mixers can process up to 2000 pounds (908 kg) of dough per minute,Irrelevant
The mixer is essentially an enclosed drum that rotates at speeds between 35 to 75 revolutions per minute,Irrelevant
Inside the drum mechanical arms knead the dough to the desired consistency in a matter of seconds,Irrelevant
Although modern bread production is highly computerized the ability of the mixing staff to judge the elasticity and appearance of the dough is critical,Irrelevant
Experienced personnel will be able to determine the consistency by the sound of the dough as it rolls around the mixer,Irrelevant
The mixing process takes about 12 minutes,Irrelevant
Three methods are used to ferment the dough,Irrelevant
In some plants the highspeed machinery is designed to manipulate the dough at extreme speeds and with great force which forces the yeast cells to rapidly multiply,Irrelevant
Fermentation can also be induced by the addition of chemical additives such as 1cysteine (a naturally occurring amino acid) and vitamin C,Irrelevant
Some breads are allowed to ferment naturally,Irrelevant
In this instance the dough is placed in covered metal bowls and stored in a temperaturecontrolled room until it rises,Relevant
After the dough has fermented it is loaded into a divider with rotating blades that cut the dough into predetermined weights,Relevant
A conveyer belt then moves the pieces of dough to a molding machine,Relevant
The molding machine shapes the dough into balls and drops them onto a layered conveyer belt that is enclosed in a warm humid cabinet called a prover,Relevant
The dough moves slowly through the prover so that it may rest and so that the gas reproduction may progress,Irrelevant
When the dough emerges from the prover it is conveyed to a second molding machine which reshapes the dough into loaves and drops them into pans,Relevant
The pans travel to another prover that is set at a high temperature and with a high level of humidity,Relevant
Here the dough regains the elasticity lost during fermentation and the resting period,Relevant
From the prover the pans enter a tunnel oven,Relevant
The temperature and speed are carefully calculated so that when the loaves emerge from the tunnel they are completely baked and partially cooled,Relevant
While inside the tunnel the loaves are mechanically dumped from the pans onto shelves,Relevant
The baking and cooling process lasts approximately 30 minutes,Irrelevant
The bread continues to cool as it moves from the oven to the slicing machine,Relevant
Here vertical serrated blades move up and down at great speeds slicing the bread into consistently sized pieces,Relevant
Metal plates hold the slices together while picking up each loaf and passing it to the wrapping machine,Relevant
Preprinted plastic bags are mechanically slipped over each loaf,Relevant
At some bakeries workers close the bags with wire twists,Relevant
Other plants seal the bags with heat,Relevant
Some bungee jumping companies design and manufacture their own cord,Relevant
In general this is a proprietary process which they keep secret,Irrelevant
The following describes a typical Bungee Cordprocess by which commercial or milspec bungee cords are manufactured,Irrelevant
Natural or synthetic rubber is prepared and extruded into long ribbons of rubber,Relevant
These ribbons are approximately 009 inch to 012 inch (024032 cm) thick 025 inch (064 cm) wide and up to 100 feet (30 m) long,Irrelevant
The extruder consists of a heated cylinder into which the rubber is placed,Relevant
One end of the cylinder moves under pressure to force the rubber out through a small hole in the other end,Relevant
The hole or die is in the shape of the desired ribbon crosssection,Relevant
When the rubber ribbons have cooled they are coiled and shipped to the bungee cord manufacturer,Relevant
The number of ribbons or strands in a bungee cord determines the diameter of the cord and the overall tensile strength rating,Irrelevant
The appropriate number of rubber strands are partially unwound from their coils,Irrelevant
To prevent the individual strands from sticking to each other in hot weather they are coated with finely powdered talc or soapstone,Relevant
This is done continuously as the strands are being unwound from the coils during the braiding process (steps 3 and 4 below),Relevant
The free ends of the rubber strands are brought together and manually fed through a machine called the braider,Relevant
At the input end of the braider they pass through a roller or other device which gently squeezes them into a bundle,Relevant
At the other end another roller or a takeup reel pulls the strands through the machine,Relevant
By adjusting the pressures and speeds of the input and output devices the rubber strands are placed under tension and slightly stretched while they pass through the machine,Relevant
This reduces the diameter of the bundle of rubber strands to allow the fabric covering to be wound tightly,Irrelevant
The braider weaves the covering yarn around the stretched rubber bundle as it passes through the machine,Relevant
The yarn must be woven in a tight enough pattern to prevent dirt from entering gaps between the yarn threads when the cord is fully extended,Relevant
If two or more layers of covering are required they are woven one after the other,Irrelevant
The outer covering yarn may be colored and woven in a pattern for age dating or decorative purposes,Relevant
(See Quality Control),Irrelevant
The finished bungee cord is cut to length coiled and placed in cardboard boxes for shipping,Relevant
Some cords are first placed in dark plastic bags as further protection against ultraviolet radiation during handling and storage,Relevant
The end fittings may be attached by someone other than the bungee cord manufacturer,Relevant

In the case of commercial bungee cord used as luggage and equipment tie downs another manufacturer or distributor cuts the bungee cord into the required lengths doubles each end over and tightly coils a stiff wire around the ends with a wire coiler machine,Relevant
The other end of this wire is usually bent into a jshaped hook to allow the ends to be secured,Irrelevant
Bungee cord used for bungee jumping may have the ends bent around a nonmetallic eye and wrapped with a strong waxed string called whipping that is wound tightly while the cord is stretched,Relevant
Other end fittings may involve sewing the cord to fabric webbing,Irrelevant
The fuselage group is the first main assembly to be produced,Irrelevant
The fuselage group consists of the nose structure assembly forward cabin structure assembly aft cabin structure assembly and the tailcone assembly,Irrelevant
The aircraft is essentially assembled from the back forward,Irrelevant
The first part of the fuselage to be assembled is the aft cabin barrel assembly (see illustration marked Position 4 Setback 0),Relevant
The cabin barrel is assembled in the vertical direction in a floor assembly jig,Relevant
The cabin barrel jig incorporates all the frame assemblies skins and supporting structures necessary to complete the aft cabin barrel assembly,Irrelevant
Details and subassemblies are provided with tooling holes and locators set to contour templates which define the aircrafts loft or contour,Relevant

Next an aft cabin intermediate jig is used to assemble three primary components the aft cabin barrel the aft pressure bulkhead (which serves as the boundary of the pressurized section of the fuselage) and the wing attach fittings,Relevant
The nose and forward cabin structures are assembled next (see Position 3 Setback 1),Irrelevant
The nose section jig assembles the forward frame wheelwell assembly skin assemblies and supporting structures,Relevant
The forward cabin buildup jig assembles the windshield frame cabin door frame forward pressure bulkhead supporting structure and skins,Relevant
The forward and aft cabin sections are now mated using a cabin mate jig,Relevant
Both cabin sections are located in the jig through the use of tooling holes which coordinate both the forward and aft pressure bulkheads (see Position 3 Setback 0),Relevant
While the cabin sections are being built the upper and lower tailcone sections Business Jetare also being assembled,Relevant
The tailcone mate jig is used to connect and align the upper and lower tailcone subassemblies (see Position 2 Setback 2 and Position 2 Setback 1),Relevant
The three primary fuselage sections nose forward and aft cabin assemnbly and tailcone are located and assembled using a fuselage mate jig,Relevant
The forward and aft cabin sections are loaded into the jig first followed by the nose and tailcone sections,Relevant
Engine mount brackets forward and aft are now installed onto the structural engine beams which extend out from the fuselage,Relevant
Mounting holes are also aligned,Relevant
These will be used to attach the vertical stabilizer to the tailcone and the aft canted bulkhead (the aft canted bulkhead caps off the end of the tailcone section),Irrelevant
(See Position 2 Setback 0),Irrelevant
The empennage or tail assembly is the next section to be assembled,Irrelevant
It consists of the vertical fin rudder horizontal stabilizer and elevators,Relevant
The rudder is the primary control surface for yaw or side to side movement usually used to turn the aircraft,Relevant
Two elevators are mounted on the trailing edge of the horizontal stabilizer and are used to control the pitch or up and down motion of the aircraft,Relevant

The horizontal stabilizer frame buildup jig is used to assemble the leading edge and spar assemblies along with the vertical attach fittings stringers (aluminum extrusions which are used to provide structural support for sheet metal skins) skins and supporting structures (see Position 1 Setback 2),Relevant
Elevator frame buildup trim tab assembly and skinning jigs are used to assemble the right and left hand elevators,Relevant

The trim tabs are movable control surfaces attached on the trailing edge of the elevators used to hold the aircraft in level flight during cruise conditions (somewhat analogous to cruise control in a car),Relevant
After the elevator frame and trim tabs are constructed the skinning jig is then used to assemble the frame and trim tab assemblies along with the tip leading and trailing edge skins,Relevant

The vertical fin buildup jig is used to assemble the leading edge spar and bonded skin assemblies along with the horizontal attach side plates and the supporting structure required to complete the vertical fin section,Relevant
The fastener locations in the tailcone are established by the airframe alignment jig to ensure the vertical fins relationship to the wing and engine attach points,Relevant
Rudder frame buildup trim tab assembly and skinning jigs are utilized in assembling the rudder assembly,Relevant
After the rudder frame and trim tab is completed the skinning jig is then used to assemble the frame and trim tab assemblies along with the leading and trailing edge skins,Relevant

The empennage section of the aircraft is completed after the elevators horizontal stabilizer vertical stabilizer and rudder are assembled (the rudder is usually installed last along with the flight control systems),Relevant
(See Position 1 Setback 1),Irrelevant
The empennage section is then mated to the aircraft tailcone section (see Position 1 Setback 0),Relevant
The wing assembly is next and typically consists of the center wing section outboard wing sections and aileron and flap assemblies,Relevant
The ailerons are movable control surfaces usually hinged to the outer wing which help provide control in roll about the longitudinal axis of the plane,Relevant
The flaps are movable control surfaces mounted inboard on the wing which are able to hinge downward,Relevant
These increase lowspeed lift and add drag allowing the aircraft to make steep approach landings without gaining excess airspeed,Relevant
Aileron frame buildup and skin and rivet jigs are used to assemble the left and right hand aileron assemblies,Relevant
After the aileron frame is completed the skin and rivet jig is used to load the aileron frame skin and doublers (used for extra strength) then rivet the assembly complete,Relevant
The aileron frame is located by pinning the hinge bearings and the inboard and outboard rib webs (the ribs are primary structural members running across the aileron),Relevant
The ailerons are usually installed last along with the flight control instruments and flaps,Relevant
Flap frame buildup and skin jigs are used in constructing the left and right hand flap assemblies,Relevant
The flap frame is completed first,Relevant
Then the flap skin jig assembles the bonded upper skin and trailing edge skin flap spar section leading edge assembly and end ribs and interconnect clevises,Relevant
The building of the outboard wing section involves the use of many different jigs for drilling riveting and buildup,Relevant

The main tool used is the outboard wing buildup jig which assembles the forward outboard wing assembly rear spar assembly trailing edge bonded skin assemblies and the supporting structure (see Position 1 Setback 3),Relevant
The construction of the center wing section also requires the use of many different buildup jigs,Irrelevant

The primary tool used here is the center wing buildup jig which assembles the center section subassembly wheelwell structure rib and skin assemblies and the supporting structure (see Position 1 Setback 2),Relevant
The wing assembly mate jig assembles both the left and right outboard wings with the center wing,Relevant
The wing sections and center section are located in the jig by locators and contour boards,Relevant
The center section is loaded first followed by the left and right outboard wings (see Position 1 Setback 1),Relevant
The completed wing assembly is then mated to the fuselage section (see Position 1 Setback 0),Relevant
There are two different landing gear assemblies the nose and main landing gears,Relevant
Both use retraction systems which are electrically controlled and hydraulically actuated,Irrelevant
The main landing gear (MLG) is usually a trailing link type and retracts inboard into the wing,Irrelevant
The nose landing gear (NLG) retracts forward into the fuselage nose section and is enclosed by doors,Irrelevant
The landing gears are assembled away from the main assembly line and are brought to the line when needed usually when the fuselage and wings are being mated (see Position 1 Setback 0),Relevant
A business jet is typically powered by two turbofan jet engines located on each side of the rear fuselage in nacelle assemblies,Relevant

The nacelle assemblies consist of an inlet section a cowl or outer housing an exhaust nozzle section and a bleed air system which diverts hot air to the wing and nacelle leading edges for deicing,Relevant
Bleed air is also used for cabin heating and pressurization,Irrelevant
The large sheet metal panels which form the cowl are typically roll formed,Irrelevant
Some of the other sheet metal parts such as the nose cap on the nacelle inlet section are formed using a female die in a draw press,Irrelevant
Nacelle assemblies are built separately away from the line and then brought back for installation (see Position 1 Setback 0),Relevant
The flight control systems are usually installed last along with the ailerons flaps and rudder,Relevant
There are many different flight control systems which go into a modern aircraft,Relevant

The following is a partial list of the major systems aileron control system aileron trim system speedbrake system flap interconnect system rudder control system rudder trim control system elevator control system elevator trim control system pressurization system windshield antiice system wing antiice system oxygen system pitot static system,Relevant
(See Position 1 Setback 0),Irrelevant
Before the aircraft leaves the factory all electrical and mechanical systems undergo a functional test,Relevant
Examples of items checked are fuel calibration hydraulic systems gear blow down and lock warning lights and horns and avionics,Irrelevant
After the engines and flight control systems are installed the aircraft is ready to go out the door for engine testing and flight test,Relevant
The aircraft is put through numerous performance and systems tests before it is approved for delivery to the customer,Relevant
Before delivery the aircraft is sent to be painted after which the interior is finished,Relevant
(See Position 0 Setback 0),Irrelevant

For many years the major creameries for butter manufacturing were located in the states of the Eastern seaboard but the flourishing of a more industrialized agriculture in the Midwest led to the predominance of buttermaking facilities there,Irrelevant
The modern buttermaking process begins when fresh cows milk from dairy farms is brought into the facility,Irrelevant
The product is inspected classified into different groups according to its adjudged quality and then filtered to remove impurities,Relevant
Then the milk is separated by means of centrifugal force,Relevant
It is pumped into a large cylindrical vertical rotator device,Relevant
When turned on this rotator spins the liquid until the cream rises to the top,Relevant
The cream is then fed into large stainless steel vats and heated to 180°F (82°C) for about 30 minutes in the pasteurization process to remove any lingering bacteria,Relevant
The pasteurized cream is then left to cool,Relevant
The cream is placed in a large mechanical churn usually made of aluminum,Relevant
Some of these industrialsized churns can make 15005000 pounds (6812270 kg) of butter at a time,Irrelevant
When the churn is activated it tumbles the cream much like the motion of a clothes dryer while a worker watches the process through a small glass window on the churn,Relevant
After about 45 minutes small granules of butter begin to form and the butter and buttermilk are separated,Relevant
Salt is added and the mixture is churned further,Relevant
When this process is completed a stainless steel mobile device sometimes called a boat is placed adjacent to the opening of the mechanical churn,Relevant
The door of the churn is opened and the butter begins to spill out into the boat activating the churn removes the rest,Relevant
It is then wrapped into 64pound (29 kg) cartons and sent to the distributor,Relevant
There the butter is repackaged for consumer and foodservice industry use,Relevant
When the ingredients arrive at the margarine manufacturing facility they must first undergo a series of preparatory measures,Irrelevant
The oil—safflower corn or soybean among other types—is treated with a caustic soda solution to remove unnecessary components known as free fatty acids,Relevant
The oil is then washed by mixing it with hot water separating it and leaving it to dry under a vacuum,Relevant
Next the oil is sometimes bleached with a mixture of bleaching earth and charcoal in another vacuum chamber,Relevant
The bleaching earth and charcoal absorb any unwanted colorants and are then filtered out from the oil,Relevant
Whatever liquid is used in the manufacturing process—milk water or a soybased substance—it too must undergo preparatory measures,Relevant
It also undergoes pasteurization to remove impurities and if dry milk powder is used it must be checked for bacteria and other contaminants,Relevant
The oil is then hydrogenated to ensure the correct consistency for margarine production a state referred to as plastic or semisolid,Relevant
In this process hydrogen gas is added to the oil under pressurized conditions,Relevant
The hydrogen particles stay with the oil helping to increase the temperature point at which it will melt and to make the oil less susceptible to contamination through oxidation,Relevant
The continuousflow process is the most commonly used method in the manufacture of margarine,Relevant
If milk is used as the liquid base it is joined with salt and an emulsifying agent in a chamber,Irrelevant
The emulsifying agent ensures that the emulsification process—chemically defined as a suspension of small globules of one liquid in a second liquid—takes place,Relevant
An emulsifier works by decreasing the surface tension between the oil globules and the liquid mixture thereby helping them form chemical bonds more easily,Relevant
The result is a substance that is neither wholly liquid nor wholly solid but rather a combination of the two called semisolid,Relevant
Lecithin a natural fat derived from egg yolk soybean or corn is one typical emulsification agent used in margarine manufacturing,Relevant
In the initial step the liquid salt and lecithin are mixed together into one tank opposite another vat holding the oils and oilsoluble ingredients,Relevant
In the continuousflow process the contents of the two vats are fed on a timed basis into a third tank typically called the emulsification chamber,Relevant
While the blending process is taking place the equipments sensors and regulating devices keep the mixtures temperature near 100°F (38°C),Relevant
Next the margarine mixture is sent to a device called a Votator the brand name for the most commonly used apparatus in US margarine manufacturing,Relevant
It has been standard equipment to the industry since the 1930s,Irrelevant
In the Votator the margarine emulsion is cooled in what is referred to as Chamber A,Irrelevant
Chamber A is divided into a trio of tubes that successively decrease its temperature,Relevant
Within two minutes the mixture has reached 4550°F (710°C),Relevant
It is then pumped into a second vat called Chamber B,Relevant
There it is occasionally agitated but generally left to sit still and form its semisolid state,Relevant
If it needs to be whipped or otherwise prepared for special consistency the agitation is done in Chamber B,Relevant
Polyester arrives at a button factory in liquid form,Relevant
At the start of the manufacturing process polyester is drained from its Buttonstorage tank and measured into a stainless steel kettle,Relevant
Then dye is added if the buttons are to be any color other than the natural translucence of the polyester,Relevant
After the dye is mixed in the liquid polyester is poured into a 3gallon (11 l) metal beaker,Relevant
The catalyst and liquid wax are added,Relevant
The mixture of polyester catalyst and wax is then poured into a large rotating metal cylinder,Relevant
The cylinders are made of steel and lined with chrome and are typically 2 feet (61 cm) long and 4 feet (122 cm) in diameter,Irrelevant
The cylinders lie on their sides on rollers which rotate the drums at 250 rpm,Irrelevant
The polyester solution is slowly poured into the rotating interior of the cylinder and the centrifugal force of the rotation causes the solution to spread lining the drum with an even sheet,Relevant
A greater amount of polyester is used for thicker buttons and less for thinner ones,Relevant
A 2inch (5 cm) lip around the ends of the cylinder prevents the polyester from leaking out,Relevant
As the polyester rotates in the cylinder it begins to interact with the chemical catalyst and harden,Relevant
The wax rises to the top of the sheet and also sinks to the bottom so that the hardening polyester is eventually held between two layers of wax,Relevant
This process is completed after 20 minutes of rotation,Irrelevant
The resulting polyester sheet has changed from its liquid state to a crumbly solid likened to the consistency of stale cheese,Relevant
When the sheet has reached the proper hardness the drum is stopped and the sheet is cut,Relevant
Then it is rolled out of the cylinder onto a wooden tube,Relevant
The wax makes it easy to remove from the drum but the material is still very delicate,Relevant
The top layer of wax is then peeled off and the sheet is transferred to a blanking machine,Relevant
The blanking machine moves the polyester sheet along on a conveyor belt,Relevant
As the sheet passes along the belt circular steel cutting dies descend and punch out buttonsized circles called blanks,Relevant
Buttons come in standard sizes and different diameter dies can be loaded into the blanking machine depending on the size needed,Irrelevant
After the blanks are cut they fall into a chute and the punched out sheet of polyester rolls beneath the chute,Relevant
Cutting the blanks from the sheet takes from two to four minutes depending on the size of the buttons being made,Relevant
The blanks at this stage are hot because the polyester is still reacting with the catalyst releasing heat,Relevant
So at this point the blanks are removed from the chute and poured into a nylon bag,Relevant
The bag is then lowered into a tank of salt water which is heated to 230°F (110°C),Relevant
The blanks float in the salt water for 15 minutes,Relevant
The water slowly cools and the polyester blanks harden,Relevant
Next the nylon bag is transferred to a cold water tank and the blanks reach their final state of hardness,Relevant
After the hot and cold baths the blanks are dried in a centrifugal drying machine which spins them in a wire mesh basket,Relevant
The blanks are now ready to be cut into their finished button shape,Relevant
The exact design of the button can be specified by a clothing manufacturer and the button maker must make a steel cutting tool according to the design he is given,Relevant
A different cutting tool is needed for example to make a beveled edge or a flat one or to make a slightly concave button,Relevant
When the appropriate cutting tool is in place the buttons are poured into a hopper at the top of the cutting machine,Relevant
The blanks fall into a holder where they are clamped tightly and moved toward the cutting tool,Relevant
The spinning blade advances and cuts the button then retracts,Relevant
Next the button moves beneath a set of drills which create the holes,Relevant
Like the cutting tool the drills must be designed to conform to the clothing manufacturers specifications,Relevant
The design specifies not only two holes or four holes but the diameter of the holes and the distance between them as well,Irrelevant
After the buttons pass beneath the drill they are sucked by vacuum out of the holder and into a box beneath the machine,Relevant
Hundreds of buttons a minute can be made this way though the number varies according to the size of the button and the complexity of the design,Relevant
After the buttons are cut and drilled they have rough or sharp edges scratches and tool marks,Relevant
They are placed into hexagonal tumbling drums which contain water an abrasive material and a foaming agent,Relevant
The drums spin for up to 24 hours,Relevant
The buttons bounce around in the drum until they are smooth and shiny,Relevant
After tumbling the buttons are washed and dried,Relevant
Optical glass is supplied to lens manufacturers by specialized vendors,Irrelevant
Usually it is provided as a pressed plate or sliced glass plate from which the elements are cut,Irrelevant
The glass elements are shaped to concave or convex forms by a curve generator machine that is a firststep grinder,Relevant
To reach the specifications for its shape a lens goes through a sequence of processes in which it is ground by polishing particles in water,Relevant
The polishing particles become smaller in each step as the lens is refined,Relevant
Curve generation and subsequent grinding vary in speed depending on the frailty softness and oxidation properties of the optical materials,Relevant
After grinding and polishing the elements are centered so that the outer edge of the lens is perfect in circumference relative to the centerline or optical axis of the lens,Relevant
Lenses made of plastic or bonded glass and resin are produced by the same processes,Relevant
Bonded materials are used to make lenses with nonspherical surfaces and these lenses are called hybrid aspherics,Irrelevant

The aspherical surfaces of these lenses are completed during centering 2 Formed lenses are coated to protect the material from oxidation to prevent reflections and to meet requirements for designed spectrum transmission or color balance and rendition,Relevant
The lens surfaces are carefully cleaned before coating,Relevant
Techniques for applying coatings and the coatings themselves are major selling points for a manufacturers lenses and are carefully guarded secrets,Relevant
Some types of coatings include metal oxides lightalloy fluorides and layers of quartz that are applied to lenses and mirrors by a vacuum process,Irrelevant
Several layers of coating may be applied for the best color and light transmission but excessive coating can reduce the light that passes through the lens and limit its usefulness,Relevant
The barrel includes the chassis that supports the various lens elements and the cosmetic exterior,Relevant
Metal mounts grooves and moving portions of the lens are critical to the performance of the lens and are machined to very specific tolerances,Relevant
Lens mounts may be made of brass aluminum or plastic,Irrelevant
Most metal barrel components are diecast and machined,Irrelevant
Metal mounts last longer maintain their dimensions can be machined more precisely and can be dismantled to replace elements if necessary,Irrelevant
Plastic mounts are less expensive and of lighter weight,Irrelevant
If the barrel is made of engineering plastic it is produced by a highly efficient and precise method of injection molding,Irrelevant
The interior surfaces of the barrel are also coated to protect them and to prevent internal reflection and flare,Irrelevant
Other parts of the lens such as the diaphragm and auto focus module are produced as subassemblies,Irrelevant
The iris diaphragm is constructed of curved leaves cut out of thin sheets of metal,Irrelevant
The metal leaves are held in place by two plates,Relevant
One plate is fixed the other moves and has slots for sliding pins,Irrelevant
These slide the leaves back toward the barrel to open the diaphragm or into the center to close the opening as the fstop ring is turned,Irrelevant
The diaphragm assembly is fastened into place when the lens mount is attached to the end of the barrel,Relevant
The auto focus is also added the optical elements are positioned and the lens is sealed,Relevant
After final assembly the lens is adjusted and inspected rigorously,Relevant
It must meet the design standards for optical resolution mechanical function and auto focus response,Relevant
Lenses may also be tested by subjecting them to shocks dropping and vibration,Relevant
Since most carpet in the US is tufted earlier methods of weaving carpet such as Wilton and Axminster are ignored in the following account,Irrelevant
Synthetic yarns arrive at the carpet manufacturer either in staple fiber form or bulk Carpetcontinuous filament form,Irrelevant
The staple fibers which average 7 inches (18 cm) long are loose individual strands that arrive in bales,Irrelevant
Several bales are blended together into one batch in a hopper,Relevant
Then after lubrication they are spun into long loose ropes called slivers by a carding machine,Relevant
The slivers are then pulled straightened and spun into single yarn that is wound onto spools,Relevant
Both the singleply staple fibers (now spun into filament) and the bulk continuous filament must now be twisted together to form thicker twoply yarn suitable for tufting,Irrelevant
The yarns are then steamed to bulk them and then heated to 270280°F (132138°C),Relevant
This heat setting causes the yarn to maintain its shape by fixing its twist,Relevant
After cooling these yarns are wound onto tubes and transported to the tufting machines,Relevant
Most carpets are dyed after tufting yet sometimes the yarns are dyed first,Relevant

The methods include putting 5001000 pounds (227455 kg) of fiber into pressurized vats Carpetthrough which treated dyes are circulated or passing the fiber continuously through the bath or passing skeins of yarn through the vat of dye,Relevant
The yarn can also be put on forms and the heated dyes can then be forced under pressure from inside the forms to color the yarn,Relevant
Another method passes the yarn through printing rollers while yet another involves knitting the yarn onto a form that is then printed with dyes before the yarn is unraveled,Relevant
All yarn that has been dyed is then steamed washed and dried,Relevant
The yarn is put on a creel (a bar with skewers) behind the tufting machine then fed into a nylon tube that leads to the tufting needle,Relevant
The needle pierces the primary backing and pushes the yarn down into a loop,Relevant
Photoelectric sensors control how deeply the needles plunge into the backing so the height of the loops can be controlled,Irrelevant
A looper or flat hook seizes and releases the loop of yarn while the needle pulls back up the backing is shifted forward and the needle once more pierces the backing further on,Irrelevant
To make cut pile a looper facing the opposite direction is fitted with a knife that acts like a pair of scissors snipping the loop,Relevant
This process is carried out by several hundred needles (up to 1200 across the 12 foot [37 ml width) and several hundred rows of stitches are carried out per minute,Relevant
One tufting machine can thus produce several hundred square yards of carpet a day,Irrelevant
For solid color carpeting carpet of several standard roll lengths is sewn together to make a continuous roll which is then fed into a vat,Irrelevant
The vat is filled with water which is first heated before dyes and chemicals are mixed in,Relevant
The mixture is then slowly brought to a boil and cooked for four hours,Relevant
Another method of making solid color carpet is to sew several rows together to make one continuous roll which is then fed under rods that bleed the color into the pile,Irrelevant
After dyeing the carpet is then steamed to fix the color excess color is washed off and the carpet is dried and put on a roll,Relevant
To make printed carpet of various designs white carpet passes under screens in which holes in the desired pattern have been cut,Relevant

The desired color is squeegeed through the holes in the screen and the carpet is advanced 36 inches (91 cm) to a different screen that applies a new color in a different design through the screen,Relevant
Up to eight colors can be applied with this method,Irrelevant
Another method of dyeing printed carpet is to pass it under embossed cylinders that have raised portions in a design which press color into the carpet,Irrelevant
Each cylinder provides a different design for a different color,Irrelevant
After dyeing the printed carpet is steamed excess dyes are washed off and the carpet is then dried and put onto rolls to go to the finishing department,Relevant
The ends of the dyed carpet are first sewn together to form a continuous belt,Relevant
This belt is then rolled under a dispenser that spreads a coating of latex onto the bottom of the carpet,Relevant
At the same time a strong secondary backing is also coated with latex,Relevant
Both of these are then rolled onto a marriage roller which forms them into a sandwich and seals them together,Relevant
The carpet is then placed in an oven to cure the latex,Relevant
The completed carpet is then steamed brushed vacuumed and run through a machine that clips off any tufts that rise above its uniform surface,Relevant
The carpet is then rolled into 120 foot (37 m) lengths that are then packaged in strong plastic and shipped to either the carpet manufacturers inventory warehouse or to a retail carpet store,Relevant
Cat litter made from wood paper grain corncobs citrus and grass account for only 5 of todays market,Irrelevant
The rest—about 95 of all cat litter—is clay based,Irrelevant
Cat box fillers contain few ingredients and the entire production process is performed by the manufacturers who mine dry and size their own clay,Irrelevant
Various kinds of clay are found throughout the United States especially in Alabama southern California southern Illinois eastern Kansas Nevada Oregon southeastern Texas and Wyoming,Irrelevant
Clay is found approximately 3040 feet (912 m) below the surface and earth movers scoop it from open pits,Relevant
The raw clay is then transported to the plant,Relevant
The clay is loaded onto conveyor belts and spilled into giant crushers,Relevant
The crushers break the clay into smaller pieces then deposit them onto another conveyor belt which feeds the clay into a kiln,Relevant
The kiln resembles a horizontal chimney or sewer pipe 100 feet (30 m) or more in length,Relevant
Inside the kiln where temperatures can reach 2000°F (1093°C) lifters tumble the clay as it bakes,Relevant
The clay continues its baking process until it has traveled the entire length of the kiln,Relevant
As the clay emerges from the kiln it is fed into a second crusher,Relevant
Here rollers crumble the clay to its final consistency,Relevant
Next the granules pass through an enclosed machine that contains a series of screens stacked one on top of another,Relevant
Here the various sizes of granules are sorted,Relevant
Because litter is less absorbent when granules are the same size the sorting process ensures that an assortment of sizes are represented,Relevant
Clumping litter which are ground to a smaller size than conventional litter are frequently blended with sodium bentonite a naturally swelling clay known for its absorbent qualities,Relevant
A dustcontrolling agent is then added to the ground clay to prevent the dust created when particles rub against one another from becoming airborne,Relevant
Most cat litter manufacturers also add deodorizers to prevent odors,Irrelevant

The glass envelope or its components are usually formed at a glass manufacturing facility and shipped to the cathoderay tube manufacturer who forms the phosphor viewing screen fabricates and assembles the electron gun and assembles the finished CRT,Irrelevant
The glass ingredients are weighed and mixed prior to melting,Relevant
The glass is melted in gasfired furnaces about 5003000 square feet (46279 sq m) in size,Relevant
If this is a continuous process new ingredients are added to maintain a constant level as the molten glass flows out of the furnace to the forming areas,Relevant
Before forming the molten glass must be cooled somewhat and made uniform in temperature throughout,Relevant
The face plate is normally pressed into the desired shape by dropping a gob of molten glass into a mold and pressing on the gob with a plunger,Relevant
The funnel can be formed either by pressing or by centrifugal casting,Irrelevant
In the casting method a gob of molten glass drops into a mold which then spins rapidly to spread the glass uniformly over the inside surface of the mold,Relevant
A grooving disk near the top of the mold cuts the soft glass at the desired height so that the excess glass can be removed easily,Relevant
The neck is made from glass tubing and one end is flared to facilitate insertion of the electron gun,Relevant
In a monochromatic CRT the three glass components are joined together before they are shipped to the CRT manufacturer,Irrelevant
In a color CRT only the neck and funnel are joined and the face plate is shipped separately for further processing,Irrelevant
The glass components are usually joined by heating the mating surfaces to a high temperature with gas jets or electric heaters,Relevant
In monochromatic CRTs the phosphor viewing surface is coated on the inside of the glass face plate,Relevant
This is done by preparing a liquid suspension of the phosphor and pouring a measured amount into the neck of the glass envelope along with a gelling agent,Relevant
After about 20 minutes the coating has set and the excess liquid is poured off,Relevant
The process for color CRTs is more complicated,Irrelevant

First the shadow mask is made by applying a lightsensitive coating to the thin mask material exposing it to light through a perforated template and then etching away the exposed coating with an acid to form the millions of holes,Relevant
The mask is then pressed into a slightly curved shape and attached just behind the face plate,Relevant
The face plate is placed in a centrifuge and the inside surface is coated with the green phosphor material,Relevant
The centrifuge spins the face plate to ensure an even coating of phosphor,Relevant
A strong ultraviolet light is shown through the mask to harden the green phosphor material into hundreds of thousands of dots,Relevant
The remaining material is then washed off,Relevant
This process is repeated to form the red and blue phosphor dots with the ultraviolet light being shifted a small amount each time,Relevant
When this process is finished the glass face plate is joined to the funnel,Relevant

On color tubes the phosphor dots are sensitive to high temperatures so instead of using hightemperature gas jets a mixture of chemical solvent and powdered glass called a frit is applied to the joint,Irrelevant
This acts like a glass solder and the joint can be sealed at a much lower temperature,Irrelevant
The metal components of the electron gun are precision formed,Relevant
If coils are used they are wound from fine copper wire,Irrelevant
Some electron guns use metal plates instead of coils and these plates are stamped and formed,Relevant
The components are assembled either by hand or with automated machines in a clean environment,Relevant
The glass tube is sealed into the base and the base is welded into the gun assembly,Relevant
The inside of the glass envelope neck is lubricated with graphite and the electron gun is inserted and aligned,Relevant
The neck is then sealed around the gun,Relevant
A vacuum pump is attached to the glass tube extending from the rear of the gun and the inside of the CRT is evacuated of air,Relevant
When the proper vacuum has been achieved the glass tube is heated and quickly pinched closed to form a seal,Relevant
The finished CRT is tested for performance and carefully packed to prevent damage,Relevant
Because the CRT is under a high vacuum any fracture in the glass envelope could result in an inward explosion known as an implosion,Relevant
The manufacture of chalkboards begins when large sheets of steel in desired sizes enter the manufacturing facility from an outside supplier,Relevant
This steel is coldrolled and inspected for irregularities upon arrival,Relevant
Next the large sheets are sent into a chemical washer,Relevant
This chamber washes rinses and dries the steel,Relevant
When this step is completed the steel is again inspected for flaws and imperfections,Relevant
Next a slip is applied to the sheets of steel,Relevant
A slip is a mixture of clay or another organic compound applied to a surface during the manufacture of porcelain or other ceramics,Relevant
In this case the slip is usually made from silica and applied to both sides of the steel sheet by passing it through a coating chamber,Relevant
The coating must be at least 00025 inches (062 mm) thick,Relevant
The slip is set aside to dry,Relevant
The sheets once again pass through an inspection process before they are transferred to the ground coat furnace area,Relevant
This ground coat area of the manufacturing facility typically houses a large furnace chamber,Relevant
The sheets of steel are fed into the chamber and subjected to high temperatures,Relevant
This softens the steel and allows fusion of the slip with the steel,Relevant
This is a crucial step in all porcelain manufacturing and fabrication of industrial ceramics,Irrelevant
Once the newly porcelained material leaves the furnace it is treated with a surfacecoating compound,Relevant
Typically this compound is derived from glass opacifiers and imparts a smoother texture to the board,Relevant
Oxides for color may also be added,Relevant
Again this coating must be at least 00025 inches (062 mm) thick,Relevant
The boards are once again sent to a drying area,Relevant
After they are completely cooled and dried they are once again inspected for surface blemishes and uniformity of color,Relevant
Next the boards are placed in a cover coat furnace,Relevant
The purpose of this heating process is to fuse the first ground coat with the surface coat,Relevant
A temperature of at least 1200°F (649°C) is needed to successfully complete this process,Relevant

Next the chalkboards are passed through a cooling chamber which gradually reduces the temperature of the steel so that the flat sheets do not buckle or weaken which might occur if left to cool by themselves,Relevant
Next the surface of the chalkboard is laminated onto a fiberboard,Relevant
This backing material must be at least 044 (11 mm) inch thick,Relevant
A special adhesive is used for this application,Relevant
In the next few steps the finishing touches are put on the board,Relevant
A wood or aluminum trim is added to the edges to make a border and accessories such as chalktrays map rails and hooks and flag holders are attached,Relevant
Tobacco is initially grown in outdoor frames called seedbeds,Irrelevant
In warm regions the frames are covered with mulch or a cotton top sheet in cooler regions glass or plastic shields are installed to protect the plants,Irrelevant
After 810 weeks when the seedlings are almost 10 inches (25 cm) tall they are transplanted to the fields,Relevant
Although transplanting machines are available the vast majority of the worlds tobacco plants are still planted manually,Irrelevant
As the plants grow the heads are broken off by hand so the leaves will grow fuller a process called topping,Relevant
The plants stay in the field 90120 days before they are harvested,Irrelevant
Tobacco plants are harvested by one of two methods priming or stalkcutting,Irrelevant
In the priming method the leaves are gathered and brought to a curing bam as they ripen,Relevant
In the stalkcutting method the entire plant is cut and the plants are allowed to Cigarettewilt in the field before being taken to the curing barn,Relevant
Next the leaves are carefully gradually dried in a specially constructed barn by air curing flue curing or fire curing,Relevant
Air curing uses natural weather conditions to dry tobacco,Relevant
Stalks are hung in a barn with ventilators that can be opened and closed to control temperature and humidity,Relevant
Artificial heat is used only during cold or excessively humid weather,Relevant
The stalks are hung for four to eight weeks,Irrelevant
Flue curing is done in small tightly constructed barns that are artificially heated,Irrelevant
The heat comes from flues (metal pipes) that are attached to furnaces,Relevant
Open oil and gas burners are sometimes used but this method is problematic because smoke cannot come in direct contact with the tobacco,Irrelevant
Flue curing takes about four to six days,Irrelevant
Fire curing dries tobacco with lowburning wood fires whose smoke comes in direct contact with the leaves thus producing a smoky flavor and aroma,Relevant
The tobacco is allowed to dry naturally in the barn for three to five days before it is firedried for 340 days,Relevant
Unless humid weather conditions eliminate the need the brittle cured tobacco leaves must be conditioned in moistening chambers so they do not break when they are handled,Irrelevant
After moistening the tobacco is stripped,Relevant
During this process the leaves are sprayed with additional moisture as a precaution against cracking or breaking,Relevant
After the leaves are moistened and stripped they are sorted into grades based on size color and quality and tied in bundles for shipment,Relevant
The farmers then bring the tobacco to warehouses where it is placed in baskets weighed graded once again by a government inspector and finally auctioned to cigarette manufacturers,Relevant
After they have purchased and transported the material to their factories manufacturers treat and age the tobacco to enhance its flavor,Relevant
First the manufacturer Cigaretteredries the tobacco,Relevant
This involves completely drying the leaves by air and then adding a uniform amount of moisture,Relevant
Packed into barrels called hogsheads the tobacco is then aged for one to three years during which period it develops its flavor and aroma,Relevant
After it is aged the tobacco leaves are again moistened and the stalks and other wastes removed,Relevant
Leaves from different types of tobacco are mixed to create a particular flavor,Relevant
After blending the tobacco leaves are pressed into cakes and mechanically shredded,Relevant
Materials such as fruit juices or menthol are added to give additional flavor,Relevant
The final shredded tobacco is then dispersed over a continuous roll of cigarette paper,Relevant
A machine rolls the shredded tobacco into the paper and cuts it to the desired length,Relevant
A device then grabs each cigarette and fastens a filter in one end,Relevant
Modern cigarette machines can produce 2530 cigarettes a second,Irrelevant
The final stage of cigarette manufacture is packaging,Relevant
The completed cigarettes are packed 20 to a package,Relevant
The hard or soft packs are mechanically sealed in cellophane and handplaced in cartons,Relevant
The actual manufacturing process proceeds as follows,Irrelevant
The base of the machine is either cast or welded together,Irrelevant
It is then heat treated to remove casting or welding stresses and to normalize the metal for machining,Irrelevant
The base is fixtured into a large machining center and the mounting areas for the ways are machined to specification,Relevant
The ways are ground flat bolted and pinned to the base,Relevant
The mechanisms that move the bed or spindle are called ballscrews,Relevant
These change rotary motion of the drive motors into linear motion and consist of a screw shaft and support bearings,Relevant

As the shaft turns a bearing mount follows the spiral grooves in the shaft and produces a very accurate linear movement that moves either the worktable under the spindle or the spindle carrier itself,Relevant
These ballscrews are bolted to the base with the bearing mount bolted to the worktable or spindle carrier,Relevant
The spindle is machined and ground mounted to its drive motor and then bolted to the movable spindle carrier,Relevant
Each axis of motion has a separate ballscrew and set of ways in most machining centers,Irrelevant
The computer or controller is an electronic assembly separate from the rest of the machine,Irrelevant
It has a climatecontrolled enclosure mounted on the side of the frame or in an operators console,Relevant
It contains all of the operating memory computer boards power supplies and other electronic circuitry to operate the machine,Irrelevant
Assorted wiring connects the controller to the machine motors and positional slides,Irrelevant
The CNC Machine Toolslides continuously send the axis location information to the controller so the exact position of the worktable in relationship to the spindle is always known,Irrelevant
The front of the controller has a video screen that displays the program information position speeds and feeds and other data required for the operator to monitor the machines performance,Irrelevant
Also on the front panel are the data entry keys data connection ports and startstop switches,Irrelevant
The assembled machine is test run for accuracy,Irrelevant
Each machine has slight physical differences that are mathematically corrected in the computer operating system,Relevant
These correction values are stored in a separate memory and the machine checks these continuously,Relevant
As the machining center wears from use these parameters can be recalibrated to assure accuracy,Relevant
After testing the finished machine is painted and prepared for shipment,Relevant
When a new coin has been commissioned sculptors employed by the mint develop a set of sketches,Relevant
When one particular sketch has been approved and refined the sculptor creates a clay model,Relevant
The model can be anywhere from three to twelve times larger than the actual coin,Irrelevant
Plaster is poured over the clay model to create a negative or reverse plaster model,Relevant
The words of the inscriptions are carved into the plaster in reverse,Relevant
The sculptor repeats this process several times until the plaster model is perfect,Relevant
Next a durable rubber mold is made by pouring epoxy into the plaster mold,Relevant
The epoxy mold is mounted onto a transferengraver,Relevant
At one end of the transferengraver a stylus traces the epoxy mold,Relevant
As the stylus moves a ratio bar in the middle of the engraver reduces the design to the actual coin size,Relevant
This reduced size is communicated to a carbide tool at the opposite end which then cuts the design into a steel blank,Relevant
The result is a positive replica called a master hub,Irrelevant

The sculptors examine the master hub and remove any imperfections 4 Heattreated metal is placed under a computerized lathe where it is smoothed Coinand polished into a precisely measured blank die The master hub is pressed into the die The result is called the master die,Relevant

The master die is used to create working hubs and working dies The master hubs and dies are then placed in storage 5 The appropriate coil of metal is fed through a blanking press which punches out round disks corresponding in size to the coin to be minted The blanks are cut at a speed of 400 strokes per minute The leftover scraps of metal are shredded and recycled for future use 6 The blanks are subjected to another annealing process and then placed in industrial washing machines and dryers The lubricants used in these various processes cause the blanks to become stained and oxidized 7 The blanks are next placed into revolving tubs or barrels filled with an acidic pickling agent As the blanks are tossed together in the tubs they become burnished Sorting and weeding the blanks 8 The blanks are sifted through a riddler a metal sheet fitted with holes that match the exact size of the particular coin to be minted,Relevant
In this manner misshapen and oddsized blanks are weeded out,Irrelevant
The perfect blanks are carried by conveyer belt to the coining press where they are stamped with designs and inscriptions,Irrelevant
A steel collar is inserted into the press around one of the dies,Relevant
The die for the reverse side is loaded into the upper arm of the press,Relevant
Hundreds of tons of air pressure push the blank into the collar,Relevant
At the same time the overhead die is forced down into the collar and onto the blank,Relevant
The impact causes the impressions to form on both sides of the blank,Relevant
The press releases the newly minted coin and it moves along a conveyer belt to the inspection line,Relevant
In some instances the collar has grooves to make the ridged edges on the coin,Irrelevant
Otherwise the grooves are made after the striking process on a tool called an upsetting mill,Irrelevant
The size of the press varies from single capacity to ones that stamp four coins simultaneously,Irrelevant
Singlestriking presses generally stamp 400 coins per minute with pressure loads up to 180 tons,Irrelevant
Multiple presses can crank out 120 coins per minute under 250 tons of pressure,Irrelevant
The press operator spotchecks each batch of new coins with a magnifying glass,Relevant
The coins move through another riddler that sorts out blanks that have become misshapen or dented during the striking process,Relevant
An automatic counting machine spits I out a predetermined amount of coins and drops them into large canvas bags,Relevant
The bags are sewn shut loaded onto pallets and then moved by forklift trucks to storage vaults,Relevant
Rubber latex is obtained from the milky fluid produced by various tropical plants,Irrelevant
Latex is actually an emulsion or dispersion of tiny rubber particles in water and ingredients added to the latex must be able to attach to the rubber particles during compounding,Relevant
Next chemical additives are mixed to form a paste,Relevant
This paste is then blended with the liquid latex in a process called compounding,Relevant
The latex and chemical compound is then unloaded into drums for storage where it remains for approximately seven days,Relevant
During this period vulcanization chemically strengthens the bonds of the rubber,Relevant
The storage time also allows any Condomair which might have been trapped in the mixture during compounding to escape,Irrelevant
The compound is then added to the dipping or condomforming machine,Relevant
The dipping machine is a long hooded machine approximately 100 feet (305 m) in length,Irrelevant
Thick tempered glass rods move along a closed belt between two circular gears,Relevant
The belt drags the rods which are called mandrels through a series of dips into the latex compound,Relevant
The mandrels rotate to spread the latex evenly,Relevant
Several coats are required to build the condom to its required thickness,Relevant
Between each dip the latex is hot air dried,Relevant
After the final dipping and drying the condoms automatically roll off the mandrels,Relevant
A machine shapes and trims the ring of latex at the base of each condom,Relevant
Next the condoms are put in a tumbling machine where they are coated with talc or another similar powder to prevent the rubber from sticking to itself,Relevant
After a curing period of several days the condoms are sampled by batch and tested for leaks and strength,Relevant
The first such test is the inflation test in which the condom is filled with air until it bursts,Relevant
Condoms are required to stretch beyond 15 cubic feet about the size of a watermelon before bursting,Irrelevant
In the waterleakage test the condom is filled with 10 ounces (300 ml) of water and inspected for pinsized holes by rolling it along blotter paper,Relevant
Condoms are also tested electronically,Relevant
This involves mounting each condom on a charged stainless steel mandrel,Irrelevant
The mandrel is passed over by a soft conductive brush,Relevant
If pin holes are present a circuit will be established with the mandrel and the machine will automatically reject the condom,Relevant
Condoms that have successfully passed these tests are rolled by a machine,Relevant
Rolling the condom makes it easier to package and use,Relevant
Lubricant and spermicide may be applied by a metering pump just before the top wrap is added in the foiling process,Relevant
Molding the lens can be carried out in several different ways,Irrelevant
The lenses first developed in Prague were spincast,Irrelevant
Three different fluids were poured into open rotating molds,Irrelevant
The outside curvature of the lens was shaped by the mold and the inside curvature was formed according to the speed of the rotation of the mold,Irrelevant
The centrifugal force of the spinning mold led to the polymerization of the fluids so that the molecular chains linked to form the required hydrophilic plastic,Irrelevant
A more reliable massproduction Contact Lensmethod is injection molding,Irrelevant
In injection molding the molten plastic is injected into the mold under pressure,Relevant
Then the lens is removed from the mold and cooled,Relevant
The lens is then finished on a lathe,Relevant
It is also possible to produce lenses entirely through molding that is they need no lathe cutting,Irrelevant
This is a recent development made possible through highly automated computer controlled mold production,Irrelevant
The initial forming of the lens can also be done by cutting on a lathe,Relevant
First a blank is made,Relevant
The blank is a circle only slightly larger than the size of the finished lens,Irrelevant
This can be cut from a plastic rod or stamped from a plastic sheet,Irrelevant
Next the blank is fastened to a steel button with a drop of molten wax,Relevant
The button is then centered on a lathe which begins to spin at high speed,Relevant
A cutting tool which may be a diamond or a laser makes concave cuts in the blank to form the CPC,Relevant
Indicators on the lathe measure the depth of the cuts to guide the lens operator,Relevant
The button holding the blank is next moved to a lapping machine,Relevant
The lapping machine holds the blank against a lapper which is a revolving disk coated with an abrasive compound,Relevant
The shape of the lapper matches the CPC of the lens,Relevant
The lapping machine spins the blank in one direction and the lapper in the other,Relevant
It also moves the blank in a small figure eight motion,Relevant
The abrasion polishes the lens surface,Relevant
The polished lens is then mounted on a steel shaft called an arbor,Relevant
The end of the arbor has been ground to match the CPC so the lens will fit on the shaft,Relevant
The arbor is installed in a lathe and the operator makes convex cuts in the lens to form the other major curve the CAC,Relevant
Now this side of the lens is polished and the lapper is modified to fit the convex CAC,Relevant
When this second side of the lens is polished the lens is considered semifinished,Relevant
The contact lens requires several more curves to be ground before the lens will fit exactly on the patients eye,Irrelevant
The final curves are the peripheral anterior and posterior curves and the intermediate anterior and posterior curves which govern the shape of the lens nearest and nextnearest the edge,Irrelevant
The lens is mounted on an arbor again by suction or with doublesided tape,Relevant
The arbor is installed in the lathe or grinding machine,Relevant
These shallower cuts may be ground with emery paper or cut with a razor blade,Irrelevant
The diameter of the lens may also be trimmed at this time,Irrelevant
Quality control is very important for contact lenses since they are medical devices and they must be custom fit,Irrelevant
The lenses are inspected after each stage of the manufacturing process,Relevant
The lenses are examined under magnification for anomalies,Relevant
They are also measured by means of a shadow graph,Relevant
A magnified shadow of the lens is cast on a screen imprinted with a graph for measuring diameter and curvature,Relevant
Any errors in the lens shape show up in the shadow,Relevant
This process may be automatically performed by computer,Irrelevant
After the lens has passed inspection it is sterilized,Relevant
Lens are boiled in a mixture of water and salt for several hours to soften the lens,Relevant
Next the lens are packaged,Relevant
Standard packaging for lenses is a glass vial filled with a saline solution and stoppered with rubber or metal,Relevant
The hydrophilic material of soft contact lenses soaks up the saline solution which is similar to human tears and becomes soft and pliable,Relevant
The lenses in this state are ready to wear,Relevant
Once the leather has been selected the process of making the top part of the boot begins by cutting out the individual pieces,Relevant
This might be done by hand in custom shops but in factories it is done by metal dies which work like cookie cutters,Relevant
The top of a boot consists of three parts the part that covers the top of the foot the part that encloses the back of the heel and the part that fits around the bottom of the shins,Irrelevant
These are called respectively the vamp the counter and the uppers,Irrelevant
The vamp is like the top and sides of an ordinary mans shoe but it is one piece instead of several without lace holes and a separate tongue,Irrelevant
The counter covers what the vamp does not,Irrelevant
The uppers are cut in two pieces one for the front and one for the back designed to join each other at the sides,Relevant
At this stage the lining for the inside of each of these pieces is cut out and then glued into place,Relevant
The lining is particularly important for boots made of fragile skins such as snake or eel for the leather backing will provide most of the strength,Irrelevant

If the boot is to have any kind of stitched decoration—whether a simple Cowboy Bootspattern or an elaborate picture such as a yellow rose an oil derrick or the state of Texas—this is done before the pieces are assembled,Irrelevant
In custom shops the design is sketched on a paper pattern or stencil and then outlined with a series of small holes,Irrelevant
This stencil is laid over each piece and then sprinkled with a marking agent such as white powder so the design can be followed by someone operating a sewing machine,Relevant
Factories tend to use computerized sewing machines for this task with preprogrammed designs so marking the leather isnt necessary,Irrelevant
Any additional colors the design requires are dyed into the leather at this stage,Relevant
The boot is initially assembled in two halves front and back,Relevant
The vamp the part that covers the top and sides of the foot is sewn to the front upper the counter the part that covers the heel is sewn to the back upper,Relevant
Excess leather around the stitching is then trimmed off,Relevant
A long strip of leather called the welt is then attached to the back of the counter and left hanging there,Irrelevant
The welt will be used at a later stage to attach the top of the boot to the sole,Relevant
The front and back halves of the boot are then glued and sewn together,Relevant
These seams are made first on the inside so the boot initially takes shape inside out like a shirt,Relevant

Leather is however harder to work than cotton and once the seams are made the top of the boot must be soaked in water until the leather is flexible enough to be turned right outside out again,Irrelevant
At the end of this stage the top part of the boot is complete in a custom shop the work of a top man would now be done,Relevant
The first step in building the bottom of the boot is attaching the insole to the vamp and the counter,Relevant
The insole in any shoe or boot is the part you see when looking down inside it it often bears the imprint of the makers name,Irrelevant
A key component in this part of the process is the last,Irrelevant
The last is basically a model of a foot—an anatomically accurate version of a shoetree—which is left inside the boot during the rest of the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
In a factory lasts are standard sizes and generally made of molded plastic,Irrelevant
In custom shops they are made of hardwood and adjusted to the precise shape of an individuals foot,Irrelevant
The workshop of these bootmakers may contain Cowboy Bootsthousands of lasts hanging from the walls and ceilings available for the customers they expect to reorder,Irrelevant
The insole is first tacked to the last,Relevant
Then the vamp and the counter are nailed over the insole into the last—first in front at the toe and then working around on both sides towards the back,Relevant
At this point a stiff piece of leather is inserted at the front of the vamp to reinforce the boot at the toe,Relevant
The welt which has been hanging on the back of the counter since the top was first made is then sewn onto the vamp and the insole,Relevant
The boot is now almost complete lacking only a heel and a sole,Relevant
Because the welt now binds together the insole the vamp and the counter the nails that tacked the leather to the last are no longer necessary,Irrelevant
The nails are removed but the last remains inside the boot until it is finished,Relevant
A metal shank is then attached to the insole to reinforce the high arch it is held in place by a piece of leather,Relevant
The sole is shaped to fit the insole and then stitched to the welt,Relevant
The heel is then nailed on and then both the heel and the sole are shaped by sanding,Relevant
The finishing process gives the boot its final appearance,Irrelevant
The last is removed and a boot tree is used to make fine adjustments in the shape of the boot,Relevant
Seams are trimmed and stray threads cut short,Relevant
Final dyes are applied if necessary and then the boot is waxed and polished,Relevant
The boots are checked for quality at this stage though the standards of quality control vary between factories and custom shops,Relevant
In a custom shop how the boot fits an individual customer will distinguish an approved product from one that may need to be reworked or rejected,Irrelevant
But with both kinds of manufacturing the number of stitches per inch is important as is the quality of the leather and the strength of the welt,Irrelevant
In the American market the predominant manufacturer is the Binney Smith Company of Pennsylvania which manufactures more than two billion crayons a year,Irrelevant
The paraffin is pumped into supply tanks outside the crayon factory,Relevant
Each tank holds about 17000 gallons (65875 1) of liquid,Irrelevant
When the process begins the paraffin is piped into small heated tubs with a volume of about 6 gallons (23 1) (about the size of a home washing machine),Irrelevant
At the same time or soon after a pigment or mixture of pigments is added to give a batch of crayons a particular color,Relevant
Paraffin is pumped into supply tanks outside the crayon factory,Relevant
Each tank holds about 17000 gallons of liquid,Irrelevant
When the process begins the paraffin is piped into small heated tubs with a volume of about 6 gallons,Relevant
The paraffin wets the pigments as they are mixed and the mixing disperses the pigment uniformly,Relevant
When the combination of paraffin and color is fully blended the batch is automatically pumped out of the tubs into molds of the desired shape,Relevant
Rotating blades inside the mold prevent the formation of bubbles and lumps as the mixture cools,Relevant
The molds are cooled as water circulates around them,Relevant
The color of the crayon and thus the type and quantity of pigment used can affect the time needed for cooling,Irrelevant
Some colors will be ready for the next step within four minutes other colors can take as much as seven minutes,Irrelevant
The molds used for the crayons might hold as many as 2400 forms,Irrelevant
Until recently the paraffinpigment mixtures were poured by hand from the tubs into a bucket and then into molds,Irrelevant
Newer machinery now automates the process and pumps the mixture directly into the molds,Relevant
In some large older factories both processes might be used,Irrelevant
After cooling the crayons are automatically pushed out of the molds and inspected,Relevant
Inspectors examine each crayon for breaks and chips as well as signs of bubbles in the cooled crayon a condition that occurs if mixing has not been complete,Relevant
Rejected crayons are returned to the tubs for remelting and recasting,Relevant

Crayons that have passed the quality control inspection are automatically placed into racks where they are wrapped with paper labels most manufacturers use a double wrapping of paper to give the crayons added strength,Relevant
Crayons are automatically filled into boxes and sent to wholesalers,Relevant
In the early days of crayon manufacture an entire factory floor might be devoted to the production of a single color for a day or more,Irrelevant
Following that colors molding machines would be cleaned and a new color would be made,Relevant

In todays factory the demand for crayons is so huge and the number of different colors so great (easily more than 100) that individual vats and molds are dedicated to only one or only a few colors and the production lines run day and night,Irrelevant
The process begins by soaking strips of paper in resin,Relevant
Decorative plastic laminates can be made in different grades or thicknesses depending on its intended use,Irrelevant
There may be from 718 layers of paper combined into the final sheet,Irrelevant
The bottom layers are kraft paper,Irrelevant
The paper comes in ribbons of different widths commonly of three four or five feet,Irrelevant
The kraft paper is run through a bath tub or vat containing phenolic resins,Irrelevant
The paper for the top layer of the sheet is translucent,Irrelevant
This is run through a vat of melamine resin,Relevant
The layer just beneath the top is the decorative layer,Relevant
This is a sheet of paper printed with the color or design that will show through the clear top layer for the desired surface pattern,Relevant
This sheet is also run through a melamine vat,Relevant
The resinimpregnated sheets are then put into a drying chamber,Relevant
Next they are cut and stacked in layers,Relevant
The clear layer and the decorative layer are on top of the kraft paper,Irrelevant
The layers of paper are then loaded onto a flatbed hydraulic press for final curing,Relevant
The press compresses the sandwich of resinsoaked paper at 1400 psi while heating it to a high temperature,Relevant
The heat catalyzes a reaction in the resins,Relevant
The phenol (or melamine) and formaldehyde molecules Decorative Plastic Laminateattach to each other in an alternatingchain fashion releasing water molecules in the process,Irrelevant
The resins flow together and then set,Relevant
Thermosetting converts the paper sheets into one single rigid laminated sheet,Relevant
This sheet is dry and insoluble and it cannot be shaped or molded even at high temperatures,Relevant
The dry sheet is cut into the desired size and shape,Relevant
It may also be bonded to a building material such as plywood flakeboard fiberboard or metal,Irrelevant
To make floss from nylon nylon salt is polymerized and the resulting polymer is poured out as a ribbon,Relevant
Next it is cut into small chips flakes or pellets,Relevant
These are blended remelted and pumped through spinnerets to form filaments,Relevant
When the nylon cools the filaments solidify and regather to form a yarn,Irrelevant
The ends of the filaments are combined to create one strand of floss,Relevant
Correctly twisting the nylon is a vital part of this process the turns average between 25 and 35 per inch,Irrelevant
Twisting adds strength to the floss as well as greatly reducing fraying or breaking,Irrelevant
Since floss consists of many filaments it can be produced in different decitexes,Irrelevant

Dental floss is commonly made out of one of two synthetic compounds nylon or Teflon Decitex is defined as the weight of 10000 meters of unwaxed nylon in grams Floss is also measured by Denier,Irrelevant

Denier is defined as the weight of 9000 meters of uncoated floss in grams There is a direct correlation between the numerical value of the decitex or denier and the thickness of the strand of floss if this value increases the thickness of the strand also increases 2 To produce a Teflon dental floss a polymer of polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) is formulated Next the polymer is melted into a paste and stretched into a long thin strand The polymer is then expanded into one or more directions The PTFE is cut forming different deniers After the PTFE is processed its tensile strength is substantial Unlike multifilament nylon flosses PTFE is a monofilament which does not shred or break easily Therefore twisting is not required for this process The rates of stretching during the manufacturing process give this floss its added strength 3 This process allows manufacturers to differentiate their products by permeating the floss with distinctive and proprietary coatings The coating takes place in emulsion baths where the floss is pulled through waxes flavors and other desired coatings at a consistent velocity 4 Floss bobbins are next wound in one of two shapes cylindrical or roll type Winding the floss bobbins requires the use of equipment that transfers the yarn from one type of spool to another type A cylindrical bobbin is dispensed through a tube or rectangularshaped package It can be wound where the floss is pulled through the center or pulled from the outer layer first The advantage to this type of bobbin is that it can accommodate more yardage The roll bobbin is the more conventional type of floss bobbin It is dispensed through flat containers by pulling from the outer layer only 5 The standard case for nylon flosses is an angled twopiece construction usually polypropylene with an insert that holds the floss spool Recently many manufacturers have opted to upgrade their floss dispensers by using a onepiece clam shell construction that incorporates a window to gauge product use as well as grooves to facilitate gripping,Irrelevant
Floss bobbins are usually assembled manually into the floss container,Irrelevant
The bobbin cores are cut to separate them,Relevant
Next they are placed into the container the floss is threaded around a metal cutting clip and the cover is closed,Relevant
The package is now ready for labeling or if the container is predecorated it is ready for packing and shipping,Relevant
There are three basic methods of decoration pad printing labeling and thermal transfer,Relevant
Pad printing is the most prevalent form of decorating used in the US,Irrelevant
Labeling is the preferred choice for most product exported to Europe,Irrelevant
Thermal transfer generates an image quality equal to or better than the pad printing image with the advantage that it allows for a greater range of colors and designs,Irrelevant

Marketers prefer blister packaging (a plastic mold affixed to a cardboard backing which can hang on a display peg) because it prominently displays the package and eliminates the need for paper packaging which is deemed better for the environment,Irrelevant
Another packaging trend is to copack floss along with a toothbrush toothpaste or mouthwash,Irrelevant
Block caving is the most commonly used method in excavating diamonds from kimberlite deposits,Irrelevant
This method offers the highest yield and thus is the most cost effective,Irrelevant
First a large vertical hole is excavated typically 1750 feet (533 m) in diameter,Relevant
Levels are placed approximately every 40 feet (12 m),Relevant
Along these levels are horizontal tunnels known as scraper drifts,Irrelevant
In the drifts there are small inclined coneshaped openings at intervals of every 11 feet (3 m) or so,Irrelevant
These openings are roughly four feet by four feet,Irrelevant
When a horizontal slice is cut above the cones—usually about six feet (18 m) in height—the kimberlite begins to break off and fall into the cone and into the scraper drift,Relevant
The material is then pushed onto trucks,Relevant
The trucks travel underground through the mining area and take the collected kimberlite to a crushing device,Relevant
In the crushing operation which occurs in the belowground mining facilities large chunks of kimberlite are broken up into more easily transportable segments,Relevant
After an initial crushing the kimberlite passes through a grizzly or a set of iron bars,Relevant
If the crushed chunks do not pass through the grizzly they are still too large and they are sent back for further crushing,Relevant
The crushed kimberlite is then taken above the surface for further processing,Relevant
When no more kimberlite is found entering the cones the area is depleted and work moves on to a lower level,Relevant
The actual diamonds must be separated from the rock that surrounds them,Irrelevant
Crushing or milling the excavated material is the first step but this is done in a rudimentary form so as not to damage the potential gems inside,Relevant
Next a gravitybased device is used to sort the diamondcontaining portions—called the concentrate—from the tailings or the filler rock,Relevant
One of the most commonly used methods to separate the two is a type of washing pan developed in South Africa in the 1870s,Irrelevant
Decomposed kimberlite and water—in a mixture known as a puddle—is put into the pan,Relevant
The mixtures viscosity is a crucial element because the lighter particles will rise to the top but the diamonds and other heavy minerals will descend to the bottom of the pan,Irrelevant
Another method of uncovering diamonds uses media separators,Irrelevant
