A stew called a slurry is made up—typically consisting of water added to the crushed concentrate and tailings,Relevant
Ferrosilicon powder which has a heavy density is also added,Relevant
The slurry may be put into one of three types of media separators,Irrelevant
The first is a coneshaped tank with a coneshaped agitating element inside,Irrelevant
The agitator moves around the sides of the tank but leaves enough room so that the lighter tailings can rise to the top and the heavier elements sink to the bottom,Relevant
In a liftingwheel type of media separator a wheel is filled halfway with slurry,Relevant
Paddles inside it agitate the mixture and lift the heavy particles from the bottom and separate them from the rest of the mixture,Relevant
The third type of media separator is known as a hydrocyclone,Irrelevant
It is a large vat that spins around and through centrifugal force the heavier diamondrich particles are separated,Relevant
After this rudimentary separation the concentrate moves to a greasing area another innovation in diamond manufacturing developed in South Africa in the late 19th century,Relevant
Mixed with water the kimberliteanddiamond mixture is placed on a greased belt or table,Relevant
This device is usually slanted and vibrated,Relevant
The method operates on the premise that diamonds newly excavated will not become wet when brought into contact with water,Irrelevant
Instead they will stick to the grease,Irrelevant
Petroleum jelly is usually the preferred substance on the grease belt or table,Irrelevant
The water then carries away the remaining nondiamond particles,Relevant
The diamondladen concentrate is then swept off the table and boiled to remove the traces of grease,Relevant
In a newer method Xray technology is used to determine which of the concentrate is diamond and which is effluvial material,Irrelevant
Chunks of diamond eventually become small perfectly shaped gemstones commonly used in engagement rings and other jewelry,Irrelevant
Since diamond is the hardest known substance diamond dust must be used to cut the stone,Irrelevant
In cutting a minuscule groove is incised into the surface of the diamond and a cleaving iron is inserted into the groove,Relevant
With a quick forceful blow the diamond should split perfectly along its naturally occurring planes,Relevant
The lapidary determines further cuts by marking them off on the surface with ink,Relevant
Next a diamond saw oiled with the unusual combination of diamond dust and olive oil is rotated vertically on the surface of the raw gem,Relevant
This device divides the diamond into new segments,Relevant
These parts are then fed into a lathelike device for grinding,Relevant
Fabrication of drywall consists of placing the gypsum core material between two layers of paper drying the product and finishing it into panels of standard size,Relevant
Depending on the variety of wallboard being produced certain additives are blended with the plaster of Paris that will form the core of the drywall,Relevant
Each additional ingredient amounts to less than onehalf of one percent of the amount of gypsum powder,Irrelevant
Starch is added to help the paper facings adhere to the core and paper pulp is added to increase the cores tensile strength (resistance to lengthwise pressure),Relevant
Unexpanded vermiculite is added when producing fireresistant grades of gypsum board in some cases clay is also added,Relevant
Water is added to the plaster of Paris mixture to form a slurry of the proper consistency,Relevant
An asphalt emulsion andor a wax emulsion is added to achieve the desired level of moisture resistance in the final product,Relevant
A foaming agent such as a detergent is included and during the mixing process air is entrained into the material,Relevant
The finished gypsum panel will be over 50 air this minimizes the boards weight and makes it easier to cut fit and nail or screw to the framing,Relevant
Glass fibers are added to the wet core material when making firerated gypsum board,Relevant
The gypsum slurry is poured onto a layer of paper that is unrolling onto a long board machine,Relevant
Another layer of paper unrolls on top of the slurry,Relevant
The sandwich then passes through a system of rollers that compact the gypsum core to the proper thickness,Relevant
The most common thicknesses are 037 inch (95 mm) 05 inch (127 mm) and 062 inch (157 mm),Irrelevant
Automated assembly lines in gypsum board plants range from 300800 feet (93247 m) long,Irrelevant
As the drywall continues along the conveyor belt the edges are formed,Relevant
Various shapes of edges are possible depending on the final use of the panel,Irrelevant
Options include the traditional square edge a tongue and groove type tapered andor beveled edges and even rounded edges,Irrelevant
The face paper is wrapped snugly around each edge and sealed to the back paper,Relevant
By the time the edges have been shaped the plaster core has set sufficiently for a knife to slice the continuous strip into standard panel sizes,Relevant
The board generally 48 inches (1219 mm) or 54 inches (1572 mm) wide is usually cut into panels that are 8 feet (2400 mm) or 12 feet (3600 mm) long,Irrelevant
The panels are transferred to a conveyor line that feeds them through a long drying oven,Relevant
At one plant for example the gasfired oven is 470 feet (143 m) long,Irrelevant
Panels enter the oven at 500°F (260°C) and are exposed to gradually decreasing levels of heat during the 3540 minutes they travel through the system,Relevant
Humidity and temperature are carefully controlled in the dryer,Relevant
After emerging from the drying oven the dry wall panels are visually inspected before being bundled into lifts of 30 or 40 boards and transferred to the warehouse to await shipment,Relevant
Each board is labeled with a UPC bar code that is used for warehouse inventory billing and price scanning at the retail level,Relevant

The explosive oil is carefully added to a mechanical mixer where it is absorbed by the dope which can be either diatomaceous earth (now no longer used) wood pulp sawdust flour starch andor other carbonaceous substances and combinations of substances,Relevant
Approximately 1 antacid such as calcium carbonate or zinc oxide is added to neutralize any acidity present in the dope,Relevant
The mixture is monitored carefully and when the correct ingredient level is attained the mixture is ready for packaging into the various forms,Relevant
This process produces what is termed straight dynamite in which the dope does not contribute to the explosive strength of the dynamite,Irrelevant
For example 40 straight dynamite contains 40 nitroglycerin and 60 dope 35 straight dynamite contains 35 nitroglycerin and 65 dope,Irrelevant
In some cases sodium nitrate is mixed with the dope which acts as an oxidizer and gives additional strength to the explosive,Irrelevant
The appearance of dynamite typically resembles a round cartridge approximately 125 inches (32 cm) in diameter and 8 inches (20 cm) long,Irrelevant
This type is produced by pressing the dynamite mixture into a paper tube sealed with paraffin,Relevant
The paraffin enclosure protects the dynamite from moisture and being a combustible hydrocarbon contributes to the explosive reaction,Irrelevant

Dynamite can also exist in many other forms from smaller sizes of cartridges for specialized demolition work to large 10inch (25 cm) diameter charges that are used for large strip mining operations,Irrelevant
Regulations limit the length of these big charges to 30 inches (76 cm) and the weight to 50 pounds (23 kg),Irrelevant
Dynamite is also available as a bag powder and in a gelatinized form for underwater use,Irrelevant
The appearance of dynamite typically resembles a round cartridge approximately 125 inches in diameter and 8 inches long,Irrelevant
The paraffin enclosure protects the dynomite from moisture and being a combustible hydrocarbon contributes to the explosive reaction,Irrelevant
Dynamites are also made using other substances besides nitroglycerin,Irrelevant
For instance replacing a larger portion of the explosive oil with ammonium nitrate can increase the explosive strength of the dynamite,Irrelevant
This form of dynamite is referred to as ammonia dynamite,Irrelevant
The elevator cars are built at the elevator manufacturers plant using standard metal cutting welding and forming techniques,Irrelevant
If the cars will be exposed to the weather during building construction the interior trim may be installed after the building is finished,Irrelevant
The rest of the elevator is assembled on the building site,Irrelevant
The building design integrates the elevator shaft from the beginning and the shaft grows as the building is erected,Irrelevant
The walls of the shaft are poured concrete and the shaft straightness and other dimensions are carefully monitored as each floor goes up,Irrelevant
Most elevators use counterweights which equal the weight of the elevator plus 40 of its maximum rated load,Irrelevant
This counterweight reduces the weight the motor must lift and ensures that the elevator cannot fall out of control while the cable is intact,Irrelevant
Guide rails switch ramps service ladders and similar support equipment are bolted into the shaft after the shaft walls are complete but before the shaft is roofed,Relevant
While the shaft is still open at the top a crane raises the counterweight to the top of the building and lowers it into the shaft along its rails,Irrelevant
The crane then lifts the elevator car and inserts it partly into the shaft,Relevant
The guide wheels connect the car to the guide rails and the car is carefully lowered to the bottom of the shaft,Relevant
The shaft is then roofed over leaving a machine room above the shaft,Relevant
The hoist motor governor controller and other equipment are mounted in this room with the motor located directly over the elevator car pulley,Relevant
The elevator and governor cables are strung and attached the electrical connections completed and the controller programmed,Relevant
Water gum and sugar are mixed in a dry blender and then moved to a batch tank,Relevant
Egg whites whey protein concentrate and skim milk proteins are added,Relevant
The pH or acidity levels are adjusted to the mix as it sits in the batch tank,Relevant

Lethecin pectin and citric acid are completely dissolved and dispersed so that no particles larger than 1 micron (one millionth of a meter) can be found in the premix before homogenizing pasteurization,Relevant
The pectincitric acid mix is then added to the egg white whey and milk proteins,Relevant
The premix a thin pourable liquid is warmed by a heat exchanger to a temperature just below the coagulation region of the protein,Relevant
This is about 165°F (74°C) for egg whites,Irrelevant
The warmed mix is poured into the homogenizing pasteurizer and heated another 20°F (67°C) in less than 10 seconds,Relevant
During this time the mixture is continuously exposed to a uniformly turbulent field of homogenizing force,Irrelevant
Half of the protein denatures as a gel and forms beadlets of about 1 to 3 microns in diameter,Irrelevant
Sometimes the mixture is poured through a holding tube before it is cooled,Irrelevant
Upon exiting the pasteurizer the mixture is cooled to become creamy smooth opaque and semisolid,Relevant
Simplesse is the end product,Irrelevant
Once the batch is prepared it is fed into a furnace for melting,Relevant
The furnace may be heated by electricity fossil fuel or a combination of the two,Relevant
Temperature must be precisely controlled to maintain a smooth steady flow of glass,Relevant
The molten glass must be kept at a higher temperature (about 2500°F [1371°C]) than other types of glass in order to be formed into fiber,Relevant
Once the glass becomes molten it is transferred to the forming equipment via a channel (forehearth) located at the end of the furnace,Relevant
Several different processes are used to form fibers depending on the type of fiber,Irrelevant

Textile fibers may be formed from molten glass directly from the furnace or the molten glass may be fed first to a machine Fiberglassthat forms glass marbles of about 062 inch (16 cm) in diameter,Relevant
These marbles allow the glass to be inspected visually for impurities,Irrelevant
In both the direct melt and marble melt process the glass or glass marbles are fed through electrically heated bushings (also called spinnerets),Relevant
The bushing is made of platinum or metal alloy with anywhere from 200 to 3000 very fine orifices,Irrelevant
The molten glass passes through the orifices and comes out as fine filaments,Relevant
A long continuous fiber can be produced through the continuousfilament process,Relevant
After the glass flows through the holes in the bushing multiple strands are caught up on a highspeed winder,Relevant
The winder revolves at about 2 miles (3 km) a minute much faster than the rate of flow from the bushings,Irrelevant
The tension pulls out the filaments while still molten forming strands a fraction of the diameter of the openings in the bushing,Relevant
A chemical binder is applied which helps keep the fiber from breaking during later processing,Relevant
The filament is then wound onto tubes,Relevant
It can now be twisted and plied into yarn,Relevant
An alternative method is the staplefiber process,Irrelevant
As the molten glass flows through the bushings jets of air rapidly cool the filaments,Relevant
The turbulent bursts of air also break the filaments into lengths of 815 inches (2038 cm),Relevant
These filaments fall through a spray of lubricant onto a revolving drum where they form a thin web,Relevant
The web is drawn from the drum and pulled into a continuous strand of loosely assembled fibers,Relevant
This strand can be processed into yarn by the same processes used for wool and cotton,Relevant
Instead of being formed into yarn the continuous or longstaple strand may be chopped into short lengths,Relevant
The strand is mounted on a set of bobbins called a creel and pulled through a machine which chops it into short pieces,Relevant
The chopped fiber is formed into mats to which a binder is added,Relevant
After curing in an oven the mat is rolled up,Relevant
Various weights and thicknesses give products for shingles builtup roofing or decorative mats,Irrelevant
The rotary or spinner process is used to make glass wool,Irrelevant
In this process molten glass from the furnace flows into a cylindrical container having small holes,Relevant
As the container spins rapidly horizontal streams of glass flow out of the holes,Irrelevant
The molten glass streams are converted into fibers by a downward blast of air hot gas or both,Relevant
The fibers fall onto a conveyor belt where they interlace with each other in a fleecy mass,Relevant
This can be used for insulation or the wool can be sprayed with a binder compressed into the desired thickness and cured in an oven,Irrelevant
The heat sets the binder and the resulting product may be a rigid or semirigid board or a flexible batt,Relevant
In addition to binders other coatings are required for fiberglass products,Relevant
Lubricants are used to reduce fiber abrasion and are either directly sprayed on the fiber or added into the binder,Relevant
An antistatic composition is also sometimes sprayed onto the surface of fiberglass insulation mats during the cooling step,Relevant
Cooling air drawn through the mat causes the antistatic agent to penetrate the entire thickness of the mat,Relevant
The antistatic agent consists of two ingredients—a material that minimizes the generation of static electricity and a material that serves as a corrosion inhibitor and stabilizer,Irrelevant
Sizing is any coating applied to textile fibers in the forming operation and may contain one or more components (lubricants binders or coupling agents),Irrelevant
Coupling agents are used on strands that will be used for reinforcing plastics to strengthen the bond to the reinforced material,Relevant
Sometimes a finishing operation is required to remove these coatings or to add another coating,Relevant
For plastic reinforcements sizings may be removed with heat or chemicals and a coupling agent applied,Relevant
For decorative applications fabrics must be heat treated to remove sizings and to set the weave,Relevant
Dye base coatings are then applied before dying or printing,Relevant
Fiberglass products come in a wide variety of shapes made using several processes,Irrelevant
For example fiberglass pipe insulation is wound onto rodlike forms called mandrels directly from the forming units prior to curing,Irrelevant
The mold forms in lengths of 3 feet (91 cm) or less are then cured in an oven,Relevant
The cured lengths are then demolded lengthwise and sawn into specified dimensions,Relevant
Facings are applied if required and the product is packaged for shipment,Relevant
The selection and purchase of the truck chassis is based upon the tactical application of the apparatus,Irrelevant
The truck frame may be bare having only the engine axles springs frame members steering and brake systems installed,Irrelevant
The apparatus builder may choose however to use a cab and chassis where the frame has the engine cab seats front sheet metal and wiring already completed,Irrelevant
In either case the truck frame is usually ordered from a wellestablished truck builder such as General Motors Ford International Freightliner or Peterbilt,Irrelevant
The apparatus builder advises the truck manufacturer of the intended design so special options concerning the performance of the frame can be made,Irrelevant
It is critical that the proper selection of suspension be made to support the average 35000pound (15890 kg) fire engine,Irrelevant
In our example we have chosen the cab and chassis frame design,Irrelevant
The basic design of the fire apporatus begins with a thorough review of the fire lood and geographicol terroin of the area the fire department will be responding to,Irrelevant
After the truck frame is received and inspected the fabrication of the body (or coach as it is sometimes called) begins,Relevant
Primarily sheet steel is used for body panels and supports although aluminum and some stainless steel are also incorporated,Relevant
Sheet steel is approximately 0,Irrelevant
06 inch (1,Irrelevant
5 mm) thick and comes in sheets 48 inches (1,Irrelevant
2 m) and 96 inches (2,Irrelevant
4 m) long,Irrelevant
It can also be supplied in rolls of the same width and weighing 2000 pounds (908 kg) or more,Irrelevant
Each door panel support body panel and equipment tray is cut and bent using shearing machines and press brakes,Relevant
Holes for electrical equipment and piping are also punched at this time,Relevant
The body is typically metal inert gas (Mig) welded together with the doors and access panels bolted for ease of replacement,Irrelevant
Many manufacturers protect the body from corrosion by dipping each panel into a rust inhibiting sealer,Irrelevant
The interior and other hidden areas of the doors and cabinets are prepainted before assembly,Irrelevant
While the body construction is underway the pump and tank are mounted to the frame,Irrelevant
The pump is selected to perform specifically for the practices of the fire department,Irrelevant
Essentially the pump is the only reason for the fire engine,Irrelevant
All of the other features are practically useless if the pump does not perform adequately,Irrelevant
Most firepumps today are centrifugal pumps and are manufactured by separate companies and purchased by the apparatus builder,Irrelevant
A typical firepump can pump 1000 gallons (3785 1) of water per minute,Irrelevant
This flow can safely provide enough water to fight a residential or small commercial building fire,Irrelevant
Pump size can be restricted by the available water supply particularly in rural areas where there are no fire hydrants,Irrelevant
Pumps are usually cast iron with bronze for the rotating impeller and steel gears in the drive unit,Irrelevant
Our truck shall have the 1000 gallon per minute pump bolted to the frame near the center and driven by an auxiliary output shaft (or power take off) from the truck transmission,Irrelevant
This type of arrangement is referred to as a midship pump apparatus,Irrelevant
The pump sits across the frame of the truck and is bolted through the support castings to the upper frame flange,Irrelevant
Alignment with the transmission is important to reduce vibration,Irrelevant
The water tank for this example apparatus would typically be a polypropylene tank holding 5001000 gallons (18923785 1) of water,Irrelevant
This is bolted to special Fire Enginesupports before being attached to the frame immediately behind the pump,Irrelevant
Connective piping to the pump and filling openings is also installed typically of galvanized steel construction,Irrelevant
Tanks may be square round or oval and many are hotwelded together out of sheet material,Irrelevant
The hotwelding process uses a high temperature stream of air to melt the plastic pieces at their joint where the material mixes and fuses together,Irrelevant
Most tanks contain perforated plates or baffles to reduce the sloshing of the water while driving,Irrelevant
Occasionally a quick dump is installed in the tank of an apparatus designed for use in rural locations,Relevant
This large valve dumps the water from the main tank into a folding portable tank carried to the fire on a separate tanker truck,Irrelevant

This allows the tanker trucks to shuttle water from long distances and empty into the portable tank where large suction hoses feeding directly into the pump allow the flow to be increased to maximum capacity,Irrelevant
These quick dump valves empty the 1500 gallons (5677 1) of water in 45 seconds,Irrelevant
When the body is completed it is mounted to the frame over the pump and tank and bolted using neoprene or rubber vibration strips,Relevant
Along each side and above the tank are the equipment and hose compartments,Irrelevant
They are formed into the body with doors and covers for protection,Irrelevant
Related equipment such as hose nozzles as well as tactical equipment such as forcible entry tools and selfcontained breathing units are stored in the side equipment compartments,Irrelevant
They are sized and equipped to allow the fastest and easiest deployment of the equipment,Irrelevant
The hose beds carry the fire hose,Irrelevant
The top bed usually contains 50 foot (15 m) long 2,Irrelevant
5 inch (76 cm) diameter sections of fire hose connected together to form hoselines reaching up to 1000 feet (305 m),Irrelevant
This hose is folded in such a manner as to allow it to be pulled from its bed with ease and speed,Irrelevant
Shorter sections of suction hoses are also carried on the apparatus,Irrelevant
These suction hoses are made of a firm material so they do not collapse from the reduced pressure when coupled to the suction of the pump,Irrelevant
They cannot be folded so they are usually placed into hose troughs specially designed for suction hoses,Irrelevant
All other types of fire hoses are collapsible and for use on the pressure side of the pump only,Irrelevant
After the last accessories and wirings are installed and individually tested the apparatus builder submits the finished truck to an independent inspection agency,Relevant
Upon successful testing the apparatus and the builder are awarded a certificate of performance,Relevant
In front of the tank and above the pump are the attack hoseline beds,Irrelevant
These beds contain 1,Irrelevant
5 inch (3,Irrelevant
8 cm) diameter firehoses preconnected to the output of the pump with the nozzles ready for action,Irrelevant
Two or four beds of preconnects are common,Irrelevant
These will be the first hoses used in the incident therefore they are the most important,Irrelevant
Behind the tank is the reel booster,Irrelevant
Here a oneinch (2,Irrelevant
5 cm) diameter hose on a power rollup reel is stored,Irrelevant
This booster hose is used for cleaning the apparatus and equipment and for cooling the outside of the apparatus when it is near a large fire,Irrelevant
It is also occasionally used to put out small trash or grass fires,Irrelevant
This reel is handy because the hose can be quickly rewound by simply pressing a button,Irrelevant
All other hoses on the fire truck must be washed and packed back into their beds by hand after the fire incident,Irrelevant
Ladders for the fire service are extra heavy duty,Irrelevant
Though made out of aluminum they are physically heavy so they are typically carried in racks above the curbside (right side) equipment compartments,Irrelevant
Power racks have been developed to lower the ladder to waist height but most commonly the fire fighters simply lift the ladder off of the rack and proceed to the fire,Irrelevant
Ladders like pumps are also purchased from other suppliers and installed by the apparatus builder,Irrelevant
Once the body has been assembled to the truck frame the equipment mounting holes are located and drilled and any additional holes or passages are cut into the panels,Relevant
This allows the painting operation to seal the exposed edges of holes and other openings,Relevant
The exterior of the apparatus is washed and sanded in preparation for painting,Relevant
The interior of the doors and compartments have already been painted,Relevant
The outside can be painted in matching colors,Relevant
The painting process includes a primer surfacer to fill small sanding marks and surface defects and a sealer to improve paint adhesion,Irrelevant
Fire trucks used to be all red but some experiments with yellow blue and white have been done to increase visual identification,Irrelevant
Today the NFPA recommends yellow or the standard Fire Engine Red,Irrelevant
The type of paint is usually a tough enamel or synthetic to resist burning embers and wear from fire service,Irrelevant
Hardening agents are added to the paint to improve the shine and durability,Relevant
After painting the ladders and accessories can be installed using stainless steel fasteners,Relevant
The modern fire apparatus can be complicated,Irrelevant
Radio systems cellular phones computers and cellular fax machines are all finding their way into the fire service,Irrelevant
Even our example apparatus will require several hundred feet of wiring to operate the warning lights siren radios bay lights generator flood lights pump electricals and other systems,Irrelevant
Most apparatuses have two independent battery systems which must be wired into the apparatus after painting,Irrelevant
The pump operators control panel containing the pressure gauges and valves used to control the pump will also be installed,Relevant
The ingredients used to prepare stars are obtained from chemical supply companies and stored in barrels,Relevant
At the time of mixing the chemicals are scooped out of the barrels weighed and sifted twice through brass screens to remove lumps,Relevant
(Brass is used because it does not produce sparks),Irrelevant
The sifted powders are placed on a large sheet of paper and gently mixed by hand,Relevant
The powders may also be mixed inside a rotating drum or a stationary container with rotating paddles,Relevant
These devices must be used with great care to avoid generating heat through friction or trapping bits of powder between moving parts,Irrelevant
The mixed powder is placed in barrels and taken from the mixing room to the cutting room,Relevant
Water is mixed with it to form a soft dough,Relevant
Lumps of the dough are scooped into large paperlined wooden molds shaped like loaves of bread,Relevant
The dough is packed firmly into the mold with a wooden mallet,Relevant
(The wet dough is much safer to manipulate than the dry powder),Irrelevant
The loaves of dough weighing about 35 pounds (16 kg) each are unmolded onto a workbench covered with heavy cardboard sprinkled with black powder,Irrelevant
The loaves are cut in one direction to form slices then cut in the other direction to form dice,Relevant
The dimensions of the dice may be anywhere from 0062 inches (0165 cm),Irrelevant
The black powder adheres to the wet dice and will help them burn when the firework is ignited,Irrelevant
The dice are allowed to dry on papercovered screens,Relevant
The dried dice are now stars,Relevant
They are moved to the packing room to be placed into cardboard containers,Relevant
A hollow cardboard tube is placed in the center of the cylindrical container and stars are gently poured around it,Relevant
A large container may hold as many as 900 stars (about 44 pounds [2 kg]),Irrelevant
When the container is full black powder is poured inside the hollow tube and the tube is removed,Relevant
The powder fills the spaces between the stars and will serve to ignite and scatter them,Relevant
A paper cap is placed on the filled container now called a break,Relevant
The break is wrapped with heavy string a process known as spiking,Relevant
Spiking is done by tying one end of a large spool of string to the break and winding the string around it,Relevant
When the break is completely covered the string is cut and tied,Relevant
Some breaks are not spiked but are made instead of plastic or heavier cardboard to withstand the stress of being launched,Relevant
A time fuse (a short slowburning fuse that causes the break to explode a certain amount of time after it is launched) is inserted into the break and it is wrapped in heavy paper,Relevant
The wrapped breaks are moved to the pasting room to be wrapped in heavy pastesoaked paper then allowed to dry for about two days,Relevant
The paper hardens as the paste dries to form a strong tight seal,Irrelevant
Some breaks known as salutes are filled with flash powder rather than stars and black powder,Relevant
Flash powder is mixed in much the same way as the chemicals used to make stars,Relevant
It is then poured into cardboard containers that are thicker and stronger than other breaks,Irrelevant
This allows more pressure to build up before the salute bursts resulting in a louder bang,Irrelevant
These salutes are then spiked and pasted like other breaks,Relevant
The dry breaks are moved to the finishing room to be assembled into shells,Relevant
The simplest shells consist of a small compartment of black powder combined with a single break,Irrelevant
Due to their spherical structure Asian shells always contain only one break,Irrelevant
Because American and European shells are cylindrical more than one break can be stacked together so that the shell will display multiple bursts of different colors when it explodes,Irrelevant
Multibreak shells usually consist of a small compartment of black powder three or four colored breaks and a salute,Irrelevant
Some large shells contain as many as 10 breaks and at least one gigantic shell has been made holding 22 breaks,Irrelevant

The shell is assembled by stacking the components together attaching a starting fuse (a long fastburning fuse used to ignite the black powder that launches the firework) wrapping them in heavy paper and tying the package together with string,Relevant
The completed firework is then labeled and stored until needed,Relevant
Small fireworks intended for private use are made in much the same way as large ones but they are generally simpler in construction and contain much less explosive,Irrelevant

Small fireworks include firecrackers (paper tubes holding a small amount of explosive) fountains (paper cones filled with chemicals which release colored sparks) and Roman candles (long paper tubes filled with a small amount of explosive and several small stars which shoot out one at a time),Irrelevant
Some small fireworks contain no explosive at all and may be as simple as a single chemical wrapped in paper or foil,Irrelevant
Examples include smoke balls (filled with a chemical that releases colored smoke) and snakes (filled with ammonium dichromate which slowly burns and produces a long trail of ash),Irrelevant
Sparklers are made by dipping a metal wire in a slurry containing a fuel an oxidizer a coloring agent and aluminum granules which provide the sparks,Irrelevant
Professional fireworks are usually launched by the same companies who make them,Irrelevant

If a set piece (a groundbased display that forms a picture or words with colored flares called lances) is to be used the design to be formed is sketched on graph paper and sent to carpenters who build a wooden frame with thin wooden slats in the shape of the design,Irrelevant
If music will accompany the fireworks the timing of the display is planned to match the tempo of the music,Irrelevant
Several hours before the show begins (or a few days in advance for a very large show) the crew arrives with all the necessary equipment including fire extinguishers and first aid kits,Irrelevant
Mortars to launch the shells are placed in their proper places,Relevant
Large ones are placed in holes dug in the ground or in steel drums filled with sand,Relevant
Smaller mortars are placed in wooden racks,Relevant
The proper shell for each mortar is loaded in place,Relevant
The frames for set pieces are assembled lances are attached to the slats and fuses are attached to the lances,Relevant
When the display begins the lances and mortars are lit at the proper times either with long handheld flares or with electrical wires attached to a central switchboard,Relevant
After the show the crew safely destroys any unexploded duds,Relevant
The ingredients for fortune cookies are mixed together to form the batter,Relevant

This watery dough is transferred by a pump to the fortune cookie oven which is circular and contains a number of shallow cups with flat bottoms (about 3 inches [76 cm] in diameter) in the shape of the finished but unfolded cookie,Relevant
When the cups are filled with the correct amount of dough as regulated by the batter pump flat metal plates are placed in the cups on top of the dough,Relevant
The plates flatten the dough and also allow heat to transfer through the metal surfaces against both the top and bottom of the cookie so it is golden brown on both sides,Relevant
The cookies rotate through the circular oven,Relevant
One complete orbit takes 35 minutes which is the time it takes the thin dough to bake,Irrelevant
In a variation of this method the dough is poured on a griddle and the round shapes are stamped out by metal forms,Relevant
When the cookie has finished baking it sticks to the plate,Relevant
As the plates are lifted up a mechanical arm snatches the cookie from the plate and transfers it to a receiving area where the fortunes are added,Relevant
The paper strips are sucked by vacuum onto the cookies,Relevant
The cookies are pushed along to two mechanical fingers that grab the still hot cookie and fold it in half so it resembles a halfmoon with the paper fortune inside,Relevant

The machine then bends the cookie in the middle to its familiar crescent shape (which has been fancifully described as a pair of water wings a fan or an extracted molar!) The formed cookie is then cooled by air from a fan and pushed to the packaging area,Relevant
Cookies are packed in small bags for store sale or large bags for restaurant use and the bags are placed in cartons to protect their fragile cargo,Relevant
A freezedrying processing facility is usually a large plant with modern equipment,Irrelevant
Its foodhandling areas must be approved by the United States Department of Agriculture and the company and its employees must adhere to government regulatory procedures,Irrelevant

The plant may include a receiving and storage area for raw foods that arrive at the plant in bulk a food cooking area for those foods that must be cooked before processing a large area with several large freezing and drying chambers and a packaging area,Irrelevant

The facility may also include a research area where improved methods of freezedrying foods are developed and a test kitchen where new preparation techniques to improve the final taste quality and texture of the food are tried,Irrelevant
Some plants are dedicated to freezedrying only one product like freezedried coffee,Irrelevant
Others process a wide range of meats vegetables and fruits,Irrelevant
Nonfood products such as chemicals and pharmaceuticals are usually processed in separate plants from food products,Irrelevant
The freezedrying process varies in the details of temperatures times pressures and intermediate steps from one food to another,Irrelevant
The following is a generalized description of the process with several specific exceptions noted,Irrelevant
The food is first checked for contamination and purity,Relevant
Fruits meats and some other edibles are tested for bacterial counts and spoilage,Relevant
Much of the work of the plant is dependent on the harvest season for each food,Irrelevant
In January for example the plant would be processing celery olives lemons oranges and pineapples,Irrelevant
In July it would process green beans peas and strawberries among others,Irrelevant
Some kinds of food like seafood and meats must be cooked before freeze drying,Relevant
They are usually purchased already cut into small pieces,Relevant
If they have not been precooked and frozen these foods are placed in large industrialsized kettles and properly cooked,Relevant
Fruits and vegetables are usually purchased already cut pitted and peeled,Relevant
These foods are simply washed with sprays of water,Relevant
Some vegetables like peas and corn are quickly scalded or blanched before freezing,Irrelevant
Coffee is purchased as a prebrewed concentrated liquid,Relevant
Because the aroma of coffee is important to consumers a small amount of coffee bean oil may be added to the liquid,Relevant
Unlike the water the oil is not removed during the drying process,Relevant
The food pieces are spread out on flat metal trays which are stacked 20 to 30 high in slots in a wheeled cart,Irrelevant
With food that has been precooked and frozen the trays are prechilled to prevent partial thawing during handling,Relevant
With liquids like coffee the prebrewed coffee is poured into shallow pans,Relevant
The carts are wheeled into a large walkin coldroom where the temperature can be as low as 40°F (40°C),Relevant
In this extremely cold temperature the food is quickly frozen,Relevant
There are usually a dozen or more coldrooms in operation and the carts are kept there until it is time to move them into the drying chamber,Irrelevant
The carts are wheeled out of the coldroom and into a vacuum drying chamber,Relevant
In the case of liquids like coffee the frozen coffee is first ground up into small particles in a lowtemperature grinder,Relevant
The drying chamber is a large long horizontal cylinder with semielliptical ends,Irrelevant
One end is hinged to open and close,Relevant
When the trays of frozen food pieces are inside the chamber is closed and sealed,Relevant
In a large plant there may be 20 to 30 drying chambers in operation at any time,Irrelevant
The drying procedure involves a process known as sublimation,Irrelevant
In sublimation a solid material is forced to change state into a gaseous material without ever becoming a liquid,Irrelevant
In the case of freezedried food the solid ice crystals trapped in the frozen food pieces are forced to change into water vapor without ever becoming liquid water,Irrelevant
In the drying chamber this is accomplished by evacuating the air with a vacuum pump to reduce the pressure to about 0036 psi (00025 bar),Irrelevant
The temperature of the food is raised to about 100°F (38°C) by direct conduction through the bottom of the trays radiation from heat lamps or microwave heating,Relevant
When the chamber is evacuated of air the pressure is below the threshold at which water can simultaneously exist in a solid liquid and gaseous (vapor) state,Irrelevant
This threshold is known as the triple point of water,Irrelevant
Once the pressure falls below this point the heat causes the ice crystals trapped in the frozen pieces of food to change directly to water vapor,Irrelevant
The vapor is drawn off and condensed within the chamber leaving the food behind,Relevant
The dried food is filled with tiny voids like a sponge where the ice crystals were once present,Relevant
Not only does this make it easier for the food to reabsorb water when it is prepared for consumption but the dried food retains its original size and shape,Irrelevant
The time for this drying process varies,Irrelevant
Freezedried liquids make take only about four hours to prepare while semisolids and solids like soup and sliced meats may take 12 hours or more,Irrelevant
The dried food pieces are removed from the drying chamber and tested for moisture content and purity,Relevant
Some food pieces may be ground to a smaller size or may be reduced to a powder,Relevant
Others may be screened to separate them by size,Relevant
Two or more different products may also be blended together to meet a customers specific specifications,Relevant
Freezedried foods must be sealed in airtight containers to prevent them from absorbing moisture from the air,Relevant
Several types of containers may be used plastic laminated foil pouches metal and plastic cans or metal and fiber drums for bulk packaging,Irrelevant
Some freezedried food is vacuum packed in which the air is evacuated from the container before sealing,Relevant
Other food has an inert gas like nitrogen injected into the container before sealing to displace the oxygen in the air and prevent oxidation or spoiling of the food,Relevant
The packaging is done in the freezedry plant almost as soon as the foods come out of the drying chamber,Relevant
The plant can form fill and seal the packages to the desired weight for the end user,Irrelevant
Packages that are to be sold directly to the consumer are packed in cartons stacked on pallets and transported to the grocery warehouse,Relevant
Other freezedried food is packaged in bulk and sold to a secondary processor for incorporation into other food products,Relevant
Freezedried blueberries for example may be sent to a company that makes pancake and muffin mixes,Irrelevant
The ingredients are selected for freshness and quality,Irrelevant
They are measured in precise quantities according to the particular recipe,Relevant
Liquid and dry ingredients are combined separately,Relevant
The liquids are poured into a vat mixed together and heated,Relevant
Next the dry ingredients are added to the liquids in a particular order,Relevant
Meanwhile the batch is stiffed and the temperature gradually increased,Relevant
Most ingredients must be incorporated before the mix is heated to 120°F (49°C) so that the mix does not become lumpy,Relevant
The mixture must be heated to dissolve and blend the ingredients,Relevant
Pasteurizing the batch is necessary to destroy pathogenic bacteria and to help preserve the finished product,Relevant
It is also required by law in most regions,Irrelevant
Pasteurization is a simple process that involves quickly bringing the mix to a high temperature for a specified time and then quickly reducing the temperature to less than 40°F (4°C),Irrelevant
The trend in the industry has been toward increasing the pasteurization temperature to about 175°F (79°C) for about 2540 seconds,Irrelevant
For greater results batches can be pasteurized at temperatures as high as 210°F (99°C) to 220°F (104°C),Relevant
These high temperatures also improve the flavor and help blend the ingredients more effectively,Irrelevant
Homogenizing the batch makes it smoother primarily by decreasing the size of fat globules to less than two micrometers,Irrelevant
Without homogenization fat could rise to the top of the mixture and create a layer of cream,Irrelevant
Homogenization consists of pumping the batch through a small valve and against an impact ring,Relevant
Three forces are at work,Irrelevant
As the mix passes at a high velocity of about 30000 fpm (feet per minute) through the valve shear forces begin to break up the fat particles,Relevant
The impact ring ruptures the fat further,Irrelevant
Completing the process is cavitation in which vapor bubbles are created by a sudden discharge of pressure,Irrelevant
Within the bubbles the fat droplets crash against the vapor walls and disintegrate thus the more fat the more homogenization required,Irrelevant
While the temperature of the mix is 90°F (32°C) it is inoculated with 1 yogurt culture,Irrelevant
The mix remains at this temperature until it sets and is ready for cooling,Irrelevant
After homogenization the mixture must be cooled,Relevant
If it is cooled slowly from about 90°F (32°C) to about 40°F (4°C) the mix will become more viscous,Irrelevant
Once the temperature falls between 32°F (0°C) and 40°F (4°C) the batch is stored in aging tanks inside coolers,Relevant
The mix is aged for up to four hours,Relevant
The final ingredients are mixed together in a flavor vat,Relevant
These include sweeteners flavorings and coloring,Irrelevant
This mixture is then pumped into the freezer with the rest of the mixture which is about 20°F (6°C) to 28°F (2°C),Relevant
While the mix is hardening it is agitated to incorporate air and create overrun or excess volume,Relevant
The addition of air also smoothes the consistency and creates a more palatable product,Relevant
In about three minutes the mix begins to freeze and within a few more minutes the desired overrun about 50 is achieved,Relevant
About one to twothirds of the water freezes during this stage,Relevant
After the desired overrun is reached the mixture is packaged and placed in freezers where the freezing process continues,Relevant
The temperature falls quickly within one or two minutes to at least 0°F (17°C) but ideally 15°F (26°C),Irrelevant
For best results the freezing process should occur rapidly so that the mixture does not form large coarse ice crystals but small smooth ones,Irrelevant
The frozen yogurt may be stored in continuous or batch freezers,Irrelevant
In the former there is a constant flow of product into the freezer while in the batch method batches are prepared individually,Irrelevant
Depending on the type of freezer and the size and shape of the package the final hardening takes between 30 minutes to 12 hours,Irrelevant
The containers of frozen yogurt are piled closely together inside the delivery trucks to minimize the temperature change during shipping,Relevant

The vehicles are generally mechanically refrigerated at the same temperatures as in the storage facilities in the factory about 15°F (26°C) and not above the temperature at the retail outlet,Irrelevant
Dry ice may be used as a refrigerant though it risks heatshock to the yogurt which occurs if the temperature falls too low the freezing point for dry ice is 109°F (78°C),Irrelevant
The frozen yogurt is shipped to retail outlets and food service establishments or to other manufacturers for further processing into novelties,Relevant
The first step in the manufacture of gasoline is to find its parent ingredient petroleum,Relevant
Crude oil is trapped in areas of porous rock or reservoir rock after it has migrated there from the area of its origin,Relevant
Possible areas of oil concentration may be pinpointed by looking for rock types that are commonly found in those areas,Irrelevant
Explorers may examine the surface features of the land analyze how sound waves bounce off the rock or use a gravity meter to detect slight differences in rock formations,Relevant
Gasoline is a volatile flammable liquid obtained from the refinement of petroleum or crude oil,Irrelevant
After a possible oil reservoir is found the area must be test drilled,Relevant
Core samples are taken from test wells to confirm rock formations and the samples are chemically analyzed in order to determine if more drilling is justified,Relevant
Although the methods used today are more advanced than any of the past there is still no certainty in oil exploration,Irrelevant
Crude oil is recovered through wells that can reach over 1000 feet (305 m) into the rock,Relevant
The holes are made by rotary drillers which use a bit to bore a hole in the ground as water is added,Relevant
The water and soil create a thick mud that helps hold back the oil and prevent it from gushing due to the internal pressure contained in the reservoir rock,Relevant
When the reservoir is reached the mud continues to hold back the oil while the drill is removed and a pipe is inserted,Relevant
To recover the oil a complicated system of pipes and valving is installed directly into the drilling well,Relevant
The natural pressure of the reservoir rock brings the oil out of the well and into the pipes,Relevant
These are connected to a recovery system which consists of a series of larger pipes taking the crude oil to the refinery via an oil (liquid) and gas (nonliquid) separator,Relevant
This method allows the oil to be recovered with a minimum of waste,Irrelevant
Eventually the natural pressure of the well is expended though great quantities of oil may still remain in the rock,Relevant
Secondary recovery methods are now required to obtain a greater percentage of the oil,Relevant
The pressure is restored by either injecting gas into the pocket above the oil or by flooding water into the well which is far more common,Relevant
In this process four holes are drilled around the perimeter of the well and water is added,Relevant
The petroleum will float on the water and come to the surface,Relevant
Crude oil is not a good fuel since it is not fluid and requires a very high temperature to burn,Irrelevant
The long chains of molecules in crude oil must be separated from the smaller chains of refined fuels including gasoline in a petroleum refinery,Irrelevant
This process is called fractional distillation,Irrelevant
A fractional distillation tower is a huge unit that may hold up to 200000 barrels of crude oil,Irrelevant
The oil is first pumped into a furnace and heated to over 600°F (316°C) causing all but the largest molecules to evaporate,Relevant
The vapors rise into the fractionating column which may be as tall as 150 feet (46 m),Relevant
The vapors cool as they rise through the column,Relevant
Since the boiling points of all the compounds differ the larger heavier molecules will condense first lower in the tower and the shorter lighter molecules will condense higher in the tower,Irrelevant
Natural gases gasoline and kerosene are released near the top,Relevant
Heavier compounds used in the manufacture of plastics and lubricants are removed lower in the tower,Irrelevant
Fractional distillation itself does not produce gasoline from crude oil it just removes the gasoline from other compounds in crude oil,Irrelevant
Further refining processes are now used to improve the quality of the fuel,Relevant
Catalytic cracking is one of the most important processes in oil refining,Irrelevant
This process uses a catalyst high temperature and increased pressure to affect chemical changes in petroleum,Irrelevant
Catalysts such as aluminum platinum processed clay and acids are added to petroleum to break down larger molecules so that it will possess the desired compounds of gasoline,Relevant
Another refining process is polymerization,Irrelevant
This is the opposite of cracking in that it combines the smaller molecules of lighter gases into larger ones that can be used as liquid fuels,Irrelevant
Once gasoline is refined chemicals are added,Relevant
Some are antiknock compounds which react with the chemicals in gasoline that burn too quickly to prevent engine knock,Irrelevant
In leaded gasoline tetraethyl lead is the antiknock additive,Irrelevant
(Unleaded gasoline is refined further so the need for antiknock additives is minimal),Irrelevant
Other additives (antioxidants) are added to prevent the formation of gum in the engine,Relevant
Gum is a resin formed in gasoline that can coat the internal parts of the engine and increase wear,Irrelevant
Gasoline is primarily a mixture of two volatile liquids heptane and isooctane,Irrelevant
Pure heptane a lighter fuel burns so quickly that it produces a great amount of knocking in an engine,Irrelevant
Pure isooctane evaporates slowly and produces virtually no knocking,Irrelevant
The ratio of heptane to isooctane is measured by the octane rating,Relevant
The greater the percentage of isooctane the less knocking and the higher the octane rating,Irrelevant
For example an octane rating of 87 is comparable to a mixture of 87 isooctane and 13 heptane,Irrelevant
The outer skin covers and shields of the baler are punched or blanked out of sheet steel in a large punch press or by laser cutter,Relevant
The sheet metal can be taken directly from the roll or precut into flat sheets as needed,Irrelevant
Punch presses operate by forcing a hardened steel punch through the material into a hardened die with up to 200 tons of force,Relevant
This shears the metal to size and the rapid stroke of the punch press allows many parts to be produced per hour,Relevant
More intricate shapes and lowvolume parts are cut using an industrial laser to burn through the metal in a preprogrammed pattern,Relevant
In spite of being slower than the punch press the laser reduces material waste by arranging the part shapes to most effectively utilize the sheet size,Relevant
Another advantage of the laser cutter is that it requires practically no set up which means it can create differentsized parts without physically adapting the machine,Irrelevant
This is important as one machine can then produce hundreds of different parts in any random order and provide them to the rest of the manufacturing process as needed,Irrelevant
Balers are constructed primarily of structural and sheet steel,Irrelevant
This steel can be in bar stock sheets or in rolls,Irrelevant
Hydraulic cylinders pumps wheels and tires belts and other components are purchased from suppliers and shipped to the baler assembly plant,Irrelevant
Bar stock steel that is used for frames shafts arms and other structural parts is cut using a band saw,Irrelevant
These saws have many toothed cutting blades driven over two large wheels,Irrelevant
The wheels rotate and move the blade continuously to cut through the bar,Irrelevant
Bar stock can be round square rectangular solid or hollow plus many other shapes specific to the desired application,Irrelevant
After cutting to length holes and slots are drilled punched or milled into the parts as needed,Relevant
Structural parts are usually fabricated close to the welding area to minimize time between operations,Irrelevant
Welding is performed primarily by robotic welders,Irrelevant
These machines are operated by a computer that has been programmed to move the welding electrode wire through a specific range of motion,Irrelevant
The robotic welder is very accurate and makes highquality repeatable welds,Irrelevant
After the various components are clamped into a large welding fixture by the operator the robot extends a short piece of welding wire from the welding gun,Relevant
With the welding current turned off it gently touches a computer sensor that accurately defines the exact position of the wire tip,Relevant
Then the robot touches the tip of the wire to each of the components in two or three places,Relevant
All of this touching is actually transmitting data to the computer about the exact location of the components in reference to the desired location of the weld,Relevant
Once complete the computer program compensates slightly for any deviation from the exact position,Relevant
The welding current is turned on and the wire is fed into the arc while the robot moves the gun along the joint,Relevant
This insures that the welds will be exactly at the proper place and achieve the highest possible strength,Relevant
It also prevents welding any misplaced or incorrect parts reducing scrap and possible machine failures,Relevant
In many critical applications robotic welders can be more accurate than a human welder because of this type of programming,Irrelevant
After welding fabricated parts as well as shields and covers are cleaned and painted,Relevant
Cleaning is accomplished by hot steam or solvents inside an enclosure,Relevant
The paint is applied by dipping the parts into an electrostatic paint tank,Relevant
These tanks are large enough to submerge an entire baler frame typically 15 feet (45 m) long and 10 feet (3 m) wide,Irrelevant
They contain 2000040000 gallons (75700151400 1) of paint,Irrelevant
The paint is suspended in a water solution and charged with a negative electric charge,Relevant
The parts are charged positive and when the parts submerge into the solution the electrical attraction of the two charges sticks the paint tightly to the metal,Relevant
The parts are hoisted out of the tank and allowed to drip before they are placed into a drying oven,Relevant
This drying oven heats the parts to approximately 365°F (185°C) which bakes the paint into a hard finish,Irrelevant
Because balers are used and sometimes stored outside a good finish is needed to protect the steel from rusting,Irrelevant
The hay enters the baler through the pickup,Relevant
Directly behind the pickup is the compressor bar which holds the hay in place so the auger can feed it into the bale chamber,Irrelevant
The bale chamber contains a plunger that drive in and out each time packing and compressing hay into the desired shape,Irrelevant
After painting the frame of the baler is placed onto a wheeled cart,Relevant
This allows the baler to be moved and assembled at a variety of work stations each adding specific components and performing quality checks during production,Irrelevant
The hydraulics pickup tines bale tensioners knotters and subassemblies are bolted into place,Relevant
Many design features create special hole patterns tabs pins notches and other forms to prevent the parts from being assembled in the wrong place or position,Relevant
After assembly the hydraulic systems are filled with oil belt and chain tensions are adjusted and the bearings greased,Relevant
The baler then has the tire and wheel assemblies mounted and identifying decals and stickers attached,Relevant
Since a baler can be a very dangerous machine many warning labels are applied to caution operators to keep their hands away from the moving parts,Relevant
Finished balers are finally inspected and operated without hay to check the functionality of all the parts,Relevant
Most are shipped by truck or railcar to dealers all over the world,Relevant
A technician may be sent out to the field with the new baler to instruct the operator and make final adjustments,Relevant
Often changes in the hay crop will require occasional adjustment to the baler to produce quality bales,Relevant
Before fabrication begins the user is screened by a trained professional,Irrelevant
The screening includes a hearing test and the results are used to create an audiogram covering a variety of parameters,Irrelevant
At the screening stage an impression or mold of the users outer ear is also taken,Relevant
The audiogram and the impression are integral to the manufacturing process,Irrelevant

All order data—desired product features and the results of the audiogram—are entered in a computer to determine the operating range for the hearing aid specifically which levels of amplification are required for the user,Irrelevant
For some manufacturers the computer also selects the electronic circuitry to be used,Relevant
Typically an order card will be prepared and sent to the production line along with the ear impression,Relevant
A parts card is also printed and sent to the stock room where the various components are stored,Relevant
In this step a form or reverse copy of the impression of the outer ear and ear canal is produced,Relevant
A sheet of clear vinyl is placed over the impression then heat is applied,Relevant
When cooled the impression is removed from the vinyl form and trimmed,Relevant
Next the impression is dipped in hot wax giving it a smooth paperthin coating for the casting step,Relevant
Here a technician will place the impression on a metal plate and place rings around it,Relevant
A clear liquid colloid or particle suspension is poured into the rings immersing the impression,Relevant
The liquid is allowed to cure into a rubbery silicone consistency,Relevant
Lastly the impression is pulled out of the gel,Relevant
The shell or outer casing of the hearing aid is made from this mold,Relevant
The mold is first heated in 110°F (43°C) water and air is blown through it to clear away any impurities,Relevant
At this point a technician will mix liquid acrylic of equal parts monomer and polymer (for a structurally sound shell) and add the desired pigment to give the shell a pink tan or brown color,Relevant
The technician pours the liquid into the heated colloid mold and after ten seconds pours off any excess leaving a thin acrylic shell inside the mold,Relevant
After 10 minutes of cooling the technician pulls from the mold a shell that is a perfect replica of the raw impression of the ear canal,Relevant
After a technician grinds off the excess flanges from the shell he will add a vent or opening,Relevant
A small piece of silicon wire shaped to the vent size is run through the inside of the shell and pulled out,Relevant
The technician drills holes into the canal end of the shell for the receiver tube,Relevant
After that the outside of the shell will be buffed to a smooth shiny finish,Relevant
A technician will size the shell for a face plate or flange—the area that will be exposed outside the ear canal—using the vacuum form from the original impression,Relevant
The plate will be carefully set at the correct angle for the users ear,Relevant
The components and circuits are run on a ceramic substrate base of various designs,Relevant
The substrate is made by a screen printing technique that alternates layers of conductive and insulating materials depending on the engineered design,Irrelevant
The conducting layer contains gold and silver and the insulating layers contain silicon compounds,Irrelevant
Between the printing of each layer the substrate is passed by a conveyor through a furnace where it bakes for two hours at 850°F (454°C),Relevant
This seals the layers and creates the color patterns characteristic of printed circuit boards only on a smaller scale,Relevant
The various electronic components are bonded by hand to the gold and silver parts on both sides of the substrate,Relevant
A technician will interconnect the devices using gold wire of 001 inch (025 mm) thickness,Relevant
Lastly the components are sealed in an epoxy paste and heathardened,Relevant

Working from the parts card or bill of materials determined at the outset of production a technician assembles the electronic hardware on the face plate where holes have been drilled for mounting the microphone amplifier battery compartment and volume control all handwired with colors for traceability,Irrelevant
The wires are soldered into place,Relevant
After this the receiver is mounted into the shell and a preliminary hearing check made on the instrument,Relevant
In the final production steps the parts are carefully packaged to avoid interferences,Relevant
A plastic cement is brushed on while the technician performs a listening check to make sure there is no oscillation in the sound quality,Relevant
Once the cement dries excess face plate is cut away and the remaining edge ground off with a hand lathe,Relevant
Finally the aid is buffed and shined to a high gloss and manufacturing is complete,Relevant
The aid is now ready for final testing,Relevant
The blade begins as a blank cut from flat material that is in a soft condition which means it has not been heat treated,Relevant
Massproduced knives are stamped in a punch press using a hardened punch and die shaped to match the outline of the blade,Relevant
The punch is forced through the material into the die blanking the rough blade into shape,Relevant
Custom knives may be cut out with a saw or an industrial laser may be used to cut especially intricate blades,Relevant
The most important part of the modern hunting knife the blade is made of steel or stainless steel,Irrelevant
Of particular importance is the carbon content of the metal which determines the hardness of the blade,Irrelevant
After the blank is cut holes for the handle stocks are drilled into the tang,Relevant
Rough shaping is also performed by grinding or machining,Relevant
This shaping forms the thickness of the blade at various points and reduces the amount of finish grinding on the sharp edge,Relevant
Any identifying markings or decorative details are stamped while the blade is in a soft condition,Relevant
The blade is hardened to preserve the sharpness of the knife edge,Relevant
Each blade material may require different hardening and heattreating methods however common steel blades are generally heat treated in the following manner,Irrelevant
To harden the blade several blades are placed into a ceramic tray in a heattreating oven,Relevant
They are laid flat so the weight of the blades does not cause warping,Relevant
Depending upon the specific requirements of the alloy the temperature in the oven is raised to approximately 1600°F (871°C),Irrelevant
After heating the blades for approximately two hours the entire tray is removed from the oven and the blades are submerged in oil or water,Relevant
This rapidly cools the blades and is called quenching,Irrelevant
The quenching locks the metal crystals into an intricate microscopic pattern,Relevant
This process also results in the metal becoming very brittle,Irrelevant
After quenching the blades are reheated to approximately 500°F (260°C),Relevant
At this point the metal has a slight darkreddish color and the crystals change their alignment slightly,Irrelevant
Then the blades are allowed to cool slowly in a process called tempering,Irrelevant
This toughens the metal while retaining some of the brittleness needed for fine sharpening,Irrelevant
Further heating and cooling cycles may be used to harden other specialized alloys,Relevant
After the heattreated blades are cool they are polished and sharpened,Relevant
Polishing is performed by machine or by hand,Relevant
A flat belt sander is used to produce a smooth even brushed finish to the sides of the blade,Relevant
This also polishes out any marks from the punch press operation and removes the surface residue from the heattreat operation,Relevant
Next the blade is placed into a grinding fixture that passes it through a series of grinding wheels,Relevant
Each rotating wheel removes the correct amount of metal to form the edge relief point rough edge angle and other features of the working portion of the blade,Irrelevant
When utility knives are made many of these features are left without further finishing since they are for functional rather than cosmetic purposes,Relevant
In the case of fancier knives these features may be hand polished using a rotating buffing wheel and jewelers rouge,Irrelevant
The rouge is a soft abrasive paste which when spread onto the cotton buffing wheel and then buffed against the blade surface polishes the metal to a high luster,Irrelevant
When the blade is finished with these steps it will be quite sharp and may appear ready to use,Relevant
However the final sharpening steps are required to produce a longlasting edge,Relevant
To the casual observer the knife edge appears as simply the result of two intersecting surfaces,Relevant
Upon closer examination the true form of the edge is seen to consist of two distinctly separate sets of angles,Irrelevant
The first is left by the rough grinding as explained above while the second is the fine angle that actually forms the cutting edge,Relevant
This edge is produced by a fine grinding operation called honing,Irrelevant
The angle of the hone may be between 17 and 30 degrees to the axis of the blade depending upon the blade application,Irrelevant
A smaller angle will produce a sharper edge but the edge will wear and become dull more quickly,Irrelevant
A fine grinding hone or stone is oiled and gently rubbed on the knife edge,Relevant
This action produces the finest sharpened edge and is the only true method of properly sharpening a knife blade,Relevant
When viewed under a microscope the rough ground edge appears as a series of jagged points,Irrelevant
While sharp enough to cut adequately in this condition the points wear easily and soon the sharpness is gone,Irrelevant
By honing these points are blended into a consistent edge of equal sharpness,Relevant
The stocks are riveted or pressed onto the tang of the knife blade,Relevant
A buffing wheel is used to smooth the stocks and blend the rivet heads,Relevant
In the case of a leather handle the washer segments are stacked onto the tang starting at the guard,Relevant
After the handle length is filled with leather the pommel is pressed onto the end of the tang and secured with a pin or rivet,Relevant
This squeezes the leather together making a tight easily gripped handle,Relevant
The leather may be shaped using a grinding wheel and then sealed with a penetrating sealer,Relevant
The guard and pommel can then be finished by polishing with the buffing wheel,Relevant
Great care must be taken during the assembly and finishing process as not to damage the knife blade or ruin the sharp edge,Relevant
The leather or nylon is fed into a cutting machine that stamps out eight standardized pieces four for the boot lining and four for the boot upper,Irrelevant
A similar machine cuts pieces for the tongue sole heel and reinforcement sections,Relevant
The pieces are mechanically punched with a date code size order number and eyelet holes,Relevant
The boot is sewn together on industrial sewing machines that the plant workers regulate with foot pedals or control panels,Relevant
The lining pieces are stitched together at the back and toe seams,Relevant
The upper pieces are stitched together in the same manner,Relevant
Stiffening material called a counter and usually made of leather or plastic is inserted from the ball of the boot around the heel to the middle of the arch to provide support for the ankle,Relevant
Reinforcement pieces are cemented onto the underside of the upper with latex or neoprene base cement,Relevant
Foam padding is layered on top of the reinforcement,Relevant
The lining is then sewn onto the upper boot through all three layers,Relevant
Excess edges are trimmed,Relevant
A line of topstitching provides additional support and decoration,Relevant
The eyelet placket is also reinforced by means of a strip of leather,Relevant
The tongue is lined with sponge rubber then tacked first to the lining and then to the boot upper using a crossbutterfly stitch,Relevant
The partially constructed boot is then subjected to a heat and moisture process called mulling that leaves the leather more pliable,Relevant
The boot is shaped by placing it on a last which is a plastic foot form corresponding to a particular shoe size and width,Relevant
The lasts resemble shoe trees,Irrelevant
A skate manufacturer can have as many as 102 sizes and widths for women and as many as 57 sizes for men,Irrelevant
This large difference in number of lasts may be due to several factors there are more women skaters (particularly in figure skating) than men thus increasing the variety demanded,Irrelevant
In addition women may be more particular about fit as evidenced by the wider variety of width and sizes for womens street shoes than mens,Irrelevant
First an insole is tacked onto the last,Relevant
Then the boot is pulled tight by hand over the bottom of the last,Relevant
The worker must make sure that all wrinkles are eliminated working from the arch to the heel then from the arch to the toe,Relevant
Tacks or cement adhere the arch heel and toe to the insole,Irrelevant
The tacks holding the insole to the last are removed,Relevant
The boot still stretched over the last is placed into a drying chamber,Relevant
Heat is applied to set the boot to the length and width of the last,Relevant
A worker then removes the last from the interior of the skate boot,Relevant
The boot is placed upside down on a peg under an electric grinder to remove the leather finish from the boot bottom,Relevant
The grinding process causes a crevice to form across the middle of the boot bottom where the foots natural arch occurs,Irrelevant
This crevice is packed with a synthetic filler and an 18gauge springsteel arch support shank,Relevant
A leather or rubber sole is then attached to the boot with a urethane base cement,Relevant
The heel is constructed by gluing square stacks of leather or waterrepellent fiberboard on top of each other,Relevant
The height and width of the heel varies with the type of skate,Irrelevant
The heel is glued onto the boot and then six to ten long nails are driven through the heel outsole and insole,Relevant
Finally the heel is trimmed and smoothed,Relevant
The sole and heel plates of the blade are lined up with the sole and heel area of the boot bottom,Relevant
The worker eyes the placement making sure that the blade is centered on the sole,Relevant
An equal amount of boot bottom should be exposed at the toe and heel,Relevant
The worker then screws the blade onto the boot using a highspeed drill on a footpowered press,Relevant
Only a few of the screws are inserted into the boot the remainder are packaged with the ice skates,Relevant
This allows the skater to adjust the blade as necessary before the remaining screws are inserted and tightened,Relevant
However the blades of skates fitted with rubber soles are permanently attached with rivets,Relevant
The completed skate is handpolished and sprayed with a solution to make it shine,Relevant
Laces are threaded through the eyelets,Relevant
The skates are then boxed for shipping,Relevant
Inline skates are manufactured using an assembly line process whereby all components move down a conveyor belt and are assembled piece by piece,Irrelevant
Inline boot shells are made by a process called injection molding,Irrelevant
Urethane plastic is injected into a mold to form the boot shell much like a ski boot,Relevant
Dye may be added for color,Relevant
When the mold has cooled the injectionmolding machine ejects the finished boot,Relevant
Soft cloth or plastic foam is cut to various sizes and inserted into the boot shell,Relevant
The dimensions of the liner should conform to the skaters foot,Relevant
The remaining shell cuff (as well as the tongue) metal buckles and plastic or velcro fasteners are attached to the shell,Relevant
Most of these pieces are bought prefabricated,Irrelevant
The frame including wheels and bearings is attached to the boot shell by rivets or by a coupling system,Relevant
The frame is often assembled ahead of time,Relevant
The wheels are placed in a row and attached to the frame,Relevant
On inexpensive models the boot and frame are injection molded as one unit,Irrelevant
Once the inline skate has been assembled it is boxed and delivered to stores,Relevant
Every robot begins with the design phase,Irrelevant

These and other factors must be accounted for in the design job to be performed speed of operation environment of operation hazardous materials involved length of reach path of travel process variables human involvement controller capability and result of failures,Irrelevant
Most manufacturers have a basic machine design to which they incorporate modifications and accessories to meet the specific requirements of the application,Irrelevant
Once designed the base arms column and supports are fabricated,Relevant
The base is usually heavy to prevent the robot from tipping over,Irrelevant
It is made by casting or by welding then machined,Irrelevant
Many robot manufacturers use robots to weld parts for new ones,Irrelevant
Those areas that mate with the rest of the robot are machined with close dimensional control to assure proper fit and operation of the attaching components,Irrelevant
Likewise the main column and arms are constructed to fit accurately into the final assembly,Relevant
Robots are assembled using a substantial amount of purchased components such as electric motors hydraulic cylinders bearings wiring controllers and other important parts,Irrelevant
An industrial robot can contain 2000 individual parts and is assembled by teams,Irrelevant
These teams begin with the base and assemble components into the robot until it is complete and ready for testing and finishing,Irrelevant
To begin the assembly process mobile robots first have the traction motors batteries axles wheels and tires mounted,Relevant
Stationary robots do not require these items,Irrelevant
They are temporarily bolted to the floor for stability during assembly,Relevant
The moving columns and arms are subassembled with their respective drive motors and then attached to the base,Relevant
The base contains a ring gear that is motor driven to provide the turning motion,Irrelevant
It must mate closely with the drive gear contained in the column,Irrelevant
Thrust bearings support the weight of column and arms on the base,Irrelevant
A magnetic scale surrounds the bearing and provides electronic position feedback to the controller,Irrelevant
The next joint is the link,Irrelevant
It acts like an elbow and connects the arm to the base,Irrelevant
A stabilizer support provides positional control to the link allowing it to move in a predetermined path,Irrelevant
These components contain bearing mounts into which pivot shafts are bolted,Irrelevant
Each bearing is prelubricated or provided with a lubrication line or fitting,Relevant
The link contains a position sensor which provides another position signal to the controller,Irrelevant
The arm is assembled onto the upright portion of the link,Relevant
It provides the most reach to the robot and supports the wrist,Irrelevant
The arm contains the drive shafts that operate the wrist,Irrelevant
Three motors or a combination of motors and hydraulic cylinders are connected to the drive shafts,Relevant
Since the arm and link joint must withstand the entire load of the wrist this is accomplished with large bearings and a pivot pin,Relevant
An industrial robot can contain 2000 individual parts and is assembled by teams,Irrelevant
These teams begin with the base and assemble components into the robot until it is complete and ready for testing and finishing,Irrelevant
The wrist is the critical mechanism of the robot,Irrelevant
It is the wrist that most replicates human motion by twisting and turning to place the paint gun welder or other tool in the correct position,Irrelevant
Many robots also have loadsensing electronics in the wrist to signal when an obstruction has been hit or when a load is too heavy to safely pick up,Irrelevant
Additional position sensors and tool control electronics are also assembled into the arm and wrist,Irrelevant
Once the mechanical assembly has been completed the wiring and plumbing of the robot can be finished,Relevant
All of the motors sensors and electrical components must have wires for power and to carry information back to the control computer,Relevant
Occasionally unused space in the arms and base provides a handy place to mount some of the controller electronics shortening the wiring paths,Irrelevant
Hydraulic and air cylinders have hoses that carry pressure to operate them controlled from the valves in the base,Irrelevant
Most of these wires and hoses are routed back to the controller cabinet which for mobile robots is attached to the base,Irrelevant
If the robot is stationary this controller is usually mounted several feet away and is connected by an umbilical cord,Irrelevant
After assembly the arms and column of the robot are sometimes covered with guards and shields to protect them from paint spray welding sparks or other hazards in the environment,Relevant
