Installation occurs at the users site,Relevant
If stationary the robot is secured to the floor with bolts,Relevant
If moving a guide wire is buried into the floor for the robot to follow from task to task,Relevant
It follows the wire by radio signals and also uses the wire to communicate with the central controller,Irrelevant
Recently lasers have been used to eliminate the wire,Irrelevant
The robot is guided through its path by a laser beam reflected off the walls,Relevant
Some designs also incorporate video cameras,Irrelevant
Stationary applications usually require that fences be constructed around the robot so an unsuspecting human doesnt wander into the robots work area and be injured,Irrelevant
After installation the robot manufacturer usually provides operation and maintenance training to the customer,Relevant
Hundreds of integrated circuits are made at the same time on a single thin slice of silicon and are then cut apart into individual IC chips,Irrelevant
The manufacturing process takes place in a tightly controlled environment known as a clean room where the air is filtered to remove foreign particles,Relevant
The few equipment operators in the room wear lintfree garments gloves and coverings for their heads and feet,Relevant
Since some IC components are sensitive to certain frequencies of light even the light sources are filtered,Irrelevant
Although manufacturing processes may vary depending on the integrated circuit being made the following process is typical,Irrelevant
A cylindrical ingot of silicon about 15 to 40 inches (38 to 102 cm) in diameter is held vertically inside a vacuum chamber with a hightemperature heating coil encircling it,Relevant
Starting at the top of the cylinder the silicon is heated to its melting point of about 2550°F (1400°C),Relevant
To avoid contamination the heated region is contained only by the surface tension of the molten silicon,Irrelevant
As the region melts any impurities in the silicon become mobile,Irrelevant
The heating coil is slowly moved down the length of the cylinder and the impurities are carried along with the melted region,Relevant
When the heating coil reaches the bottom almost all of the impurities have been swept along and are concentrated there,Relevant
The bottom is then sliced off leaving a cylindrical ingot of purified silicon,Relevant
A thin round wafer of silicon is cut off the ingot using a precise cutting machine called a wafer slicer,Relevant
Each slice is about 001 to 0025 inches (0004 to 001 cm) thick,Irrelevant
The surface on which the integrated circuits are to be formed is polished,Relevant
The surfaces of the wafer are coated with a layer of silicon dioxide to form an insulating base and to prevent any oxidation of the silicon which would cause impurities,Relevant

The silicon dioxide is formed by subjecting the wafer to superheated steam at about 1830°F (1000°C) under several atmospheres of pressure to allow the oxygen in the water vapor to react with the silicon,Irrelevant
Controlling the temperature and length of exposure controls the thickness of the silicon dioxide layer,Irrelevant
The complex and interconnected design of the circuits and components is prepared in a process similar to that used to make printed circuit boards,Irrelevant
For ICs however the dimensions are much smaller and there are many layers superimposed on top of each other,Irrelevant
The design of each layer is prepared on a computeraided drafting machine and the image is made into a mask which will be optically reduced and transferred to the surface of the wafer,Relevant
The mask is opaque in certain areas and clear in others,Irrelevant
It has the images for all of the several hundred integrated circuits to be formed on the wafer,Irrelevant
A drop of photoresist material is placed in the center of the silicon wafer and the wafer is spun rapidly to distribute the photoresist over the entire surface,Relevant
The photoresist is then baked to remove the solvent,Relevant
The coated wafer is then placed under the first layer mask and irradiated with light,Relevant
Because the spaces between circuits and components are so small ultraviolet light with a very short wavelength is used to squeeze through the tiny clear areas on the mask,Irrelevant
Beams of electrons or xrays are also sometimes used to irradiate the photoresist,Irrelevant
The mask is removed and portions of the photoresist are dissolved,Relevant
If a positive photoresist was used then the areas that were irradiated will be dissolved,Relevant
If a negative photoresist was used then the areas that were irradiated will remain,Relevant
The uncovered areas are then either chemically etched to open up a layer or are subjected to chemical doping to create a layer of P or N regions,Relevant
One method of adding dopants to create a layer of P or N regions is atomic diffusion,Irrelevant
In this method a batch of wafers is placed in an oven made of a quartz tube surrounded by a heating element,Relevant
The wafers are heated to an operating temperature of about 15002200°F (8161205°C) and the dopant chemical is carried in on an inert gas,Relevant
As the dopant and gas pass over the wafers the dopant is deposited on the hot surfaces left exposed by the masking process,Relevant
This method is good for doping relatively large areas but is not accurate for smaller areas,Irrelevant
There are also some problems with the repeated use of high temperatures as successive layers are added,Irrelevant
The second method to add dopants is ion implantation,Irrelevant
In this method a dopant gas like phosphine or boron trichloride is ionized to provide a beam of highenergy dopant ions which are fired at specific regions of the wafer,Relevant
The ions penetrate the wafer and remain implanted,Relevant
The depth of penetration can be controlled by altering the beam energy and the amount of dopant can be controlled by altering the beam current and time of exposure,Relevant
Schematically the whole process resembles firing a beam in a bent cathoderay tube,Relevant
This method is so precise it does not require masking—it just points and shoots the dopant where it is needed,Irrelevant
However it is much slower than the atomic diffusion process,Irrelevant
The process of masking and etching or doping is repeated for each successive layer depending on the doping process used until all of the integrated circuit chips are complete,Relevant
Sometimes a layer of silicon dioxide is laid down to provide an insulator between layers or components,Relevant

This is done through a process known as chemical vapor deposition in which the wafers surface is heated to about 752°F (400°C) and a reaction between the gases silane and oxygen deposits a layer of silicon dioxide,Irrelevant
A final silicon dioxide layer seals the surface a final etching opens up contact points and a layer of aluminum is deposited to make the contact pads,Relevant
At this point the individual ICs are tested for electrical function,Relevant
The thin wafer is like a piece of glass,Irrelevant
The hundreds of individual chips are separated by scoring a crosshatch of lines with a fine diamond cutter and then putting the wafer under stress to cause each chip to separate,Relevant
Those ICs that failed the electrical test are discarded,Relevant
Inspection under a microscope reveals other ICs that were damaged by the separation process and these are also discarded,Relevant
The good ICs are individually bonded into their mounting package and the thin wire leads are connected by either ultrasonic bonding or thermocompression,Relevant
The mounting package is marked with identifying part numbers and other information,Relevant
The completed integrated circuits are sealed in antistatic plastic bags to be stored or shipped to the end user,Relevant
After processing the ore is blended with other ore and goes to the blast furnace,Relevant
A blast furnace is a towershaped structure made of steel and lined with refractory or heatresistant bricks,Irrelevant
The mixture of raw material or charge enters at the top of the blast furnace,Relevant
At the bottom of the furnace very hot air is blown or blasted in through nozzles called tuyeres,Relevant
The coke burns in the presence of the hot air,Relevant
The oxygen in the air reacts with the carbon in the coke to form carbon monoxide,Relevant
The carbon monoxide then reacts with the iron ore to form carbon dioxide and pure iron,Relevant
The melted iron sinks to the bottom of the furnace,Relevant
The limestone combines with the rock and other impurities in the ore to form a slag which is lighter than the iron and floats on top,Relevant
As the volume of the charge is reduced more is continually added at the top of the furnace,Relevant
The iron and slag are drawn off separately from the bottom of the furnace,Relevant
The melted iron might go to a further alloying process or might be cast into ingots called pigs,Relevant
The slag is carried away for disposal,Relevant

The hot gases produced in the chemical reactions are drawn off at the top and routed to a gas cleaning plant where they are cleaned or scrubbed and sent back into the furnace the remaining carbon monoxide in particular is useful to the chemical reactions going on within the furnace,Relevant
A blast furnace normally runs day and night for several years,Irrelevant
Eventually the brick lining begins to crumble and the furnace is then shut down for maintenance,Relevant
Each manufacturers jelly bean and each new flavorcolor combination begin in a chemistry laboratory where the right balance of ingredients is mixed and developed in test batches,Irrelevant
New designer flavors are suggested based on marketing studies and the flavors are tested for taste and visual appeal in the laboratory,Irrelevant
Subsequently a new flavor will be manufactured over a trial time period and test marketed,Irrelevant
If the flavor proves popular it will become a new product,Irrelevant
The chemists also develop new flavors with an eye toward the consumers interest in natural products and they evaluate its nutrition facts including ingredients and caloric content,Irrelevant

After the chemists have finetuned their recipe the candy kitchen creates the syrup that forms the jelly bean center by dissolving the sugar and other ingredients in large boilers where the syrup is cooked to the proper temperature and consistency,Irrelevant
Flavor and color for the bean center are added to the syrup which is then piped to the starch casting area,Relevant
The kitchens also mix and cook the flavor and color syrups for the panning process described below,Relevant
These syrups are carefully transported to the panning room and are added in measured doses during panning,Relevant
Formation or shaping of a single jelly bean begins with a process called starch casting,Irrelevant
Dry corn starch is a fine white powder that retains impressions or shapes well,Irrelevant
A machine called a mogul deposits a layer of corn starch in a plastic tray and moves the tray to a machine die which presses dents into the corn starch,Irrelevant
Each tray may contain several hundred to over 1200 of these impressions or dents each of which is the size and shape of the center of a jelly bean,Irrelevant
The mogul moves the trays to a depositor or filling station where heated candy syrup is squirted into the tiny molds,Relevant

From the mogul conveyors carefully move the trays to cooling rooms in which temperature and humidity are controlled and where the liquid candy cools and sets up to form the gummy center of the jelly bean,Relevant
The panning process gives the jelly beans their outer color and flavor protective sugar shells and shiny glaze,Irrelevant
The trays of candy centers are dumped out,Relevant
The corn starch absorbs moisture from them during the cooling process but it is removed dried reprocessed and recycled to create molds for more candies,Relevant
The centers which are all the same flavor and color are placed in stainless steel vessels called pans that are globeshaped and hollow with an opening at one pole of the globe,Relevant
Just like globes the pans are tilted on their axes so the candies can be placed in them easily and so workers can add other ingredients through the openings,Relevant
At the bottom pole or axis end the vessel is linked to a rotating power source,Relevant
The pans rotate the jelly bean centers several hundred times per minute,Relevant
Sugar is added through the opening which gradually builds up on the soft center to form a harder sugar shell,Relevant
Workers add colors and flavors during the panning process by pouring beakers of syrup supplied by the candy kitchen through the opening in the vessel,Irrelevant
They can also observe the jelly bean shells as they form and become colored throughout the process,Irrelevant
The beans are essentially finished at this point but are rather dulllooking,Relevant
To give them their glossy coats a glaze of confectioners sugar is added while the beans are still revolving in the pans,Relevant
The process of making the jelly bean takes 6 to 10 days depending on the kind of bean and the manufacturer,Irrelevant
Packaging is the final step before sending the jelly beans to distributors,Irrelevant
Jelly beans are placed in trays after panning and are still segregated by color or flavor,Relevant
The trays of candies are taken to a large bin where they are dumped in and mixed to the desired combination of colors and flavors,Relevant
The mixing bin is a large rotating cylinder,Irrelevant
On one side a grid is set in the wall of the bin,Relevant
Beans that are too small fall through the openings in the grid and into a receiving bin while beans that are too large stick in the mesh and are removed later,Irrelevant
The beans that continue rotating are therefore only the desired size and shape,Relevant
They fall from the mixing bin onto a conveyor where workers inspect them and remove any candies that look imperfect,Relevant

The beans that pass inspection move on the conveyor to a packaging machine where the candy is weighed and bagged in any of several sizes of bags either for bulk sale or purchase by individual consumers,Relevant
The packaging machine can package and seal about 80000 bags of jelly beans a day,Relevant

Exceptions to the sorting and mixing process occur when jelly beans (usually the gourmet type) are packaged by single flavor or when the flavors are separated in small compartments in gift or sampler boxes that let the taster experience the unique flavors of designer beans,Irrelevant
The candies are still sized and inspected but individual flavors are then placed in funnellike bins,Relevant
The small openings fit the compartments in plastic trays in the gift boxes and a controlled quantity of each flavor is dropped into its specific tray compartment,Relevant
Although the candies are thoroughly mixed to try to get an equal distribution of colors the randomness of conveying and sorting may cause some variations in the mix,Relevant
The consumer who purchases the larger bag has a better chance statistically of getting a nearequal distribution of colors and flavors,Relevant
Slight variations in size and shape account for one bag of jelly beans containing more beans than the next even though the contents are weighed,Irrelevant
Some manufacturers put more than the stated weight in each package so the customer may actually get more beans than paid for in each bag,Relevant
The body of a polyethylene kayak is a long hollow shell of uniform thickness made by a process called rotational molding,Irrelevant
After the shell is made the seat and other components are added in a manual assembly process,Relevant
The shell may be molded in one piece or it may be made from two separate pieces which are joined later,Relevant
Rotational molding requires fairly rounded contours so onepiece shells cannot have sharp intersections between surfaces,Irrelevant
If the design requires a sharper intersection—such as between the hull and the deck for example—then a twopiece shell is used,Irrelevant
The process for making the twopiece shell is described here,Irrelevant

Measured amounts of powdered or granulated polyethylene plastic are mixed with coloring agents and an exact amount is loaded into the bottom of a twopiece thinwalled aluminum mold for either the hull or the deck,Relevant
The mold is then closed and the two halves secured tightly,Relevant
The mold is held by a mechanical arm which can rotate the mold in two directions at the same time,Relevant
The arm can also move or index the mold from one process station to another,Relevant
After the mold is loaded it is moved to the heating station where an oven heats it to 480840°F (250450°C),Relevant
As the heat from the mold melts the plastic the mold is slowly rotated in two directions,Relevant

Gravitational force causes the melted plastic to flow to the front and rear and up the sides of the rotating mold eventually covering the entire surface with a uniformly thick skin of plastic,Relevant
Continued heating then fuses the plastic into a solid layer that attaches itself to the mold,Relevant
Next the mold is indexed to the cooling chamber,Relevant
By continuing to rotate the mold and gradually cooling it with carefully directed sprays of air and then water the kayak hull or deck further hardens and shrinks away from the mold,Relevant
Repeated cycles of heating and cooling may be required to form the kayak properly,Relevant
After the final cooling the hull or deck is removed from the mold,Relevant
The hull and deck are designed so that they fit together at a single seam running horizontally along the length of the boat,Irrelevant
Careful sealing ensures that the shell acts as a single structural unit,Irrelevant
After sealing a decorative strip can be added to conceal the seam,Relevant
On some designs a keel stiffener is bonded along the length of the shell to give it added strength,Relevant
Closedcell foam flotation aids are inserted into each end of the kayak and held in place with adhesive,Relevant
Some kayaks use inflatable flotation bags instead,Irrelevant
These flotation aids keep the kayak level and floating on the surface should the craft capsize,Irrelevant
If the kayak design uses bulkheads then those pieces are bonded in place and sealed with a polyurethane sealant,Irrelevant
The seat is either suspended from straps attached to the sides or supported by a piece of foam bonded to the inside of the bottom of the hull,Relevant
Adjustable foot braces or rudder pedals are attached to the inside of the shell forward of the cockpit using noncorrosive metal fasteners,Relevant
The hatch covers have waterproof gaskets installed before they are put in place and the grab loops are installed,Relevant
Finally a drain plug is inserted in a molded hole in the shell,Relevant
Kayaks are relatively large but lightweight,Irrelevant
Packaging to protect the shell from abrasion is more important than providing a strong support,Relevant
Traditional methods of preparing a kayak for shipping include shrinkwrapping in plastic or placing the kayak in a cardboard box,Irrelevant
One environmentally sensitive approach uses heavy tarplike cloth bags,Irrelevant
Ketchup manufacturers must seek out the best quality tomatoes for their product,Irrelevant
Tomato varieties are developed which are superior in color flavor texture and yield,Relevant
Consistency is an important factor as slight variations in tomato characteristics could alter the flavor and color of the finished product,Irrelevant
Tomatoes are harvested mechanically between June and July,Relevant
The fruit is commonly conveyed by water from the trucks into a flume or an inclined channel,Relevant
The water method washes the tomatoes and protects them from bruising while they pass from the truck to the factory,Irrelevant
The US Department of Agriculture or state inspectors approve and grade tomatoes to meet initial requirements,Irrelevant
The tomatoes are sorted washed and chopped,Relevant
Next precooking or scaling in stainless steel vats preserves the tomatoes and destroys bacteria,Relevant
The chopped and precooked tomatoes are pumped into pulping machines or cyclones which separate seeds skins and stems from the pulp,Relevant
The pulp and juice are filtered through screens and processed further into ketchup though some may be stored in a paste for use later in the year,Relevant
The pulp is pumped into cooking tanks or kettles and heated to boiling,Relevant
Foaming may occur if fresh tomato pulp is used but can be corrected with antifoaming compounds or compressed air,Irrelevant
Precise amounts of sweeteners vinegar salt spices and flavorings are added to the tomato pulp,Relevant
Most spices are added early in the cooking process,Relevant
To avoid excessive evaporation volatile spice oils and vinegar must be mixed in later,Relevant
Onions and garlic can be mixed in with the spices placed in a separate bag or chopped and added to the pulp,Relevant
Salt and sugar may be added at any stage of cooking though it is better to add sugar later to prevent burning,Relevant
The mixture cooks for 3045 minutes and is circulated by rotating blades installed in the cookers,Relevant
The temperature must be carefully regulated to insure absorption of the ingredients without overcooking which creates a flat body,Relevant
Once the cooking is complete the ketchup mixture passes through a finishing machine,Relevant
Finishers remove excess fiber and particles through screens creating a smoother consistency,Relevant
The ketchup passes to a holding tank before further processing,Relevant
The ketchup may be milled at higher temperatures and pressures to achieve a smoother consistency,Relevant
The ketchup must be deaerated to prevent discoloration and growth of bacteria,Relevant
Excess air might also create unattractive air pockets and impede the closure process,Relevant
To prevent contamination the ketchup passes from the receiving tanks to the filling machines at a temperature not lower than 190°F (88°C),Relevant
The containers are filled with the ketchup and immediately sealed to retain the freshness of the product,Relevant
Ketchup containers come in various sizes and shapes including 14oz bottles No 10 cans pouch packs roomservice sizes and singleserve packets,Irrelevant
The containers must be cooled to prevent flavor loss through stack burning which occurs when ketchup stays at high temperatures after cooking is complete,Relevant
Containers of ketchup may be cooled in cold air or cold water,Relevant
Finally the ketchup containers are labeled and coded with product information including ingredients date and location of manufacture and shelflife,Relevant
The bottled ketchup may be inspected again before shipping,Relevant
The entire process of ketchup manufacturing generally takes two to three hours,Irrelevant
The first step in retrieving leadbearing ore is to mine it underground,Irrelevant
Workers using heavy machinery drill the rock from deep tunnels with heavy machinery or blast it with dynamite leaving the ore in pieces,Relevant
Then they shovel the ore onto loaders and trucks and haul it to a shaft,Relevant
The shaft at a large mine may be a mile or more from the drill or blast site,Irrelevant
The miners dump the ore down the shaft and from there it is hoisted to the surface,Relevant
After the ore is removed from the mine it is treated at a concentrating mill,Relevant
Concentrating means to remove the waste rock from the lead,Relevant
To begin the ore must be crushed into very small pieces,Relevant
The ore is ground at the mill leaving it in particles with diameters of 01 millimeter or less,Relevant
This means the individual granules are finer than table salt,Irrelevant
The texture is something like granulated sugar,Irrelevant
The principal lead ore galena is properly known as lead sulfide and sulfur makes up a substantial portion of the mineral,Irrelevant
The flotation process collects the sulfurbearing portions of the ore which also contains the valuable metal,Irrelevant
First the finely crushed ore is diluted with water and then poured into a tank called a flotation cell,Relevant
The ground ore and water mixture is called slurry,Irrelevant
One percent pine oil or a similar chemical is then added to the slurry in the tank,Relevant
The tank then agitates shaking the mixture violently,Relevant
The pine oil attracts the sulfide particles,Relevant
Then air is bubbled through the mixture,Relevant
This causes the sulfide particles to form an oily froth at the top of the tank,Irrelevant
The waste rock which is called gangue sinks to the bottom,Relevant
The flotation process is controlled by means of Xray analyzers,Relevant
A flotation monitor in the control room can check the metal content of the slurry using the Xray analysis,Relevant
Then with the aid of a computer the monitor may adjust the proportion of the chemical additive to optimize recovery of the metal,Relevant
Other chemicals are also added to the flotation cell to help concentrate the minerals,Relevant
Alum and lime aggregate the metal or make the particles larger,Relevant
Xanthate is also added to the slurry in order to help the metal particles float to the surface,Relevant
At the end of the flotation process the lead has been separated from the rock and other minerals too such as zinc and copper have been separated out,Relevant
After the ore is concentrated in the flotation cells it flows to a filter which removes up to 90 of the water,Relevant
The concentrate at this point contains from 4080 lead with large amounts of other impurities mostly sulfur and zinc,Irrelevant
It is ready at this stage to be shipped to the smelter,Irrelevant
The gangue or rock that was not mineralbearing must be pumped out of the flotation tank,Relevant
It may be dumped into a pond resembling a natural lake and when the pond eventually fills the land can be replanted,Relevant
The lead concentrate fresh from the filter needs to be further refined to remove the sulfur,Irrelevant
After the concentrate is unloaded at what is called the sinter plant it is mixed with other leadbearing materials and with sand and limestone,Relevant
Then the mixture is spread on a moving grate,Relevant
Air which has been heated to 2550°F (1400°C) blows through the grate,Relevant
Coke is added as fuel and the sulfur in the ore concentrate combusts to sulfur dioxide gas,Relevant
This sulfur dioxide is an important byproduct of the lead refining process,Irrelevant
It is captured at a separate acid plant and converted to sulfuric acid which has many uses,Relevant
After the ore has been roasted in this way it fuses into a brittle material called sinter,Relevant
The sinter is mostly lead oxide but it can also contain oxides of zinc iron and silicon some lime and sulfur,Relevant
As the sinter passes off the moving grate it is broken into lumps,Relevant
The lumps are then loaded into the blast furnace,Relevant
The sinter falls into the top of the blast furnace along with coke fuel,Relevant
A blast of air comes through the lower part of the furnace combusting the coke,Relevant
The burning coke generates a temperature of about 2200°F (1200°C) and produces carbon monoxide,Relevant
The carbon monoxide reacts with the lead and other metal oxides producing molten lead nonmetallic waste slag and carbon dioxide,Relevant
Then the molten metal is drawn off into drossing kettles or molds,Relevant
The molten lead as it comes from the blast furnace is from 9599 pure,Relevant
It is called at this point base bullion,Irrelevant
It must be further refined to remove impurities because commercial lead must be from 9999999 pure,Relevant
To refine the bullion it is kept in the drossing kettle at a temperature just above its melting point about 626°F (330°C),Relevant
At this temperature any copper left in the bullion rises to the top of the kettle and forms a scum or dross which can be skimmed off,Relevant
Gold and silver can be removed from the bullion by adding to it a small quantity of zinc,Relevant
The gold and silver dissolves more easily in zinc than in lead and when the bullion is cooled slightly a zinc dross rises to the top bringing the other metals with it,Relevant
When the lead has been sufficiently refined it is cooled and cast into blocks which may weigh as much as a ton,Relevant
This is the finished product,Irrelevant
Lead alloys may also be produced at the smelter plant,Relevant
In this case metals are added to the molten lead in precise proportions to produce a lead material for specific industrial uses,Relevant
For example the lead commonly used in car batteries and also for pipe sheet cable sheathing and ammunition is alloyed with antimony because this increases the metals strength,Irrelevant
The skins are trimmed and sorted according to size weight and thickness,Relevant
It is necessary to remove any remaining proteins that could stimulate the growth of bacteria,Relevant
To this end the skins are soaked in revolving drums filled with water bactericides and detergents,Relevant
Hair is removed with the application of chemical sprays or lime solutions,Relevant
A scudding machine fitted with dull blades scrapes off any excess hair,Relevant
Another round of washing (deliming) removes these chemicals before the hides are soaked in an acid solution and then bated an enzyme treatment to further remove the skins collagens,Relevant
Finally the hides are pickled with salt and sulfuric acid,Relevant
The hides undergo one of three types of tanning,Irrelevant
Vegetable tanning requires the most time with the skins soaked in progressively stronger tannic acid solutions for several weeks,Relevant
However some soft leathers such as lambskin may be soaked for as little as 12 hours,Irrelevant
Mineral tanning is significantly faster but can change the color of the leather,Irrelevant
For this method the skins are placed in alum saltfilled drums fitted with paddles that provide a constant agitating motion,Relevant
The third method oil tanning is the one that resembles the ancient methods most closely,Irrelevant
Here fish oil is sprayed onto the skins,Relevant
After the skins have been tanned they are washed once again and wrung out thoroughly,Relevant
Then the skins are passed under a band knife which cuts the skins to a uniform thickness and placed on conveyer belts which carry them to drying tunnels,Relevant
Usually the skins are stretched on frames to prevent shrinkage during the drying stage,Relevant
To combat the stiffness that drying produces the hides are sprayed with water and soap and allowed to hang for a period of time,Relevant
After the skins have been conditioned they are placed in machines designed to rhythmically manipulate the leather so that the fibers are further loosened and made more flexible,Relevant
In the final drying period the hides are hung in vacuumdrying cabinets,Relevant
When the skins are thoroughly dried they are buffed with revolving steel cylinders covered with abrasive paper,Relevant
Suede finishes are produced by passing the hides under highspeed emery wheels,Relevant
At this point glazes dyes and lacquers are applied,Relevant
The skins are now ready to be sent to the garment factory,Relevant
The development of highspeed sewing machinery changed the face of traditional sewing factories where one person may have worked on a single garment from start to finish,Irrelevant
Because leather garments are considered luxury items handconstruction by highly skilled artisans is still sought by many consumers,Irrelevant
However the following steps are those used in factory mass production,Irrelevant
Garment manufacturers typically employ designers to create patterns from which the clothing is made,Relevant
Computerized machines grade the designs according to government anthropometric tables which assign sizes based on body height and weight,Irrelevant
The computer then produces patterns in a range of sizes from the original design,Relevant
The tanned leather is placed on moving tables called spreaders,Relevant
Although modern technology allows several layers of fabric to be cut simultaneously leather is usually cut one layer at a time,Relevant
The pattern is placed on top of the leather,Relevant
This is accomplished in one of two ways tissuepaper patterns may be pinned onto the leather or the pattern may be marked with tailors chalk,Irrelevant
The spreading table works on the conveyer system moving the fabric to the cutting machine which is fitted with either rotary blades or bandknives,Relevant
The table is either guided by a human operator or run automatically,Irrelevant
The most recent technological advance is the computerized laser beam system in which the fabric seams are vaporized rather than cut,Irrelevant
Lining material for the jacket is cut in the same manner,Relevant
Because it is of a much thinner weight lining can be placed on the spreaders in multiple layers,Irrelevant
The jacket is assembled in roughly this order the sides are stitched to the back portion sleeve underseams are stitched together and the sleeves are attached to the armholes,Relevant
The attachment of finishing pieces such as collars cuffs buttonholes buttons zippers and pockets varies according to the design of the jacket,Relevant
Patch pockets are sewn onto the side pieces before they are stitched to the back portion and side pockets are sewn in at the same time that the sides are attached to the back,Relevant
Generally lining material is attached to each piece before it is sewn onto the jacket,Relevant
In mass production the pieces are moved along a highly sophisticated production line using integrated automatic sewing machines that are capable of sewing as many as 8000 stitches per minute,Relevant
In a sequential system one sewing machine stitches a particular section of the jacket and then moves the garment to another sewing machine which performs the next step,Relevant
For example after one machine stitches a cuff to the sleeve the sleeve moves to another machine where it is attached to the jacket armhole,Irrelevant
A tandem sewing system calls for two or more machines to work on the same garment simultaneously,Irrelevant
In this instance one machine attaches buttons to the front of the jacket while another machine applies the collar,Relevant
Each step from setting thread and needle positions to aligning the fabric to extracting the sewed materials is preprogrammed,Irrelevant
Each sewing machine is equipped with underbed trimming devices that automatically knot and cut threads after each seam is sewn,Irrelevant
Excess threads are carried away to waste receptacles by streams of compressed air,Relevant
Operators regulate the work at each station with a modified presserfoot or from a control panel,Relevant
A stopmotion device allows the operator to halt production to make adjustments such as replacing broken threads or needles,Irrelevant
A number of pressing processes incorporating heat application steaming and blocking are employed to complete the transformation of the animal skins into a jacket,Irrelevant
Buck presses equipped with controls and gauges to regulate the amount of steam and pressure are used to give the jacket its distinctive shape whether a bomber or blazerstyled jacket,Irrelevant
Curved blocks are placed around the collars and cuffs and then heat is applied,Relevant
The blocks are removed leaving the collars and cuffs curved,Relevant
Each jacket is inspected by hand before it leaves the factory floor,Relevant
The completed jackets are then sheathed in plastic bags packed into cartons and shipped to the retailer,Relevant

The steps in the manufacture of life vests are similar to those for any automated garment manufacturing process differing in specific features such as raw materials and more importantly safety specifications,Irrelevant
The operations necessary to complete a garment from scratch are known in the industry as cutfittrim,Irrelevant
As many as 100 life vests may be manufactured simultaneously in an automated manufacturing process such as the one described here,Irrelevant
Pattern designs are digitally fed from a computer into a machine called a plotter which draws a stencil of the pattern design on long sheets of white paper,Relevant
The drawn sheets are called markers,Irrelevant
A machine called a spreader unrolls a bolt of nylon fabric along a table usually 6672 inches (168183 cm) wide and up to 100 feet (31 m) long,Relevant
Thin fabrics such as nylon may be layered 25 deep for cutting,Irrelevant
Wrinkles are smoothed by the spreader or by hand and the marker is laid on top of the nylon,Irrelevant
Some manufacturers use an automated cutting machine to cut the pattern pieces out of the nylon,Relevant
Other manufacturers may cut the pieces by hand using a portable motordriven straight knife which resembles a jig saw,Relevant
In automated cutting the digital pattern is fed into the cutting machine,Irrelevant
A sheet of cellophane wider than the fabric is drawn over the top of the marker and fabric layers,Relevant
A vacuum pulls the cellophane down tight against the table holding the marker and nylon layers in place,Relevant
A knife cuts the pattern out of cellophane marker and fabric layers at the same time,Relevant
The cut pattern pieces are then bundled for transfer to assembly areas,Relevant
The marker which can be read through the cellophane identifies the pattern pieces,Relevant
The closedcell foam is sliced to the desired thickness with a type of band saw called a splitter,Relevant
A band saw has a long thin blade welded in a continuous loop that travels over a driven wheel up and over one or more idler wheels and then down through the material being cut,Irrelevant
The foam then goes through the pattern cutting process in the same way as the nylon,Relevant
Reflective tape and small attachable pieces such as straps are cut from rolls with a smaller cutting machine called a die cutter,Relevant
Sewing professionals each stationed at an industrial sewing machine match the pieces and sew them together,Relevant
The pieces are sewn inside out and then reversed,Relevant
The cut foam pieces are inserted through an open seam which is then sewn shut,Relevant
Straps reflective tape and labels are sewn on last,Relevant
Snaps are attached by an eyelet or riveting machine much like that used by a shoemaker for shoelace holes,Relevant
A computeraided embroidery machine—much like those used by department stores to personalize towels—is used to embroider brand names and logos,Relevant
Individual finished vests are placed in plastic bags for protection,Relevant
The bags are packed into corrugated boxes and sent to distribution centers,Relevant
Just as the materials are different for different kinds of magnets the manufacturing processes are also different,Irrelevant
Many electromagnets are cast using standard metal casting techniques,Irrelevant
Flexible permanent magnets are formed in a plastic extrusion process in which the materials are mixed heated and forced through a shaped opening under pressure,Relevant
Some magnets are formed using a modified powdered metallurgy process in which finely powdered metal is subjected to pressure heat and magnetic forces to form the final magnet,Relevant

Here is a typical powdered metallurgy process used to produce powerful neodymiumironboron permanent magnets with crosssectional areas of about 310 square inches (2065 sq cm) 1 The appropriate amounts of neodymium iron and boron are heated to melting in a vacuum,Relevant
The vacuum prevents any chemical reaction between air and the melting materials that might contaminate the final metal alloy,Relevant
Once the metal has cooled and solidified it is broken up and crushed into small pieces,Relevant
The small pieces are then ground into a fine powder in a ball mill,Relevant
The powdered metal is placed in a mold called a die that is the same length and width (or diameter for round magnets) as the finished magnet,Relevant
A magnetic force is applied to the powdered material to line up the powder particles,Relevant

While the magnetic force is being applied the powder is pressed from the top and bottom with hydraulic or mechanical rams to compress it to within about 0125 inches (032 cm) of its final intended thickness,Relevant
Typical pressures are about 10000 psi to 15000 psi (70 MPa to 100 MPa),Irrelevant
Some shapes are made by placing the powdered material in a flexible airtight evacuated container and pressing it into shape with liquid or gas pressure,Relevant
This is known as isostatic compaction,Irrelevant
The compressed slug of powdered metal is removed from the die and placed in an oven,Relevant
The process of heating compressed powdered metals to transform them into fused solid metal pieces is called sintering,Irrelevant
The process usually consists of three stages,Irrelevant
In the first stage the compressed material is heated at a low temperature to slowly drive off any moisture or other contaminants that may have become entrapped during the pressing process,Relevant

In the second stage the temperature is raised to about 7090 of the melting point of the metal alloy and held there for a period of several hours or several days to allow the small particles to fuse together,Relevant
Finally the material is cooled down slowly in controlled stepbystep temperature increments,Relevant
The sintered material then undergoes a second controlled heating and cooling process known as annealing,Relevant
This process removes any residual stresses within the material and strengthens it,Relevant
The annealed material is very close to the finished shape and dimensions desired,Irrelevant
This condition is known as nearnet shape,Irrelevant
A final machining process removes any excess material and produces a smooth surface where needed,Relevant
The material is then given a protective coating to seal the surfaces,Relevant
Up to this point the material is just a piece of compressed and fused metal,Irrelevant
Even though it was subjected to a magnetic force during pressing that force didnt magnetize the material it simply lined up the loose powder particles,Irrelevant
To turn it into a magnet the piece is placed between the poles of a very powerful electromagnet and oriented in the desired direction of magnetization,Relevant
The electromagnet is then energized for a period of time,Relevant
The magnetic force aligns the groups of atoms or magnetic domains within the material to make the piece into a strong permanent magnet,Relevant
Sand soda lime and crushed cullet are fed into a large furnacedriven tank,Relevant
In the tank the mixture is heated to 2300°F (1260°C) to melt the raw materials,Relevant
This can take as long as 28 hours,Irrelevant
Next the molten mixture moves out of the tank through an opening into another vat known as the flow tank,Relevant
There an opening in the tank injects molten colored glass,Relevant
This hot pigmented glass gives the marbles their distinct appearance,Relevant
A green marble has been injected with glass containing iron oxide cobalt results in a blue marble and manganese will yield a purple one,Relevant
The use of uranium oxide gives marbles an eerie greenishyellow cast,Relevant
The speed and force of the injection determines the final design of the marble,Irrelevant
A grooved feeder device patented by the Akro Agate Company was able to produce multicolored marbles known as corkscrews,Irrelevant
Next the stillmolten glass is released from the flow tank as globs of glass,Relevant
Automatic cutting devices slice the mixture into equal parts,Relevant
The globs travel down metal ramps that simultaneously cool them and perfect their spherical shape,Relevant
Next they travel down a second metal slide and are sorted by hand,Relevant
These grooved rollers were the invention of Horace Hill a former employee of Christensen and Son and later founder of Akro Agate,Irrelevant
This device produced marbles much more quickly and reduced the labor necessary by nearly twothirds,Irrelevant
Marbles with flaws are sent back to another area of the factory for remelting,Relevant
The marbles cool off in 5gallon (19 1) containers that house 5000 marbles at a time,Relevant
The milking machine components are created and assembled in several major manufacturing plants throughout the world using traditional processes and procedures,Relevant
Stainless steel and plastic are used for containers and liners and cast iron and steel for vacuum pumps controls and metering devices,Relevant
Here stainless steel is received in large sheet or tube form,Relevant
Stainless steel is used to fabricate components that will come in contact with milk,Irrelevant
The sheets are protected from scratches by a vinyl lining which will be removed later after forming and machining,Relevant
Milking machine components are created using stainless steel and plastic for containers and liners and cast iron and steel for vacuum pumps controls and metering devices,Relevant
At this point the stainless steel from the foundry has a dull finish,Irrelevant
The steel sheets may be sent directly to a polishing station where large machines create a smooth finish,Relevant
Once the initial finish is achieved the sheets may move on rollers to numerically controlled punch machines where they are cut into shapes for various parts,Relevant
From there some parts are formed or bent into shape on large brakes,Relevant
Mounting panels for controls structural components and small detail parts for the claws and pumps are made at this stage,Irrelevant
The shell that contains the liner is fabricated as an extrusion,Relevant
This process involves forcing steel tubing over a die under heat and pressure to form the elongated rigid piece,Relevant
The claw is made as a series of smaller extruded pieces of tubing that form the manifold which spaces the teatcups in a cluster formation,Relevant
The extrusions are then manually welded together in fixtures according to the desired size,Relevant
Both the completed claws and shell have a dull finish that will require polishing,Relevant
Receiver tanks are stainless steel tanks that receive milk from the milk lines generally holding from 1526 gallons (60100 1),Relevant
Although some are customized plastic most are steel with the heads or ends spun on specialty machines,Irrelevant
This production technique shapes a thin steel disc as it is being turned in a lathe,Irrelevant
The disc is shaped as it is forced over a steel shape or mandrel,Irrelevant
Once the operator forms the ends of the receiver as cups another technician will weld the body to the head leaving orifices or openings for milk input and output,Relevant
Individually manufactured the receivers will also be polished by hand,Relevant
Some receivers will have translucent plastic panel inserts so that dairy farmers can visually gauge the cows milk production,Relevant
All major stainless steel components are polished to the familiar finish associated with foodhandling equipment,Relevant
The manufacturers use a variety of mechanized belts cloths and spinning wheels in what becomes a very labor intensive process to meet government and industry sanitary standards,Relevant
This polishing is in addition to the polishing the large stainless sheets undergo following receiving,Irrelevant
Workers wield an assortment of hand polishers and attachments to shine all contact and protective surfaces from the claws to receivers to pipelines,Irrelevant
These drivers of air and fluids through the system are manufactured by select vendors,Relevant

The unit is basically a sealed iron case with a set of timing gears inside and an impeller resembling two blades or paddles on a shaft that spins at over 3000 revolutions per minute to create a vacuum that will draw fluids in the line,Irrelevant
The making of the pumps requires raw castings to be poured for the various parts,Irrelevant

The rough parts are handmachined on a bench by technicians and then placed on a CNC rotating cutter table where the cutting stone makes two precise passes along the predetermined edges to cut away any rough surfaces,Irrelevant
The assembly of the major components—along with seals bearings and shafts—is critical because a variation of just 0002 inch can change the balance and affect the pump,Irrelevant
The components are placed on a coordinate measuring machine where the profile is checked so that all parts fit properly,Relevant
The technicians using feeler gauges will set proper clearances before locking the critical gear parts in place and bolting the unit together,Relevant
Then they will run the pumps in a test booth before releasing them for distribution,Relevant
The manufactured and purchased parts are placed in several different areas where the milking machine subassemblies come together,Relevant
Technicians will select the parts according to the system design specifications often customized to meet certain operations,Relevant
It is at this stage that pressures and loads will gauge equipment performance,Irrelevant

Final assembly of all machine components will not occur until after shipment to the farm and installation in bams where often elaborate stalls and stations will be used to maximize the milk harvest,Irrelevant
Workers at assembly will also make initial line connections from valves to pumps to meters checking for tolerances and poor fits,Irrelevant
Vacuum pumps or blowers the heart of the milking system are tested so that both milk and accompanying air can be efficiently removed,Relevant
The pumps will be tested under simulated loads,Relevant
Vacuum controllers which admit the necessary air to maintain the proper vacuum level are selected,Relevant
The air lines and milk lines are selected to size and connection hardware grouped,Relevant
Controls also purchased are prepared for installation,Relevant
Most nails are made from coils of metal wire,Irrelevant
The wire is fed into a nailmaking machine which can produce up to 700 nails per minute,Relevant
The nails may then be further twisted or formed cleaned finished and packaged,Relevant
Wire is drawn from a coil and fed into the nailmaking machine where it is gripped by a pair of gripper dies,Relevant
The shape of the head of the nail has been machined into the end of the dies,Irrelevant
While the dies clamp the wire in place the free end of the wire is struck by a mechanical hammer,Relevant
This deforms the end of the wire into the die cavity to form the head of the nail,Relevant
With the wire still clamped in the dies a set of shaped cutters strike the opposite end of the nail forming the point and cutting the nail free from the rest of the wire coming off the coil,Relevant
The dies open and an expelling mechanism knocks the nail into a collection pan below the machine,Relevant
The free end of the wire is drawn from the coil and fed into the machine,Relevant
The cycle then begins again,Irrelevant
Nails with helical twists serrations or other surface configurations are fed into other machines that roll twist stamp or cut the required forms,Irrelevant
This may be a purely mechanical process or may require heating the material before forming,Irrelevant
The nails are cleaned in a rotating barrel filled with hot caustic soda,Relevant
This removes any oil from the forming machine and cleans up any small metal scraps or nippings that might be clinging to the nails,Relevant
Many nails are given a final bright finish before being packaged,Relevant
This is accomplished by placing the nails in a rotating drum of hot sawdust to lightly polish the surface of the nails,Relevant
Other nails may be passed through an open flame in an oven to give them a blued finish,Relevant
Galvanized nails are dipped into a tank of molten zinc in a process called hotdip galvanizing,Relevant
A zinc coating may also be applied by heating the nails to about 570°F (300°C) in a closed container filed with a powder composed of zinc dust and zinc oxide,Relevant
Other coated nails are either dipped or sprayed to obtain their final finish,Relevant
Depending on the tolerances desired some specialty nails may also require an additional heat treating step,Relevant
Magnetic elevators convey the finished nails to weighing machines which drop them into open cardboard boxes,Relevant
As they are dropped in a magnetic field aligns them so they stack in neat rows,Irrelevant
After they are packaged the nails are demagnetized,Relevant
Nails are usually sold in boxes of 1 5 10 25 and 50 pounds,Irrelevant
Smaller nails such as brads are sold in 2ounce or 4ounce boxes and are packaged without being magnetically aligned,Relevant
Manufacturing neon signs is largely a manual process,Irrelevant
It consists of bending the tubing and attaching the electrodes removing any impurities from within the tubing then evacuating the air and adding the gas,Relevant
The following process is typical,Irrelevant
Lengths of glass tubing are cleaned and placed vertically in a coating machine,Relevant
The machine blows a liquid phosphor suspension upwards into the tube and then lets it drain back out the bottom,Relevant
The tubes are placed vertically in an oven which dries the coating,Relevant
Color tints are applied in a similar manner,Relevant
Tubes that are to be filled with neon to form a red or orange light or argon to form a blue light are left clear,Relevant
The design of the sign is laid out in full size on a heatresistant sheet of asbestos,Relevant
The glass tubing is carefully heated and softened using a variety of burners,Relevant
Gasfired ribbon burners 24 inches (61 cm) or longer are used to make curves in round letters and the sweeping curves of script,Relevant
Smaller hand torches are used to heat shorter lengths,Relevant
Using the asbestos template as a guide the tubing is bent by hand,Relevant
The tube benders do not wear protective gloves because they must be able to feel the heat transfer and the degree of softening in the glass to determine the right moment to make the bend,Irrelevant
To prevent the softened tubing from collapsing the tube bender attaches a short length of flexible hose called a blow hose to one end,Relevant
While the glass is still soft the tube bender gently blows into the hose to force the tubing back to its original diameter,Relevant
Tubes with restricted diameters will not operate properly,Irrelevant
Most large neon signs are made of several sections of glass tubing,Irrelevant
A length of 810 feet (2442591 m) for each section is considered a practical limit,Irrelevant
To make each section the ends of two lengths of tubing are heated and spliced together,Relevant
When the shape of the lettering or design has been formed for a section an electrode is heated and fused onto each end,Relevant
A small port called a tubulation is added to allow the tubing to be evacuated with a vacuum pump,Relevant
This tubulation port may be part of one of the electrodes or may be a separate piece joined into the tubing,Irrelevant
A process known as bombarding is used to remove any impurities from the glass phosphors and electrodes,Irrelevant
First the air inside the tubing is evacuated,Relevant
After the vacuum reaches a certain level dry air is allowed back into the tubing until the pressure is in the range of 002004 inches (0442010 mm) of mercury,Relevant
The longer the tubing the lower the pressure may have to be,Irrelevant
A very highcurrent transformer is connected to the electrodes,Relevant
For a length of tubing that may normally run on 30 milliamperes 400750 milliamperes may used for the bombarding process,Irrelevant
The high current heats the glass to about 420°F (216°C) and the metal electrode is heated to about 1400°F (760°C),Relevant
This heating forces the impurities out of the materials and the vacuum pump carries the impurities out of the system,Relevant
Once the tube has cooled the gas is inserted under low pressure,Relevant
The gas must be free from impurities in order for the sign to operate properly and have a long life,Irrelevant
The normal fill pressure for a tube 06 inches (15 mm) in diameter is about 05 inches (12 mm) of mercury,Irrelevant
The tubulation port is then heated and sealed off,Relevant
The finished gasfilled tubing is put through an aging process,Irrelevant
Sometimes this process is referred to as burning in the tube,Irrelevant
The purpose is to allow the gas in the tube to stabilize and operate properly,Irrelevant
A transformer often rated slightly higher than the normal operating current is attached to the electrodes,Relevant
The tube should come to full illumination within 15 minutes if neon is used,Relevant
It may take up to a few hours for argon,Irrelevant
If a small amount of mercury is to be added to an argon tube a droplet was first placed into the tubulation port before it was sealed,Relevant
The droplet is then rolled from one end to the other to coat the electrodes after the aging process,Relevant
Any problems such as a flicker in the gas or a hot spot on the tube indicate the tubing must be opened and the bombarding and filling processes repeated,Irrelevant
Small neon signs are mounted on their framework and wired in the shop,Relevant
Larger signs may be mounted in pieces and put into place on the building or other support structure where they are interconnected and wired,Relevant
Very large installations may require months to install,Relevant
The composing room receives the story in an electronic format with the computer text file already translated with typeset codes,Irrelevant
In a typeset file the characters are of the same type—style size and width—as they appear on the pages of the newspaper,Irrelevant
The setting of stories into the type that a reader sees went unchanged for several decades until the latter years of the 20th century,Irrelevant
Well into the 1800s type was set by hand letter by letter,Irrelevant
A typesetter dropped small metal letters into a handheld tray called a stick,Irrelevant
The invention of the Linotype machine in 1884 made possible a quicker more efficient method of typesetting ,Irrelevant

Invented by German immigrant Ottmar Mergenthaler of Baltimore Maryland this large cumbersome machine worked by casting hot lead into a line of type with the assistance of an operator who typed in the copy on a keyboard ,Irrelevant
Individual lines of type were then placed by hand onto a page form ,Irrelevant
When a page was completed it was then sent to a stereotyping room where a curved metal plate was made from the page form ,Irrelevant
The page form was then placed on the printing press ,Relevant
Modern technology has replaced the Linotype process through a method called phototypesetting ,Irrelevant
The first step in this process is the transfer of the dummy to the page layout section of the newspaper ,Relevant
There an operator transfers the instructions on the dummy into a rough page prototype ,Relevant
A printed version may be looked over and adjusted several times by one of the reporters whose story is featured as well as by the copy editor ,Relevant
If another breaking story comes in this page layout can be altered in a matter of minutes ,Relevant

The final version of the page is then approved by the editor on duty—sometimes a night editor in the case of a paper that is slated for a morning edition—and sent over to a process department ,Relevant
There the page is taken in its computer format and transferred via laser beams onto film in an image setter apparatus ,Relevant
The operator then takes the film to a processor in another section of the paper who develops it and adjusts it for its final look ,Relevant
Photographs are scanned into another computer terminal and inserted into the page layout ,Relevant
The pages that are set to be printed together are then taped down onto a device called a stripper and an editor checks them over once more for errors,Relevant
The strippers are then put into frames on lightsensitive film and the image of each page is burned onto the film,Relevant
The film of each page is inserted into a laser reader a large facsimile machine that scans the page and digitally transfers the images to the printing center of the newspaper,Relevant

At the printing center typically a large plant separate from the newspapers editorial offices and centrally located to facilitate citywide distribution the pages arrive at the laser room and are put through a laser writer another scanning device that makes a negative image of them,Relevant
In the negative image of the page the text is white while the blank spaces are black,Relevant
The final images of each page are further adjusted,Relevant
This lastminute adjustment may involve finetuning of the colored sections and retouching photographs,Relevant
From these negatives the forms from which the paper will be printed are composed in a platemaking room,Relevant
The film of the page usually done two pages at a time is then placed on a lighted box,Relevant
Next an aluminum plate containing a lightsensitive coating is placed on top of the image of the pages,Relevant
The light box is then switched on and ultraviolet light develops the image of the pages onto the aluminum plate,Relevant
The aluminum plate is then bent at the edges so that it will fit into a press and is fitted onto plate cylinders,Relevant
The aluminum plates of each page next move on to the actual printing press an enormous machine often two stories high,Relevant
When the press is running the noise in the building is deafening and employees must wear earplugs,Irrelevant
The most common method of printing newspapers is called web offset,Irrelevant
The web refers to the large sheets of blank newsprint that are inserted in rolls sometimes weighing over a ton into the actual printing press,Irrelevant
The reels of newsprint are loaded in at the bottom floor of the press,Relevant

The rolls are inserted onto a reel stand which has three components the first reel brings a roll of paper up to the press a second is loaded and ready to replace the first roll when it runs out and a third reel stays empty and ready to be fed with another when the first reel is almost finished,Relevant

Each roll of blank newsprint has doublesided tape at its edges so that when one roll runs out in the press another smoothly takes up where the other left off without interrupting the printing process,Irrelevant
The plate cylinders then press the image of the page onto a blanket cylinder leaving a version of the pages image on the cylinders soft material,Relevant
When the paper runs through the press the blanket cylinder presses the image onto it,Relevant
The chemical reaction of the ink which contains oil and the squirting of jets of water into the process result in the actual newspaper page of black or colored images on a white background,Relevant
Since oil and water do not mix the areas where ink should adhere to the page are black or colored and water washes away the parts where ink is not needed,Relevant
This is why this printing process is referred to as offset,Irrelevant
Next the large sheets of printed newsprint move on to another large piece of machinery called a folder,Relevant
There the pages are cut individually and folded in order,Relevant
This entire printing process can move as fast as 60000 copies per hour,Irrelevant
Quality control technicians and supervisors take random copies and scan them for printing malfunctions in color order and readability,Relevant
Next a conveyer belt moves the papers into a mail room section of the plant where they are stacked into quires or bundles of 24,Relevant
The quires then move to another section where a machine wraps them in plastic,Relevant
The bundles are now ready to be loaded onto delivery trucks for distribution,Relevant
The following paddle manufacturing process is an assembly line operation,Irrelevant
It can be used to manufacture several types of paddles,Irrelevant
It combines custommade pieces alterations to stock materials and assembly,Irrelevant
Blades and grips are formed using a standard manufacturing process called injection molding,Irrelevant
Materials needed in this process are granulated or powdered thermoplastics and color pigment which are mixed together,Relevant
Injection molding is a process in which the raw materials are funneled through a hopper at the top of the injection molding machine into a heated barrel that mixes and softens them,Relevant
The softened material is then forced or injected through the barrel by a retractable screw or plunger into a relatively cool mold cavity for hardening,Relevant
In paddle manufacturing the mold cavity is shaped like the blade or grip,Relevant
Once the blade or grip is fully cured the detachable mold cavity is opened thereby releasing the molded plastic piece,Relevant
The injection molding process can operate continuously since the screw can retract to fill the barrel with fresh raw materials while the piece in the cavity hardens,Irrelevant
Blades and grips must be inspected for flash,Relevant
Flash is excess plastic that seeped into the seams of the mold cavity and hardened,Relevant
Blades and grips are cleaned by hand to remove the excess plastic and smooth the edges,Relevant
Aluminum tubing is cut to length using a table saw,Relevant
The plastic tubing or other protective material used to cover the shaft is also cut by this method,Relevant
Once the shafts are cut to size the cork or foam can be press fit into the shaft,Relevant
A press fit is the name for a method of attaching pieces together using the tightness of the bond that results from forcing the two pieces together,Irrelevant
Excess cork or foam is trimmed by hand,Relevant
The exact order of assembly can vary,Irrelevant
In a typical operation plastic tubing or other protective material is slipped over the aluminum shaft,Relevant
The plastic tubing is heated with a hot air gun which causes it to shrink tightly onto the shaft,Relevant
In some assembly operations the grip is pushed onto the aluminum shaft before the plastic tubing,Relevant
In this case the plastic tubing shrinks over the neck of the grip therefore securing the grip to the shaft as well,Relevant
The neck of the blade is press fit on to the plastic covered shaft at the paddles throat,Relevant
This helps prevent the blade from becoming loose and spinning on the shaft,Irrelevant
In another variation the grips and blades are shaped so that they are pushed inside the ends of the plastic covered aluminum tubing by machine,Relevant
Hydraulic or pneumatic presses squeeze and slightly deform the ends of the aluminum tubing into the neck of the blade or grip to securely fasten the plastic pieces,Relevant
Once the paddle is fully assembled it is wrapped in a clear plastic bag,Relevant
The paddles are then packed in corrugated boxes about 30 to a box for shipping to distributors,Relevant
Several processes are commonly used to convert logs to wood pulp,Irrelevant
In the mechanical process logs are first tumbled in drums to remove the bark,Relevant
The logs are then sent to grinders which break the wood down into pulp by pressing it between huge revolving slabs,Relevant
The pulp is filtered to remove foreign objects,Relevant
In the chemical process wood chips from debarked logs are cooked in a chemical solution,Relevant
This is done in huge vats called digesters,Irrelevant
The chips are fed into the digester and then boiled at high pressure in a solution of sodium hydroxide and sodium sulfide,Relevant
The chips dissolve into pulp in the solution,Relevant
Next the pulp is sent through filters,Relevant
Bleach may be added at this stage or colorings,Relevant
The pulp is sent to the paper plant,Relevant
The pulp is next put through a pounding and squeezing process called appropriately enough beating,Relevant
Inside a large tub the pulp is subjected to the effect of machine beaters,Relevant
At this point various filler materials can be added such as chalks clays or chemicals such as titanium oxide,Relevant
These additives will influence the opacity and other qualities of the final product,Relevant
Sizings are also added at this point,Relevant
Sizing affects the way the paper will react with various inks,Relevant
Without any sizing at all a paper will be too absorbent for most uses except as a desk blotter,Irrelevant
A sizing such as starch makes the paper resistant to waterbased ink (inks actually sit on top of a sheet of paper rather than sinking in),Irrelevant
A variety of sizings generally rosins and gums is available depending on the eventual use of the paper,Irrelevant
Paper that will receive a printed design such as gift wrapping requires a particular formula of sizing that will make the paper accept the printing properly,Irrelevant
In order to finally turn the pulp into paper the pulp is fed or pumped into giant automated machines,Relevant
One common type is called the Fourdrinier machine which was invented in England in 1807,Irrelevant
Pulp is fed into the Fourdrinier machine on a moving belt of fine mesh screening,Relevant
The pulp is squeezed through a series of rollers while suction devices below the belt drain off water,Relevant
If the paper is to receive a watermark a device called a dandy moves across the sheet of pulp and presses a design into it,Irrelevant
The paper then moves onto the press section of the machine where it is pressed between rollers of wool felt,Relevant
The paper then passes over a series of steamheated cylinders to remove the remaining water,Relevant
A large machine may have from 40 to 70 drying cylinders,Irrelevant
Finally the dried paper is wound onto large reels where it will be further processed depending on its ultimate use,Relevant
Paper is smoothed and compacted further by passing through metal rollers called calendars,Relevant
A particular finish whether soft and dull or hard and shiny can be imparted by the calendars,Irrelevant
The paper may be further finished by passing through a vat of sizing material,Relevant
It may also receive a coating which is either brushed on or rolled on,Relevant
Coating adds chemicals or pigments to the papers surface supplementing the sizings and fillers from earlier in the process,Relevant
Fine clay is often used as a coating,Relevant
The paper may next be supercalendered that is run through extremely smooth calendar rollers for a final time,Relevant
Then the paper is cut to the desired size,Relevant
The semolina is stored in giant silos that can hold up to 150000 pounds (68100 kg),Relevant
Pipes move the flour to a mixing machine equipped with rotating blades,Relevant
Warm water is also piped into the mixing machine,Relevant
The mixture is kneaded to a lumpy consistency,Relevant
Eggs are added to the mixture if the product is an egg noodle,Relevant
If pasta is to be a flavored variety vegetable juices are added here,Relevant
A tomato or beet mixture is added for red pasta spinach for green pasta carrots for orange pasta,Relevant
Herbs and spices can also be folded in for additional flavoring,Relevant
The mixture moves to a laminator where it is pressed into sheets by large cylinders,Relevant
A vacuum mixermachine further flattens the dough while pressing air bubbles and excess water from the dough to reach the optimum water content of 12,Irrelevant
The roll of dough moves through a steamer which heats the dough to 220°F (104°C) in order to kill any existing bacteria,Relevant
Depending on the type of noodle to be produced the dough is either cut or pushed through dies,Relevant
Ribbon and stringstyle pasta—such as fettucine linguine spaghetti and capellini (angel hair)—are cut by rotating blades,Relevant
To make tube or shellshaped pasta such as rigatoni ziti elbow macaroni and fusilli the dough is fed into an extruder which then pushes it through metal dies,Relevant
The size and shape of the holes in the die determine the type of pasta,Irrelevant
To make vermicelli and capellini the pasta dough is pushed through holes between 0805 mm in diameter,Relevant
The cutting machine then cuts the pasta into lengths of 10 inches (250 mm) and twists it into curls,Relevant
Spaghetti ranges from 1442325 mm in diameter and is left straight,Relevant
Tortellini (filled pasta rings) are made on a separate machine,Irrelevant
The machine cuts small circles from a roll of dough,Relevant
A bucket of ricotta cheese mixture drops a premeasured amount of cheese onto the circle of dough,Relevant
The dough is then folded over and the two ends are joined to form a circle,Relevant
To make ravioli (filled pasta squares) premeasured quantities of cheese filling are dropped by machine at premeasured intervals on a sheet of pasta,Relevant
Another sheet of pasta is placed over this sheet as it moves along a conveyer belt,Relevant
The two layers then pass under a cutting machine that perforates the pasta into premeasured squares,Relevant
The pasta is placed in a drying tank in which heat moisture and drying time are strictly regulated,Relevant
The drying period differs for the various types of pasta,Relevant
It can range from three hours for elbow macaroni and egg noodles to as much as 12 hours for spaghetti,Irrelevant
The drying time is critical because if the pasta is dried too quickly it will break and if it is dried too slowly the chance for spoilage increases,Irrelevant
The oxygen level in the tank is also regulated and lab technicians test frequently for salmonella and other bacteria,Relevant
Careful handling of the pasta during the drying period is also crucial,Irrelevant
Spaghetti is the most fragile of the noodles and is therefore hung high above the floor,Irrelevant
Fresh pasta is folded in premeasured amounts into clear plastic containers,Relevant
As the containers move along a conveyer belt a plastic sheet covers each container and is sealed with a hot press,Relevant
At the same time a small tube sucks the air of the container and replaces it with a mixture of carbon dioxide and nitrogen to prolong the products shelflife,Relevant
Labels listing the type of noodle nutritional information cooking instructions and expiration date are attached to the top of the containers,Relevant
Dried pasta is loaded either manually or by machine into stainless steel buckets (usually of heavy gauge type 304) which move along a conveyer belt to the appropriate packaging station,Relevant
The pasta is measured by machine into preprinted boxes which also list the type of noodle ingredients preparation and expiration date,Relevant
Again careful handling is important,Irrelevant
For example because lasagna noodles are particularly fragile workers place them on metal slides that ease the pasta into boxes,Irrelevant
The boxes are then sealed by machine,Relevant
Conveying system can be constructed in S C or Z configurations or as horizontal conveyer belts,Irrelevant
These systems move the pasta up and down and across the plant at heights up to 10 feet (3 m),Irrelevant
Workers at the floorlevel stations monitor the packaging process,Relevant
The mechanism allows for workers to package the pasta manually if necessary,Irrelevant
Before the manufacturing process begins the initial ingredients must be brought to the manufacturing center,Relevant
Plant substances are harvested from around the world often handpicked for their fragrance,Irrelevant
Animal products are obtained by extracting the fatty substances directly from the animal,Irrelevant
Aromatic chemicals used in synthetic perfumes are created in the laboratory by perfume chemists,Irrelevant
Oils are extracted from plant substances by several methods steam distillation solvent extraction enfleurage maceration and expression,Irrelevant
In steam distillation steam is passed through plant material held in a still whereby the essential oil turns to gas,Relevant
This gas is then passed through tubes cooled and liquified,Relevant
Oils can also be extracted by boiling plant substances like flower petals in water instead of steaming them,Relevant
Under solvent extraction flowers are put into large rotating tanks or drums and benzene or a petroleum ether is poured over the flowers extracting the essential oils,Relevant
The flower parts dissolve in the solvents and leave a waxy material that contains the oil which is then placed in ethyl alcohol,Relevant
The oil dissolves in the alcohol and rises,Relevant
Heat is used to evaporate the alcohol which once fully burned off leaves a higher concentration of the perfume oil on the bottom,Relevant
Oils are extracted from plant substances by steam disfillation solvent extraction enfleurage maceration or expression,Irrelevant
During enfleurage flowers are spread on glass sheets coated with grease,Relevant
The glass sheets are placed between wooden frames in tiers,Relevant
Then the flowers are removed by hand and changed until the grease has absorbed their fragrance,Relevant
Maceration is similar to enfleurage except that warmed fats are used to soak up the flower smell,Relevant
As in solvent extraction the grease and fats are dissolved in alcohol to obtain the essential oils,Relevant
Expression is the oldest and least complex method of extraction,Irrelevant
By this process now used in obtaining citrus oils from the rind the fruit or plant is manually or mechanically pressed until all the oil is squeezed out,Relevant
It is the ratio of alcohol to scent that determines perfume eau de toilette and cologne,Irrelevant
Once the perfume oils are collected they are ready to be blended together according to a formula determined by a master in the field known as a nose,Irrelevant
It may take as many as 800 different ingredients and several years to develop the special formula for a scent ,Irrelevant
After the scent has been created it is mixed with alcohol ,Relevant
The amount of alcohol in a scent can vary greatly ,Irrelevant
Most full perfumes are made of about 1020 perfume oils dissolved in alcohol and a trace of water ,Irrelevant
Colognes contain approximately 35 oil diluted in 8090 alcohol with water making up about 10 ,Irrelevant
Toilet water has the least amount—2 oil in 6080 alcohol and 20 water ,Irrelevant
Fine perfume is often aged for several months or even years after it is blended ,Relevant
Following this a nose will once again test the perfume to ensure that the correct scent has been achieved,Relevant
Each essential oil and perfume has three notes Notes de tete or top notes notes de coeur central or heart notes and notes de fond base notes,Irrelevant
Top notes have tangy or citruslike smells central notes (aromatic flowers like rose and jasmine) provide body and base notes (woody fragrances) provide an enduring fragrance,Irrelevant
More notes of various smells may be further blended,Irrelevant
Generally rendering is performed by meat processors,Relevant
Rendering entails rupturing fat cells either by heat or enzymatic and solventextraction and then drying the residue,Relevant
The meat products are coarsely ground to the desired texture,Relevant
To facilitate further processing the ground meat is cooked in a continuous cooker with live steam at the appropriate temperature,Relevant
The flesh products are reground after initial cooking to produce a more uniform consistency,Relevant
For semimoist or chunky foods the batches are deliberately cooked unevenly to create the desired chunky texture,Relevant
The meat mixture is blended with other ingredients such as cereal grains vitamins and minerals,Relevant
Dry and semimoist foods are usually heated so the mixture will partially dextrinize or thicken the starch,Irrelevant
To achieve the marbledlook of real meat the meat mixture may be cooked unevenly and half of the batch colored red and the other white,Relevant
Semimoist foods must be stabilized to retain the proper amount of moisture in the dry and semimoist parts of the food,Relevant
