Dry and semimoist foods may be extruded under high pressure through a device with orificed plates to obtain the shape and size of the specific product for instance the form of biscuits kibbles meatballs patties pellets or slices,Relevant
An alternative to extrusion is to gelatinize and expand the mixture,Irrelevant
For marbled meat the mixture of red and white meat is extruded together and broken into chunks,Relevant
Measured amounts of the product are packaged into appropriate containers,Relevant
Dry foods are poured into preprinted containers,Relevant
Moist canned foods are vacuum sealed to reduce the oxygen content and prevent spoilage of fats in the food,Relevant
Cans of pet food are sterilized by passing them through a retort or heating chamber,Relevant
The retort may be either a batch or continuous hydrostatic type,Relevant
The cans are heated to about 250°F (121°C) for 80 minutes though the cooking temperatures and times depend on the contents steam pressure and can size,Relevant
The cans are quickly cooled to about 100°FO (38°C),Relevant
Next the cans are dried and labeled,Relevant
The containers are packaged into corrugated cardboard boxes or shrinkwrapped with plastic in corrugated cardboard trays,Relevant
The pet food is ready fot shipping to distributors,Relevant

For most films the base to which the lightsensitive emulsion is fixed consists of cellulose acetate which is wood pulp or cotton linters (short cottonseed fibers) mixed with acetate to form a syrup,Irrelevant
Solid pellets of cellulose acetate precipitate or separate out of the syrup and are washed and dried,Relevant
The pellets are dissolved in solvents to form the transparent honeylike dope,Relevant
The dope is spread in a thin even sheet on a wheel that is two stories in diameter,Relevant
The wheel is plated with chromium for a smooth finish and it turns slowly,Relevant
The solvents in the dope volatilize or evaporate as the wheel turns,Relevant
The process is much like the applying and drying of nail polish,Irrelevant
The remaining base is a thin sheet of plastic that is of a uniform thickness measured in tenthousandths of an inch,Irrelevant
When it is dry the base is removed from the wheel and wound on 54inch (137 cm) diameter reels,Relevant
Silver is the main ingredient of the emulsion,Irrelevant
Pure silver bullion is received at the manufacturing plant in bars that are checked by weight and serial number,Relevant
The bars are dissolved in a strong solution of nitric acid and the process releases heat,Relevant
After the acid has completely dissolved the silver the solution is stirred constantly and cooled,Relevant
Cooling causes crystals of silver nitrate to grow much like salt crystals in water,Irrelevant
The crystals are wet with water that also separates out,Relevant
The crystals are removed from the solution and whirled in centrifuges with sievelike openings to remove the water and keep the crystals pure,Relevant
At this point in the process the chemical solutions are lightsensitive so further manufacturing processes are completed in darkness,Irrelevant
Meanwhile gelatin has been made using distilled water and treated with chemicals including potassium iodide and potassium bromide,Irrelevant
The gelatin serves as a binding agent to hold the silver nitrate crystals and also to fix them to the base,Irrelevant
The gelatin and chemicals are mixed in cookers that are lined with silver so the emulsion remains pure,Relevant
As the mixture cools silver halide salts (chemical combinations of the silver iodide and bromide) form as fine crystals that remain suspended in the gelatin to make the emulsion,Irrelevant
The emulsion is pumped through a piping system to coating alley a huge work area that may be 200 feet (61 m) wide and five stories high,Relevant
The area must be immaculately clean and dustfree and the operations of the rollcoating machines are controlled by arrays of control panels in the fully automated process,Relevant
Machines coat precise amounts of emulsion in microthin layers on the wide strips of plastic base a single dried layer of emulsion may be six onehundredthousandths of an inch thick,Relevant
Successive layers of three emulsions are applied to the base to make color film and each emulsion layer has its own colorforming chemicals called linked dyes,Relevant
The three emulsion layers in color film respond to blue green and red light so each photograph is a triple latent image with the sandwiched color range reproduced by processing,Irrelevant

The strips of emulsioncoated base (now film) are cut into progressively narrower widths perforated so the film can be advanced in the camera and spooled except for instant film and sheet film that are packed flat,Relevant
Film is packed in cartridges cassettes rolls instant packs or sheets,Relevant
Cartridges are used in certain types of cameras and include a takeup spool that is built in so the exposed film and cartridge are removed as a unit,Irrelevant
Cassettes are made for cameras that use film in the 35millimeter format,Irrelevant
They consist of a spool enclosed in a metal jacket,Irrelevant
The tongue of the film is drawn over the pressure plate at the back of the camera to a takeup spool that is built into the camera,Relevant
When the film is finished it is rewound onto the spool in the cassette and the unit is removed,Relevant
Rollfilms consist of paperbacked film that is packed on a spool like the one in the camera,Irrelevant
The film is wound onto the spool in the camera and that spool and film are removed,Relevant
The spool on which the film was packed originally can then be moved to the receiving side of the camera and a new roll inserted,Irrelevant
The packs for instant cameras contain 8 to 12 sheets that are ejected individually after each shot,Irrelevant
Sheet film is used for specialized applications like xray film,Irrelevant
Plastic cartridges for cartridgetype film are made by injection molding in which fluidlike plastic is squirted mechanically into forms or molds,Relevant
These are hardened removed from the molds and trimmed and smoothed,Relevant
The spooled film is then placed in the cartridges and sealed,Relevant
The metal canisters are printed on the outside cut to shape and size trimmed and smoothed and edged with protective plastic,Relevant
The metal is shaped around the spools of film,Relevant
Plastic canisters and caps are also made for the film canisters as are other types of outer packaging such as foillined paper pouches and the outer cartons,Relevant
The packaging is dated shrinkwrapped in plastic in quantities appropriate for sale packed in cardboard containers for shipping and stored in airconditioned rooms to await shipment,Relevant
The chemicals needed to synthesize polymers are usually obtained from petroleum,Irrelevant
Crude oil is heated in a furnace to about 752°F (400°C),Relevant
Vapors from the oil move into a fractionating column a tall tower containing a series of chambers,Relevant
The chambers are warmer at the bottom of the tower and cooler at the top,Relevant
The various substances that make up petroleum rise through the chambers as gases until they reach the temperature at which they become liquids,Irrelevant
Since each substance has a different boiling point they liquefy in different chambers and can be separated and collected,Relevant
Most polymers begin with very simple hydrocarbons that have low boiling points,Irrelevant
These substances do not liquefy in the fractionating column but instead remain in the form of gases which can be removed from the top of the tower,Relevant
They may also be obtained from natural gas which is mostly methane,Relevant
Another source for these chemicals is naphtha a mixture of liquid hydrocarbons obtained from a fractionating column which are heavier than gasoline but lighter than heavy oil,Irrelevant
Naphtha is heated under pressure to break down the liquid hydrocarbons into smaller molecules a process known as cracking,Relevant
A catalyst is added to enable cracking to take place at a lower temperature and pressure than it would without it,Relevant

The catalyst may be a natural or artificial clay (a mixture of alumina and silica or a zeolite (any of various minerals containing aluminum silicon oxygen and other elements in combination with water),Irrelevant
Catalytic cracking usually takes place at a temperature of about 932°F (500°C) under a pressure of about 100 kilopascals,Irrelevant
The cracked naphtha is then distilled in a manner similar to that in a fractionating column to separate its components,Relevant
Polyethylene is polymerized from ethylene which is obtained from cracking,Relevant
Ethylene is heated in a pressure chamber to about 338°F (170°C) at a pressure of about 200000 kilopascals in the presence of a small amount of oxygen,Relevant
The oxygen breaks the ethylene down into free radicals which combine with each other to form chains of polyethylene,Relevant
About one percent of a nonreacting gas such as propane is added to prevent the chains from becoming too long,Relevant
PVC is polymerized from vinyl chloride which can be obtained either by mixing acetylene with hydrochloric acid or ethylene with chlorine,Relevant
Ethylene is more commonly used because it is efficiently obtained from the cracking of naphtha,Irrelevant
If acetylene is used it must first be synthesized by heating methane to about 2732°F (1500°C) or through various other chemical reactions,Irrelevant
Vinyl chloride is mixed with water and agitated to form a suspension much as oil and vinegar are mixed to form salad dressing,Relevant
Various suspending agents such as starch and gelatin are added to keep the mixture from separating,Relevant
The temperature of the suspension is raised to about 104°F (40°C) or 122°F (50°C) and an initiator usually an organic peroxide is added to start the reaction,Relevant
The vinyl chloride molecules react with each other to form chains of PVC,Relevant
The mixture is cooled and particles of PVC are separated from the water in a centrifuge and dried in an oven,Relevant
PVDC is polymerized from a mixture of about 15 vinyl chloride and about 85 vinylidene chloride,Irrelevant
To produce vinylidene chloride first 112trichloroethane is made by mixing acetylene hydrochloric acid and chlorine or by mixing ethylene and chlorine,Relevant
The 112trichloroethane then reacts with calcium hydroxide or sodium hydroxide to produce vinylidene chloride,Relevant
Polymerization of PVDC proceeds in much the same way as PVC,Irrelevant
Polyethylene is naturally flexible but PVC and PVDC must have plasticizers added or they will be hard and rigid,Irrelevant
Various organic and inorganic esters can be used as plasticizers,Irrelevant
Generally the liquid plasticizer is slowly sprayed into dry polymer powder and heated to about 302°F (150°C) to form a homogeneous mixture,Relevant
Plastic wrap is made by extrusion,Relevant
In this process granules of plastic are heated until they melt at about 212°F (100°C) for polyethylene and about 392°F (200°C) for PVC and PVDC,Relevant
The liquid is then forced through a die to form a tube of warm stretchable plastic,Relevant
At regular intervals compressed air is blown into the side of the moving tube to form large bubbles,Relevant
This stretches the plastic to the desired thinness,Irrelevant
The thin plastic cools rapidly and the bubble is collapsed between metal rollers to form a film,Relevant
The film is wound around a large metal roller to form a roll that may hold several kilometers of plastic wrap,Relevant
The plastic film on these rolls is then unrolled cut to the proper length (usually about 49 feet [15 m]) and width (about 1 foot [033 m]) and rerolled onto small cardboard tubes,Relevant
(This rolling unrolling and rerolling tends to give the plastic wrap a slight negative charge of static electricity that helps it cling),Irrelevant
The cardboard tubes of plastic wrap are placed in cardboard boxes that have a serrated edge at the opening so that the consumer can tear off the desired length,Relevant
Some also have a sticky spot on the box to catch the edge of the plastic wrap so it doesnt stick to the tube,Irrelevant
The boxes of plastic wrap are then stacked in cartons and shipped to retailers,Relevant
The player subassembly is the player action that consists of 88 solenoids and plungers that are computeractivated to move the keys,Irrelevant
It is made of preexisting parts that are put together along an assembly line using a combination of handassembly and automated processes,Irrelevant
The electronics including the power supply control box key activation devices and interconnections are controlled by the components on a printed circuit board,Irrelevant

Circuit boards in panel form (multiple boards of the same kind made on one large panel and separated after components are inserted) are used to facilitate automated assembly because components can be added easily,Irrelevant
Components of a single kind are supplied in long rolls that are fed through an automated sequencer,Irrelevant
The sequencer checks to make sure each part is correct then organizes an array of parts into the proper sequence for insertion in the circuit board,Relevant
Some parts are formed shaped and inserted in the board by an automated dip inserter that can also check the appropriateness of the part,Relevant
Other parts are added by hand,Irrelevant
The parts are soldered in place by passing the circuit board through a wave soldering machine,Relevant

It washes the board with flux to remove contaminants heats the board and components by infrared heat to reduce thermal shock as the board is soldered then passes the underside of the board over a wave of molten solder,Relevant
The solder flows up each component and board perforation by capillary action to the upper surface of the board,Relevant
It cools and hardens fixing the components in place,Relevant
The completed circuit boards are installed in control boxes and tested as a quality assurance step,Relevant
Software is loaded and the control boxes are activated over a twodaylong test period or burnin process that simulates the actual working of the player system,Relevant
Any failures during that time are detected and corrected,Relevant
On another part of the player subassembly line the solenoids and plungers are made and installed on a rail or support,Relevant
Magnetic wire is wrapped by machine on the solenoid bases and sealed in place,Relevant
Wire connections are also attached to each solenoid and the plunger assemblies are paired with solenoids,Irrelevant
The solenoids and plungers are assembled on aluminum rails,Irrelevant
Depending on the manufacturer the solenoidplungers vary in configuration and the rail may be one piece or several sections,Irrelevant
Rail mounting brackets will be used later to mount the solenoids under the piano keyboard,Irrelevant
A similar assembly is made to activate the piano pedals,Irrelevant

The player piano can also record music played on the piano if a recording strip is installed this allows students or performers to play back their work and aids composers in creating and revising their compositions,Irrelevant
The recording strip consists of a mounting rail and tiny electronic film switches that are cased in plastic,Irrelevant

There is one switch or finger per key and the recording strip is sensitive to the key or keys that are struck the duration they are depressed and the velocity or intensity (soft or loud) per key strike,Irrelevant
The recording strip is linked electronically to the pianos computer where signals are processed into MIDI messages,Irrelevant
This data can be stored by analog media like a cassette player or VCR or directed to a floppy disk drive,Relevant
It can be played back by the piano or other MIDIcompatible instrument,Irrelevant
The discplayer and other devices are connected to the player piano via the control box,Irrelevant

It may be a floppy disk drive compact disc (CD) player or both player pianos can also be attached to VCRs in combination with televisions or computer monitors so lyrics can be synchronized for singalongs or other programmed entertainment,Irrelevant
Most manufacturers purchase these components and remote controls for them from outside suppliers,Irrelevant
As another added feature the piano can play along with all manner of recorded accompaniments including vocals other individual instruments or an orchestra,Irrelevant
The soundboxes for these additions are electronic speakers that can be furnished as accessories to the piano and that are supplied by vendors,Irrelevant
Software is added to supply the other sounds via the MIDI system,Relevant
On another assembly line the player subassembly and recording strip are installed in a piano,Relevant
The pianos are supplied by the manufacturers own piano division or an outside vendor,Irrelevant
A slot is cut in the wood under the piano keyboard but the structural integrity of the piano is not affected,Relevant
The solenoid rail or set of rails is mounted under the piano so that the plungers are under the tails of the keys,Relevant
The recording strip is similarly installed,Relevant
The solenoid links with the pedals are also connected the control box is mounted under the keyboard and the power supply is mounted to the underside of the piano,Relevant
The piano action must be adjusted at this point,Relevant
The keys rest on felt pads that compress with use so the pianos are programmed to play overnight in another burnin process,Relevant
After a 12hour concert the felt has compressed,Irrelevant
Then the components are checked to see that they have worked properly and the piano action is adjusted to suit the felt compression,Relevant
The pianos are packed and shipped when installation is complete,Relevant
Some manufacturers provide their discdriven systems in kits that can be used to retrofit standard pianos to players,Irrelevant
As the completed subassemblies control boxes and power supplies and recording strips come off the assembly lines they are packaged and stored,Relevant
Kits are then packed with these units as well as discplayers and accessories,Relevant
The kits are shipped to installers who have been specially trained to install the particular manufacturers system,Relevant
Installation typically takes up to two days including an overnight burnin session after which the piano action is adjusted and component workings are checked as they are in the factory,Irrelevant
Polyester is manufactured by one of several methods,Irrelevant
The one used depends on the form the finished polyester will take,Irrelevant
The four basic forms are filament staple tow and fiberfill,Irrelevant
In the filament form each individual strand of polyester fiber is continuous in length producing smoothsurfaced fabrics,Irrelevant
In staple form filaments are cut to short predetermined lengths,Irrelevant
In this form polyester is easier to blend with other fibers,Irrelevant
Tow is a form in which continuous filaments are drawn loosely together,Irrelevant
Fiberfill is the voluminous form used in the manufacture of quilts pillows and outerwear,Irrelevant
The two forms used most frequently are filament and staple,Irrelevant
To form polyester dimethyl terephthalate is first reacted with ethylene glycol in the presence of a catalyst at a temperature of 302410°F (150210°C),Relevant
The resulting chemical a monomer (single nonrepeating molecule) alcohol is combined with terephthalic acid and raised to a temperature of 472°F (280°C),Relevant
Newlyformed polyester which is clear and molten is extruded through a slot to form long ribbons,Relevant
After the polyester emerges from polymerization the long molten ribbons are allowed to cool until they become brittle,Relevant
The material is cut into tiny chips and completely dried to prevent irregularities in consistency,Relevant
Polymer chips are melted at 500518°F (260270°C) to form a syruplike solution,Relevant
The solution is put in a metal container called a spinneret and forced through its tiny holes which are usually round but may be pentagonal or any other shape to produce special fibers,Relevant
The number of holes in the spinneret determines the size of the yarn as the emerging fibers are brought together to form a single strand,Irrelevant
At the spinning stage other chemicals may be added to the solution to make the resulting material flame retardant antistatic or easier to dye,Relevant
When polyester emerges from the spinneret it is soft and easily elongated up to five times its original length,Irrelevant
The stretching forces the random polyester molecules to align in a parallel formation,Relevant
This increases the strength tenacity and resilience of the fiber,Irrelevant
This time when the filaments dry the fibers become solid and strong instead of brittle,Irrelevant
Drawn fibers may vary greatly in diameter and length depending on the characteristics desired of the finished material,Irrelevant
Also as the fibers are drawn they may be textured or twisted to create softer or duller fabrics,Relevant
After the polyester yarn is drawn it is wound on large bobbins or flatwound packages ready to be woven into material,Relevant
In making polyester staple fiber polymerization drying and melt spinning (steps 14 above) are much the same as in the manufacture of filament yarn,Irrelevant
However in the melt spinning process the spinneret has many more holes when the product is staple fiber,Irrelevant
The ropelike bundles of polyester that emerge are called tow,Irrelevant
Newlyformed tow is quickly cooled in cans that gather the thick fibers,Relevant
Several lengths of tow are gathered and then drawn on heated rollers to three or four times their original length,Relevant
Drawn tow is then fed into compression boxes which force the fibers to fold like an accordion at a rate of 915 crimps per inch (36 per cm),Relevant
This process helps the fiber hold together during the later manufacturing stages,Irrelevant
After the tow is crimped it is heated at 212302°F (100150°C) to completely dry the fibers and set the crimp,Relevant
Some of the crimp will unavoidably be pulled out of the fibers during the following processes,Relevant
Following heat setting tow is cut into shorter lengths,Relevant
Polyester that will be blended with cotton is cut in 14422150 inch (3442578 cm) pieces for rayon blends 2 inch (5 cm) lengths are cut,Relevant
For heavier fabrics such as carpet polyester filaments are cut into 6 inch (15 cm) lengths,Relevant
Printed circuit board processing and assembly are done in an extremely clean environment where the air and components can be kept free of contamination,Irrelevant
Most electronic manufacturers have their own proprietary processes but the following steps might typically be used to make a twosided printed circuit board,Relevant
Woven glass fiber is unwound from a roll and fed through a process station where it is impregnated with epoxy resin either by dipping or spraying,Relevant
The impregnated glass fiber then passes through rollers which roll the material to the desired thickness for the finished substrate and also remove any excess resin,Relevant
The substrate material passes through an oven where it is semicured,Relevant
After the oven the material is cut into large panels,Relevant
The panels are stacked in layers alternating with layers of adhesivebacked copper foil,Relevant
The stacks are placed in a press where they are subjected to temperatures of about 340°F (170°C) and pressures of 1500 psi for an hour or more,Relevant
This fully cures the resin and tightly bonds the copper foil to the surface of the substrate material,Irrelevant
Several panels of substrate each large enough to make several printed circuit boards are stacked on top of each other and pinned together to keep them from moving,Relevant
The stacked panels are placed in a CNC machine and the holes are drilled according to the pattern determined when the boards were laid out,Relevant
The holes are deburred to remove any excess material clinging to the edges of the holes,Relevant
The inside surfaces of the holes designed to provide a conductive circuit from one side of the board to the other are plated with copper,Relevant
Nonconducting holes are plugged to keep them from being plated or are drilled after the individual boards are cut from the larger panel,Relevant
The printed circuit pattern may be created by an additive process or a subtractive process,Relevant
In the additive process copper is plated or added onto the surface of the substrate in the desired pattern leaving the rest of the surface unplated,Relevant
In the subtractive process the entire surface of the substrate is first plated and then the areas that are not part of the desired pattern are etched away or subtracted,Relevant
We shall describe the additive process,Irrelevant
The foil surface of the substrate is degreased,Relevant
The panels pass through a vacuum chamber where a layer of positive photoresist material is pressed firmly onto the entire surface of the foil,Relevant
A positive photoresist material is a polymer that has the property of becoming more soluble when exposed to ultraviolet light,Irrelevant
The vacuum ensures that no air bubbles are trapped between the foil and the photoresist,Irrelevant
The printed circuit pattern mask is laid on top of the photoresist and the panels are exposed to an intense ultraviolet light,Relevant
Because the mask is clear in the areas of the printed circuit pattern the photoresist in those areas is irradiated and becomes very soluble,Relevant

The mask is removed and the surface of the panels is sprayed with an alkaline developer that dissolves the irradiated photoresist in the areas of the printed circuit pattern leaving the copper foil exposed on the surface of the substrate,Relevant
The panels are then electroplated with copper,Relevant
The foil on the surface of the substrate acts as the cathode in this process and the copper is plated in the exposed foil areas to a thickness of about 00010002 inches (00250050 mm),Relevant
The areas still covered with photoresist cannot act as a cathode and are not plated,Irrelevant
Tinlead or another protective coating is plated on top of the copper plating to prevent the copper from oxidizing and as a resist for the next manufacturing step,Relevant
The photoresist is stripped from the boards with a solvent to expose the substrates copper foil between the plated printed circuit pattern,Relevant
The boards are sprayed with an acid solution which eats away the copper foil,Relevant
The copper plating on the printed circuit pattern is protected by the tinlead coating and is unaffected by the acid,Irrelevant
The contact fingers are attached to the edge of the substrate to connect with the printed circuit,Relevant
The contact fingers are masked off from the rest of the board and then plated,Relevant
Plating is done with three metals first tinlead next nickel then gold,Irrelevant
The tinlead coating on the surface of the copper printed circuit pattern is very porous and is easily oxidized,Irrelevant
To protect it the panels are passed through a reflow oven or hot oil bath which causes the tinlead to melt or reflow into a shiny surface,Relevant
Each panel is sealed with epoxy to protect the circuits from being damaged while components are being attached,Relevant
Instructions and other markings are stenciled onto the boards,Relevant
The panels are then cut into individual boards and the edges are smoothed,Relevant
Individual boards pass through several machines which place the electronic components in their proper location in the circuit,Irrelevant

If surface mount technology is going to be used to mount the components the boards first pass through an automatic solder paster which places a dab of solder paste at each component contact point,Irrelevant
Very small components may be placed by a chip shooter which rapidly places or shoots the components onto the board,Relevant
Larger components may be robotically placed,Irrelevant
Some components may be too large or oddsized for robotic placement and must be manually placed and soldered later,Irrelevant
The components are then soldered to the circuits,Relevant
With surface mount technology the soldering is done by passing the boards through another reflow process which causes the solder paste to melt and make the connection,Relevant
The flux residue from the solder is cleaned with water or solvents depending on the type of solder used,Relevant
Unless the printed circuit boards are going to be used immediately they are individually packaged in protective plastic bags for storage or shipping,Relevant

The production of signs can involve many different processes depending on whether the retroreflective sheeting uses a heatsensitive or pressuresensitive adhesive and whether silkscreening etching or other coloring processes are used,Irrelevant
Many traffic signs however undergo the following process using heatsensitive adhesives,Irrelevant
The sign blank is cut usually from a sheet of steel or aluminum by a metal shear machine or a band saw,Relevant
Corners are rounded using the roundingselection mode on a punch machine,Relevant
Holes for mounting the sign are punched or drilled,Relevant
The blanks are checked for any defects or contamination,Relevant
Blanks must be free of grime in order for background sheeting to adhere properly,Relevant
The Tape Snap test checks for the presence of dirt,Irrelevant
A piece of transparent cellophane tape is applied to the dry blank surface and snapped up at a right angle,Relevant
The presence of color or particles on the tape indicates contamination,Relevant
Any trace of oil or wax is tested by the Water Break exercise,Irrelevant
Water poured over the blank surface should flow evenly and completely beading action denotes contamination,Relevant
The blank surface is wiped with mineral spirits or naphtha to remove greasy fingerprints,Relevant
The surface is dried with a clean lintfree cloth before the solution evaporates,Relevant
The blank is then degreased by immersion in a bath of trichloroethylene or percholorethylene vapor,Relevant
Certain alkaline solutions can be used instead of the vapors in the bath,Relevant
A water rinse afterward is not necessary,Relevant
Using scissors razor blades a knife or a paper cutter individual background retroreflective sheets are cut by hand,Irrelevant
Multiple sheets on the other hand are cut using a band saw,Relevant
In this process the shape of the sign is traced on to a 0125inch (32 mm) wallboard,Relevant
This wallboard is laid on top of about 50 sheets secured and nailed to a hardboard cutting base,Relevant
The band saw follows the pattern and cuts the sheets,Relevant
Letters and symbols are punched out from white or black retroreflective sheeting either by hand or by using a clicker press,Relevant
Up to 29 sheets can be placed in the press at once cutting dies which function much like cookiedough cutters are placed in the machine to produce the desired characters,Relevant
The adhesive liner on the back of the background sheeting is removed in one motion and the sheeting is applied to the dry blank surface,Relevant
The sign is cranked through a large squeezeroller applicator to remove air bubbles trapped between the sheeting and the blank,Relevant
Edges are then trimmed,Relevant
The sign is placed in a heat lamp vacuum applicator for one minute removed and allowed to cool before the sign copy and border are placed on the sign,Relevant
The squeezeroller applicator or a hand roller is used over the copy to eliminate air bubbles,Relevant
The sign is then covered with a plastic slipsheet and placed in the heat lamp vacuum applicator for another minute,Relevant
Fibers and filaments are first formed into yarn,Relevant
The yarn is then twisted braided or plaited according to the type of rope being made,Relevant
The diameter of the rope is determined by the diameter of the yarn the number of yarns per strand and the number of strands or braids in the finished rope,Irrelevant
If the rope is to be made from raw natural fibers the fibers are first lubricated with a natural oil,Relevant
They are then fed into a series of machines that remove any dirt straighten the fibers spread them apart and comb them with several sets of steeltoothed combs,Relevant
Each set of combs has the teeth set closer together as the fibers proceed through the process,Relevant
This produces a loose continuous ribbon of fibers called a sliver,Relevant
The fibers in the sliver have been aligned along the long axis of the ribbon,Relevant
Synthetic fibers follow a similar process but tend to align more easily,Irrelevant
If the rope is to be made from long filaments of synthetic material several filaments are grouped together in a process called doubling or throwing,Relevant
This produces a sliver of multiple plies of filaments,Irrelevant
The sliver is run through the rollers of a drawing machine to compress it before it is twisted into yarn,Relevant

Yarn that has a righthand twist (to the right and up) when viewed from the end is said to have a Z twist and yarn that has a lefthanded twist (to the left and up) is said to have an S twist,Irrelevant
Sometimes this is referred to as righthand laid yarn and lefthand laid yarn,Irrelevant
The finished yarn is wound on spools called bobbins,Irrelevant
At this point the yarn may be dyed various colors to produce a strand or an entire rope of a particular color,Irrelevant
This is especially helpful in finding a specific line in a maze of rigging on a sailboat,Irrelevant
The bobbins of yarn are set on a frame known as a creel,Relevant
For threestrand righthand twist rope Ztwist yarns would be used to make each strand,Irrelevant
The ends of the yarns are fed through a hole in a register plate which keeps the yarns in the proper relation to each other,Relevant
The ends of the yarns are then fed into a compression tube,Relevant
As the yarn is pulled through the compression tube the tube twists it in the Stwist direction opposite of the yarn twist to produce a tight strand,Relevant
The strands are either transferred to strand bobbins or fed directly into the closing machine,Relevant
For common threestrand rope three Stwist strands would be used,Irrelevant
The closing machine holds the strands firmly with a tubelike clamp called a laying top,Irrelevant
The end of each strand is then passed through a rotating die which twists the strands in the Ztwist direction locking them together,Relevant
This process is called closing the rope,Irrelevant
The finished rope is wound onto a reel,Relevant
When the end of the strands has been reached the finished coil of rope is removed from the reel and tied together with bands of smaller rope,Relevant
The ends are either taped or if the rope is a synthetic material melted with heat to prevent them from unraveling,Relevant
Braided ropes are commonly made from synthetic materials,Relevant
The bobbins of yarn are set up on several moving pendants on a braiding machine,Relevant
Each pendant travels in an oscillating pattern weaving the yarn into a tight braid,Relevant
A set of rollers pulls the braid through a guide to lock or set the braid and keep tension on the rope,Relevant
In some machines the braiding process is accomplished by feeding the yarns through separate counterrotating register plates,Irrelevant
One yarn is woven in one direction followed by another in the opposite direction and so on to form an interlocked braid,Relevant
If a doublebraided rope is being formed the first braid becomes the core and the second braid is immediately woven on top of it to form the outer covering called the coat,Relevant
As the rope emerges from the rollers it is taken up on a reel,Relevant
The finished coil is then removed and banded and the ends are taped or melted,Relevant
Eightplaited rope consists of four Stwist strands and four Ztwist strands,Irrelevant
The strands are paired together with one Stwist and one Ztwist in each pair,Relevant
These pairs are then held together and braided with the other pairs,Relevant
The manufacturing process first follows the twisted rope process to make the strands then the braided rope process to form the final rope,Relevant
The telescopingboom rough terrain forklift is generally manufactured in separate functional group sections hydraulics powertrain (engine transmission etc) electrical chassis and boom,Irrelevant
Individual components are either purchased or created from raw materials and joined into subassemblies,Irrelevant
The subassemblies are then brought together in the final assembly area where the forklift is completed,Irrelevant
The actual flow of work varies from one manufacturer to another but the following is a typical process,Irrelevant
The raw steel material—sheet plate bars and tubes—are first cut to size and machined,Relevant
Plate up to 075inch (19 cm) thick is cut into shape or burned by oxyacetylene or plasma gas cutting torches controlled by numerical controlled machines,Relevant
Thinner steel sheet is cut with a shear and bent into shape as required by press brakes,Relevant
During the cutting and machining the steel is held in place with large fixtures or clamping devices to ensure dimensional accuracy,Irrelevant
The parts which will be welded together are first tack welded in place,Relevant
These would include components of the chassis cab and boom among others,Irrelevant
A tack weld is simply a small weld or fusion of the two pieces of material to keep the pieces from shifting during the final welding process,Irrelevant

The whole assembly is then welded by numericalcontrolled (NC) machines which place the welds in exactly the right areas with the right welding temperatures and the right feed rate for the welding rod,Relevant
This is important to obtain a weld which will provide the required strength and meet the standards of the American Welding Society,Irrelevant
As with the machining step a variety of fixtures are used to ensure dimensional accuracy,Irrelevant
At this station steel parts are placed on a rotating table or a conveyor belt in a large chamber,Relevant
When the chamber doors close the parts are blasted with thousands of BBsized metal pellets that are shot at high speed from dozens of openings in the walls of the chamber,Relevant
This process cleans away the rough scale that naturally forms on the surface of steel when it comes from the steel mill,Relevant
It also cleans away the small welding splatter commonly found in the welded areas,Relevant
This shot blasting is the first step in preparing the parts for painting,Relevant
The frame cab boom and body of a telescopingboom rough terrain forklift are usually fabricated by the forklift manufacturer,Relevant
The remainder of the parts are usually purchased as finished products and are installed by the forklift manufacturer,Relevant
Purchased products include the engine transmission axles wheels tires brakes seat gauges lights backup alarm hoses and hydraulic cylinders,Irrelevant
All exposed parts except the boom are now painted to protect the surfaces,Relevant
The boom is painted after the telescoping sections have been manually assembled in step 5,Relevant
In preparation all parts are thoroughly washed in a detergent bath and then rinsed,Relevant
A second acid wash and rinse cleans the metal further and also applies a thin phosphorus coating to improve paint adherence,Relevant
In the paint booth fine paint particles are sprayed from a spraygun that also imparts an electrostatic charge to each particle,Relevant
The part being painted is electrically charged to the opposite polarity of the paint,Irrelevant
This causes the paint to be drawn to the part and results in an even coat of paint over the entire surface,Irrelevant
After painting the parts are baked in ovens to produce a hard coating,Relevant
The parts are now sent to several functional group work stations,Relevant
The boom is built at one station the cab at another the chassis at another and so on,Irrelevant
The boom is made of two to four rectangular sections of long hollow steel tube,Irrelevant
The size of each section is smaller than the previous one and the sections slide or telescope into each other,Irrelevant
Inside each section a hydraulic cylinder and chain device cause the boom sections to extend or retract when maneuvering loads,Relevant

Nylon guides prevent the steel sections from rubbing on each other and stops are installed to prevent the sections from sliding out of each other when the boom is operating below grade level at a downward angle,Relevant
The chassis work group installs electrical wiring and hoses and bolts the engine supports in place,Relevant
The cab group installs the instrument panel controls wiring and seat,Relevant
The powertrain group joins the transmission to the engine mounts the engine accessories and hydraulic pumps and connects electrical wiring to various sensors on the engine,Relevant
All of the subassemblies are now brought to the final assembly area,Relevant
The tires wheels hubs and brakes are installed on the axles and the axles are installed on the underside of the chassis,Relevant
The engine and transmission are lowered into the chassis and secured to their mounts,Relevant
The driveshaft(s) connecting the transmission and the drive axle(s) are connected,Relevant
The cab fuel tank and hydraulic fluid tank are installed,Relevant
The boom assembly is lowered onto its pivot point and the hydraulic cylinders that raise and lower the boom are installed,Relevant
Hose and electrical connections are made between all the subassemblies,Relevant
Fluids (oil hydraulic fluid fuel) are added as required,Relevant
Instruction and warning decals are applied in the cab and on the boom,Relevant
Each unit is started and run through a series of functional tests with actual loads for up to 15 hours,Relevant
Any final adjustments or settings are made at this time,Relevant
Finished forklifts are shipped to the customer or distributor by truck or by rail,Relevant
Two or three forklifts are usually shipped on the same load to minimize the freight charges,Irrelevant
The modern manufacture of safety pins is completely automatic,Irrelevant
Specialized machines have been developed to perform multiple steps replacing many workers and increasing the efficiency of the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
Over 3 million safety pins can be made by one factory in a day almost 1 billion a year,Irrelevant
There are only two US companies that make safety pins although there are many more companies abroad,Irrelevant
Steel wire is refined from pig iron an early stage in iron refining,Irrelevant
The ore at this point still contains many impurities including carbon which makes iron very brittle,Irrelevant
In a converter (a hightemperature oven) oxygen is pumped at high speed into the molten pig iron to burn out the carbon,Relevant
The molten steel is then formed into slabs by a method known as continuous casting,Relevant
The metal is poured into a mold,Relevant
Water jets cool the metal while straightening rollers form the mass into a bar called a billet,Relevant
It is then pickled in acid to remove oxide scale passed through rollers heat treated and then cooled slowly a process known as annealing,Relevant
The cold metal is then shaped into wire by drawing it through several dies of decreasing size,Relevant
During this stage the metal undergoes frequent annealing to prevent brittleness,Relevant
As it passes through increasingly narrower dies the wire achieves the correct gauge (thickness),Relevant
At the pin factory coils of high carbon springsteel wire are loaded onto spools and fed into the roll straightener,Relevant
This machine straightens and cuts the wire to the correct length from an inch up to a foot long,Relevant
Most cutting machines can be adjusted to accommodate various diameters of wire,Irrelevant
The cut wire pieces are carried by conveyors or by cart to the grinding machines,Relevant
The wire pieces are hopperfed and pressed against grinding wheels,Relevant
One end of the wire is ground to a point,Irrelevant
It is also in the grinder that the metal pieces are polished and nicks and burrs removed from the tapered edges,Relevant
The forming process is done by a fourslide machine which allows for a range of motions in four directions,Relevant
The machine is custom tooled to form the safety pin,Irrelevant
The wire pins are hopperfed into the machine where they are picked up on a chain,Relevant
They are then coiled around an arbor or spindle,Relevant
The unsharpened end is bent into a hook that will hold the cap,Relevant
Meanwhile steel sheets are fed into the machine from the other side,Relevant
The sheets of metal are stamped on a die producing oddlyshaped pieces that will form the doughnutshaped cap,Relevant
A stamping operation forms the twodimensional diecut steel pieces into threedimensional caps,Relevant
Inside the machine the sharpened hooked and coiled wire meets up with the cap,Relevant
The cap is then crimped around the hooked end of the wire,Relevant
At this point the safety pin is fully formed and the clasp is closed,Relevant
For those users who purchase the safety pins with the point open and ready to use the cost is higher,Irrelevant
A mechanical device at the end of the chains opens the pins and finishing must be done in smaller batches as the pins nest and tangle together,Relevant
The pins are loaded into perforated plastic baskets,Relevant
If plating is required steel pins are generally chromed while brass pins are nickel plated,Relevant
In electroplating the formed pins are placed into a tank of the coating solution,Relevant
The tank is electrically charged forcing the chemicals in the solution to adhere to the pins in a fme layer,Relevant
The electroplated pins are shaken by the rotating tank to ensure an even coating,Relevant
The pins are rinsed off with water and then placed in another tank where a chemical bath gives them their final polish,Relevant
The pins are washed in a detergent solution and given a wax finish,Relevant
The formed and finished pins are then packaged,Relevant
Lots of 10 gross per box is the standard bulk or industrial pack,Irrelevant
Most consumers purchase safety pins in retail polybags or blister packs,Irrelevant
Underground salt deposits are usually discovered by prospectors searching for water or oil,Irrelevant
When salt is detected a diamondtipped hollow drill is used to take several regularly spaced core samples throughout the area,Relevant
These samples are analyzed to determine if salt mining would be profitable,Relevant
When a site is selected for mining shafts are sunk into the center of the salt deposit,Relevant
Then a machine that looks like a gigantic chain saw is used to cut a slot about 60 inches (15 cm) high about 66 feet (20 m) wide and about 10 feet (3 m) deep into the salt at floor level,Relevant
This process is known as undercutting,Irrelevant
A series of holes are drilled into the undercut salt with an electric drill containing a tungsten carbide bit,Relevant
These holes are filled with an explosive such as dynamite or ammonium nitrate,Relevant
Electric blasting caps connected to long wires are attached and the explosive is detonated from a safe distance,Relevant
Cutting and blasting are repeated in a pattern that leaves pillars of salt standing to support the roof of the mining area,Relevant
This is known as the roomandpillar method and is also used in coal mines,Irrelevant
Chunks of blasted rock salt are transported to an underground crushing area,Relevant
Here they are passed over a grating known as a grizzly which collects pieces smaller than about 9 inches (23 cm),Relevant
Larger pieces are crushed in a rotating cylinder between metal jaws with spiked teeth,Relevant
The salt is then transported outside the mine to a secondary crushing area where a smaller grizzly and a smaller crusher reduce the particle size to about 32 inches (8 cm),Relevant
At this point foreign matter is removed from the salt a process known as picking,Irrelevant
Metal is removed by magnets and other material by hand,Relevant
Rocky material may also be removed in a Bradford breaker a rotating metal drum with small holes in the bottom,Relevant
Salt is dumped into the drum breaks when it hits the bottom and passes through the holes,Relevant
Rocky matter is generally harder than salt so it does not break and does not go through,Irrelevant
The picked salt then goes to a tertiary crushing area where an even smaller grizzly and crusher produce particles about 10 inch (25 cm) in size,Relevant
If smaller particles are needed the salt is passed through a grinder consisting of two metal cylinders rolling against each other,Relevant
If purer salt is needed rock salt is dissolved in water to form brine for further processing,Relevant
Otherwise the crushed or ground salt is passed through screens to sort it by size poured into bags and shipped to the consumer,Relevant
The simplest method of evaporating brine is solar evaporation but it can only be used in hot dry sunny places,Irrelevant
The brine is collected into shallow ponds and allowed to evaporate in the sun,Relevant
Insoluble impurities such as sand and clay and slightly soluble impurities such as calcium carbonate settle to the bottom as evaporation begins,Relevant
The brine is pumped or moved by gravity flow to another pond where calcium sulfate settles out as evaporation continues,Relevant
The remaining brine is moved to yet another pond where the salt settles out as evaporation proceeds,Relevant

The brine is moved one more time before evaporation is complete to prevent highly soluble impurities such as magnesium chloride magnesium sulfate potassium chloride and magnesium bromide from settling out with the salt,Relevant
These substances may be collected separately for commercial use,Relevant
Rock salt is simply crystallized salt,Relevant
It is the result of the evaporation of ancient oceans millions of years ago,Irrelevant
Large deposits of rock salt are found in the United States Canada Germany eastern Europe and China,Irrelevant
The salt is scooped up by machines running on temporary railroad tracks laid on top of the layer of salt,Relevant
It is then washed with highly concentrated salt water,Relevant
This water contains so much salt that it cannot hold any more so the salt is washed free of any trace impurities without dissolving,Relevant
The washed salt is removed from the salt water rinsed with a small amount of fresh water and piled into huge stacks to drain for two or three months,Relevant
At this point the salt is about 994 pure and can be used for many industrial purposes,Relevant
If purer salt is needed it is rewashed in salt water and fresh water allowed to drain for one or two days then dried in a hot air oven at about 365°F (185°C),Relevant
This salt is about 998 pure and can be used for food processing,Relevant
Most brine is processed by a multipleeffect vacuum evaporator,Irrelevant
This device consists of three or more closed metal cylinders with conical bottoms,Relevant
Brine is first treated chemically to remove calcium and magnesium compounds,Relevant
It then fills the bottom of the cylinders,Relevant
The brine in the first cylinder passes through tubes heated by steam,Relevant
The brine boils and its steam enters the next cylinder where it heats the brine there,Relevant
The steam from this brine heats the brine in the next cylinder and so on,Relevant
In each cylinder the condensation of steam causes the pressure inside to drop allowing the brine to boil at a lower temperature,Relevant
Salt is removed from the bottom of the cylinders as a thick slurry,Relevant
It is filtered to remove excess brine dried and passed through screens to sort the particles by size,Relevant
Salt made this way is known as vacuum pan salt and consists of small cubic crystals,Irrelevant
Brine is water containing a high concentration of salt,Irrelevant
The most obvious source of brine is the ocean but it can also be obtained from salty lakes and underground pools of salt water,Irrelevant
Brine may also be processed in a grainer,Irrelevant
The brine is chemically purified and pumped into a long open pan heated by steam running through pipes immersed in the brine,Relevant
The brine is heated to a temperature slightly below the boiling point and flakes of salt form on its surface as it evaporates,Relevant
Usually a temperature of about 194°F (90°C) is used,Relevant
Lower temperatures produce larger flakes and higher temperatures produce smaller flakes,Irrelevant
The flakes grow until they sink to the bottom of the pan where they are collected and dried,Relevant
Grainer salt consists of small flakes rather than cubes and is preferred for certain uses in food processing,Relevant
Sometimes the Alberger process is used in which the brine is first partially evaporated in a vacuum evaporator then moved to a grainer,Irrelevant
This process produces a mixture of flakes and cubes,Irrelevant
At this point salt used for most purposes is ready to be packaged in bags or boxes and shipped to consumers,Relevant

To make iodized table salt however potassium iodide is added then magnesium carbonate calcium silicate calcium phosphate magnesium silicate or calcium carbonate is added to make it freeflowing,Relevant
The salt is then packaged and shipped to restaurants and grocery stores,Relevant
The polymerbased adhesive is mixed and placed into the machine which applies the glue to the paper,Relevant
For preprinted pads the memo headings are printed onto large sheets of paper,Relevant
The paper is placed into the machine and prepared to be fed through the priming device,Relevant
As the paper passes through the machine continuous rollers prime the back side of the paper with a substrate,Relevant
Next the polymer glue is applied on top of the substrate,Relevant
As the paper passes from the glue application another device stacks the sheets of paper on top of each other to form large pads,Relevant
Attached to the bottom of the pad is a piece of paper listing the company and brand names,Relevant
The pads are cut into smaller square and rectangular pads in the standard sizes ranging from the smaller 15 by 20 inches (38 by 51 cm) to 85 by 11 (22 by 28 cm),Relevant
The pads are labeled with the product name and manufacturer and wrapped in plastic,Relevant
The pads are packaged together in bulk into larger boxes and shipped to distributors and wholesalers,Relevant
Only the healthiest moths are used for breeding,Irrelevant
Their eggs are categorized graded and meticulously tested for infection,Relevant
Unhealthy eggs are burned,Relevant
The healthiest eggs may be placed in cold storage until they are ready to be hatched,Relevant
Once the eggs are incubated they usually hatch within seven days,Relevant
They emerge at a mere oneeighth of an inch (32 mm) long and must be maintained in a carefully controlled environment,Relevant
Under normal conditions the eggs would hatch once a year in the spring when mulberry trees begin to leaf,Irrelevant
But with the intervention of sericulturists breeding can occur as many as three times per year,Irrelevant
The silkworms feed only on the leaves of the mulberry tree,Irrelevant
The mulberry leaves are finely chopped and fed to the voracious silkworms every few hours for 20 to 35 days,Relevant
During this period the wormns increase in size to about 35 inches (89 cm),Relevant
They also shed their skin or molt four times and change color from gray to a translucent pinkish color,Relevant
When the silkworm starts to fidget and toss its head back and forth it is preparing to spin its cocoon,Relevant
The caterpillar attaches itself to either a twig or rack for support,Relevant
As the worm twists its head it spins a double strand of fiber in a figureeight pattern and constructs a symmetrical wall around itself,Relevant
The filament is secreted from each of two glands called the spinneret located under the jaws of the silkworm,Relevant
The insoluble proteinlike fiber is called fibroin,Irrelevant
The fibroin is held together by sericin a soluble gum secreted by the worm which hardens as soon as it is exposed to air,Relevant
The result is the raw silk fiber called the bave,Relevant
The caterpillar spins a cocoon encasing itself completely,Relevant
It can then safely transform into the chrysalis which is the pupa stage,Irrelevant
The natural course would be for the chrysalis to break through the protective cocoon and emerge as a moth,Relevant
However sericulturists must destroy the chrysalis so that it does not break the silk filament,Relevant
This is done by stoving or stifling the chrysalis with heat,Relevant
The filature is the factory in which the cocoons are processed into silk thread,Irrelevant
In the filature the cocoons are sorted by various characteristics including color and size so that the finished product can be of uniform quality,Irrelevant
The cocoons must then be soaked in hot water to loosen the sericin,Relevant
Although the silk is about 20 sericin only 1 is removed at this stage,Irrelevant
This way the gum facilitates the following stage in which the filaments are combined to form silk thread or yarn,Irrelevant
Reeling may be achieved manually or automatically,Irrelevant
The cocoon is brushed to locate the end of the fiber,Relevant
It is threaded through a porcelain eyelet and the fiber is reeled onto a wheel,Relevant
Meanwhile diligent operators check for flaws in the filaments as they are being reeled,Relevant
As each filament is nearly finished being reeled a new fiber is twisted onto it thereby forming one long continuous thread,Relevant
Sericin contributes to the adhesion of the fibers to each other,Irrelevant
The end product the raw silk filaments are reeled into skeins,Relevant
These skeins are packaged into bundles weighing 510 pounds (24 kg) called books,Relevant
The books are further packaged into bales of 133 pounds (60 kg) and transported to manufacturing centers,Relevant
Silk thread also called yarn is formed by throwing or twisting the reeled silk,Relevant
First the skeins of raw silk are categorized by color size and quantity,Relevant
Next they are soaked in warm water mixed with oil or soap to soften the sericin,Relevant
The silk is then dried,Relevant
As the silk filaments are reeled onto bobbins they are twisted in a particular manner to achieve a certain texture of yarn,Relevant
For instance singles consist of several filaments which are twisted together in one direction,Irrelevant
They are turned tightly for sheer fabrics and loosely for thicker fabrics,Irrelevant
Combinations of singles and untwisted fibers may be twisted together in certain patterns to achieve desired textures of fabrics such as crepe de chine voile or tram,Irrelevant
Fibers may also be manufactured in different patterns for use in the nap of fabrics for the outside or for the inside of the fabric,Irrelevant
The silk yarn is put through rollers to make the width more uniform,Relevant
The yarn is inspected weighed and packaged,Relevant
Finally the yarn is shipped to fabric manufacturers,Relevant
To achieve the distinctive softness and shine of silk the remaining sericin must be removed from the yarn by soaking it in warm soapy water,Relevant
Degumming decreases the weight of the yarn by as much as 25,Irrelevant
After degumming the silk yarn is a creamy white color,Relevant
It may next be dyed as yarn or after the yarn has been woven into fabric,Relevant
The silk industry makes a distinction between puredye silk and what is called weighted silk,Irrelevant
In the puredye process the silk is colored with dye and may be finished with watersoluble substances such as starch glue sugar or gelatin,Irrelevant
To produce weighted silk metallic substances are added to the fabric during the dying process,Relevant
This is done to increase the weight lost during degumming and to add body to the fabric,Irrelevant
If weighting is not executed properly it can decrease the longevity of the fabric so puredye silk is considered the superior product,Irrelevant
After dyeing silk fabric may be finished by additional processes such as bleaching embossing steaming or stiffening,Relevant
Not all of the silk filament is usable for reeled silk,Irrelevant
The leftover silk may include the brushed ends or broken cocoons,Irrelevant
This shorter staple silk may be used for spinning silk in a manner of fabrics like cotton and linen,Irrelevant
The quality of spun silk is slightly inferior to reeled silk in that it is a bit weaker and it tends to become fuzzy,Irrelevant
The waste material from the spun silk can also be used for making waste silk or silk noil,Irrelevant
This coarse material is commonly used for draperies and upholstery ,Irrelevant
Modern skis can be classified into three different types laminated torsionbox and singleshell,Irrelevant
The laminated method is the one most commonly used in ski manufacturing since the combination of various materials allows for greater array of models,Irrelevant
Laminated skis may contain one or all of the following materials plastic fiberglass carbon wood steel aluminum neoprene or ceramics,Irrelevant
These elements are sandwiched or layered on the top and bottom of the core,Relevant
In a torsionbox ski the core material is surrounded by fiberglass or carbon fibers,Relevant
Instead of being sandwiched around the core the layers wrap around it in what is known as wet wrap construction,Relevant
The core is then sealed with resin and heat ,Relevant
This more complex manufacturing process means that torsionbox skis are more expensive than laminated ones but they provide better handling and thus are more appealing to serious skiers ,Irrelevant
Singleshell skis are made from a strong inner material such as wood but enclosed by a flexible fiberglass or plastic shell and sides ,Irrelevant
The lighter weight of singleshell skis means that more control is located at the tip of the skis giving the user better steering control and turning ability ,Irrelevant
The manufacturing process for most skis originates in a warehousetype room of the factory ,Irrelevant
Here all the raw materials—the roughlycut blocks of wood for wood cores the steel edges sheets of polyethylene for the bases rolls of fiberglass or aluminum—are sorted and stacked ,Irrelevant
For skis with wood cores the prelaminated wood is put through a mill for precise cutting and finishing ,Relevant
These mills are computeroperated by a technician who sets the parameters through numerical controls on the machine ,Relevant
This process is also used for aluminum cores ,Irrelevant
The machine cuts and mills the material including the cores thickness and sidecut and also collects the excess which are returned to the suppliers ,Relevant
In skis with polyurethane cores the top and base layers are put into a mold then a press and the foam is injected with a hose ,Relevant
As it expands and hardens the foam fuses the layers and becomes the core ,Relevant
Modern skis can be classified into three different types ,Irrelevant
In laminated skis various layers sandwich the core on top and bottom ,Irrelevant
In torsionbox ski construction the layers wrap around the core,Irrelevant
In singleshell construction polyurethane foam is sometimes injected into the ski shell ,Irrelevant
As this foam expands and hardens the top and sides form one sheet ,Irrelevant
In the next step the core and the rest of the layers including the top and base are placed into a mold and then into a press ,Relevant
Heat and pressure result in a rudimentary ski then epoxy resin is used to completely seal the layers together ,Relevant
Singleshell or cap skis require a more complicated assembly process and more precise molding chambers,Irrelevant
They still use wood or foam cores but the top and sides are united in one sheet and this makes the core less integral to the skis overall performance,Irrelevant
The polyethylene base the running surface of the ski is bonded onto the ski,Relevant
Steel edges are also bonded onto the ski surface,Relevant
Another important difference between the laminated and torsionbox types of skis and singleshell ones is the application of graphics,Irrelevant
Flashy colors and logos are a trademark of ski design and manufacturers use graphics to differentiate their models,Irrelevant
In singleshell skis graphics are applied to the top or cap before the parts go into the mold,Irrelevant
The heattransfer process is commonly used a method that can best be compared to the way an emblem is applied to a tshirt with an iron,Irrelevant
In the ski industry this process is called sublimation and it yields a visually complex but clear image,Irrelevant
Another method used in singleshell graphics applications is backprinting in which graphics are applied in reverse to a clear sheet through silkscreening then flipped over,Irrelevant
During assembly the freshly applied graphics remain protected during the molding stage,Irrelevant
With traditional laminated and torsionbox skis the graphics are applied in one of the final steps of the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
The actual ski goes through a silkscreen process where the design is first put on a piece of silk or other thin fabric,Irrelevant
The areas which are not to be colored are covered with an impermeable substance and then ink is forced through the fabric,Relevant
This must be done several times over one press for each color and the ski must be allowed to dry between presses,Relevant
A curtain coat of lacquer is then applied,Relevant
Because of the complexities of this process skis made this way often take days to dry whereas singleshell skis can be finished in a matter of hours,Irrelevant
The final finishing process is nearly the same among all types of skis,Irrelevant
The bases must be put through a machine that grinds and polishes them and this is done with a combination of belt sanding and stone grinding,Relevant
Stone grinding is considered superior to the belt method,Irrelevant
Next the skis must be matched up into pairs,Relevant
The edges are also beveled and polished,Relevant
This is done with a machine that tests their flexibility and camber,Relevant
After they are paired a quality control technician makes certain that they are wellmatched,Relevant
In the final stages the steel edges are oiled the skis waxed wrapped in polyethylene and boxed for shipping to retail outlets,Relevant
The production of a smoke detector consists of two major steps,Irrelevant
One is fabrication of the Am241 into a form (typically a foil) that can be installed into the sensing and reference chambers,Irrelevant

The other is assembly of the entire ICSD beginning either with all of the individual components or with prefabricated sensing and reference chambers obtained from the manufacturer of the radioactive source material,Irrelevant
The following description covers all steps even though some may be done by different manufacturers,Irrelevant
Tests and inspections at several stages of the assembly process ensure a reliable product,Irrelevant
The process begins with the compound AmO 2 an oxide of Am241,Irrelevant
This substance is thoroughly mixed with gold shaped into a briquette and fused by pressure and heat at over 1470°F (800°C),Relevant
A backing of silver and a front covering of gold or gold alloy are applied to the briquette and sealed by hot forging,Relevant
The briquette is then processed through several stages of cold rolling to achieve the desired thickness and levels of radiation emission,Relevant
The final thickness is about 0008 inches (02 mm) with the gold cover representing about one percent of the thickness,Relevant
The resulting foil strip which is about 08 inches (20 mm) wide is cut into sections 39 inches (1 meter) long,Relevant
Circular ICSD source elements are punched out of the foil strip,Relevant
Each disc which is about 02 inches (5 mm) in diameter is mounted in a metal holder,Relevant
A thin metal rim on the holder is rolled over to completely seal the cut edge around the disc,Relevant
One disc of source material is mounted in the sensing chamber and another is mounted in the adjacent reference chamber,Relevant
The electrodes are installed in both chambers and connected to external leads which project out of the bottoms of the chambers,Relevant
Printed circuit boards are prepared from design schematics by punching holes for the component leads and by laying a copper trace on the back to form the paths for electric currents,Relevant
On the assembly line the various electronic components (diodes capacitors resistors etc) are inserted into the proper holes on the board,Relevant
Leads extending out the back of the board are trimmed,Relevant
The sensing chamber reference chamber and an alarm horn are installed on the printed circuit board,Relevant
The board then passes over a wave solder machine which solders the electronic components into place,Relevant
The plastic housing consists of a mounting base and a cover,Irrelevant
Both are made by injection molding process in which powdered plastic and molding pigments are mixed heated forced into a mold under pressure then cooled to form the final pieces,Relevant
The circuit board is seated on the plastic mounting base,Relevant
A test button is installed so the device can be tested periodically after installation in the home,Relevant
A mounting bracket is added to the base and the cover is added to complete the assembly,Relevant
The smoke detector is packaged in a cardboard box along with a battery and an owners manual,Relevant
The kettle method of making soap is still used today by small soap manufacturing companies,Irrelevant
This process takes from four to eleven days to complete and the quality of each batch is inconsistent due to the variety of oils used,Irrelevant
Around 1940 engineers and scientists developed a more efficient manufacturing process called the continuous process,Irrelevant
This procedure is employed by large soap manufacturing companies all around the world today,Irrelevant
Exactly as the name states in the continuous process soap is produced continuously rather than one batch at a time,Irrelevant
Technicians have more control of the production in the continuous process and the steps are much quicker than in the kettle method—it takes only about six hours to complete a batch of soap,Irrelevant
Fats and alkali are melted in a kettle which is a steel tank that can stand three stories high and hold several thousand pounds of material,Relevant
Steam coils within the kettle heat the batch and bring it to a boil,Relevant
After boiling the mass thickens as the fat reacts with the alkali producing soap and glycerin,Relevant
The soap and glycerin must now be separated,Relevant
The mixture is treated with salt causing the soap to rise to the top and the glycerin to settle to the bottom,Relevant
The glycerin is extracted from the bottom of the kettle,Relevant
To remove the small amounts of fat that have not saponified a strong caustic solution is added to the kettle,Relevant
This step in the process is called strong change,Irrelevant

The mass is brought to a boil again and the last of the fat turns to soap The batch may be given another salt treatment at this time or the manufacturer may proceed to the next step 4 The next step is called pitching,Relevant
The soap in the kettle is boiled again with added water The mass eventually separates into two layers The top layer is called neat soap which is about 70 soap and 30 water,Relevant
The lower layer called nigre contains most of the impurities in the soap such as dirt and salt as well as most of the water,Irrelevant
The neat soap is taken off the top,Relevant
The soap is then cooled,Relevant
The finishing process is the same as for soap made by the continuous process,Irrelevant
Developed around 1940 and used by todays major soapmaking companies the above illustrations show the continuous process of making soap,Irrelevant
The first step of the continuous process splits natural fat into fatty acids and glycerin,Relevant
The equipment used is a vertical stainless steel column with the diameter of a barrel called a hydrolizer,Irrelevant
It may be as tall as 80 feet (24 m),Irrelevant
Pumps and meters attached to the column allow precise measurements and control of the process,Irrelevant
Molten fat is pumped into one end of the column while at the other end water at high temperature (266°F [130°C]) and pressure is introduced,Relevant
This splits the fat into its two components,Relevant
The fatty acid and glycerin are pumped out continuously as more fat and water enter,Relevant
The fatty acids are then distilled for purification,Relevant
The purified fatty acids are next mixed with a precise amount of alkali to form soap,Relevant
Other ingredients such as abrasives and fragrance are also mixed in,Relevant
The hot liquid soap may be then whipped to incorporate air,Relevant
The soap may be poured into molds and allowed to harden into a large slab,Relevant
It may also be cooled in a special freezer,Relevant
The slab is cut into smaller pieces of bar size which are then stamped and wrapped,Relevant
The entire continuous process from splitting to finishing can be accomplished in several hours,Irrelevant
Most toiletry soap undergoes additional processing called milling,Irrelevant
The milled bar lathers up better and has a finer consistency than nonmilled soap,Irrelevant
The cooled soap is fed through several sets of heavy rollers (mills) which crush and knead it,Irrelevant
Perfumes can best be incorporated at this time because their volatile oils do not evaporate in the cold mixture,Relevant
After the soap emerges from the mills it is pressed into a smooth cylinder and extruded,Relevant
The extruded soap is cut into bar size stamped and wrapped,Relevant
Most soft drinks are made at local bottling and canning companies,Irrelevant
Brand name franchise companies grant licenses to bottlers to mix the soft drinks in strict accordance to their secret formulas and their required manufacturing procedures,Irrelevant
The quality of water is crucial to the success of a soft drink,Irrelevant
Impurities such as suspended particles organic matter and bacteria may degrade taste and color,Irrelevant
They are generally removed through the traditional process of a series of coagulation filtration and chlorination,Irrelevant
Coagulation involves mixing a gelatinous precipitate or floc (ferric sulphate or aluminum sulphate) into the water,Relevant
The floc absorbs suspended particles making them larger and more easily trapped by filters,Relevant
During the clarification process alkalinity must be adjusted with an addition of lime to reach the desired pH level,Relevant
The clarified water is poured through a sand filter to remove fine particles of floc,Relevant
The water passes through a layer of sand and courser beds of gravel to capture the particles,Relevant
Sterilization is necessary to destroy bacteria and organic compounds that might spoil the waters taste or color,Relevant
The water is pumped into a storage tank and is dosed with a small amount of free chlorine,Relevant
The chlorinated water remains in the storage tank for about two hours until the reaction is complete,Irrelevant
Next an activated carbon filter dechlorinates the water and removes residual organic matter much like the sand filter,Relevant
A vacuum pump deaerates the water before it passes into a dosing station,Relevant
The dissolved sugar and flavor concentrates are pumped into the dosing station in a predetermined sequence according to their compatibility,Relevant
The ingredients are conveyed into batch tanks where they are carefully mixed too much agitation can cause unwanted aeration,Relevant
The syrup may be sterilized while in the tanks using ultraviolet radiation or flash pasteurization which involves quickly heating and cooling the mixture,Relevant
Fruit based syrups generally must be pasteurized,Irrelevant
The water and syrup are carefully combined by sophisticated machines called proportioners which regulate the flow rates and ratios of the liquids,Relevant
The vessels are pressurized with carbon dioxide to prevent aeration of the mixture,Relevant
Carbonation is generally added to the finished product though it may be mixed into the water at an earlier stage,Relevant
The temperature of the liquid must be carefully controlled since carbon dioxide solubility increases as the liquid temperature decreases,Relevant
Many carbonators are equipped with their own cooling systems,Irrelevant
The amount of carbon dioxide pressure used depends on the type of soft drink,Irrelevant
For instance fruit drinks require far less carbonation than mixer drinks such as tonics which are meant to be diluted with other liquids,Irrelevant
The beverage is slightly overpressured with carbon dioxide to facilitate the movement into storage tanks and ultimately to the filler machine,Relevant
The finished product is transferred into bottles or cans at extremely high flow rates,Relevant
The containers are immediately sealed with pressureresistant closures either tinplate or steel crowns with corrugated edges twist offs or pull tabs,Relevant
Because soft drinks are generally cooled during the manufacturing process they must be brought to room temperature before labeling to prevent condensation from ruining the labels,Relevant
This is usually achieved by spraying the containers with warm water and drying them,Relevant
Labels are then affixed to bottles to provide information about the brand ingredients shelf life and safe use of the product,Relevant
Most labels are made of paper though some are made of a plastic film,Irrelevant
Cans are generally preprinted with product information before the filling stage,Irrelevant
Finally containers are packed into cartons or trays which are then shipped in larger pallets or crates to distributors,Relevant
Stained glass is still made the same way it was back in the Middle Ages and comes in various forms,Irrelevant
For the glass used in leaded glass windows a lump of the molten glass is caught up at one end of a blow pipe blown into a cylinder cut flattened and cooled,Relevant
Artisans also vary this basic process in order to produce different effects,Irrelevant

For example flashed glass is made by dipping a ball of molten white glass into molten colored glass which when blown and flattened results in a less intense color because it will be white on one side and colored on the other,Irrelevant
Socalled Norman slabs are made by blowing the molten glass into a mold in the shape of a foursided bottle,Relevant
The sides are cut apart and form slabs thin at the edges and as much as 025 inch (06 cm) thik) at the center,Relevant
Another form of glass known as cathedral glass is rolled into flat sheets,Relevant
This results in a somewhat monotonous regularity of texture and thickness,Irrelevant
Other similarly made glasses are referred to as marine antique but have a more bubbly texture,Irrelevant
Large manufacturers of stained glass mix the batch of raw materials including alkaline fluxes and stabilizing agents in huge mixers,Irrelevant
The mix is then melted in a modern furnace at 2500°F (1371°C),Relevant
Each ingredient must be carefully measured and weighed according to a calculated formula in order to produce the appropriate color,Relevant
For cathedral glass the molten glass is ladled into a machine that rolls the glass into 18inch (32mm) thick sheets,Relevant
The sheets are then cooled in a special furnace called an annealing lehr,Relevant
The glass is then inspected trimmed to standard size and packed into cases,Relevant
At a typical factory eight to ten different color runs are made per day,Irrelevant
