Straight whiskeys and single malt Scotch whiskeys are not blended that is they are produced from single batches and are ready to be bottled straight from the barrel,Irrelevant
All other whiskeys are blended,Irrelevant
Different batches of whiskey are mixed together to produce a better flavor,Relevant
Often neutral grain spirit is added to lighten the flavor caramel is added to standardize the color and a small amount of sherry or port wine is added to help the flavors blend,Irrelevant
Blended Scotch whiskey usually consists of several batches of strongly flavored malt whiskeys mixed with less strongly flavored grain whiskeys,Irrelevant
A few blends contain only malt whiskeys,Irrelevant
Blending is often considered the most difficult and critical process in producing premium Scotch whiskeys,Irrelevant
A premium blended Scotch whiskey may contain more than 60 individual malt whiskeys which must be blended in the proper proportions,Irrelevant
Glass is always used to store mature whiskey because it does not react with it to change the flavor,Irrelevant
Modern distilleries use automated machinery to produce as many as 400 bottles of whiskey per minute,Irrelevant
The glass bottles move down a conveyor belt as they are cleaned filled capped sealed labeled and placed in cardboard boxes,Relevant
The whiskey is ready to be shipped to liquor stores bars and restaurants,Relevant
Zinc ores are dug from underground mines using conventional blasting drilling and hauling techniques,Irrelevant
The ores occur as zinc sulfide (also called sphalerite) zinc carbonate (smithsonite) zinc silicate (calimine) and in compounds of manganese and iron (franklinite),Irrelevant
Zinc ore is sometimes mined in conjunction with silver or lead ores,Irrelevant
In addition to the ore itself oil and sulfuric acid are required for the breakdown of the ores and electricity coke or natural gas are needed to provide the heat energy for smelting,Irrelevant
Zinc can be produced by a process called froth flotation which is also used for reduction of copper and lead ores,Irrelevant
This process involves grinding the zinc ore to a fine powder mixing it with water pine oil and flotation chemicals and then agitating the mixture to float the zinc to the surface,Irrelevant
A variety of chemicals are used to coat the important zinc particles and prevent them from becoming wetted by the water,Relevant
Then air is injected and the coated minerals attach themselves to the bubbles,Relevant
The operation is performed inside a vat and agitated with an impeller,Relevant
The rotating impeller draws the air down the standpipe that surrounds the impeller shaft and dissipates it throughout the mixture or pulp,Relevant
The zinc rises to the top and the residue stays in the bottom of the pulp since it cannot adhere to the bubbles,Irrelevant
Automatic scrapers remove the mineralladen froth containing the zinc,Relevant
The froth is filtered to remove the water and liquid oils,Relevant
The pastelike remainder is mixed with lime and sent to a furnace,Relevant
The furnace roasts the mixture at 2500°F (1371°C) which fuses the minerals into solid chunks called sinter,Relevant
At this point the material has been completely converted to zinc oxide,Relevant
The next reduction process uses a blast furnace to melt the prepared ore into its elemental components,Relevant
The blast furnace is fueled by electricity coke or natural gas which generate temperatures of up to 2200°F (1204°C),Relevant
This however also generates carbon dioxide which recombines with the zinc as it cools to reform zinc oxide,Relevant
To reduce this reformation the zinc is sprayed with molten lead while it is still hot,Relevant
The lead at 1022°F (550°C) dissolves the zinc and carries it to another chamber where it is cooled to 824°F (440°C),Relevant
At this temperature the lighter zinc separates out of the lead and is drained off the top,Relevant
The lead is reheated and returned to the blast furnace,Relevant
Further metal improvement can be made by keeping the zinc molten and undisturbed for several hours,Irrelevant
In this state iron and other contaminants settle to the bottom allowing the almost pure zinc to be carefully drawn off the top and cast into ingots,Relevant
Most zinc is alloyed with other metals before use to improve its properties,Irrelevant
Alloying involves remelting and mixing the zinc with other metals in precise proportions,Relevant
For example approximately 4 aluminum is added to improve casting quality and die life in the diecasting process,Irrelevant
Other added alloys are small amounts of titanium copper and magnesium,Relevant
After alloying the molten metal is poured into sow molds and ingot molds,Relevant
Sows can weigh several thousand pounds while ingots weigh about 45 pounds (20 kg),Irrelevant
The manufacture of an accordion is not a completely automated process,Irrelevant
In a sense all accordions could be called handmade since there is always some hand assembly of the small parts required,Irrelevant
The general process involves making the individual parts assembling the subsections assembling the entire instrument and final decorating and packaging,Irrelevant
Depending on the manufacturer the parts of an accordion can be supplied by outside manufacturers or made inhouse,Irrelevant
The wooden parts are typically cut into the appropriate shapes by jigs and presses,Relevant
This is an automated process in which the wood passes by these machines and is then cut,Relevant
This system significantly simplifies the repeated making of identical components and ensures they are made with a high degree of precision,Irrelevant
The plastic components of the accordion such as the buttons and keys are usually produced by injection molding,Relevant
In this approach plastic is supplied as granules or powder and is fed into a large hopper,Relevant
It is then heated converting it into a liquid that can then be forcibly injected into a mold,Relevant
After it cools it solidifies and maintains its shape after the die is opened,Relevant
Various processes are used to construct the many metal parts of an accordion,Irrelevant
These typically involve melting the metal to a liquid form then placing it in a preformed mold,Relevant
When the metal is cooled and hardened the mold is opened and the part is complete,Relevant
In the case of the reeds the metal is specially treated by a process called tempering,Relevant
This reduces the hardness and brittleness of the metal making it more ductile and tough,Irrelevant
After the individual parts are made partial assembly begins,Irrelevant
The reeds are riveted or screwed to an aluminum alloy reed plate,Relevant
This plate has two slots and the reeds are attached over each on opposite sides,Relevant
On the open end of each slot a leather or plastic valve is secured,Relevant
The reed plates are then arranged in a specific order and attached to a wooden reed block,Relevant
Depending on the model three or four of these blocks are put in the treble and bass side casings,Relevant
The treble keyboard is attached to the reed block and the bass side buttons and keyboards are also attached,Relevant
The bellows is typically supplied by outside manufacturers,Relevant
It is made by folding and pleating strong cardboard and reinforcing it with leather and steel strips,Relevant
The treble and bass casings are attached to it and sealed with wax to prevent air leakage,Relevant
After the main parts have been assembled various decorative finishing touches are put on the accordion,Relevant
For example the instrument is painted the treble grill is attached and the manufacturers name is added,Irrelevant
The accordion is then put in its case packaged and shipped to distributors for sale,Relevant
Sculpted acrylic nails are not manufactured on an assembly line by a machine,Irrelevant
Instead as the name implies they are sculpted by a nail technician,Relevant
Each handcrafted nail is formed one at a time using a process which consists of the following steps cleansing priming mixing sculpting and finishing,Irrelevant
Before the new nail can be sculpted the natural nail must be properly prepared,Relevant
A nail bed cleanser is used to thoroughly clean the surface of the nail,Relevant
These cleansers are typically solvents such as isopropyl alcohol which dissolve oils and grease from the surface of the nail,Irrelevant
They will also remove bacteria from the area to help reduce the chance of infection,Irrelevant
Care must be used when applying these solvents because they may dry out the skin surrounding the cuticle,Irrelevant
This occurs because the solvents also remove the skins own natural moisturizing oils,Irrelevant
After the nail bed has been cleansed a primer is applied to the nail bed to make sure the acrylic will adhere properly,Relevant
Primers are available in two types nonetching and etching,Irrelevant

The nonetching type works like doublesided tape one side of the primer is very good at sticking to the natural nail and the other end is equally attracted to the acrylic polymers used in the artificial nail,Irrelevant
The etching type of primers are acids such as methacrylic acid which actually dissolve a thin layer of the nail itself,Irrelevant
This etching process allows the acrylic to adhere to the nail better,Relevant
The etching primers are more commonly used than nonetching,Irrelevant
There is some debate regarding the proper use of etching primers some chemists argue that the primer should dry thoroughly before applying the acrylic,Irrelevant
Others believe that the acrylic should be applied while the primer is still wet to pull the acrylic deeper into the nail and anchor it more firmly,Irrelevant
The resin is made when the acrylic liquid is mixed with the acrylic powder,Relevant
The nail technician must work quickly with the resin once the liquid and powder are mixed,Relevant
If not the resin will harden before it can shaped into a nail and will not be useable,Irrelevant
Before the resin is applied a nailshaped form is placed over each fingertip in order to hold the resin in place and ensure it takes the correct size and shape,Relevant
These forms may be made of metalized foil or plastic,Irrelevant
One common type consists of a thin metallic foil with an adhesive backing,Irrelevant
The form is peeled off a roll (like a label) and carefully affixed to the fingers,Relevant
The technician then applies the resin to the clients fingertips,Relevant
The resin is sculpted to look as natural as possible before the resin hardens,Relevant
The form is then removed,Relevant
After the acrylic dries the new nail is filed and manicured to shape,Relevant
Finally coatings and polishes are used to complete the manicure,Relevant
As the natural nail grows further application of the liquid plastic is needed for the acrylic nail to maintain a regular contour,Relevant
In some cases an acetate tip is also applied to the end of the nail to provide a stronger base for the layers of acrylic resin,Relevant
Most air conditioners start out as raw material in the form of structural steel shapes and sheet steel,Irrelevant
As the sheet metal is processed into fabrication cells or work cells it is cut formed punched drilled sheared andor bent into a useful shape or form,Irrelevant
The encasements or wrappers the metal that envelopes most outdoor residential units is made of galvanized sheet metal that uses a zinc coating to provide protection against corrosion,Irrelevant
Galvanized sheet metal is also used to form the bottom pan face plates and various support brackets throughout an air conditioner,Irrelevant
This sheet metal is sheared on a shear press in a fabrication cell soon after arriving from storage or inventory,Relevant
Structural steel shapes are cut and mitered on a band saw to form useful brackets and supports,Relevant
From the shear press the sheet metal is loaded on a CNC (Computer Numerical Control) punch press,Relevant

The punch press has the option of receiving its computer program from a drafting CADCAM (Computer Aided DraftingComputer Aided Manufacturing) program or from an independently written CNC program,Irrelevant
The CADCAM program will transform a drafted or modeled part on the computer into a file that can be read by the punch press telling it where to punch holes in the sheet metal,Relevant
Dies and other punching instruments are stored in the machine and mechanically brought to the punching arm where it can be used to drive through the sheet,Relevant
The NC (Numerically Controlled) press brakes bend the sheet into its final form using a computer file to program itself,Relevant
Different bending dies are used for different shapes and configurations and may be changed for each component,Irrelevant
Some brackets fins and sheet components are outsourced to other facilities or companies to produce large quantities,Irrelevant
They are brought to the assembly plant only when needed for assembly,Irrelevant

Many of the brackets are produced on a hydraulic or mechanical press where brackets of different shapes and configurations can be produced from a coiled sheet and unrolled continuously into the machine,Irrelevant
High volumes of parts can be produced because the press can often produce a complex shape with one hit,Irrelevant
All parts must be completely clean and free of dirt oil grease and lubricants before they are powder coated,Irrelevant
Various cleaning methods are used to accomplish this necessary task,Irrelevant
Large solution tanks filled with a cleaning solvent agitate and knock off the oil when parts are submersed,Relevant
Spray wash systems use pressurized cleaning solutions to knock off dirt and grease,Relevant
Vapor degreasing suspending the parts above a harsh cleansing vapor uses an acid solution and will leave the parts free of petroleum products,Relevant
Most outsourced parts that arrive from a vendor have already been degreased and cleaned,Irrelevant
For additional corrosion protection many parts will be primed in a phosphate primer bath before entering a drying oven to prepare them for the application of the powder coating,Irrelevant
Before brackets pans and wrappers are assembled together they are fed through a powder coating operation,Relevant
The powder coating system sprays a paintlike dry powder onto the parts as they are fed through a booth on an overhead conveyor,Relevant
This can be done by robotic sprayers that are programmed where to spray as each part feeds through the booth on the conveyor,Irrelevant
The parts are statically charged to attract the powder to adhere to deep crevices and bends within each part,Relevant
The powdercoated parts are then fed through an oven usually with the same conveyor system where the powder is permanently baked onto the metal,Relevant
The process takes less than 10 minutes,Irrelevant

The condenser and evaporator both act as a heat exchanger in air conditioning systems and are made of copper or aluminum tubing bent around in coil form to maximize the distance through which the working fluid travels,Relevant
The opposing fluid or cooling fluid passes around the tubes as the working fluid draws away its heat in the evaporator,Relevant
This is accomplished by taking many small diameter copper tubes bent in the same shape and anchoring them with guide rods and aluminum plates,Irrelevant
The working fluid or refrigerant flows through the copper tubes and the opposing fluid flows around them in between the aluminum plates,Irrelevant
The tubes will often end up with hairpin bends performed by NC benders using the same principle as the NC press brake,Relevant
Each bend is identical to the next,Irrelevant
The benders use previously straightened tubing to bend around a fixed die with a mandrel fed through the inner diameter to keep it from collapsing during the bend,Relevant
The mandrel is raked back through the inside of the tube when the bend has been accomplished,Relevant
Tubing supplied to the manufacturer in a coil form goes through an uncoiler and straightener before being fed through the bender,Relevant
Some tubing will be cut into desired lengths on an abrasive saw that will cut several small tubes in one stroke,Relevant
The aluminum plates are punched out on a punch press and formed on a mechanical press to place divots or waves in the plate,Relevant
These waves maximize the thermodynamic heat transfer between the working fluid and the opposing medium,Irrelevant

When the copper tubes are finished in the bending cell they are transported by automatic guided vehicle (AGV) to the assembly cell where they are stacked on the guide rods and fed through the plates or fins,Relevant
A major part of the assembly is the joining of the copper tubing with the aluminum plates,Irrelevant
This assembly becomes the evaporator and is accomplished by taking the stacked copper tubing in their hairpin configuration and mechanically fusing them to the aluminum plates,Relevant
The fusing occurs by taking a bullet or mandrel and feeding it through the copper tubing to expand it and push it against the inner part of the hole of the plate,Irrelevant
This provides a thrifty yet useful bond between the tubing and plate allowing for heat transfer,Irrelevant
The condenser is manufactured in a similar manner except that the opposing medium is usually air which cools off the copper or aluminum condenser coils without the plates,Irrelevant
They are held by brackets which support the coiled tubing and are connected to the evaporator with fittings or couplings,Relevant
The condenser is usually just one tube that may be bent around in a number of hairpin bends,Irrelevant
The expansion valve a complete component is purchased from a vendor and installed in the piping after the condenser,Relevant
It allows the pressure of the working fluid to decrease and reenter the pump,Irrelevant
The pump is also purchased complete I h from an outside supplier,Irrelevant
Designed to increase system pressure and circulate the working fluid the pump is connected with fittings to the system and anchored in place by support brackets and a base,Irrelevant
It is bolted together with the other structural members of the air conditioner and covered by the wrapper or sheet metal encasement,Relevant
The encasement is either riveted or bolted together to provide adequate protection for the inner components,Relevant
The envelope is made of patterns of fabric panels,Irrelevant
Two or three plies of cloth are impregnated with an elastomer,Relevant
One of these plies is placed in a bias direction with respect to others,Relevant
The pieces of the envelope can be put together in a number of ways,Irrelevant
They can be cemented and sewn together or heatwelded (heatsealed),Irrelevant
The outside of the envelope is coated with aluminized paint for protection against sunlight,Relevant
The envelope will have the required shape when filled with gas,Irrelevant
The catenery curtains are attached on to the main envelope proper in a similar manner,Relevant
The bladder is formed from strips that are welded together,Relevant
The tail construction consists mostly of lightweight metal structural beams covered with doped fabric,Irrelevant
They are held to the envelope by cables which distribute the load into fabric patches cemented or heatwelded to the envelope proper,Relevant
They are not directly attached to the envelope in the manufacturing process but put on when the blimp is inflated,Relevant
The frame of the gondola is made of material similar to the tail construction covered with doped fabric,Irrelevant
The erection of the blimp takes only a short amount of time,Irrelevant
(The following is only one method of inflation),Irrelevant
There are variations on this method,Irrelevant
The envelope is spread out on the floor of the airship hangar with a net placed over it,Relevant
This net is held down by sandbags,Relevant
Gas is fed into the enveloped from tank cars each containing 200000 cu ft (5700 cu m) of 999 pure helium compressed to 2100 psi (145 megapascals),Relevant
The net is allowed to slowly rise with the envelope underneath it,Relevant
Fins nose cone battens air valves and helium valves are attached while the envelope is still near the ground,Relevant
After these parts are attached the envelope is allowed to rise high enough to permit rolling the gondola underneath it,Relevant
After the gondola is attached the net is removed and the airship is rigged for flight,Relevant
When transported the uninflated fabric envelopes can be folded shipped and stored in a space that takes up less than 1 of its inflated volume,Relevant
This feature makes the nonrigid airship more practical than a rigid one,Irrelevant
Creating an animated short or fulllength feature is a long tedious process,Irrelevant
Extremely laborintensive the average short cartoon has approximately 45000 separate frames,Irrelevant
To make a character say Hello Simon can require 12 drawings to depict each movement of the characters lips,Irrelevant
Sometimes the animator is also the writer,Irrelevant
The animator makes a storyboard a series of onepanel sketches pinned on a board,Relevant
Dialogue andor action summaries are written under each sketch,Relevant
The sketches may be rearranged several times as a result of discussions between the writer the animator and the director,Relevant
Actors record the voices of each character,Relevant
Background music and sound effects such as doors slamming footsteps and weather sounds are recorded,Relevant
These recordings are generally preserved on magnetic tape,Relevant
The music is timed for beats and accents this information is recorded on a bar sheet so that the animation can be fitted around the music,Relevant
Because Walt Disney was one of the first animators to fit the action to the music this process is called Mickey Mousing,Irrelevant

Many professional studios now use an optical sound track on which voices music and sound effects are represented by varying lines An electronic sound reader and synchronizer gives an accurate count of the number of frames required for each sound 3 A technician known as a track reader measures each vowel and consonant in the dialogue Words are recorded on exposure sheets (also called xsheets or dope sheets) each of which represents a single film frame This allows the animators to synchronize each movement of the characters lips with the dialogue Footage the time needed between lines of dialogue for the action to take place is also charted on the exposure sheet Slugs or sections of film without sound are inserted where the action occurs 4 A model is created for each character in order to keep their appearances uniform throughout the film The models can be detailed descriptions or sketches of the characters in various positions with various facial expressions 5 A layout artist creates linear drawings that animators use as a guide for action and that the background artists use to paint the backgrounds 6 Using the model sheets the head animator sketches the primary or extreme action,Irrelevant
For example if the character is running the head animator will draw the foot leaving the floor the foot in the air and the foot returning to the floor,Irrelevant
Or if the story calls for the character to blink the head animator will sketch the eyes going through the motions,Irrelevant
Animation assistants then fill in the details,Relevant
The drawing is done on a transparent drawing board that is lighted from below,Relevant
After one drawing is completed a second sheet of paper is laid on top of the first and the second drawing is varied slightly to signify movement,Relevant
Drawings are cleaned up and checked for accuracy 7 Artists check the characters against the model sheets,Relevant
Drawings are enhanced but not altered,Relevant
Scenes are checked to ensure that all action called for on the exposure sheet is included,Relevant
All figures are checked for proper lineup with the background,Relevant
A video test is conducted 8 A computerized videotape is made of the sketches to check for smoothness of motion and proper facial expressions,Relevant
Adjustments are made until the desired effect is achieved,Relevant
Artists create backgrounds 9 Artists create color background paintings including landscapes scenery buildings and interiors from the pencil layouts,Relevant
The color is filled in by computer,Relevant
As the computer scans the layout artists click on colors from a template,Relevant
Sketches are inked in and painted 10 If the animation drawings have been executed on paper they are now transferred to cels using xerography a process similar to photocopying,Relevant
In a few studios the inking is still done by hand tracing the pencil sketches onto the cels,Irrelevant
Colors are applied to the reverse side of the cel usually by computer in the same manner that background colors are applied,Relevant
All inked and painted materials are checked several times for accuracy,Relevant
The action is filmed 11 The cels and backgrounds are photographed according to the instructions on the exposure sheets,Relevant
One scene of action can take several hours to photograph,Irrelevant
The cels are laid on top of the backgrounds and photographed with a multiplane camera that is suspended high above,Relevant
When more than one character appears in a frame the number of cels stacked on top of the background increases,Irrelevant
Each level is lit and staggered creating the illusion of threedimensional action,Irrelevant
The film is sent to the photo lab where a print and a negative are made,Relevant
The sound is dubbed 12 Dialogue music and sound effects are rerecorded from 10 or more separate tracks onto one balanced track,Relevant
Another set of two tracks one with dialogue and the other with music and sound effects is often made to facilitate translation when the film is sent to foreign markets,Relevant
The dubbing track and print are combined 13 The final dubbing track is combined with the print to make a married print,Relevant
If the animated film is for television viewing the negative and the tracks are often sent to a video postproduction house to be put on videotape,Relevant
The following description applies generically to reusable hard tags details may vary among manufacturers,Irrelevant
Disposable security tags are manufactured in a similar manner except that the resonator is sealed inside a flexible plastic envelope which may be backed with adhesive,Irrelevant
The plastic casing for the tag is vacuum formed or injection molded,Relevant
In the former process plastic that has been softened by heat is drawn into a mold by creation of a vacuum,Relevant
In the latter semimolten plastic is squirted under pressure into a cooled mold where it hardens quickly,Relevant
There are several ways a resonator can be made,Irrelevant
One technique involves laminating copper or aluminum coils onto a web of nonconductive material,Relevant
This is done by passing the adhesivecoated base web between rollers that apply a spiralshaped mask of nonsticky material after which the web passes through a dryer to set the mask,Relevant
A thin flat strip of metal is then laminated to the uncoated (sticky) portion of the base web,Relevant

The laminated strip subsequently passes between a backup roller and a cutting roller which cuts through the metal but not the base web disconnecting the individual metal coils from one another,Relevant

This masking and laminating process is repeated adding a layer of web with metal spirals atop the first layer so that the two layers of spirals are face to face separated by a layer of dielectric (nonconductive) material,Relevant
Finally the laminated strip is cut into individual resonators that can be inserted into security tags,Relevant
Another type of resonator is made by winding insulated (encased in plastic) copper wire into a flat spiral of about a dozen loops with the ends of the wire connected through a diode,Irrelevant
One company makes a buttonshaped tag that can operate with a very smalldiameter coil because the wire is spiraled into a cone shape,Relevant
After the resonator is inserted into the security tags plastic casing the locking mechanism is installed,Relevant
This usually consists of a clutch that will accept and lock a metal pin that can be inserted through a product at the retail store,Irrelevant
There are numerous designs of clutches but one example is a metal plate with a small hole in the middle,Irrelevant
The hole is too small for the pins shaft to pass through unless the metal plate is flexed to enlarge the hole,Relevant
Once the pin is inserted the plate flattens and the minimized hole fits around a grooved section in the shaft of the pin,Relevant
To release this grip the sales clerk inserts the tag into a magnetic device that flexes the clutch plate allowing the pin to slide free,Relevant

Another example of a clutch type is a ring of tiny balls that encircle the pin with a spring mechanism pressing the balls into a groove in the pins shaft a magnetic deactivator retracts the balls from the groove releasing the pin,Irrelevant
Still other tag designs use a mechanical deactivator that inserts a probe into the tag to physically disengage a locking device,Relevant
With the resonator and clutch assemblies in place the upper and lower portions of the plastic tag casing are attached together,Relevant
They are sealed by heat or welded by ultrasound,Relevant
Finally the completed tags are counted and boxed for shipment,Relevant
The time to make an ocular prosthesis from start to finish varies with each ocularist and the individual patient,Irrelevant
A typical time is about 35 hours,Irrelevant
Ocularists continue to look at ways to reduce this time,Irrelevant
There are two types of prostheses,Irrelevant
The very thin shell type is fitted over a blind disfigured eye or over an eye which has been just partially removed,Irrelevant
The full modified impression type is made for those who have had eyeballs completely removed,Irrelevant
The process described here is for the latter type,Irrelevant
The ocularist inspects the condition of the socket,Relevant
The horizontal and vertical dimensions and the periphery of the socket are measured,Relevant
The ocularist paints the iris,Relevant
An iris button (made from a plastic rod using a lathe) is selected to match the patients own iris diameter,Relevant
Typically iris diameters range from 04052 in (1013 mm),Irrelevant
The iris is painted on the back flat side of the button and checked against the patients iris by simply reversing the buttons so that the color can be seen through the dome of plastic,Relevant
When the color is finished the ocularist removes the conformer which prevents contraction of the eye socket,Relevant
Next the ocularist hand carves a wax molding shell,Relevant
This shell has an aluminum iris button imbedded in it that duplicates the painted iris button,Relevant
The wax shell is fitted into the patients socket so that it matches the irregular periphery of the socket,Relevant
The shell may have to be reinserted several times until the aluminum iris button is aligned with the patients remaining eye,Irrelevant
Once properly fitted two relief holes are made in the wax shell,Relevant
The impression is made using alginate a white powder made from seaweed that is mixed with water to form a cream which is also used by dentists to make impressions of gums,Irrelevant
After mixing the cream is placed on the back side of the molding shell and the shell is inserted into the socket,Relevant
The alginate gels in about two minutes and precisely duplicates the individual eye socket,Relevant
The wax shell is removed with the alginate For a conventional implant the surgeon removes the eyeball by severing the muscles which are connected to the sclera (white of eyeball),Relevant
The surgeon then cuts the optic nerve and removes the eye from the socket,Relevant
An implant is then placed into the socket to restore lost volume and to give the artificial eye some movement and the wound is closed,Relevant
impression of the eye socket attached to the back side of the wax shell,Irrelevant
The iris color is then rechecked and any necessary changes are made,Relevant
The plastic conformer is reinserted so that the final steps can be completed,Relevant
A plasterofparis cast is made of the mold of the patients eye socket,Relevant
After the plaster has hardened (about seven minutes) the wax and alginate mold is removed and discarded,Relevant
The aluminum iris button has left a hole in the plaster mold into which the painted iris button is placed,Relevant
White plastic is then put into the cast the two halves of the cast are put back together and then placed under pressure and plunged into boiling water,Relevant
This reduces the water temperature and the plastic is thus cured under pressure for about 23 minutes,Relevant
The cast is then removed from the water and cooled,Relevant
The plastic has hardened in the shape of the mold with the painted iris button imbedded in the proper place,Relevant
About 05 mm of plastic is then removed from the anterior surface of the prosthesis,Relevant
The white plastic which overlaps the iris button is ground down evenly around the edge of the button,Relevant
This simulates how the sclera of the living eye slightly overlaps the iris,Relevant
The sclera is colored using paints chalk pencils colored thread and a liquid plastic syrup to match the patients remaining eye,Relevant
Any necessary alterations to the iris color can also be made at this point,Relevant
The prosthesis is then returned to the cast,Relevant
Clear plastic is placed in the anterior half of the cast and the two halves are again joined placed under pressure and returned to the hot water,Relevant
The final processing time is about 30 minutes,Irrelevant
The cast is then removed and cooled and the finished prosthesis is removed,Relevant
Grinding and polishing the prosthesis to a high luster is the final step,Irrelevant
This final polishing is crucial to the ultimate comfort of the patient,Relevant
The prosthesis is finally ready for fitting,Relevant
The manufacturing process is deceptively simple,Irrelevant
Its main function is to trick the extracted fibroblasts into believing that they are in the human body so that they communicate with each other in the natural way to create new skin,Irrelevant
Fibroblasts are thawed and expanded,Relevant
The fibroblasts are transferred from the vials into roller bottles which resemble liter soda bottles,Relevant
The bottles are rotated on their sides for three to four weeks,Relevant
The rolling action allows the circulation of oxygen essential to the growth process,Relevant
Cells are transferred to a culture system,Relevant

The cells are removed from the roller bottles combined with a nutrientrich media flowed through tubes into thin cassettelike bioreactors housing the biodegradable mesh scaffolding and sterilized with ebeam radiation,Relevant
As the cells flow into the cassettes they adhere to the mesh and begin to grow,Relevant
The cells are flowed back and forth for three to four weeks,Relevant
Each day leftover cell suspension is removed and fresh nutrient is added,Relevant
Oxygen pH nutrient flow and temperature are controlled by the culture system,Relevant
As the new cells create a layer of dermal skin the polymer disintegrates,Relevant
Growth cycle completed,Irrelevant
When cell growth on the mesh is completed the tissue is rinsed with more nutrientrich media,Relevant
A cryoprotectant is added,Relevant
Cassettes are stored individually labeled and frozen,Relevant
Cells are transferred to a culture system,Relevant
A small amount of the cold collagen and nutrient media approximately 12 of the combined solution is added to the fibroblasts,Relevant
The mixture is dispensed into molds and allowed to come to room temperature,Relevant
As the collagen warms it gels trapping the fibroblasts and generating the growth of new skin cells,Relevant
Keratinocytes added,Relevant
Two weeks after the collagen is added to the fibroblasts the extracted keratinocytes are thawed and seeded onto the new dermal skin,Relevant
They are allowed to grow for several days and then exposed to air inducing the keratinocytes to form epidermal layers,Relevant
Growth cycle completed,Irrelevant
The new skin is stored in sterile containers until needed,Relevant
Although its components—aspartic acid phenylalanine and methanol—occur naturally in foods aspartame itself does not and must be manufactured,Irrelevant
NutraSweet (aspartame) is made through fermentation and synthesis processes,Irrelevant
Direct fermentation produces the starting amino acids needed for the manufacture of aspartame,Irrelevant
In this process specific types of bacteria which have the ability to produce certain amino acids are raised in large quantities,Irrelevant
Over the course of about three days the amino acids are harvested and the bacteria are destroyed,Irrelevant
To start the fermentation process a sample from a pure culture of bacteria is put into a test tube containing the nutrients necessary for its growth,Relevant
After this initial inoculation the bacteria begin to multiply,Relevant
When their population is large enough they are transferred to a seed tank,Relevant
The bacterial strains used to make Laspartic acid and Lphenylalanine are B flavum and C glutamicum respectively,Relevant
The seed tank provides an ideal environment for growing more bacteria,Irrelevant
It is filled with the things bacteria need to thrive including warm water and carbohydrate foods like cane molasses glucose or sucrose,Irrelevant
It also has carbon sources like acetic acid alcohols or hydrocarbons and nitrogen sources such as liquid ammonia or urea,Irrelevant
These are required for the bacteria to synthesize large quantities of the desired amino acid,Irrelevant
Other growth factors such as vitamins amino acids and minor nutrients round out seed tank contents,Irrelevant
The seed tank is equipped with a mixer which keeps the growth medium moving and a pump which delivers filtered compressed air,Irrelevant
When enough bacterial growth is present the contents from the seed tank are pumped to the fermentation tank,Relevant
The fermentation tank is essentially a larger version of the seed tank,Irrelevant
It is filled with the same growth media found in the seed tank and also provides a perfect environment for bacterial growth,Irrelevant
Here the bacteria are allowed to grow and produce large quantities of amino acids,Irrelevant
Since pH control is vital for optimal growth ammonia water is added to the tank as necessary,Relevant
When enough amino acid is present the contents of the fermentation tank are transferred out so isolation can begin,Relevant
This process starts with a centrifugal separator which isolates a large portion of the bacterial amino acids,Relevant
The desired amino acid is further segregated and purified in an ionexchange column,Relevant
From this column the amino acids are pumped to a crystallizing tank and then to a crystal separator,Relevant
They are then dried and readied for the synthesis phase of aspartame production,Relevant
Aspartame can be made by various synthetic chemical pathways,Irrelevant
In general phenylalanine is modified by a reaction with methanol and then combined with a slightly modified aspartic acid which eventually forms aspartame,Relevant
The amino acids derived from the fermentation process are initially modified to produce aspartame,Relevant
Phenylalanine is reacted with methanol resulting in a compound called Lphenylalanine methyl ester,Relevant
Aspartic acid is also modified in such a way to shield various portions of the molecule from the effects of further reactions,Relevant
One method is by reacting the aspartic acid with substances that result in added benzyl rings to protect these sites,Relevant
This ensures that further chemical reactions will occur only on specific parts of the aspartic acid molecule,Irrelevant
After the amino acids are appropriately modified they are pumped into a reactor tank where they are allowed to mix at room temperature for 24 hours,Relevant
The temperature is then increased to approximately 149°F (65 °C) and maintained for another 24 hours,Relevant
The reaction is then cooled to room temperature,Relevant
It is diluted with an appropriate solvent and cooled to about 0°F (18°C) causing crystallization,Relevant
The crystals are then isolated by filtration and dried,Relevant
These crystals are an intermediate of aspartame which must be further modified,Relevant
The intermediate is converted to aspartame by reacting it with acetic acid,Relevant
This reaction is performed in a large tank filled with an aqueous acid solution a palladium metal catalyst and hydrogen,Relevant
It is thoroughly mixed and allowed to react for about 12 hours,Relevant
The metal catalyst is removed by filtration and the solvent is distilled leaving a solid residue,Relevant
This residue is purified by dissolving it in an aqueous ethanol solution and recrystallizing,Relevant
These crystals are filtered and dried to provide the finished powder aspartame,Relevant
Asphalt pavers are assembled from component parts,Irrelevant
Some of these parts are fabricated in the assembly plant while others are manufactured elsewhere and are shipped to the plant,Irrelevant
All parts are given a primer coat of paint,Relevant
The parts are stored in a warehouse and are brought to various work stations or areas as needed,Relevant
The tractor and the screed are assembled separately,Relevant
The tractor assembly process starts as the mainframe is placed on an airflotation pallet,Relevant
As the assembly proceeds the tractor is manually moved by attaching a compressed air line to the flotation pallet,Relevant
This allows the heavy tractor to float on a thin cushion of air and it can be easily pushed from one work station to another with the help of guide rails in the floor,Relevant
The screed is assembled in a single area and does not move from one work station to another,Relevant
Here is a typical sequence of operation for the assembly of an asphalt paver ,Relevant
The individual pieces of the mainframe are cut to size from steel plate with bandsaws or by flame cutting,Relevant
The required holes are drilled or punched,Relevant
The pieces are held in position relative to each other using jigs and fixtures,Relevant
They are then welded together with automatic wirefed welders that are programmed to weld along the contour of the joints,Relevant

When it is finished the mainframe looks like the letter H with one long leg on each side to support the tires or tracks and a cross leg in the middle to support the engine which is mounted sideways,Relevant
After the mainframe is welded together it is shot blasted with a stream of high velocity air carrying small steel balls,Relevant
This relieves any stresses in the metal caused by welding and removes any welding spatter,Relevant
The mainframe is then painted with a primer and the paint is allowed to dry,Relevant
The mainframe is placed on an airflotation pallet and is moved to the first work station,Relevant
The feeder conveyor chains and flights are installed first followed by the hydraulic feeder drive motors and the feeder lubrication hoses,Relevant
If the tractor is to have a tracked drive the left and right drive hubs are installed,Relevant
On some models the fuel tank is also installed at this time,Relevant
While the mainframe is in the first work station the engine is being prepared in a separate area,Relevant
The engine is placed on a rolling support stand and the fan oil filters and various sensors are installed at this time,Relevant
The disconnect clutch and pump drive gearbox are bolted to the rear of the engine,Relevant
The gearbox is triangularshaped and has mounting locations for three sets of hydraulic pumps,Relevant
The upper set of pumps provide power for the drive tires or tracks,Relevant
The two lower sets of pumps provide power for the left and right conveyor feeders distribution augers and screed vibrators,Relevant
Each set of pumps consists of two or more pumps sandwiched end to end and running off the same central shaft,Relevant
The mainframe is moved to the next work station,Relevant
The engine is lifted from its support stand with an overhead hoist and is lowered into position crossways on the mainframe,Relevant
It is bolted in place on several hard rubber mounts which act to isolate the engine vibration,Relevant
The radiator is bolted in place and coolant hoses are run between the engine and radiator,Relevant
The left and right distribution auger assemblies are bolted in place and the hydraulic auger drive motors and drive chains are installed,Relevant
The rear hopper pieces are bolted in place as are the hydraulic cylinders to raise and lower the screed leveling arms,Relevant
Various hydraulic hoses and electrical wiring are routed between components,Relevant
In operation a dump truck filled with asphalt backs up to the front of the pover and slowly discharges its load into the pavers hopper,Relevant
As the paver moves forward the feeder conveyors move the asphalt to the rear of the paver and the distribution augers push the asphalt outward to the desired width,Relevant
If the tractor is to have a tracked drive the left and right variablespeed hydraulic drive motors and twospeed planetary gears are bolted to the drive hubs,Relevant
If the tractor is to have a rubbertired drive the drive axle twospeed gearbox and twospeed hydraulic drive motor is installed,Relevant
At the next work station the main electrical box is installed the hydraulic tank and valves are installed and connected with hoses and the wiring for the screed and tractor lights are routed,Relevant

As the tractor moves down the assembly line the engine side covers and inlet air cleaner are installed the rear platform and open grate deck are put in place and the operators control console is mounted,Relevant
Some pavers have two operators consoles one on each side to give the operator a better view when paving close to curbing or other obstacles,Relevant
Other pavers have a movable console that can slide to one side or the other,Relevant
Any final electrical connections are made at this time,Relevant
The batteries and engine muffler are installed next and the various fluids are added as required,Relevant
If the tractor has a tracked drive the lower bogie wheels are installed at this point,Relevant
The tractor assembly is completed by attaching the screed leveling arns hopper sides engine access doors lights and other exterior components,Relevant
The tires or tracks are installed last,Relevant
The engine is started and the finished tractor is given a preliminary check for proper operation,Relevant
The tractor is washed to remove any grease or oil that may have accumulated on the surfaces during assembly,Relevant
A fluorescent dye is added to the hydraulic oil to help spot any leaks,Relevant
The tractor is then hooked up to an automatic testing machine which cycles it through various electrical and hydraulic functions,Relevant
A computer records the results of these tests for future reference,Relevant
An ultraviolet black light is used to detect leaks in the hydraulic system,Relevant
After the cycle test the tractor is driven outside and given a short functional test to visually inspect its operation,Relevant
If adjustments are required they are made at this time,Relevant
The tractor is then parked awaiting a customers order,Relevant
The screed is assembled in a separate area from the tractor,Relevant
The frame parts are fabricated and welded together,Relevant
The burner assemblies and hydraulic vibrator motors are installed and plumbed with hoses,Relevant
The burners provide heat along the length of the screed to keep the asphalt from sticking to it,Relevant
The vibrators help provide partial compaction of the asphalt as it is being laid,Relevant
Electrical wiring is routed to the various components,Relevant
The hydraulic actuators to control the sidetoside slope of the screed are installed last,Relevant
The finished screed is attached to a testing machine that duplicates the functions and controls of a tractor,Relevant
The various screed functions—burner ignition vibrator operation slope control and others—are then tested,Relevant
When a customer orders a paver the I customer may specify one of several models of tractors to be matched with one of several screed designs,Relevant
The tractor which has just a coat of primer paint is now cleaned and given a final coat of paint,Relevant
Any warning labels decorative striping or name plates are then installed,Relevant
The screed is usually painted black because it is in contact with the black oily asphalt,Relevant
The screed is attached to the tractor,Relevant
The electrical wiring burner fuel lines and hydraulic hoses are interconnected,Relevant
The finished paver is then given a final functional test,Relevant
The operators seat is installed last,Relevant
The parts for the automatic drip coffee maker are typically made by specialized shops,Irrelevant
The digital clocks timers and switches are all purchased from companies that produce those items,Irrelevant
The plastic parts are made at a plastics company and the metal parts at a metal stamping plant,Irrelevant
The manufacture of the actual coffee maker consists of putting all these parts together,Irrelevant
The plastic parts for automatic drip coffee makers are designed by the manufacturer and then outsourced to specialty plastics companies,Irrelevant
The plastics company uses the manufacturers design to make a mold,Relevant
Then parts are produced by injection molding heated plastic is forced into the mold under pressure cooled and released,Relevant
These parts are then shipped to the manufacturer for assembly,Irrelevant
The metal base plate is made at a specialized metal stamping plant,Irrelevant
A sheet of metal is rolled out and heavy machines punch out the specified shape,Relevant
Then these are shipped to the manufacturer,Relevant
The parts of the coffee maker are put together on an assembly line,Relevant
The electrical components are assembled first,Relevant
These are designed so they can be simply snapped together,Irrelevant
Workers standing at the assembly line each snap in a part as it comes to them and the whole line may have 40 to 80 workers each doing a specialized job,Irrelevant
The timer device is snapped in then the cord,Relevant
The metal warmer plate is snapped on and then the thermostat is wired,Relevant
The heater for the warmer plate is assembled then placed on a a small pallet about the size of an index card,Relevant
The pallets are placed on a conveyer belt that carries them through a sonic welding machine,Relevant
This automatically welds the wiring for the heater,Relevant
Once the internal wiring is complete the rest of the pieces—the housing and the filter reservoir—are snapped together,Relevant
Some pieces may be screwed in by workers using pneumatic screw drivers,Relevant
After assembly workers place the coffee makers in small cartons,Relevant
Then workers place these cartons in larger packing cartons which might contain several units,Relevant
These may be taped shut by hand or they may be taped automatically by passing on a conveyor belt through a taping machine,Relevant
Typically another machine automatically imprints a bar code on the packing box for tracking information,Relevant
Then the boxes are stacked on large pallets and shipped or stored in a warehouse,Relevant
Ballpoint pens are made to order in mass quantities,Relevant

While each manufacturer makes them slightly differently the basic steps include ink compounding metal component formation plastic component molding piece assembly packaging labeling and shipping,Irrelevant
In advanced shops pens can go from raw material to finished product in less than five minutes,Irrelevant
Large batches of ink are made in a designated area of the manufacturing plant,Irrelevant
Here workers known as compounders follow formula instructions to make batches of ink,Relevant
Raw materials are poured into the batch tank and thoroughly mixed,Relevant
Depending on the formula these batches can be heated and cooled as necessary to help the raw materials combine more quickly,Relevant
Some of the larger quantity raw materials are pumped and metered directly into the batch tank,Relevant
These materials are added simply by pressing a button on computerized controls,Relevant
These controls also regulate the mixing speeds and the heating and cooling rates,Relevant
Quality control checks are made during different points of ink batching,Relevant
While the ink is being made the metal components of the pen are being constructed,Relevant
The tungsten carbide balls are typically supplied by outside vendors,Relevant
Other parts of the pen such as the point and the body are made using various molds,Irrelevant
First bands of brass are automatically inserted into stamping machines which cut out thousands of small discs,Relevant
The brass discs are next softened and poured into a compression chamber which consists of a steel ram and a springbacked ejector plunger,Relevant
The steel ram presses on the metal causing the plunger to retract and forcing the metal into a die cast mold,Relevant
This compresses the metal and forms the various pen pieces,Relevant
When the ram and plunger return to their original positions the excess metal is then scraped off and recycled,Relevant
The die is then opened and the pen piece is ejected,Relevant
The formed pieces are then cleaned and cut,Relevant
They are immersed in a bath to remove oils used in the molding process,Relevant
After they emerge from the bath the parts are then cut to the dimensions of the specific pen,Relevant
The pen pieces are next polished by rotating brushes and cleaned again to remove any residual oils,Relevant
The ball can then be inserted into the point cavity,Relevant
The plastic components of the pen are constructed simultaneously with the other pen pieces,Relevant
They can be produced by either extrusion or injection molding,Relevant
In each approach the plastic is supplied as granules or powder and is fed into a large hopper,Relevant
The extrusion process involves a large spiral screw which forces the material through a heated chamber making it a thick flowing mass,Relevant
It is then forced through a die cooled and cut,Relevant
Pieces such as the pen body and ink reservoir are made by this method,Irrelevant
For pieces that have more complex shapes like caps ends and mechanical components injection molding is used,Relevant
In this process the plastic is heated converting it into a liquid that can then be forcibly injected into a mold,Relevant
After it cools it solidifies and maintains its shape after the die is opened,Relevant
After the components are formed assembly can take place,Relevant
Typically the ballpoint is first attached to the ink reservoir,Relevant
These pieces are then conveyored to injectors which fill the reservoir with the appropriately colored ink,Relevant
If a spring is going to be present it is then placed on the barrel of the reservoir,Relevant
The point and reservoir are then placed inside the main body of the pen,Relevant
At this stage other components such as the cap and ends are incorporated,Relevant
Other finishing steps such as adding coatings or decorations or performing a final cleaning are also done,Relevant
The finished pens are then packaged according to how they will be sold,Relevant
Single pens can be put into blister packages with cardboard backings,Relevant
Groups of pens are packed into bags or boxes,Relevant
These sales units are then put into boxes stacked on pallets and shipped to distributors,Relevant
The key to manufacturing a successful black box is to make it as indestructible as possible,Irrelevant
This is done by sheathing the components inside a multilayer protective shell,Relevant

The different makers of recorders each have their own proprietary design but in general the manufacturing process can be described as follows The key components (the power supply the interfacecontroller board and the memory circuits) are built as separate units and then assembled to form the completed black box,Irrelevant
This modular approach allows the components to be easily replaced without disassembly of the entire device,Irrelevant

Each of these components has its own special assembly requirements but primary attention is given to the protecting the memory unit since it contains the data that will be of interest to investigators,Irrelevant
A multilayered configuration is used to ensure the memory units integrated circuits are adequately protected,Relevant
The outermost layer is the housing which consists of steel armor plate,Irrelevant
Below that is a layer of insulation followed by a thick slab of paraffin which forms a thermal block,Irrelevant
As the paraffin melts it absorbs heat and therefore keeps the temperature of the memory core lower,Relevant
Beneath the paraffin lies the board containing the memory chips,Irrelevant
Underneath the memory board is another paraffin thermal block followed by another layer of insulation,Irrelevant
The entire assembly is mounted on a steel plate that serves as an access cover,Relevant
The assembled Crash Survivable Memory Unit is then bolted onto the front of a heavy metal plate mounting shelf with four large retaining bolts,Irrelevant
The power supply is attached just behind the CSMU,Relevant
The Interface and Control Circuit Board (ICB) is attached by screws to the underside of the mounting shelf,Relevant
A metal access cover protects the board and provides easy access,Irrelevant
The Underwater Locator Beacon (ULB) is affixed to the two arms extending from the front of the memory unit,Relevant
The ULB protrudes from the casing and has a cylindrical shape that allows it to be used as a handle for the entire device,Relevant
If the recorder is to be sold without a ULB a hollow metal handle tube is installed in its place,Relevant
The outer casing is painted bright orange or red to make it more visible in a crash,Relevant

The mainframe core which forms the rigid inner body is cut from steel plate and structural shaped so that it easily resists high impact shock loads and torsional forces normally incurred by the dozer,Relevant
The main structural skeleton formed through the welding of steel plates to machined casting is comprised of two boxedin rail sections connected to the main casing,Irrelevant

The fabrication is normally performed in a fabrication cell where the burned plate arrives ready to be mounted into fixtures and manually or robotically welded to the stationary central casting,Irrelevant

Far too massive to be lifted by hand the frames are then transported by overhead crane to different stations where steel mounting blocks and trunions or cross members are welded on as a support for the other components of the bulldozer,Relevant
Once completed the frame is rotary sanded on all plated surfaces and sent to the paint booth and the main assembly line,Relevant
At the assembly line the independently manufactured diesel engine and transmission join the mainframe,Relevant
The engine is usually purchased completely assembled as it is a complex system with machined components that can be used in many different vehicular applications,Irrelevant
In fact the engine (which has been subjected to various performance tests) is certified to operate on arrival,Irrelevant
The engine mounts in the front of the bulldozer however it is connected to the transmission which sits in the back,Relevant
The two are connected by a long shaft and supported by couplings and bearings,Relevant
The transmission is then connected to a series of gears and differentials to comprise the rest of the power train,Relevant
By mounting on pads previously welded to the frame the enginetransmission assembly can be bolted directly to the base on the main assembly line,Irrelevant
On the front of the bulldozer an engine casing is mounted to support the radiator and hydraulic lifting cylinders,Relevant
The radiator another finished assembly will then sit between the engine casing and mount to the front drive shaft,Irrelevant
Connections can then be made to attach water lines from the engine to the radiator,Relevant

Additional assemblies for the hydraulic lubrication cooling and fuel systems are also constructed at other locations and purchased as a finished assembly ready to be fastened directly to the engine or base,Irrelevant

These include hydraulic lines composed of tubes hoses and fittings preassembled and mounted on the engine or frame and connected to pumps valves tanks and cylinders each of which can be brought to the main assembly line as a finished component,Irrelevant
Fuel exhaust hydraulic and coolant lines also arrive ready for assembly and mate to other finished components,Irrelevant
Many of these components and subassemblies must be inspected and approved for dimensional compliance at an incoming inspection station prior to assembly,Relevant
Two distinct features characterize the bulldozer the long vertical steel blade in the front of the vehicle and the rotating twin tracks which facilitate the bulldozer movement,Irrelevant
The blade which can weigh up to 16000 lb (7264 kg) is useful for pushing material from one spot to another,Irrelevant

As the entire assembly of the frame engine transmission and line groups move along the main production line larger assemblies and components are brought in by overhead cranes overhead conveyors automatic guided vehicles (AGV) or lift trucks,Irrelevant
These components include the cab larger hydraulic cylinders undercarriage components and the front blade,Relevant
The cab which can also be purchased as a finished assembly is usually manufactured at a different facility and shipped for assembly,Irrelevant
Usually complete in its array of electronics and controls the cab will be mounted on steel blocks or pads located on the dozer frame,Irrelevant
After mounting connections will be made to the various controls and power can supplied to the fully functioning cab,Irrelevant

Concurrent with the enginetransmission mounting the undercarriage composed of tubular roller frames drive sprockets and bogey independent suspension rollers will be mounted on the frame and assembled to the drive train,Irrelevant
The axle assembly will turn the outer sprockets that rotate the track allowing the vehicle to maneuver,Irrelevant
The sprockets typically 2 ft (61 cm) in diameter will fit into the track with case hardened teeth which move the track as they rotate,Irrelevant

In many manufacturing operations the undercarriage can be machined assembled and painted in the same facility as the main assembly line but various smaller components like bearings and lubrication bushings need to be outsourced to other facilities or outside contractors,Irrelevant

The track which is often preassembled from machined steel links can be fitted around the drive sprockets rollers and frontback guide gears only after the enginetransmission and undercarriage components are in place,Irrelevant
The exhaust stack attached directly to the engine is supported by brackets and flanges at its base,Irrelevant

After the cab controls are connected to the engine and hydraulic systems prefabricated cowlings or body panels are mounted directly on the base frame to cover the engine transmission radiator and fluid lines,Relevant
The body panels are designed to fold back making the inside of the dozer easily accessible for regular maintenance,Irrelevant
They are assembled into hinges already fastened to structural supports,Irrelevant
Tooling and storage compartments may also be built into the dozer once the lines have all been connected,Relevant
Deck plates lie around the cabin and are welded to support brackets,Irrelevant
The front blade is attached to hydraulic cylinders which can position the blade at different angles of tilt,Irrelevant
The cylinders each comprised of a hardened steel piston inside a honed cylinder are attached at one end to engine casing in the front of the bulldozer to move the blade vertically,Irrelevant
Initially in the assembly process the cylinders are left unattached at the one end until the roll formed steel blade is assembled and then hydraulic lines can be fitted and tightened,Irrelevant
The lower end of the blade is attached at two joints with large steel pins which rotate and tilt the blade with two more cylinders,Irrelevant
Arms extending from the undercarriage are attached to the blade and then are assembled along with the other undercarriage components,Irrelevant
Once the dozer has been outfitted with its primary components more hoses electrical lines and fluid lines are attached at fitted connections,Relevant
Items such as the batteries which are connected to the starter on the engine lie underneath a cowling in a compartment located near the engine,Relevant
Lights one of the last items installed on the dozer will be placed in a number of different areas and connected to their power source,Relevant
In addition hand or guard rails and foot pegs are bolted on the frame which complete main line assembly,Relevant
At Caterpillars TrackType Tractor (TTT) division located in Peoria Illinois Caterpillar bulldozers and crawlers use the same paint and final prep lines as many other tracked vehicles,Irrelevant
Applied manually with spray guns the final paint booth will deliver paint to any area not blocked off with paper or plastic wrapping,Irrelevant
The paint dries quickly and the bulldozer will move to the next station where decals and trim are applied by hand templates,Relevant
Various fluids are added and the vehicle is then sent to a testing station where the operation of all systems is mechanically verified and recorded,Relevant
The vehicle is transported from the manufacturing site to a staging area for customization and shipping,Relevant
The completed bulldozer is shipped on a flat bed trailer and is ready for field operation upon arrival,Relevant
The camera chassis or body and back cover are made of a polycarbonate compound containing 1020 glass fiber,Irrelevant
This material is very durable lightweight and shockresistant as well as tolerant to humidity and temperature changes,Irrelevant
Its major disadvantage is that it is not resistant to chemicals,Irrelevant

The polycarbonate is molded to very specific tolerances because the internal workings of the camera must fit precisely to work well and to use the strength of the chassis for protection against jarring and other shocks to which mechanical and electronic parts are sensitive,Relevant
After the chassis is molded and assembled it becomes the frame to which other parts of the camera like electrical connections in the battery housing and the auto focus module are attached,Relevant
The shutter assembly and film transport system are manufactured on a separate assembly line,Irrelevant
These parts are largely mechanical although the film transport system has electronics to read the speed of the film,Irrelevant
DX film coding appears as silver bands on the roll of film and these are detected by multiple contacts in the film chamber,Relevant
More advanced cameras have microchips that see the data imprinted in the silver bands and adjust shutter speed flash and other camera actions,Relevant
Again all parts are precisely made the film magazine size must be accurate to 60 thousandths of an inch,Relevant
The shutter functions like a curtain that opens and closes,Irrelevant
It must operate exactly to expose the film for the correct length of time and to coordinate with other operations such as the flash,Irrelevant
The shutter is made of different materials depending on the type of camera and manufacturer,Irrelevant
The viewfinder lens is a specialized lens that is manufactured using the same methods as a camera lens,Irrelevant
The viewfinder also is made of optical glass plastic or glassplastic combinations,Irrelevant
All but the simplest viewfinders contain reticles that illuminate a frame and other information on the eyelens to help the photographer frame the picture,Irrelevant
An inline mirror has specialized coatings for color splitting as many as 17 coatings may be added to the mirror to correct and modify its reflective properties,Relevant
Singlelens reflex (SLR) cameras have throughthelens viewing capabilities and are also called real image viewfinders because they let the photographer see as the lens sees,Irrelevant
The SLR viewfinder uses a prism to bend the light from the lens to the photographers eye and the prism is made of optical glass to precise requirements to make the correct view possible,Relevant

Advanced cameras and most compact models include a liquid crystal display (LCD) screen that provides information to the photographer such as film speed aperture photographic mode (including landscape portrait closeup and other modes) count of photos taken operation of redeye and flash and other accessories battery condition and other data regarding the cameras workings,Relevant
Integrated circuitry is constructed Cameraas subassemblies for the electronic brains of the camera and attached flash if any,Irrelevant
CAT scanner manufacture is typically an assembly of various components that are supplied by outside manufacturers,Irrelevant
The following process discusses how the major components are produced,Irrelevant
The xray tube is made much like other types of electrical diodes,Irrelevant
The individual components including the cathode and anode are placed inside the tube envelope and vacuum sealed,Relevant
The tube is then situated into the protective housing which can then be attached to the rotating portion of the scanner frame,Relevant
Various detector arrays are available for CAT scanners,Irrelevant
One type of detector array is the ideal gasfilled detector,Irrelevant
This is made by placing strips of tungsten 004 inch (1 mm) apart around a large metallic frame,Relevant
A ceramic substrate holds the strips in place,Irrelevant
The entire assembly is hermetically sealed and pressure filled with an inert gas such as xenon,Relevant
Each of the tiny chambers formed by the gaps between the tungsten plates are individual detectors,Irrelevant
The finished detector is also attached to the scanner frame,Relevant
To create the large amount of voltage needed to produce x rays an autotransformer is used,Irrelevant
This power supply device is made by winding wire around a core,Relevant
Electric tap connections are made at various points along the coil and connected to the main power source,Relevant
With this device output voltage can be increased to approximately twice the input voltage,Irrelevant
The control consol and computer are specially designed and supplied by computer manufacturers,Irrelevant
The primary model building computer is specifically programmed with the reconstruction algorithms needed to manipulate the xray data from the gantry assembly,Irrelevant
The control consoles are also programmed with software to control the administration of the CAT scan,Irrelevant
The final assembly of the CAT scanner is a custom process which often takes place in the radiologic imaging facility,Relevant
Rooms are specially designed to house each component and minimize the potential for excessive radiation exposure or electric shock,Relevant
By following specific plans equipment installation and wiring of the entire CAT scanner system is completed,Relevant
Grain is received at the cereal factory inspected and cleaned,Relevant
It may be used in the form of whole grains or it may require further processing,Irrelevant
Often the whole grain is crushed between large metal rollers to remove the outer layer of bran,Relevant
It may then be ground more finely into flour,Relevant
Whole grains or partial grains (such as corn grits) are mixed with flavoring agents vitamins minerals sweeteners salt and water in a large rotating pressure cooker,Relevant
The time temperature and speed of rotation vary with the type of grain being cooked,Irrelevant
The cooked grain is moved to a conveyor belt which passes through a drying oven,Relevant
Enough of the water remains in the cooked grain to result in a soft solid mass which can be shaped as needed,Relevant
If flour is used instead of grains it is cooked in a cooking extruder,Relevant
This device consists of a long screw within a heated housing,Relevant
The motion of the screw mixes the flour with water flavorings salt sweeteners vitamins minerals and sometimes food coloring,Relevant
The screw moves this mixture through the extruder cooking it as it moves along,Relevant
At the end of the extruder the cooked dough emerges as a ribbon,Relevant
A rotating knife cuts the ribbon into pellets,Relevant
These pellets are then processed in much the same way as cooked grains,Relevant
The cooked grains are allowed to cool for several hours stabilizing the moisture content of each grain,Relevant
This process is known as tempering,Irrelevant
The tempered grains are flattened between large metal rollers under tons of pressure,Relevant
The resulting flakes are conveyed to ovens where they are tossed in a blast of very hot air to remove remaining moisture and to toast them to a desirable color and flavor,Relevant
Instead of cooked grains flakes may also be made from extruded pellets in a similar manner,Relevant
Cereals may be puffed in ovens or in socalled guns,Irrelevant
Ovenpuffed cereals are usually made from rice,Irrelevant
The rice is cooked cooled and dried,Relevant
It is then rolled between metal rollers like flaked cereals but it is only partially flattened,Relevant
This process is known as bumping,Irrelevant
The bumped rice is dried again and placed in a very hot oven which causes it to swell,Relevant
Gunpuffed cereals may be made from rice or wheat,Irrelevant
The rice grains require no pretreatment but the wheat grains must be treated to partially remove the outer layer of bran,Relevant
This may be done by abrading it off between grindstones a process known as pearling,Relevant
It may also be done by soaking the wheat grains in salt water,Relevant
The salt water toughens the bran which allows it to break off in large pieces during puffing,Irrelevant
The grain is placed in the gun a small vessel which can hold very hot steam and very high pressure,Relevant
The gun is opened quickly to reduce the pressure suddenly which puffs the grain,Relevant
Extruded pellets can also be used to make gunpuffed cereals in the same way as grains,Relevant
Shredded cereals are usually made from wheat,Irrelevant
The wheat is cooked in boiling water to allow moisture to fully penetrate the grain,Relevant
The cooked grain is cooled and allowed to temper,Relevant
It is then rolled between two metal rollers,Relevant
One roller is smooth and the other is grooved,Irrelevant
A metal comb is positioned against the grooved roll with a tooth inside each groove,Irrelevant
The cooked grain is shredded by the teeth of the comb and drops off the rollers in a continuous ribbon,Relevant
A conveyor belt catches the ribbons from several pairs of rollers and piles them up in layers,Relevant
The layers of shredded wheat are cut to the proper size then baked to the desired color and dryness,Relevant
Shredded cereals may also be made in a similar way from extruded pellets,Irrelevant
Cereals can be made in a wide variety of special shapes (circles letters of the alphabet etc) with a cooking extruder,Relevant
A die is added to the end of the extruder which forms a ribbon of cooked dough with the desired crosssection shape,Relevant
A rotating knife cuts the ribbon into small pieces with the proper shape,Relevant
These shaped pieces of dough are processed in a manner similar to puffing,Relevant
Instead of completely puffing however the pieces expand only partially in order to maintain the special shape,Irrelevant
Granolas and similar products are made by mixing grain (usually oats) and other ingredients (nuts fruits flavors etc) and cooking them on a conveyor belt which moves through an oven,Irrelevant
The cooked mixture is then crumbled to the desired size,Relevant

Hot cereals are made by processing the grain as necessary (rolling or cutting oats cracking wheat or milling corn into grits) and partly cooking it so the consumer can cook it quickly in hot water,Relevant
Salt sweeteners flavors and other ingredients may or may not be added to the partly cooked mixture,Relevant
After shaping the cereal may be coated with vitamins minerals sweeteners flavors such as fruit juices food colors or preservatives,Relevant
Frosting is applied by spraying a thick hot syrup of sugar on the cereal in a rotating drum,Relevant
As it cools the syrup dries into a white layer of frosting,Relevant
Some cereals such as shredded wheat are fairly resistant to damage from moisture,Irrelevant
They may be placed directly into cardboard boxes or in cardboard boxes lined with plastic,Relevant
Most cereals must be packaged in airtight waterproof plastic bags within cardboard boxes to protect them from spoiling,Relevant
An automated machine packages the cereal at a rate of about 40 boxes per minute,Relevant
The box is assembled from a flat sheet of cardboard which has been previously printed with the desired pattern for the outside of the box,Relevant
The bottom and sides of the box are sealed with a strong glue,Relevant
The bag is formed from moistureproof plastic and inserted into the box,Relevant
The cereal fills the bag and the bag is tightly sealed by heat,Relevant
The top of the box is sealed with a weak glue which allows the consumer to open it easily,Relevant
The completed boxes of cereal are packed into cartons which usually hold 12 24 or 36 boxes and shipped to the retailer,Relevant
The grapes are carefully loaded into the press a square wooden floor surrounded by adjustable wooden rails and topped by a heavy oak lid,Relevant
The lid is mechanically lowered and raised at intervals causing the grapes to burst and the juice to pour out,Relevant
The juices run through the rails into a sloped groove that carries the juice to stainless steel vats,Relevant
The first pressing is called the cuvee and is the best juice from a batch of grapes,Irrelevant
It is kept separate from subsequent pressings,Relevant
The cuvee begins to ferment immediately,Relevant
As scum rises to the top it is thrown off,Relevant
Some of the scum falls to the bottom of the vat this sediment is called lees,Irrelevant
The juice called must continues to ferment for 2436 hours when it gradually returns to its normal temperature,Relevant
The cuveés are moved into temperaturecontrolled stainless steels vats and fermented for several weeks at 6468°F (1820°C),Relevant
The amount of time varies depending on the house specifications,Irrelevant
Some champagne producers also put the wine through a malolactic fermentation process at this point to reduce acidity,Relevant
The head cellarer (chefde caves) and cellar assistants taste and blend wines from several different pressings to obtain the desired taste,Relevant
The blended wines are churned in vats by sweeping mechanical arms,Relevant
The blended wine is drawn off into bottles,Relevant
The liquer de tirage is added and the bottles are sealed with crown caps,Relevant
Because the carbonic acid cannot escape through the glass it builds up to a tremendous pressure equal to that in a bus tire,Irrelevant
French law requires that nonvintage wines be aged for at least one year,Irrelevant
Vintage wines must be aged for at least three years,Irrelevant
Each wine house adds to this minimum requirement as desired,Irrelevant
