Nonvintage wines are those that result from a thin harvest and are combined with reserves from past good vintages,Irrelevant
Nonvintage wine is not sold under a particular year,Irrelevant
Vintage wines on the other hand are made from Champagne grapes harvested in the same year,Irrelevant
Vintage wines are rare produced only when the summer has been unusually hot and sunny,Irrelevant
The year is printed on the cork and the label,Relevant
During the aging period the bottles of champagne are turned daily to keep the sediment caused by dead yeast cells from settling on the bottom,Relevant
Skilled workers with quick hands twist the bottles oneeighth of a turn each day,Relevant

The bottles start out in the horizontal position by the end of the aging period the bottles are vertical with the necks pointed towards the floor so that the sediment has collected on the inside face of the cork,Relevant
The bottleneck is plunged into freezing liquid causing a pellet of frozen champagne to form in the neck,Relevant
The crown cap is carefully removed and the ice expels the sediment,Relevant
Liquor dexpedition is added 8 The mixture of reserve wines sugar and brandy is added to the bottles of champagne to create the desired sweetness,Relevant
A long fat cork that has been branded with the house name is handdriven halfway into the bottleneck,Relevant
Then the exposed portion is squashed down into the neck and secured with a wire muzzle,Relevant
The bottles are labelled and stored in the cellar until shipment at which time they are packed into crates or cartons,Relevant
Tobacco plants are seeded indoors and transplanted into fields after six to 10 weeks,Relevant
The plants are carefully pruned so the leaves grow to the necessary size,Relevant
Plants that produce the outer wrappers of cigars are usually kept covered with cloth to protect them from the sun,Irrelevant
The plants take several months to mature in the fields,Irrelevant
After harvesting the tobacco leaves must be cured in order to develop their characteristic aroma,Relevant
The leaves are cured when they have passed from bright green flexible fresh leaves to dried brown or yellowish leaves,Relevant
Chemically the naturally occurring chlorophyll in the leaf gradually breaks down and is replaced by carotene,Relevant
To cure the harvested plants are strung to narrow strips of wood called laths,Relevant
The laths are hung from the ceiling of a wellventilated curing barn,Relevant
In dry weather they may cure simply by hanging a process called air curing,Irrelevant
The leaves may also be fluecured,Irrelevant
In this method the laths are hung in a small barn which is heated from 90170°F (32277°C),Relevant
The temperature must be carefully monitored in order to prevent extreme rapid drying,Relevant
Sawdust or hardwood may also be burned in the curing barn to aid in drying the leaves and impart an aroma,Relevant
After the leaves are cured they are sorted by color and size,Relevant

Small or broken leaves are used for the cigar filler large leaves for the inner wrapper or binder and large fine leaves usually grown in shade or under cloth are set aside for the outer wrapper,Relevant
The leaves are tied into bundles called hands of 10 or 15 leaves each,Relevant
The hands are packed in boxes or in large casks called hogsheads,Relevant
The tobacco is kept in the hogshead for a period of from six months to five years,Relevant
The leaves undergo chemical changes during this period referred to as fermentation,Relevant
During fermentation the aroma and taste of the leaf develops,Irrelevant
Cigar tobacco is usually fermented longer than Cigarother tobacco,Irrelevant
Fermentation for two to five years is typical for high quality cigars,Irrelevant
After fermentation the leaves are manually sorted again by highly trained workers,Relevant
The filler leaves must have their main vein (or stem) removed or else the cigar will not burn evenly,Relevant
This can be done by hand or machine,Irrelevant
Manually a worker with a thimble knife fitted to his or her finger clips the vein near the tip and pulls it down,Relevant
Then the worker stacks the stripped leaves in piles (called books or pads),Relevant
Mechanically a worker inserts the tobacco leaves into a machine under a grooved circular knife,Relevant
By depressing a foot treadle the worker causes the knife to lower and cut out the vein,Relevant
The worker can stop the machine with the foot treadle and stack the stripped leaves,Relevant
The stripped leaves are wrapped in bales and stored for further fermentation,Relevant
The bales may be shipped at this point if final production resides elsewhere,Relevant
Just before the leaves are ready for manufacture into cigars they are steamed to restore lost humidity and sorted again,Relevant
Fine cigars are rolled by hand,Relevant
Cigar rolling is skilled work it may take a year for a roller to become proficient,Irrelevant
The filler must be packed evenly for the cigar to burn smoothly and the wrapper should be wound in an even spiral around the cigar,Relevant
Hand cigar makers usually work in small factories,Irrelevant
Each worker sits at a small table with a tray of sorted tobacco leaves on it and space to roll out the cigar,Irrelevant
First the worker selects from two to six leaves for the filler,Relevant
These are placed one on top of the other and rolled into a bunch,Relevant
Then the worker places the bunch on the binder leaf and rolls the binder leaf cylindrically around the filler,Relevant
The unfinished cigars are placed in an open wooden mold that holds them in shape until they can be wrapped,Relevant
Wrapping is the most difficult step,Irrelevant
The worker takes the partially completed cigar out of the mold and places it on the wrapper leaf,Relevant
With a special rounded knife called a chaveta the worker trims off any irregularities from the filler,Relevant
Then the worker rolls the wrapper leaf around the filler and binder three and a half times and secures it at the end with a small amount of vegetable paste,Relevant
The worker cuts a small round piece out of a different wrapper leaf,Relevant
This is sometimes done by tracing around a coin,Relevant
This circle is then attached to the end of the cigar with paste,Relevant
The worker has completed the cigar though it still must be tested sorted and packed,Relevant
Cigars come in several shapes and sizes,Irrelevant
Perfecto refers to a cigar with a pointed head and tapering sides Panatella is a long thin straight cigar Cheroot is an openended cigar usually made in India or Asia,Irrelevant
From the smallest [35 in 189 cm)] to the largest [75 in (19 cm)] cigars are labeled the Half Corona Tres Petit Corona Petit Corona Corona Corona Grande Lonsdale and Double Corona,Irrelevant
Cigars may be made by hand in teams,Irrelevant
Some workers may make the bunch and wrap it in the binder and then the more delicate finishing work of rolling the wrapper is left to more skilled workers,Irrelevant
The majority of cigars are made today by machine,Irrelevant
A typical cigar machine may require several workers to tend to its different functions,Irrelevant
One worker feeds tobacco leaves onto a feed belt between guide bars that are adjusted for the length of cigar desired,Relevant
The machine bunches the leaves forming the filler,Relevant
A second worker places binder leaf (or HTL) onto the binder die,Relevant
The leaf is held down by suction and the machine cuts it to the proper size,Relevant
The filler then drops onto the binder die,Relevant
The machine rolls the binder around the filler,Relevant
A third worker places the wrapper leaf (or HTL) on a wrapper die,Relevant
The partially completed cigar drops onto the wrapper die and the machine rolls the wrapper around the cigar,Relevant
A fourth worker inspects the completed cigars and places them in trays,Relevant
The finished cigars are passed to an examiner,Relevant
The examiner inspects the cigars for imperfections and checks them for proper weight size shape and condition of the wrapper,Relevant
The examiner may correct imperfections by patching wrappers or reshaping heads,Relevant
Cigars that pass inspection are placed on trays and passed to a banding and wrapping machine,Relevant
A worker places the cigars in a hopper and the machine places a band around them,Relevant
The same machine may also wrap the cigars in cellophane,Relevant
The ringed cigars may be also passed to workers expert in sorting by shade,Relevant
They sort the finished cigars according to minute variations in wrapper color,Relevant
Cigars with the same wrapper shade are then boxed together,Relevant
When wood is harvested for clarinetmaking logs are sawed to between 34 ft (112 m) in length,Relevant
The logs must be seasoned to prevent later warping,Irrelevant
They may be seasoned by being kept in the open air for several months or they may be dried in a kiln,Relevant
Then the logs are split and sawed to lengths approximating the finished lengths of the clarinet body pieces (upper and lower joints barrel and bell),Relevant
The body pieces look like narrow rectangular blocks and pieces for the barrel are carved in a rough pyramidal shape,Relevant
These pieces are known as billets,Irrelevant
The manufacturer buys the billets in lots and begins the manufacturing process from these roughedout shapes,Relevant
When the manufacturer receives the billets workers inspect the lot,Relevant
Then skilled workers place the billets on a borer which drills a hole lengthwise through the center of each piece,Relevant
The diameter and shape of this hole called the bore of the clarinet is crucial to determining the tone of the instrument,Irrelevant
The bore may be drilled in a straight cylinder or the cylinder may be slightly tapered,Relevant
After the bore is drilled the body pieces are turned on a lathe,Relevant
The rectangular billets become smooth round hollow cylinders,Irrelevant
These cylinders are then seasoned again,Relevant
After the rough pieces have been seasoned for the second time they are reduced to finished size,Relevant
The pieces are turned on a lathe and trimmed to exceedingly precise diameters,Relevant
The joints where the body pieces fit into each other are turned after the exterior is completed,Relevant
The bore may be reamed more precisely and then it is polished on the inside,Relevant
Then the joints are painted with a black dye,Relevant
Body parts for clarinets made of plastic are produced by injection molding,Relevant
Plastic pellets are melted and forced under pressure into molds,Relevant
The molds for clarinet body parts produce hollow cylinders,Relevant
In some cases the molds are so precise that these cylinders do not need any additional reaming,Irrelevant
Or they may be reamed and polished as are wooden clarinets,Relevant
The steps that follow apply to both wooden and plastic models,Irrelevant
Next the maker bores the tone holes that the players fingers cover to make the different notes,Relevant
The most common method for massproduced clarinets is to set the body pieces in a setting out machine,Irrelevant
This is a table which holds the piece on a mount under a vertical drill,Irrelevant
The holes are drilled at specified distances apart and with precise diameters,Relevant
The exact dimension of the holes affects the tuning of the instrument and the holes may be adjusted after the instrument is nearly complete,Relevant
Not every hole is the same size and the maker may have to insert a different drill bit for each hole,Relevant
The holes are smaller on the outside than on the inside and to achieve their precise shape after the holes are drilled they are undercut,Relevant
The clarinet maker uses a small flared tool placed in the tone hole to expand the underside of the hole,Relevant
Next to the tone holes tiny holes for holding the key mechanism are also drilled,Relevant
Early clarinets were made with handforged keys,Irrelevant
The modern method is usually diecasting,Irrelevant
Molten alloy (usually German silver) is forced under pressure into steel dies,Relevant
A group of connected keys may be made in one piece in this method,Relevant
Alternately individual keys may be stamped out by a heavy stamping machine and then trimmed,Relevant
These individual keys are then soldered together with silver solder to make the connected group,Relevant
Next the keys are polished,Relevant
Keys for inexpensive models may be placed in a tumbling machine where friction and agitation of pellets in a revolving drum polish the pieces,Relevant
More expensive keys may be buffed individually by being held against the rotating wheel of a polishing machine,Relevant
Some keys may be silverplated and then polished,Relevant
There are two main clarinet key systems in use,Irrelevant
The simple or Albert system is used principally in Germanspeaking countries,Irrelevant
The Bohm system has more keys than the Albert and is standard in most other parts of the world,Irrelevant
The keys are then fitted with pads,Relevant
The pads are usually made of several layers—cardboard felt and skin or leather,Irrelevant
The circular pads are stamped or cut and then workers glue them by hand into the head of the key,Relevant
This will muffle the sound of the tone hole closing when the instrument is played,Relevant
The keys are drilled and then fitted with springs that will keep them either open or closed,Relevant
These springs are made of fine steel wire,Irrelevant
The keys are mounted on small pillars called posts,Relevant
The posts are first set in the holes previously drilled for them,Relevant
In many models the posts are threaded and they can be simply screwed in by hand,Irrelevant
Using a very small drill bit tiny holes are then drilled in the posts to hold the needle springs,Relevant
Then the keys are screwed into the posts with stainless steel hinge rods,Relevant
The assembler uses a fine screwdriver pliers and a small leather mallet to fit the keys and adjust the spring action,Relevant
The assembler also checks that the tone holes are covered completely by the key pad inserting a tiny pick under the pad on each side,Relevant
The pad may need to be adjusted or reset or the assembler may clamp a key shut temporarily to set the crease for a perfect airtight closure,Relevant
The joints of the body pieces are lined with cork and waxed so that the pieces fit smoothly into each other,Relevant
The ends of the body pieces are fitted with decorative metal rings as is the bottom of the barrel,Relevant
The barrel is usually embossed with the name of the maker,Relevant
The mouthpiece manufactured separately out of hard rubber is fitted to the instrument,Relevant
When a reed is inserted the instrument can be played for the first time,Relevant
The production of concrete blocks consists of four basic processes mixing molding curing and cubing,Irrelevant

Some manufacturing plants produce only concrete blocks while others may produce a wide variety of precast concrete products including blocks flat paver stones and decorative landscaping pieces such as lawn edging,Irrelevant
Some plants are capable of producing 2000 or more blocks per hour,Irrelevant
The following steps are commonly used to manufacture concrete blocks,Irrelevant
The sand and gravel are stored outside in piles and are transferred into storage bins in the plant by a conveyor belt as they are needed,Relevant
The portland cement is stored outside in large vertical silos to protect it from moisture,Relevant

As a production run starts the required amounts of sand gravel and cement are transferred by gravity or by mechanical means to a weigh batcher which measures the proper amounts of each material,Relevant
The dry materials then flow into a stationary mixer where they are blended together for several minutes,Relevant
There are two types of mixers commonly used,Irrelevant
One type called a planetary or pan mixer resembles a shallow pan with a lid,Irrelevant
Mixing blades are attached to a vertical rotating shaft inside the mixer,Irrelevant
The other type is called a horizontal drum mixer,Irrelevant
It resembles a coffee can turned on its side and has mixing blades attached to a horizontal rotating shaft inside the mixer,Irrelevant
After the dry materials are blended a small amount of water is added to the mixer,Relevant
If the plant is located in a climate subject to temperature extremes the water may first pass through a heater or chiller to regulate its temperature,Relevant
Admixture chemicals and coloring pigments may also be added at this time,Relevant
The concrete is then mixed for six to eight minutes,Irrelevant
Once the load of concrete is thoroughly mixed it is dumped into an inclined Concrete Blockbucket conveyor and transported to an elevated hopper,Relevant
The mixing cycle begins again for the next load,Irrelevant
From the hopper the concrete is conveyed to another hopper on top of the block machine at a measured flow rate,Relevant
In the block machine the concrete is forced downward into molds,Relevant
The molds consist of an outer mold box containing several mold liners,Irrelevant
The liners determine the outer shape of the block and the inner shape of the block cavities,Relevant
As many as 15 blocks may be molded at one time,Relevant
When the molds are full the concrete is compacted by the weight of the upper mold head coming down on the mold cavities,Relevant
This compaction may be supplemented by air or hydraulic pressure cylinders acting on the mold head,Relevant
Most block machines also use a short burst of mechanical vibration to further aid compaction,Relevant
The compacted blocks are pushed down and out of the molds onto a flat steel pallet,Relevant
The pallet and blocks are pushed out of the machine and onto a chain conveyor,Relevant
In some operations the blocks then pass under a rotating brush which removes loose material from the top of the blocks,Relevant
The pallets of blocks are conveyed to an automated stacker or loader which places them in a curing rack,Relevant
Each rack holds several hundred blocks,Irrelevant
When a rack is full it is rolled onto a set of rails and moved into a curing kiln,Relevant
The kiln is an enclosed room with the capacity to hold several racks of blocks at a time,Irrelevant
There are two basic types of curing kilns,Irrelevant
The most common type is a lowpressure steam kiln,Irrelevant
In this type the blocks are held in the kiln for one to three hours at room temperature to allow them to harden slightly,Relevant
Steam is then gradually introduced to raise the temperature at a controlled rate of not more than 60°F per hour (16°C per hour),Relevant
Standard weight blocks are usually cured at a temperature of 150165°F (6674°C) while lightweight blocks are cured at 170185°F (7785°C),Relevant
When the curing temperature has been reached the steam is shut off and the blocks are allowed to soak in the hot moist air for 1218 hours,Relevant
After soaking the blocks are dried by exhausting the moist air and further raising the temperature in the kiln,Relevant
The whole curing cycle takes about 24 hours,Irrelevant
Another type of kiln is the highpressure steam kiln sometimes called an autoclave,Irrelevant
In this type the temperature is raised to 300375°F (149191°C) and the pressure is raised to 80185 psi (5445358 bar),Relevant
The blocks are allowed to soak for five to 10 hours,Relevant
The pressure is then rapidly vented which causes the blocks to quickly release their trapped moisture,Relevant
The autoclave curing process requires more energy and a more expensive kiln but it can produce blocks in less time,Irrelevant
The racks of cured blocks are rolled out of the kiln and the pallets of blocks are unstacked and placed on a chain conveyor,Relevant
The blocks are pushed off the steel pallets and the empty pallets are fed back into the block machine to receive a new set of molded blocks,Relevant
If the blocks are to be made into splitface blocks they are first molded as two blocks joined together,Relevant
Once these double blocks are cured they pass through a splitter which strikes them with a heavy blade along the section between the two halves,Relevant
This causes the double block to fracture and form a rough stonelike texture on one face of each piece,Relevant
The blocks pass through a cuber which aligns each block and then stacks them into a cube three blocks across by six blocks deep by three or four blocks high,Relevant
These cubes are carried outside with a forklift and placed in storage,Relevant
The irritant that is surgically implanted in an oyster as the nucleus of the pearl is made from the shell of a mussel,Irrelevant
As many as ten different mussel species including the American pigtoe mussel and the washboard mussel are used because their shells are as much as an inch thick near the hinge,Irrelevant
Twenty of these beads or nuclei called kaku in Japanese can be carved from one mussel shell,Irrelevant
In a cultured pearl this nucleus is the major portion of the pearl because the pearl coating is relatively thin,Irrelevant
Many of the nuclei are manufactured in Tennessee where the Tennessee and Mississippi Rivers host the source mussels,Irrelevant
Baby oysters called spat are born in hatcheries and grown in tanks at the pearl farms,Irrelevant

They are matured in baskets in ocean waters (maricultured) after they are 60 days old and after they have grown stronger after spending three years in the water they are large enough to withstand removal and implanting,Irrelevant
To implant the nuclei harvested oysters are taken inside pearl farm operating rooms and held together on racks,Relevant
When each is removed from the crowd its shell opens slightly a wedge is inserted so the shell stays open and an operator opens the shell wider to insert the bead,Relevant
A cut is made in the oysters body and the nucleus is inserted along with a tiny cutting of the mantle of another oyster that is sacrificed for the process,Relevant
The mantle insert stimulates the production of nacre which is excreted by the mantle of the host animal,Relevant
The oysters are then returned to the water by stringing them on plastic garlands or placing them in oyster baskets suspended from rafts,Relevant
While the oysters are in the water the pearl exterior forms over time and fluctuates with water temperature and other conditions,Irrelevant
A porous layer called the conchiolin forms around the nucleus and under the nacre,Irrelevant
The nacre consists of microlayers of a specialized form of the mineral calcium carbonate called aragonite,Irrelevant

The layers are composed of microscopic plates that make cultured pearls feel rough when they are rubbed against the teeth—a test to distinguish simulated or imitation pearls from natural and cultured gems,Irrelevant

The oysters are harvested some time later (depending on the desired finished diameter of the pearl) in winter when cold water slows nacre production and also creates the best color luster and orient which is the ability of the pearl to reflect light,Irrelevant
The time of culturing typically ranges from one to three years and the progress of pearl growth inside the oysters can be monitored with x rays,Irrelevant
The pearls are carefully cut out of the oysters flesh at the pearl farm and productive oysters can be reseeded several times to produce larger pearls as the oysters continue to grow,Relevant
The extracted pearls are processed for sale,Irrelevant
Typically the better specimens of pearls are sold in bulk at auctions regulated by governments,Irrelevant
From auctions the pearls move to dealers then jewelers,Relevant
The pearl farm may also drill and string its pearls for sale,Irrelevant
Jewelry fasteners are usually added at another factory,Relevant
Design of pearls seems an unlikely possibility but in fact a wide variety of colors and shapes exist even through they are extensions of the natural process,Irrelevant
The Chinese began pearl design in the twelfth century by cementing tiny Buddhas carved from wood stone or ivory or cast from metal inside the shells of freshwater mussels,Irrelevant
The Buddhas became coated with nacre or pearlized and were a successful product,Irrelevant
This practice still thrives in Chinese pearl culturing,Irrelevant
The same general technique is used to make halfpearls called mabes,Irrelevant
A molded or cut half shape is planted against the oysters shell after it becomes coated and is removed the halfpearl can be mounted on a jewelry backing like an earring,Relevant
In color Japanese pearls range naturally from pink to blue to greenish yellow,Irrelevant
Pearls are bleached to lighten these colors and eliminate any surface staining,Relevant
Colored pearls are made by injecting dye into the porous conchiolin and the pearl must be drilled to be dyed,Relevant
The most exotic designer pearls are probably the large black pearls cultured in Australia and the South Seas,Irrelevant
They are grown in the largest pearl oysters in the world and a perfect specimen of black pearl can sell in the United States for $40000,Irrelevant
Black pearls also display a natural range of colors from silver to green pearls called peacocks—and white,Irrelevant
Shape is also designed not only by creating pearlized molds but through culturing of Cultured Pearlfreshwater pearls,Irrelevant
These come in irregular shapes determined by the piece of mantle inserted to stimulate growth of a pearl,Irrelevant
Human intervention is visible in these designs because the implanters skill influences the shape of the resulting pearl,Irrelevant
The production of a dental drill is an integrated process in which individual components are first made and then assembled to make the final product,Irrelevant
While manufacturers could make each part individually they usually depend on outside suppliers for many of the parts,Irrelevant
A typical production method would include constructing the motors and the drill bits forming the handpiece final assembly and packaging,Irrelevant
Although numerous designs and materials are used to make the handpiece they are all typically made using a preformed mold,Irrelevant
For plastic handpieces this involves injection molding a process in which the plastic is melted injected into a mold and released after it forms,Irrelevant
Metal handpieces also use a similar molding process,Irrelevant
The drill bits are formed from tungsten carbide particles,Relevant
They are made by first taking tungsten ore and chemically processing it to produce tungsten oxides,Irrelevant
Hydrogen is then added to the system to remove the oxygen resulting in a fine tungsten metal powder,Relevant
This powder is then blended with carbon and heated producing tungsten carbide particles of varying sizes,Relevant
These particles are further processed to form the appropriately shaped drill bit,Relevant
The air turbine engine is constructed from small steel components,Irrelevant
In one design the turbine is sandwiched between two sets of ball raced bearings and connected directly to the drill bit,Relevant
The entire unit is encased in the drill head with openings for incoming air and exhaust air,Relevant
Other types of turbine engines are farther up in the handpiece and are connected to the drill bit by a series of driveshafts and gears,Relevant
The lowpowered motors are put together much like the air turbine engines,Relevant
The rotary vane airpowered motor consists of a core structure with sliding vanes protruding outward,Irrelevant
It is placed in the handpiece and connected to the main driveshaft of the drill,Relevant
It also has an opening for incoming and outgoing air,Irrelevant
Electric motors are significantly Dental Drillmore complex consisting of a set of bearings magnets brushes and armature coils,Irrelevant
After all the components are available final assembly can begin,Irrelevant
Depending on the design the air turbine can be placed directly into casing of the handpiece or it can be attached along with the drill bit,Relevant
The other parts of the drill are put into the handpiece including air or electric motors driveshaft gears and control switches,Relevant
Other accessories are added such as the cooling hoses and fiber optic lighting devices,Relevant
The coupler is placed on one end of the handpiece and the drill bit is attached to the other,Relevant
After an array of quality checks the finished drills are placed in the appropriate packaging along with accessories manuals and replacement parts and are then shipped to distributors,Relevant
The manufacturing process begins with a preliminary impression of the patients mouth which is usually done in wax,Irrelevant
This impression is used to prepare a diagnostic cast,Relevant

While making the impression the dentist applies pressure to the soft tissues to simulate biting force and extends the borders of the mold to adjacent toothless areas to allow the dentures to better adapt to the gums,Relevant
Once an appropriate preliminary cast has been obtained the final cast is cast from gypsum a stonelike product,Relevant
The final mold is inspected and approved before using it to manufacture the teeth,Relevant
After the mold has been cast it is filled with acrylic resin to form the denture,Relevant
The mold is prepared with a release agent prior to adding the resin to ensure that the hardened acrylic can be easily removed once the process is completed,Irrelevant
A sheet of separating film between the acrylic and the model is also helpful in this regard,Relevant
The denturist then mixes the appropriate resin compounds in liquid form,Relevant
Upon drying the resin hardens to a durable finish,Relevant
This resin mixture is packed into the mold while a vertical vise packs it tightly,Relevant
At this point the model can be inspected to ensure it is filled properly and if necessary additional resin can be added,Relevant
Instead of vice packing certain types of acrylic may be poured into the mold,Irrelevant
This method is more prone to air bubbles than hand packing,Irrelevant
Once the mold is packed to the denturists satisfaction it is heated to initiate the chemical reaction which causes the resin to harden,Relevant
This part of the process may take up to eight hours,Irrelevant
After the heating is done and the mold has cooled the mold is broken apart so the denture may be removed,Relevant
The denture is then put in the model of the patients mouth to ensure that it fits and that the bite is good,Relevant
Because of the number of processing steps there may be a slight discrepancy in the fit,Irrelevant
Usually just a minor grinding and smoothing of surfaces is all that is necessary to make the denture fit correctly,Irrelevant
At this point if the denture is the removable type it is ready for use,Relevant
Implants require additional preparatory steps before they can be used,Relevant
The denturist must drill the appropriate holes in the jaw bone and attach an anchor,Relevant

After three to six months when the hole has healed and the anchor is set in place a small second surgical procedure is necessary to expose the implant and connect a metal rod to it that will be used to hold the crown or bridge,Relevant
Finally the replacement tooth is attached to the rod where it is held firmly in place,Relevant
The absorbent pad is formed on a movable conveyer belt that passes through a long forming chamber,Relevant
At various points in the chamber pressurized nozzles spray either polymer particles or fibrous material onto the conveyor surface,Relevant
The bottom of the conveyor is perforated and as the pad material is sprayed onto the belt a vacuum is applied from below so that the fibers are pulled down to form a flat pad,Relevant
At least two methods have been employed to incorporate absorbent polymers into the pad,Irrelevant
In one method the polymer is injected into the same feed stock that supplies the fibers,Relevant
This method produces a pad that has absorbent polymer dispersed evenly throughout its entire length width and thickness,Relevant
The problems associated with method are that loss of absorbent may occur because the fine particles are pulled through the perforations in the conveyor by the vacuum,Relevant
It is therefore expensive and messy,Irrelevant
This method also causes the pad to absorb unevenly since absorbent is lost from only one side and not the other,Relevant
A second method of applying polymer and fiber involves application of the absorbent material onto the top surface of the pad after it has been formed,Relevant
This method produces a pad which has absorbent material concentrated on its top side and does not have much absorbency throughout the pad,Irrelevant
Another disadvantage is that a pad made in Disposable Diaperthis way may lose some of the polymer applied to its surface,Irrelevant
Furthermore this approach tends to cause gel blocking since all the absorbent is on the outside of the pad,Irrelevant
The moisture gets trapped in this outer layer and does not have a chance to diffuse to the center,Relevant
This blockage holds moisture against the skin and can lead to discomfort for the wearer,Irrelevant
These problems are solved by controlling the mixture polymer and fibrous material,Relevant
Multiple spray dispensers are used to apply several layers of polymer and fiber,Relevant
As the fiber is drawn into the chamber and the bottom of the pad is formed a portion of the polymer is added to the mix to form a layer of combined polymer and fiber,Irrelevant
Then more pure fiber is pulled on top to give a sandwich effect,Relevant
This formation creates a pad with the absorbent polymer confined to its center surrounded by fibrous material,Relevant
Gel blockage is not a problem because the polymer is concentrated at core of pad,Irrelevant
It also solves the problem of particle loss since all the absorbent is surrounded by fibrous material,Relevant
Finally this process is more cost effective because it distributes the polymer just where it is needed,Irrelevant
After the pad has received a full dose of fiber and polymer it proceeds down the conveyor path to a leveling roller near the outlet of the forming chamber,Relevant
This roller removes a portion of the fiber at the top of the pad to make it a uniform thickness,Relevant
The pad then moves by the conveyor through the outlet for subsequent operations to form the competed diaper,Relevant
Sheets of nonwoven fabric are formed from plastic resin using the meltblown process as described above,Relevant
These sheets are produced as a wide roll known as a web which is then cut to the appropriate width for use in diapers,Relevant
There is a web for the top sheet and another for the bottom sheet,Relevant
It should be noted that this step does not necessarily occur in sequence after pad formation because the nonwoven fabrics are often made in a separate location,Irrelevant
When the manufacturer is ready to initiate diaper production these large bolts of fabric are connected to special roller equipment that feeds fabric to the assembly line,Irrelevant
At some point in the process stretched elastic bands are attached to the backing sheet with adhesive,Relevant
After the diaper is assembled these elastic bands contract and gather the diaper together to ensure a snug fit and limit leakage,Relevant
At this point in the process there are still three separate components the absorbent pad the top sheet and the backing sheet,Relevant
These three components are in long strips and must be joined together and cut into diapersized units,Relevant
This is accomplished by feeding the absorbent pad onto a conveyor with the polyethylene bottom sheet,Relevant
The polypropylene top sheet is then fed into place and the compiled sheets are joined by gluing heating or ultrasonic welding,Relevant
The assembled diaper may have other attachments such as strips of tape or Velcro ™ which act as closures,Relevant
The long roll is then cut into individual diapers folded and packaged for shipping,Relevant
The components of an EKG machine are typically manufactured separately and then assembled prior to packaging,Irrelevant
These components including the electrodes the amplifier and the output device can be supplied by outside manufacturers or made inhouse,Relevant
The most common electrode used for an EKG machine is the silver and silver chloride electrode because the electrode potential of these electrodes is stable when exposed to biological tissue,Relevant
The electrodes are received from outside suppliers and checked to see if they conform to set specifications,Relevant
The type of electrode used depends on the EKG model,Irrelevant
Often multiple types of electrodes will be supplied with one EKG machine,Relevant
Each electrode contains a shielded cable that can be attached to the primary unit,Irrelevant
The electronic components of an EKG device are quite sophisticated and use the latest in electronic processing technology,Irrelevant
The amplifier and output device are assembled much like that of other electronic equipment,Relevant
It begins with a board that has the electronic configuration mapped out,Relevant
This board is then passed through a series of machines which place the appropriate chips diodes capacitors and other electronic pieces in the appropriate places,Relevant
When completed it is sent to the next step for soldering,Relevant
The electronic components are affixed to the board by a wave soldering machine,Relevant
Boards that enter this machine are first washed to remove any contaminants,Relevant
The board is then heated using infrared heat,Relevant
The underside of the board is passed over a wave of molten solder which fills in the appropriate spots through capillary action,Relevant
As the board is allowed to cool the solder hardens holding the pieces in place,Relevant
Depending on the type of display device manufacture method differs,Irrelevant
Certain devices such as magnetic tape recorders and paper printers can be supplied by outside manufacturers,Irrelevant
Other components like computer microprocessors can be designed and made right along with the primary internal electronics,Irrelevant
The components of the EKG machine are assembled and placed into an appropriate metal frame,Relevant
The finished devices are then put into final packaging along with accessories such as spare electrodes printout paper and manuals,Relevant
They are then sent out to distributors and finally to customers,Relevant
The first stage of escalator construction is to establish the design as described above,Irrelevant
The escalator manufacturer uses this information to construct the appropriately customized equipment,Relevant
There are two types of companies that supply escalators primary manufacturers who actually build the equipment and secondary suppliers that design and install the equipment,Irrelevant
In most cases the secondary suppliers obtain the necessary equipment from the primary manufacturers and make necessary modifications for installation,Irrelevant
Therefore most escalators are actually assembled at the primary manufacturer,Irrelevant
The tracks step chains stair assembly and motorized gears and pulleys are all bolted into place on the truss before shipping,Relevant
Prior to installation the landing areas must be prepared to connect to the escalator,Relevant
For example concrete fittings must be poured and the steel framework that will hold the truss in place must be attached,Irrelevant
After the escalator is delivered the entire assembly is uncrated and jockeyed into position between the top and bottom landing holes,Relevant
There are a variety of methods for lifting the truss assembly into place one of which is a scissors lift apparatus mounted on a wheeled support platform,Relevant
The scissors lift is outfitted with a locator assembly to aid in vertical and angular alignment of the escalator,Relevant
With such a device the upper end of the truss can be easily aligned with and then supported by a support wall associated with the upper landing,Relevant
The lower end of the truss can be subsequently lowered into a pit associated with the floor of the lower landing,Relevant
In some cases the railings may be shipped separately from the rest of the equipment,Irrelevant
In such a situation they are carefully coiled and packed for shipping,Relevant
They are then connected to the appropriate chains after the escalator is installed,Relevant
Make final connections for the power source and check to ensure all tracks and chains are properly aligned,Relevant
Verify all motorized elements are functioning properly that the belts and chains move smoothly and at the correct speed and that the emergency braking system is activated,Relevant
The step treads must be far enough apart that they do not pinch or rub against each other,Relevant
However they should be positioned such that no large gaps are present which could increase the chance of injury,Relevant
An escalator is a continuously moving staircase,Irrelevant
Each stair has a pair of wheels on each side one at the front of the step and one at the rear,Relevant
The wheels run on two rails,Relevant
At the top and bottom of the escalator the inner rail dips beneath the outer rail so that the bottom of the stair flattens making it easier for riders to get on and off,Relevant
The production of a fake fur can be a mostly automated process,Irrelevant
The manufacturing steps involved include production of the synthetic fibers construction of the garment and modification of the garment,Irrelevant
Making a fake fur begins with the production of the synthetic fibers,Relevant
While different types of polymers are used modacrylic polymers provide a good illustration of the fiber manufacturing process,Irrelevant
First the acrylonitrile and vinyl chloride monomers are mixed together in a large stainless steel container,Relevant
They are forced into a chamber in which the pressure and temperature is increased,Relevant
Mixing blades are constantly in motion and the polymerization process begins,Relevant
A white powdery resin is produced which is then converted into a thick liquid by dissolving it in acetone,Relevant
The liquid polymer mixture is then pumped through a filter to remove undissolved particles,Relevant
From the filter the material is pumped through spinnerets which are submerged in a water bath,Relevant
The spinnerets look similar to shower heads and when the polymer is extruded through it emerges as a group of continuous fibers called a tow,Relevant
The tow is then pulled along a conveyor belt and stretched through a series of pulleys,Relevant
As the tow is stretched it is also washed and dried,Relevant
As it dries the acetone is driven off leaving only the polymer,Relevant
The continuous fibers are then annealed making them stronger and are sent to a machine that cuts them to appropriate sizes,Relevant
After various quality control checks are performed on the fibers they are moved to the next phase of processing,Relevant
Here the polymers are soaked in dye solutions and colored,Relevant
While this is not the only phase of manufacture in which the fibers are colored this is usually the point where solid background colors are obtained,Irrelevant
While the fibers provide the primary texture and look for imitation fur the backing provides most of the structure,Irrelevant
Working off a specific garment design the backing which is made out of cotton or wool is sent through a machine to be appropriately cut,Relevant
It is then transferred to the next phase of production in which the fibers will be attached,Relevant
To convert the fibers into a garment four different techniques can be employed,Irrelevant
The most basic method is the weaving process,Irrelevant
In this process the fibers are looped through and interlaced with the backing fabric,Relevant
While this technique is fairly slow it can produce a large range of cloth shapes,Irrelevant
Another method of fake fur production is called tufting,Irrelevant
It is similar to weaving however it produces garments at a much higher rate of speed,Irrelevant
Circular loop knitting and sliver knitting are other methods of fake fur garment production,Irrelevant
Sliver knitting utilizes the same equipment used in jersey knitting,Irrelevant
This makes it the fastest and most economical of all the fake fur garment production techniques and it is also the one most used by manufacturers,Irrelevant
To simulate a natural fur the garments are treated in various ways,Irrelevant
First to ensure that the fake fur will remain unchanged after it is produced the fabric is heated,Relevant
This heat setting process preshrinks the fabric giving it improved stability and expanded fiber diameters,Relevant
Next to remove loose fibers from the fabric wire brushes are passed through the fabric,Relevant
This process is known as tigering,Irrelevant
Rough shearing of the fibers by cutting them with a set of helical knives gives Fake Furthem a uniform length,Relevant
The luster of the fabric can be improved through a method known as electrofying,Irrelevant
This is a polishing technique that involves combing the fabric with a heated grooved cylinder in both directions,Irrelevant
The next treatment is the application of chemicals such as resins and silicones which improves the feel and look of the fiber,Irrelevant
Coloring to simulate specific animals can also be enhanced at this staged,Relevant
Another round of electrofying can be done as well as a finishing shearing to remove any remaining loose fibers,Relevant
Depending on the type of fake fur embossing to simulate curls can also be done during this stage of manufacture,Irrelevant
After the fake fur has been produced the government requires that they are labeled as imitation fur fabrics,Relevant
These labels are typically sewn in the inside of the garment and must be legible throughout the life of the product,Irrelevant
In the final steps of fake fur manufacturing the garment is put in the appropriate packaging and shipped to distributors,Relevant
Fully integrated factories have been designed to produce compound fertilizers,Irrelevant
Depending on the actual composition of the end product the production process will differ from manufacturer to manufacturer,Irrelevant
Ammonia is one nitrogen fertilizer component that can be synthesized from inexpensive raw materials,Irrelevant
Since nitrogen makes up a significant portion of the earths atmosphere a process was developed to produce ammonia from air,Irrelevant
In this process Fertilizernatural gas and steam are pumped into a large vessel,Relevant
Next air is pumped into the system and oxygen is removed by the burning of natural gas and steam,Relevant
This leaves primarily nitrogen hydrogen and carbon dioxide,Irrelevant
The carbon dioxide is removed and ammonia is produced by introducing an electric current into the system,Relevant
Catalysts such as magnetite (Fe 3 O 4 ) have been used to improve the speed and efficiency of ammonia synthesis,Relevant
Any impurities are removed from the ammonia and it is stored in tanks until it is further processed,Relevant
While ammonia itself is sometimes used as a fertilizer it is often converted to other substances for ease of handling,Irrelevant
Nitric acid is produced by first mixing ammonia and air in a tank,Relevant
In the presence of a catalyst a reaction occurs which converts the ammonia to nitric oxide,Relevant
The nitric oxide is further reacted in the presence of water to produce nitric acid,Relevant
Nitric acid and ammonia are used to make ammonium nitrate,Relevant
This material is a good fertilizer component because it has a high concentration of nitrogen,Irrelevant
The two materials are mixed together in a tank and a neutralization reaction occurs producing ammonium nitrate,Relevant
This material can then be stored until it is ready to be granulated and blended with the other fertilizer components,Relevant
To isolate phosphorus from phosphate rock it is treated with sulfuric acid producing phosphoric acid,Relevant
Some of this material is reacted further with sulfuric acid and nitric acid to produce a triple superphosphate an excellent source of phosphorous in solid form,Relevant
Some of the phosphoric acid is also reacted with ammonia in a separate tank,Relevant
This reaction results in ammonium phosphate another good primary fertilizer,Irrelevant
Potassium chloride is typically supplied to fertilizer manufacturers in bulk,Relevant
The manufacturer converts it into a more usable form by granulating it,Relevant
This makes it easier to mix with other fertilizer components in the next step,Irrelevant

To produce fertilizer in the most usable form each of the different compounds ammonium nitrate potassium chloride ammonium phosphate and triple superphosphate are granulated and blended together,Relevant
One method of granulation involves putting the solid materials into a rotating drum which has an inclined axis,Relevant
As the drum rotates pieces of the solid fertilizer take on small spherical shapes,Relevant
They are passed through a screen that separates out adequately sized particles,Relevant
A coating of inert dust is then applied to the particles keeping each one discrete and inhibiting moisture retention,Relevant
Finally the particles are dried completing the granulation process,Relevant
The different types of particles are blended together in appropriate proportions to produce a composite fertilizer,Relevant
The blending is done in a large mixing drum that rotates a specific number of turns to produce the best mixture possible,Relevant
After mixing the fertilizer is emptied onto a conveyor belt which transports it to the bagging machine,Relevant
Fertilizers are typically supplied to farmers in large bags,Relevant
To fill these bags the fertilizer is first delivered into a large hopper,Relevant
An appropriate amount is released from the hopper into a bag that is held open by a clamping device,Relevant
The bag is on a vibrating surface which allows better packing,Relevant
When filling is complete the bag is transported upright to a machine that seals it closed,Relevant
The bag is then conveyored to a palletizer which stacks multiple bags readying them for shipment to distributors and eventually to farmers,Relevant
Advanced technology and processing have improved the quality of fiberboard,Irrelevant
These include innovations in wood preparation resin recipes press technology and panel sanding techniques,Irrelevant
Advanced press technology has shortened overall pressing cycles while antistatic technology has also contributed to increased belt life during the sanding process,Irrelevant
Producing quality fiberboard begins with the selection and refinement of the raw materials most of which are recycled from shavings and chips reclaimed from sawmills and plywood plants,Relevant
The raw material is first removed of any metal impurities using a magnet,Relevant
Next the material is separated into large chunks and small flakes,Relevant
Flakes are separated into sawdust and wood chip piles,Relevant
The material is sent through a magnetic detector again with the rejected material being separated for reuse as fuel,Relevant
Good material is collected and sent into a presteaming bin,Relevant
In the bin steam is injected to heat and soften the material,Relevant
The fibers are fed first into a side screw feeder and then into a plug screw feeder which compresses the fibers and removes water,Relevant
The compressed material is then fed into a refiner which tears the material into usable fibers,Relevant
Sometimes the fiber may undergo a second refining step in order to improve fiber purity,Irrelevant
Larger motors on the refiners are sometimes used to sift out foreign objects from the process,Irrelevant
Resin is added before the refining step to control the formaldehyde tolerances in the mixture and after refining a catalyst is added,Relevant
The fibers are then blown into a flash tube dryer which is heated by either oil or gas,Relevant
The ratio of solid resin to fiber is carefully controlled by weighing each ingredient,Relevant
Next the fiber is pushed through scalping rolls to produce a mat of uniform thickness,Relevant
This mat goes through several pressing steps to produce a more usable size and then is trimmed to the desired width before the final pressing step,Relevant
A continuous press equipped with a large drum compresses the mat at a uniform rate by monitoring the mat height,Relevant
Presses are equipped with electronic controls to provide accurate density and strength,Irrelevant
The resulting board is cut to the appropriate length using saws before cooling,Relevant

Presses have counterbalanced simultaneous closing systems that use hydraulic cylinders to effect platen leveling which when operating in conjunction with a fourpoint position control gives greater individual panel thickness control,Irrelevant
The hydraulics system can close the press at speeds and pressures that reduce board precure problems while shortening overall pressing cycles,Relevant
To achieve a smooth finish the panels are sanded using belts coated with abrasives,Relevant
Silicon carbide has typically been used but with the requirement for finer surfaces other ceramic abrasives are utilized including zirconia alumina and aluminum oxide,Irrelevant
Eighthead sanding equipment and doublesided grading improves surface smoothness consistency,Irrelevant
Antistatic technology is used to remove the static electricity that contributes to rapid loading and excessive sanding dust thereby increasing belt life,Irrelevant
Panels can undergo a variety of finishing steps depending on the final product,Relevant
A wide variety of lacquer colors can be applied as well as various woodgrain patterns,Relevant
Guillotine cutting is used to cut the fiberboard into large sheets (for example 100 inches wide),Relevant
For smaller sheet sizes such as 42 by 49 in (107 by 125 cm) die cutting is used,Relevant
Specialty machines are used for cutting fiberboard into narrow strips of 124 in (25 61 cm) widths,Relevant
Laminating machines are used to apply vinyl foil and other materials to the surface,Relevant

This process involves unwinding a roll of fiberboard material sending it between two rolls where the adhesive is applied combining the adhesivecoated fiberboard with the laminating material between another set of rolls and sending the combined materials into the laminator,Irrelevant
Raw coffee beans are processed in two primary ways,Irrelevant
The dry method allows the beans to dry on the plant or be dehydrated by the sun after harvesting,Relevant
The beans are then separated from the rest of the plant debris by milling,Relevant
In the wet method the beans are steeped and fermented up to 24 hours then a water spray removes the pulp and the beans are dried in the sun or in tumble dryers,Relevant
A hulling machine then removes the protective membrane around the bean,Relevant
In both cases the beans are cleaned sorted and graded,Relevant
Roasting develops the beans natural flavor by making the raw beans darker and bringing out the oils,Irrelevant
Green raw beans are roasted in ovens at a temperature between 380480°F (193249°C) for one to 17 minutes,Relevant
The degree of roasting determines the depth of flavor—the darker the roast Flavored Coffee Beanthe heavier the flavor,Irrelevant
There are five commons roasts American Viennese Italian French Dark and Espresso Black,Irrelevant
The American or Regular roast has light to medium brown beans with no oil on the bean,Relevant
It makes mild to medium coffee with a definite acidic snap,Irrelevant
The Viennese roast is slightly darker than American roast,Relevant
The Italian also known as Continental roast features dark brown beans with an oily surface,Relevant
It makes coffee that is dark flavored and bittersweet,Irrelevant
French Dark roasting produces dark brown almost black beans with a shiny oily surface,Relevant
With its smoky roasty flavors it makes an authoritative coffee,Irrelevant
Espresso Black is the highest roasting degree,Irrelevant
This roast produces beans which are almost carbonized and it yields the strongest brew,Irrelevant
If flavoring is added to beans which have too mild a roast the coffee lacks significant flavor characteristics and a flattasting beverage results,Irrelevant
If the roast is too dark the added flavor is overshadowed by the taste of the beans,Relevant
For example a French Vanilla flavor will be lost on a French Roast bean because the robust quality of the bean will overwhelm the sweet creamy tones of the flavor,Irrelevant
The perfect roast color for flavored coffee is medium to brown,Irrelevant
After the beans are roasted they must be quickly cooled before flavorings can be added,Relevant
Flavoring the beans while they are still at high temperatures can destroy some of the flavor compounds,Irrelevant
In large commercial operations cooling is done by water quenching which is a quick economical process that has the undesirable effect of leaching out some of the natural flavor of the beans,Relevant
Gourmet beans are dried more carefully usually by jets of warm air,Relevant
The appropriate amount of flavoring to be used must be determined before flavor oils can be added to the roasted beans,Irrelevant
The rate of use typically varies between 23 Flavored Coffee Beanaveraging 27 industrywide,Irrelevant
A 3 usage rate means that three pounds of flavor oil are added to 100 pounds of roasted beans,Irrelevant
The amount of flavoring required depends primarily on the type of flavor and its intensity as well as the type of bean used and its roast level,Irrelevant
Cost constraints also may play a role in determining how much flavoring to apply to the beans because flavors are relatively expensive,Irrelevant

The combination of flavors to be used and the quantity to be applied to the beans is established by experimental trial and error in which test batches of beans are flavored with small quantities of oil until the desired characteristics are obtained,Irrelevant
This formulation process is similar to the way one decides how much sugar to put in a cup of coffee or tea—add a small amount taste it and if necessary add a little more,Irrelevant
Once the precise amount is set the dosage is held constant for that particular flavor oil and roasted bean combination,Irrelevant
For different combinations of oils and beans the usage level must be readjusted for optimal results,Irrelevant
Flavors are typically added to roasted beans before they are ground,Relevant
The beans are placed in a large mixer which is specially designed to gently tumble the beans without causing them damage,Relevant
Examples of this type of mixer include ribbon blenders drum rotators and candy pan coaters,Irrelevant
The flavors are usually introduced via a pressurized spray mechanism which breaks the oils into tiny droplets which allows for better mixing,Relevant
Oils must be added to the beans very gradually to guard against areas of highly concentrated flavor called hot spots,Relevant
The beans are agitated for a set amount of time to ensure the flavor is evenly spread,Relevant
This process may take 1530 minutes depending on the batch size and mixing characteristics of the oil,Irrelevant
When the beans are properly coated they take on a glossy finish that indicates a uniform distribution of oils,Irrelevant
It is also important to note that instead of flavoring whole beans flavors in dry form can be blended with ground coffee,Irrelevant
In such cases the flavors are encapsulated in starch or some other powdered matrix,Irrelevant
There is enough moisture in the coffee to promote transfer of flavor and color from the encapsulated flavors to the coffee grounds in about 24 hours after mixing,Irrelevant
The finished product is packed in bags or cans as quickly as possible and sealed to prevent contact with the atmosphere,Relevant
Prior to packaging the container is flushed with nitrogen (an inert gas) a process that removes oxygen from the container,Relevant
Oxygen can react with components of the flavor oils and the beans and cause deterioration,Irrelevant
Coffee beans once roasted release their oils and begin to stale quickly when exposed to oxygen,Relevant
Briefly flushing the container with nitrogen before filling pushes all the oxygen out and ensures freshness,Relevant
Flavored beans should be stored in a cool dark place if they are to be used within three or four weeks,Relevant
If longer storage is required the beans may be frozen,Relevant
Wheat is received at the flour mill and inspected,Relevant
Samples of wheat are taken for physical and chemical analysis,Relevant
The wheat is graded based on several factors the most important of which is the protein content,Relevant
The wheat is stored in silos with wheat of the same grade until needed for milling,Relevant
An illustration from The Young Millwright and Millers Guide depicting the processes of an automated grain mill,Irrelevant
(From the collections of Henry Ford Museum Greenfield Village),Irrelevant
Before wheat can be ground into flour it must be free of foreign matter,Irrelevant
This requires several different cleaning processes,Irrelevant
At each step of purification the wheat is inspected and purified again if necessary,Relevant
The first device used to purify wheat is known as a separator,Relevant
This machine passes the wheat over a series of metal screens,Relevant
The wheat and other small particles pass through the screen while large objects such as sticks and rocks are removed,Relevant
The wheat next passes through an aspirator,Relevant
This device works like a vacuum cleaner,Relevant
The aspirator sucks up foreign matter which is lighter than the wheat and removes it,Relevant
Other foreign objects are removed in various ways,Relevant
One device known as a disk separator moves the wheat over a series of disks with indentations that collect objects the size of a grain of wheat,Relevant
Smaller or larger objects pass over the disks and are removed,Relevant
Another device known as a spiral seed separator makes use of the fact that wheat grains are oval while most other plant seeds are round,Relevant
The wheat moves down a rapidly spinning cylinder,Relevant
The oval wheat grains tend to move toward the center of the cylinder while the round seeds tend to move to the sides of the cylinder where they are removed,Irrelevant

Other methods used to purify wheat include magnets to remove small pieces of metal scourers to scrape off dirt and hair and electronic color sorting machines to remove material which is not the same color as wheat,Relevant
The purified wheat is washed in warm water and placed in a centrifuge to be spun dry,Relevant
During this process any remaining foreign matter is washed away,Relevant
The moisture content of the wheat must now be controlled to allow the outer Flourlayer of bran to be removed efficiently during grinding,Relevant
This process is known as conditioning or tempering,Irrelevant
Several methods exist of controlling the amount of water present within each grain of wheat,Irrelevant
Usually this involves adding rather than removing moisture,Irrelevant
Cold conditioning involves soaking the wheat in cold water for one to three days,Relevant
Warm conditioning involves soaking the wheat in water at a temperature of 115°F (46°C) for 6090 minutes and letting it rest for one day,Relevant
Hot conditioning involves soaking the wheat in water at a temperature of 140°F (60°C) for a short period of time,Relevant
This method is difficult to control and is rarely used,Irrelevant
Instead of water wheat may also be conditioned with steam at various temperatures and pressures for various amounts of time,Irrelevant
If conditioning results in too much moisture or if the wheat happens to be too moist after purification water can be removed by vacuum dryers,Irrelevant
Wheat of different grades and moistures is blended together to obtain a batch of wheat with the characteristics necessary to make the kind of flour being manufactured,Relevant
At this point the wheat may be processed in an Entoleter a trade name for a device with rapidly spinning disks which hurl the grains of wheat against small metal pins,Relevant
Those grains which crack are considered to be unsuitable for grinding and are removed,Relevant
The wheat moves between two large metal rollers known as breaker rolls,Relevant
These rollers are of two different sizes and move at different speeds,Irrelevant
They also contain spiral grooves which crack open the grains of wheat and begin to separate the interior of the wheat from the outer layer of bran,Relevant
The product of the breaker rolls passes through metal sieves to separate it into three categories,Relevant
The finest material resembles a coarse flour and is known as middlings or farina,Irrelevant
Larger pieces of the interior are known as semolina,Irrelevant
The third category consists of pieces of the interior which are still attached to the bran,Irrelevant
The middlings move to the middlings purifier and the other materials move to another pair of breaker rolls,Relevant
About four or five pairs of breaker rolls are needed to produce the necessary amount of middlings,Relevant
The middlings purifier moves the middlings over a vibrating screen,Relevant
Air is blown up through the screen to remove the lighter pieces of bran which are mixed with the middlings,Relevant
The middlings pass through the screen to be more finely ground,Relevant
Middlings are ground into flour by pairs of large smooth metal rollers,Relevant
Each time the flour is ground it passes through sieves to separate it into flours of different fineness,Relevant
These sieves are made of metal wire when the flour is coarse but are made of nylon or silk when the flour is fine,Relevant
By sifting separating and regrinding the flour several different grades of flour are produced at the same time,Irrelevant
These are combined as needed to produce the desired final products,Relevant
Small amounts of bleaching agents and oxidizing agents are usually added to the flour after milling,Relevant
Vitamins and minerals are added as required by law to produce enriched flour,Relevant
Leavening agents and salt are added to produce selfrising flour,Relevant
The flour is matured for one or two months,Relevant
The flour is packed into cloth bags which hold 2 5 10 25 50 or 100 lb (About 09 23 45 113 227 or 454 kg),Relevant
For largescale consumers it may be packed in metal tote bins which hold 3000 lb (1361 kg) truck bins which hold 45000 lb (20412 kg) or railroad bins which hold 100000 lb (45360 kg),Irrelevant
After special tanning processes the cowhide selected to be used for the football Footballis cut into a bend which is the best and strongest part of the hide,Relevant
The bend is then diecut into panels,Relevant
Using a hydraulicallydriven clicking machine an operator cuts four panels into the precise shape required at the same time,Relevant
Next each panel goes through a skiving machine in order to reduce it to a predetermined thickness and weight,Relevant
A synthetic lining is sewn to each panel,Relevant
The lining which is composed of three layers of crosslaid fabric firmly cemented together prevents the panel from stretching or growing out of shape during use,Relevant
The lining and panel are sewn together using an industrial size and strength version of a home sewing machine,Relevant
A facing is then applied to those areas that will carry the lacing holes as well as the hole for the inflating needle,Relevant
The holes are then punched,Relevant
The four panels are sewn together by a hotwax lock stitch machine to ensure that the seams are especially durable,Relevant
Then the ball is turned right side out,Relevant
Next a twoply butyl rubber bladder is inserted the ball is laced and then it is inflated with a pressure of not less than 125 lb (6 kg) but no more than 135 lb (61 kg),Relevant
After inflation the ball is checked to ensure it conforms to all size and weight regulations,Relevant
The ball is ready for branding with the manufacturers name and number,Relevant
A twoply butyl rubber bladder is inserted the ball is laced and then it is inflated with a pressure of not less than 125 lb (6 kg) but no more than 135 lb (61 kg),Relevant
After inflation the ball is checked to ensure it conforms to all size and weight regulations,Relevant
After final inspections the balls are boxed and shipped to designated schools and ball clubs,Relevant
The helmet outer shell is constructed of a tough plastic called polycarbonate alloy,Irrelevant
The polycarbonate alloy arrives at the manufacturing plant in pellet form—in boxes of thermoplastic pellets the size of beebees,Irrelevant
The pellets are loaded into an injectionmolding machine melted and forced into a cavity the size of a football helmet,Relevant
It takes approximately one minute to mold one shell,Irrelevant
Shells come in small medium large and extra large sizes,Irrelevant
The shell then drops out of the machine,Relevant
Next a multidrill fixture drills 1415 holes into the mold a process that takes approximately 1215 seconds to complete,Relevant
Next protective air liners are produced,Relevant
Certain rotationallymolded onepiece liners are inflatable and are used in the helmet for obtaining proper fit and to aid in dispersing the energy imparted by an impact,Relevant
Other specificallyengineered liners contain special foams and energyattenuating or elastic materials,Irrelevant
Like air these materials are designed to absorb kinetic energy of movement and slow or decrease the impact of a blow to the head,Irrelevant
The foambased liners are made in several pieces—one is for the back neck and sides of the helmet and another is for the crown,Irrelevant
To produce the special foams required for the liner large sheets of foam are diecut to size,Relevant
Then the vinyl encasement is diecut to size,Relevant
A piece of vinyl is loaded into a vacuum former,Relevant
The pieces of the diecut foam are put into the vinyl and thermoformed to make an airtight seal,Relevant
Another layer of vinyl is placed on top of the thermoform and the process is repeated,Relevant
The jaw pads which are designed to fit below the earlobe are affixed,Relevant
Different sizes or thicknesses are available,Irrelevant
Materiols used for the production of football helmets have evolved from leather to horder leather to molded polycarbonate shells which are used today because of their strength and weight,Irrelevant
Materiols used for the production of football helmets have evolved from leather to horder leather to molded polycarbonate shells which are used today because of their strength and weight,Irrelevant
Face masks are then attached,Relevant
There are several different styles of face masks,Irrelevant
The face masks are made out of steel wire and coated with plastic,Irrelevant
There also are three different versions of plastic face masks,Irrelevant
The chin straps are then attached,Relevant
The helmets can be painted in any one of the standard finished colors,Relevant
There are over 50 standard colors to choose,Irrelevant
More often however the color finish is injection molded in at the time the shell is constructed,Relevant
Decorative pieces such as decals are generally not applied by the manufacturer but by the organization purchasing the helmets,Irrelevant
The NFL does their own decaling as well,Irrelevant
At the end of the assembly line each helmet is subjected to inspection to ensure that the workmanship standards have been met,Relevant
Only then would each helmet be placed in a poly bag and into a compartmented carton for shipment to the warehouse,Relevant
Each helmet has a serial number inside the shell and the corresponding serial number is affixed to the outside of the carton,Relevant
Garbage truck bodies are built in a fixed location within a plant rather than moving down an assembly line or moving from one work station to another,Irrelevant
Component parts are fabricated in a machine shop and are then welded or assembled into subassemblies,Relevant
The subassemblies are brought together and are welded or assembled into the finished body,Relevant
The body is then lifted and mounted on a truck chassis,Relevant
Here is a typical sequence of operations for the assembly of a frontloader garbage truck ,Irrelevant
The pieces for the body floor sides top and front end are cut to size in a machine shop using band saws metal shears and cutting torches,Relevant
Some flat pieces are bent in press brakes or curved in roller benders,Relevant
Mounting holes are punched or drilled,Relevant
The pieces for each of the body components—floor sides top and front—are moved to separate subassembly areas where they are welded together,Relevant
Welding the long reinforcing channels on the sides is often done on a flat welding table with an automatic welder that is programmed to make welds in the correct areas,Relevant
Other welding is done manually,Relevant
Templates are sometimes used to position the pieces correctly while clamps hold the pieces in position,Irrelevant
Each of the body subassemblies is brought to the body assembly area sometimes called a cell,Relevant
First the floor is brought in and positioned on supports to make it level and stable,Relevant
Then the sides are lifted in and are braced while they are welded to the floor,Relevant
Then the top is lowered and welded into place followed by the front,Relevant
When the body shell is finished it looks like an empty shoe box with one end missing,Relevant
While the body shell is being formed the operating parts of the body are being fabricated and welded into subassemblies,Relevant
These include the lift arms fork assembly hopper cover tailgate and packer blade,Irrelevant
They are formed in the same sequence as described in steps 1 and 2,Irrelevant
When the body shell is complete the operating subassemblies are brought to the body assembly area in sequence,Relevant
The packer blade is installed first because it goes inside the body,Relevant
It is lifted into position and the packer hydraulic cylinder is attached between the packer blade and the body shell,Relevant
Some body designs use two hydraulic cylinders for increased packing force,Relevant
The hopper cover is installed next,Relevant
It is welded over the loading opening on the forward portion of the body top,Relevant
The cover is hydraulically opened as the lift arms bring the trash container up and over the top and it includes shields to prevent the trash from spilling over the sides,Relevant
The hydraulic cylinder is attached to the mounting points,Relevant
The lift arms fork assembly and front and rear torque tubes are assembled and attached to the body shell,Relevant
The various hydraulic cylinders are attached to their mounting points,Relevant
The tailgate is installed last,Relevant
It is hung from its topmounted hinges and the hydraulic cylinders are attached to their mounting points,Relevant
The body lights are installed and the electrical wiring is routed and connected,Relevant
The hydraulic hoses are routed and connected to the various hydraulic cylinders,Relevant
At this point some manufacturers paint the body before it is mounted on the truck while others wait until the body is mounted on the truck before they paint it,Relevant
If the body is to be painted at this point the lights and the exposed portions of the hydraulic cylinder rods are masked off with paper and tape,Relevant
After the body is painted any name plates decorative striping and warning labels are applied as required,Relevant
A truck cab and chassis is delivered to the garbage truck body builder,Relevant
The most popular style is known as a lowcabforward in which the cab sits slightly ahead of the engine,Irrelevant
Many of the components required to work with a particular kind of garbage body are available directly from the truck manufacturer,Irrelevant
Other components must be installed by the garbage body builder,Irrelevant
This work is done in a separate area of the plant,Irrelevant

It often includes mounting a hydraulic fluid tank and filters on the truck frame installing a hydraulic pump and powertakeoff on the side of the transmission and mounting controls and instruments in the cab to operate the various hydraulic cylinders on the body,Relevant
When the body is completed and the truck cab and chassis have been properly modified the body is lifted and bolted to the truck frame rails,Relevant
The rear mounting brackets are usually bolted tight while the front mounting brackets are usually attached through springs which permit the frame rails to move slightly relative to the body,Relevant
This allows the truck frame to flex slightly when traveling over uneven ground at landfill sites,Relevant
If the rails were held rigidly against the body the resulting stress forces could cause the frame rails to break,Irrelevant
The electrical wires and hydraulic hoses are connected between the truck and the body,Relevant
The hydraulic tank and lines are filled with hydraulic fluid,Relevant
As a final test all the lights are checked and the hydraulic cylinders are actuated through their full cycle,Relevant
The truck is then driven outside to await delivery to the customer,Relevant
The design of the mask itself varies by the industrial application,Irrelevant
Some masks are designed with speech diaphragms some are built to accept extra filters and others are made to be connected to an extenal air supply,Irrelevant
Although the fundamental design does not vary for a given type of mask the kind of filtrant used will vary depending on the products intended use,Irrelevant
Manufacturers stock a variety of mask styles and cartridge filtrants,Irrelevant
When they receive orders for a specific type of mask they can custom design a mask that has the appropriate features,Irrelevant
The canister is made from styrene plastic which is resistant to water and other Gas Maskchemicals has good dimensional stability and is specially designed for injection molding,Irrelevant
Injection molding is a process by which molten plastic is injected into a mold under high pressure,Relevant
The mold used for gas mask canisters consists of two diskshaped pieces of metal that are clamped together,Relevant
The plastic resin is liquefied by heating and then injected into the mold via an injection plunger,Relevant
The mold is then subjected to high pressure,Relevant
Most injection machines compress the mold with a pressure ranging from 502500 tons (512540 metric tons),Relevant
After the molten plastic has been compressed cooling water is forced through channels in the mold to cool and harden the plastic,Relevant
The pressure is released the two halves of the mold are separated and the finished canister is ejected,Relevant
Styrene is a thermoplastic resin which means it can be repeatedly remelted so the scrap pieces can be reworked to make additional canisters,Relevant
Therefore there is very little wasted plastic in this process,Irrelevant
A similar molding process is conducted to create small circular screens that fit inside the canister,Relevant
The screens are designed to hold the activated carbon in place inside the cartridge,Relevant
As the canisters travel down the assembly line one screen is inserted the canister is filled with the appropriate filtrant then the second screen is put into place,Relevant
The face piece is injection molded from silicone rubber,Relevant
Silicone rubber has outstanding stability is resistant to high temperatures and can conform to curves in the face and head,Relevant
It is also thermoplastic and can remolded as necessary,Irrelevant
The molding process is very similar to the one described above,Irrelevant
