After molding the skirt must be removed from the mold and any rough edges must be cleaned off by hand before the other components can be attached,Relevant
The pieces are assembled on a partially automated assembly line with two to four line workers supervising the process,Irrelevant
The completed filter canister is attached to the face piece and the eyepieces are inserted and held in place with adhesive,Relevant
Finally the straps and bands are attached to the face piece with metal rivets,Relevant
When assembly is complete the mask is given a final quality check,Relevant

When the masks pass inspection they are identified with the appropriate markings in accordance with the American National Standard for Identification of Air Purifying Respirator Cartridges and Canisters,Relevant
The finished masks are packaged for shipping,Relevant
The containers used to package the masks must also designate the identity of the mask,Relevant
Furthermore they must be designed for easy access if the masks might be used in the event of an emergency,Irrelevant
Threepiece golf balls are more difficult to make and can require more than 80 different manufacturing steps and 32 inspections taking up to 30 days to make one ball,Irrelevant
Twopiece balls require about half of these steps and can be produced in as little as one day,Irrelevant
The center of the twopiece ball is a molded core,Irrelevant
It is a blend of several different ingredients all of which are chemically reactive to give a rubber type compound,Irrelevant
After heat and pressure is applied a core of about 15 inches (375 cm) is formed,Relevant
Injection molding or compression molding is used to form the cover and dimples on a twopiece ball using a twopiece mold,Relevant
In injection molding the core is centered within a mold cavity by pins and molten thermoplastic is injected into the dimpled cavity surrounding the core,Relevant
Heat and pressure cause the cover material to flow to join with the center forming the dimpled shape and size of the finished ball,Relevant
As the plastic cools and hardens the pins are retracted and the finished balls are removed,Relevant
With compression molding the cover is first injection molded into two hollow hemispheres,Relevant
These are positioned around the core heated and then pressed together using a mold which fuses the cover to the core and also forms the dimples,Relevant
Threepiece balls are all compression molded since the hot plastic flowing through would distort and probably cause breaks in the rubber threads,Relevant
Flash or rough spots and the seam on the molded cover are removed,Relevant
Two coats of paint are applied to the ball,Relevant
Each ball sits on two posts which spins so that the paint is applied uniformly,Relevant
Spray guns that are automatically controlled are used to apply the paint,Relevant
Next the ball is stamped with the logo,Relevant
The final step is the application of a clear coat for high sheen and scuff resistance,Relevant
Drying and packaging 5 After the paint is applied the balls are loaded into containers and placed in large dryers,Relevant
After drying the balls are ready for packaging in boxes and other containers,Relevant
Graham crackers are made through a series of steps which convert the raw ingredients Graham Crackerinto finished products,Irrelevant
Important steps include ingredient handling compounding forming or machining baking post conditioning and packaging,Irrelevant
Most of the major ingredients like flour vegetable shortening and sugar are delivered to cracker manufacturers in large quantities and stored in bulk tanks,Irrelevant
Depending on the ingredient these tanks may be fashioned with special equipment to control their internal environments,Irrelevant
For example a liquid such as vegetable shortening must be stored at a specific temperature until it is ready to be used,Irrelevant
If the temperature varies too much the shortening could be difficult to pump or could adversely affect the dough,Irrelevant
Therefore this tank has controls which can maintain the appropriate temperature,Irrelevant
Other tanks may have refrigeration capabilities,Irrelevant
At the start of cracker production ingredients are transferred to mixing tanks,Relevant
Liquid bulk ingredients are transferred using metered pumps which can move a specific quantity of material,Irrelevant
Bulk solid materials are pumped via a method called pneumatic transfer which involves fluidizing the powders with a stream of air and then pumping them with metered pumps,Relevant
Minor ingredients that are supplied in boxes bags and drums are weighed and poured into the mixing tank by hand,Relevant
The graham cracker ingredients are mixed together in specific quantities as specified in the recipe,Relevant
Cracker doughs are mixed with either vertical spindle mixers or highspeed horizontal drum mixers,Irrelevant
The order that ingredients are added to the mixture is important,Irrelevant
Typically the process begins with sugar water and shortening,Relevant
This forms a mixture with a creamlike consistency,Irrelevant
Next the remaining ingredients are added and a short dough is obtained,Relevant
This dough is allowed to set for two to three hours for the leavening agents to work,Relevant
Graham crackers are usually sold in two forms as squares or as animal crackers,Irrelevant
The dough used for both is ostensibly the same,Relevant
In the machining process the dough is delivered from a hopper onto a conveyor belt and rolled thin by a series of metal gauging rolls,Relevant
The thickness of the sheet is reduced by each of these rollers,Relevant
Some manufacturers stack multiple sheets on top of each other in a process known as laminating,Relevant
They are rolled out further allowed to relax and then sent along a conveyor belt to the cutting machines,Relevant
The edges of the dough sheets are cut smooth by rotary cutting machines and excess dough is sent back to the hopper for reuse,Relevant
When animal crackers are made the sheet of dough is cut into the various animal shapes by cutting machines called stampers,Relevant
These stampers or rotary dies have the animal shapes fashioned on them with intricate details,Relevant
After this stage sugar cinnamon or honey are applied to the top of the dough if the recipe requires it,Relevant
The crackers are baked in a tunnel oven,Relevant
The dough is first transferred to a metal conveyor belt and then moved through the oven which can be 100300 feet (3090 m) long,Relevant
Baking takes place in three stages called development drying and coloring,Relevant
In the development stage the dough sets taking on the size and shape of the final product,Relevant
The greatest amount of water is lost in the drying stage,Relevant
In the coloring stage the dough is changed from pale white to a light golden brown,Relevant
The amount of time a product spends baking is controlled by the speed of the moving conveyor belt,Relevant
Animal crackers bake for as little as four minutes,Relevant
Graham crackers bake slightly longer,Relevant
After the crackers come out of the oven they travel on a series of conveyors to cool,Relevant
At some point in this process they are flipped over and then flipped back to ensure that cooling is throughout,Relevant
The total cooling time can be twice as long as the baking time,Relevant
Depending on the recipe other coatings can be put on the crackers after they have cooled,Relevant
These include such things as icings chocolate coatings or sugar,Irrelevant
These can be applied using either stenciling extruders or depositors,Irrelevant
Excess toppings are removed using forced air and vibrating shaker devices,Relevant
The final step in the manufacturing process is packaging,Relevant
Because of the fragile nature of some crackers the packaging must be rigid and airtight,Relevant
For square graham crackers the crackers are cut and stacked individually and wrapped in flexible films,Relevant
Animal crackers which are less fragile are typically packaged in a coated bag,Relevant
Both types of crackers are then put inside boxes which are appropriately decorated to make the product appealing,Relevant
These boxes are put into larger case boxes which can be stacked on pallets and shipped to stores,Relevant
Gummy manufacturing uses a starch molding process,Irrelevant
First the candy is made then it is filled into starched lined trays,Relevant
The filled trays are then cooled overmight and the resulting formed candy is emptied from the trays,Relevant
In the mass production of gummy candy significant improvements have been made to increase the speed and efficiency of this process,Irrelevant
The manufacture of gummy candy begins with compounding,Relevant
Factory workers known as compounders follow instructions outlined in the recipes and physically pour the appropriate amount of gummy raw materials into the main mixing tanks,Relevant
These tanks which are equipped with mixing heating and cooling capabilities are quite large,Irrelevant
Depending on the size of the batch gummy candy compounding can take from one to three hours,Irrelevant
When the batch is complete it is sent to the Quality Control (QC) laboratory to make sure that it meets the required specifications,Relevant
After the gummy candy is compounded and passes QC testing it is either pumped or transferred to a starch molding machine known as a Mogul,Relevant
This machine can automatically perform the multiple tasks involved in making gummy candy,Irrelevant
It is called a starch molding machine because starch is a main component,Irrelevant
In this machine starch has three primary purposes,Irrelevant
First it prevents the candy from sticking to the candy molds which allows for easy removal and handling,Relevant
Second it holds the gummy candy in place during the drying cooling and setting processes,Relevant
Finally it absorbs moisture from the candies giving them the proper texture,Relevant
Making gummy candy in a Mogul is a continuous process,Irrelevant
At the start of the machine trays that contain previously filled cooled and formed gummy candy are stacked,Relevant
The trays are then removed from the stack onebyone and iwove along a conveyor belt into the next section of the machine known as the starch buck,Relevant
As they enter the starch buck the trays are inverted and the gummy candy falls out into a vibrating metal screen known as a sieve,Relevant
The vibrating action of the sieve in concert with oscillating brushes removes all of the excess starch that adheres to the gummy candy,Relevant
These pieces then move along a conveyor belt to trays where they are manually transferred to other machines by which they can be decorated further and placed into appropriate packaging,Relevant
A more recent advance called the pneumatic starch buck further automates this step,Irrelevant
In this device a tightly fitting cover is placed over the filled trays,Relevant
When it is inverted the candies adhere to the cover and remain in their ordered position,Irrelevant
The excess starch is then removed by fastrotating compressedair jets,Relevant
The candy can then be conveyed for further processing,Irrelevant
Gummy candy is manufactured in a machine called a Mogul,Irrelevant
Cooled trays of gummy candy are inverted in the starch buck,Relevant
This candy is ready for packaging,Relevant
The trays are then filled with starch to keep the candy from sticking and sent to the printer table which imprints a pattern into the starch,Relevant
The depositor fills the trays with the hot candy mixture and the trays are sent back to the stacker to cool for 24 hours,Relevant
Then the machine can start the process again,Relevant
The starch that is removed from the gummy candy is reused in the process but first it must be cleaned dried and otherwise reconditioned,Relevant
Candy particles are first removed by passing the starch through a metal screen known as a sieve,Relevant
It is then conveyed to a recirculating starch conditioning system,Relevant
As it enters this machine it is dried by being passed through hot moving air,Relevant
After drying the starch is cooled by cool air jets and conveyed back out to the Mogul to be reused in the starch molding process,Relevant
The starch returns from the drier via a conveyor belt to the Mogul where it is filled into the empty trays and leveled,Relevant
These were the same trays that were inverted and emptied in step two,Irrelevant
These starchfilled trays then move to a printer table,Relevant
Here a board that has the inverse of the mold printed on it presses the starch down so the mold has an indent in it,Relevant
From here the trays are moved to the depositors,Relevant
The gummy candy compounded in step 1 is transferred to the depositors,Relevant
This is the part of the mogul that has a filling nozzle and can deliver the exact amount of candy needed into the trays as they pass under it,Relevant
The depositor section of the mogul can contain 30 or more depositors depending on how many imprints there are on the trays,Relevant
In more modern depositors the color flavor and acids can be added to the gummy base right in the depositor,Relevant
This allows different colors and flavors to be made simultaneously speeding up the process,Relevant
The filled trays are moved along to a stacking machine and then sent to a cooling room where they stay until they are appropriately cooled and formed,Relevant
This part of the process can take over 24 hours,Relevant
After this happens the trays are moved back to the Mogul and the process starts all over again,Relevant
Before a batch of hair dye is made the ingredients must be certified,Irrelevant
That is the chemicals must be tested to make sure they are what they are labeled and that they are the proper potency,Irrelevant
Certification may be done by the manufacturer inhouse,Irrelevant
In many cases the ingredients arrive from a reputable distributor who has provided a Certificate of Analysis and this satisfies the manufacturers requirements,Relevant
Next a worker weighs out the ingredients for the batch,Relevant
For some ingredients only a small amount is necessary in the batch,Irrelevant
But if a very large batch is being made and several ingredients are needed in large amounts these may be piped in from storage tanks,Relevant
In some hair dye formulas the dye chemicals are premixed in hot water,Irrelevant
The dye chemicals are dumped in a tank and water which has been already heated to 158°F(70°C) is pumped in,Relevant
Other ingredients or solvents may also be added to the premix,Relevant
The premix is agitated for approximately 20 minutes,Relevant
The premix is then added to a larger tank containing the other ingredients of the hair dye,Relevant
In a small batch the tanks used may hold about 1600 lbs (725 kg) and they are portable,Irrelevant
A worker wheels the premix tank to the second mix tank and pours the ingredients in,Relevant
For a very large batch the tanks may hold 10 times as much as the portable tanks and in this case they are connected by pipes,Relevant
In a formula in which no premixing is required after checking and weighing the in gredients go directly to the mixing step,Relevant
The ingredients are simply mixed in the tank until the proper consistency is reached,Relevant
If a heated premix is used the second mix solution must be allowed to cool,Relevant
The ingredients that follow the premix may be additional solvents surfactants and alkalizers,Irrelevant
If the formula includes alcohol it is no added until the mix reaches 104°F(40°C) so that it does not evaporate,Relevant
Fragrances too are often added at the end of the mix,Relevant
The finished batch of hair dye is then piped or delivered to a tank in the filling area,Relevant
A nozzle from this tank lets a measured amount of hair dye into bottles moving beneath it on a belt,Relevant
The filled bottles continue on the belt to machines which affix labels and cap them,Relevant
From the filling area the bottles are taken to the packaging line,Relevant

At the packaging line the hair dye bottle is put in a box together with any other elements such as a bottle of developer or special finishing shampoo instruction sheet and gloves and cap or any other tools provided for the consumer,Relevant
After the package is complete it is put in a shipping carton,Relevant
The full cartons are then taken to the warehouse to await distribution,Relevant
While the individual parts are produced by machinery the assembly is done by hand,Irrelevant
Wooden combs are cut from a block of wood,Relevant
Channels are carved out in descending lengths across the comb,Relevant
Plastic combs are injection molded,Relevant
The plastic compound is heated to a semifluid state and then mechanically injected into a mold,Relevant
The compound hardens quickly the mold is popped open and the new comb is expelled,Relevant
The reed plate is stamped and machined creating slits that correspond to the channels on the comb,Relevant
Reeds are cut and tapered by machine,Relevant
One end of each reed is riveted to the reed plate so that a reed lays over each slit,Relevant
The opposite end of the reed is left free,Relevant
The reed plate is manually tuned,Relevant
The tuner strikes the appropriate tuning fork and then files each reed to the correct tone,Relevant
Filing the base end lowers the pitch filing the free end raises the pitch,Relevant
The reed plate is attached to the comb with nails or screws,Relevant
The assembly is done manually at a workbench similar to that used by a shoemaker,Irrelevant
The nails are inserted into the holes with needlenosed pliers and then tapped in gently with a small hammer,Relevant
The plate cover which has been machined shaped and stamped with the company name and harmonica type is attached to the reedcomb assembly with screws or nails,Relevant
The harmonicas are inserted into boxes and packed for shipment to retailers,Relevant
Boards of spruce maple beech and other woods are received by the harpmaker and inspected,Relevant
In order to perfectly match the grain of harp with a natural finish boards of wood all from the same tree may be received together,Relevant
The boards are then stored for about six months to become adjusted to the local climate in order to avoid any future problems with splitting or cracking,Relevant
Power woodcutting machines cut the boards into rough approximations of the pieces needed,Relevant
More detailed shaping of these pieces is done with hand held woodcutting tools,Irrelevant
Harpmakers learn their craft in a series of apprenticeships,Irrelevant
New workers build the base of the harp then go on to learn the skills needed to build the body and the soundboard,Irrelevant
Only the most experienced harpmakers work on the column and the neck,Irrelevant
Many thin layers of wood are glued together under pressure to foim wooden parts which are stronger than solid wood,Relevant
The various wooden parts are then stored to await assembly,Relevant
Metalworkers use a wide variety of power and hand held tools to shape brass and steel into the nearly 1500 pieces needed to make up the action of the harp,Relevant
Some simple parts may be purchased from outside manufacturers,Relevant
The metal components are then stored to await assembly,Irrelevant
Before assembly the wooden components are decorated as desired,Relevant
The column may be hand carved with complex designs which take several weeks to complete,Relevant
All wooden parts are sanded smooth in preparation for finishing,Relevant
They are then sprayed with clear lacquer or colored wood stain,Relevant
After one coat of lacquer or stain is applied it is allowed to dry and then sanded smooth again,Relevant
This process is repeated up to 10 times over as long as two weeks,Relevant
The soundboard may then be painted with elaborate designs,Relevant

A modern concert harp stands about 7075 in (1442049 m) high is about 40 in (1 m) wide weighs about 7090 lb (3241 kg) and has 47 strings ranging in size from a few inches to several feet in length,Irrelevant
Some harps have gilded columns and bases,Irrelevant
The gilder begins by sanding unfinished wooden parts to remove all imperfections,Relevant
Layers of gesso (a special mixture of glues) are applied to the smooth wood,Relevant
After the gesso sets layers of clay are applied and sanded smooth,Relevant
Glue is applied to a small area of the smooth clay,Relevant
Gold leaf 0000004 inches thick (01 microns) is applied with a brush,Relevant
(The gold is so thin that it cannot be handled directly by human hands),Irrelevant
The process is repeated on other small areas until an entire component is gilded,Relevant
Excess gold is wiped away and another layer of gold leaf is applied,Relevant
Some portions of the gold are burnished to a brilliant sheen by rubbing them with a tool made of polished agate,Relevant
Clear lacquer is applied to protect the gold,Relevant
Master harpmakers begin the slow painstaking process of bringing the wood and metal components together to form the harp,Relevant
The parts of the neck body soundboard base and column are brought together to form the frame,Relevant
The complex mechanism of the action is fitted within the column and connected to the disks on the brass plate below the neck and the pedals on the base,Relevant
Strings are attached to brass pegs on the neck fed through the disks and attached to the centerstrip of the soundboard,Relevant
At first the strings are very loose,Irrelevant
They are slowly tightened to the correct level of tension and tuned to the correct pitch,Relevant
After a final inspection the harp is packed in closefitting foam within a cardboard box to be shipped to the purchaser,Relevant
The harp manufacturer also makes special protective wooden cases with wheels which allow the harp to be moved with relative ease,Relevant
The pump is usually procured as a finished unit and installed into the system by integrating it with coupling and piping components,Irrelevant
Designed for the specific size and fluid requirements of the system the pump may be shipped depending upon its size directly to the installation site,Irrelevant
This usually occurs with large commercial heat pumps supplying heat andor refrigeration to office buildings,Irrelevant
Smaller residential models may have the pump installed into an assembly that includes the condenser evaporator and various piping,Irrelevant
These units encased in a sheet metal box will be comprised of various subassemblies for the condenser and evaporator in order to bolt every component to the box or to one another,Irrelevant
Some of the brackets used will form the base of the unit where the pump will be bolted down to a metal pan and connected to an AC motor,Relevant
Assembled from several different sheets of metal encasement units are sheared to size in a shear press,Relevant
After they are cut to the proper dimensions small assembly holes are punched in the metal using a Computer Numerically Controlled (CNC) punch press,Relevant
These punch presses have either a moveable table to move the sheet metal or a moveable die which is able to punch holes in different spots of the metal,Relevant
Punch presses are often directed where to punch by a computeraided design (CAD) program,Relevant
Different shaped punching tools are stored within the machine providing it with the ability to punch all of the necessary holes by simply changing the computer program,Irrelevant
After punching the sheet will move to a Numerically Controlled (NC) press brake where it will be bent in different shapes and configurations,Relevant
The press brake bends the metal into many different shapes by using dies or tooling,Relevant
Unlike the CNC punch press the press brake will require a manual change in tooling to perform a different bend,Irrelevant
The sheet is then ready to be welded riveted or bolted to the other sheets and brackets,Irrelevant
Once assembled these sheets provide most of the stability of standalone units,Relevant
The condenser and evaporator are made of many small thin copper or aluminum tubes which are bent around curved dies by tube bending machines,Relevant
NC tube bending machines will be programmed to provide the same exact bend on each of the tubes allowing them to be stacked one on top of the other,Relevant
These tubes will then be attached to plates or fins through which the tubes will pass and be joined through tube expansion or joint welding,Relevant
This creates a tightly sealed system,Relevant

The tube and plate assembly will act as a heat exchanger by allowing the working fluid to pass through the system inside the tubes while giving off the heat in the condenser to another fluid medium passing between the plates and acquiring the heat given off through the tubes,Relevant
In order to provide strength or connectivity to the components small brackets are punched out of mild carbon steel,Relevant
The brackets are usually punched out of steel coil that is continuously fed first through a decoiler,Relevant
Once it is decoiled it is sheared bent and formed in one continuous process,Relevant
Heat PumpThis is done with a progressive die configuration where the bracket remains attached to the coil as it moves from station to station,Relevant
Each station adds something to the bracket either a hole or notch and sends it to the next station until finally it is sheared from the coil,Relevant
This process may be outsourced to vendors who specialize in progressive die or transfer press operations and can provide better cost control,Relevant
More tubing is fabricated and bent to provide the rest of the piping needed to connect the pump with the condenser and evaporator,Relevant
Various fittings and connection components are utilized,Irrelevant
The expansion valve which is contained within some of the piping lines is another component purchased as a whole unit,Irrelevant
The expansion valve is a designed fitting that provides for the expansion of the working fluid and connection of smaller diameter tubing with larger diameter tubing,Irrelevant
In small residential units the valve is contained within the main box while in larger commercial units it may be installed on site in the piping system,Irrelevant
Components subassemblies brackets andor plates are painted or powder coated for corrosion resistance,Relevant
Before painting however some parts are treated with a special solvent to remove any grease or oil left from the manufacturing operations,Relevant
This is usually done by submersing the parts in large tanks filled with solvent and then drying them in a special oven,Relevant
Some parts which are specially coated with zinc nickel or chrome will be fed through an acid bath before being dipped into tanks of coating solution,Relevant
Once cleaned the parts are manually loaded onto trays or hung on specially designed racks and fed into a paint booth,Relevant
The paint is applied with a pressurized paint dispenser that will spray paint into each crevice,Relevant
After passing vigorous inspections the heat pump is sent to packaging where the system will be boxed and shipped to the installation site,Relevant
Generally heat pumps will be installed at the construction site,Relevant
The compressor and evaporator will be constructed of massive 3 in (75 cm) diameter tubing and have larger chambers where the working fluid will change phases,Relevant
The pump itself will be bolted to a concrete pad and connected Heat Pumpwith a large DC motor or natural gas generator,Relevant
The fittings and valves will be shipped and installed into the piping system while supported by brackets and braces anchored to existing walls,Relevant
These installations exhibit significant engineering challenges and often require cooperation between the contractor and heat pump manufacturer,Relevant
Heavyduty trucks are assembled from component parts,Irrelevant
Each truck manufacturer usually builds its own cabs and a few also build their own engines transmissions axles and other major components,Irrelevant
In most cases however the major components (and many of the other components) are built by other companies and are shipped to the truck assembly plant,Irrelevant
In most plants the trucks move along an assembly line as components are added by different groups of workers at successive workstations,Irrelevant

The truck starts with a frame assembly that acts as the backbone of the truck and finishes with the completed fully operational vehicle being driven off the end of the assembly line under its own power,Relevant
A 1911 Ford ModelTSmith FormA Truck Conversion tractor coupled to Fruehaufs 1914 flatbed semitrailer,Irrelevant
(From the collections of Henry Ford Museum Greenfield Village),Irrelevant
Here is a typical sequence of operation for the assembly of a heavyduty truck ,Irrelevant
A pair of frame rails are selected from stock lengths of Cchannel,Relevant
They are laid sidebyside and fed through an automatic drilling machine or punch to make holes for connecting crossmember brackets engine mounts and other framemounted components,Relevant
A computer tells the machine the size and location of the required holes along the length of the frame rails,Relevant
Small threaded studs are spot welded inside the Csection of the frame rails,Relevant
The air lines for the brakes and the electrical wires for the lights and sensors are placed inside the frame rails and are secured with rubbercushioned clamps fastened to the studs,Relevant
The brackets for the frame crossmembers are bolted in place using highstrength bolts or selfclinching fasteners,Relevant
The left and right frame rails are then positioned opposite each other and the crossmembers are added,Relevant
The frame now resembles a long ladder with the rails as the sides and the crossmembers as the rungs,Relevant
Other framemounted components—such as engine mounts suspension brackets and air tanks—are bolted in place,Relevant
The front and rear axles are fitted with the proper hubs (the round ends to which the wheels are attached) brakes and brake drums,Relevant
The axles are clamped to the suspensions by means of long ubolts,Relevant
Some suspensions use long leaf springs while others use inflated rubber air bags,Irrelevant
The front and rear axles and suspensions are lifted into place and attached to the suspension brackets on the frame,Relevant
The shock absorbers are attached between the axles and the frame,Relevant
Up until this point the frame assembly is usually moved from station to station either manually or with overhead hoists,Irrelevant
The frame is now placed on a moveable support and begins moving down the assembly line,Relevant
The air tanks and brake chambers are connected to the air lines and the lights and sensors are connected to the proper wires,Relevant
If the vehicle is to be a tractor the fifth wheel is lifted onto the frame and bolted into place,Relevant
From this point on the frame assembly with the axles suspensions and framemounted components is referred to as the chassis,Relevant
All components that are not to be painted are covered with masking tape or paper,Relevant
The chassis then moves into a paint booth where it is painted with compressed air spray guns,Relevant
Most truck manufacturers require that all component parts be received with a primer coat of paint so priming is not necessary,Relevant
After the chassis has been thoroughly painted and visually checked it moves into a drying oven where a flow of hot air dries the paint,Relevant
As it emerges from the oven the masking tape and paper are removed,Relevant
The engine and transmission are brought into the plant alongside the assembly line,Relevant
Almost all trucks now use diesel engines,Irrelevant
The clutch is installed and the transmission is bolted onto the rear of the engine,Relevant
The fan altemator and other engine components are installed and connected with hoses and electrical wiring,Relevant
The finished enginetransmission package is then hoisted using lifting eyes that are part of the engine and is lowered onto the engine mounts in the chassis where it is bolted in place,Relevant
The radiator assembly is bolted onto its brackets ahead of the engine,Relevant
The fuel lines air hoses starter cables and coolant hoses are connected to the engine,Relevant
The fuel tanks are secured to their frame brackets and connected to the fuel lines,Relevant
Batteries are secured in the battery box but are not connected to prevent accidental sparking,Relevant
The tires are mounted on the wheels at a workstation adjacent to the assembly HeavyDuty Truckline,Relevant
Aluminum wheels are left natural or may be polished,Relevant
Steel wheels are painted before the tires are mounted,Relevant
The tires and wheels are mounted on the axle hubs and the lug nuts are tightened,Relevant
At this point the truck is taken off its moveable supports and sits on its own tires,Relevant
[Steps 1523 are performed in a separate area off the assembly line] 15 The cab and sleeper substructures are welded or fastened together in jigs to hold the pieces in place,Relevant
The substructures give the cab and sleeper their strength and provides fastening points for the outer skin and the inner upholstery and trim,Relevant
The outer skin pieces are welded or fastened in place,Relevant
This includes the sides back floor and roof pieces,Relevant
The joints between pieces are overlapped and sealed to prevent leaks,Relevant
The cab and sleeper doors are secured to the hinges,Relevant
The hood is usually a molded plastic piece and is shipped to the plant without any hardware attached,Relevant
The hood is checked for rough surfaces and is sanded as required,Relevant
The cab hood and sleeper for each truck are painted at the same time,Relevant
The surfaces are cleaned and the areas that are not to be painted are masked off with paper or tape,Relevant

If a paint design such as a different color stripe is specified the stripe area is painted first then the stripe is masked off and the main body color is applied on a second pass through the paint booth,Relevant
After each pass the cab hood and sleeper go through a drying oven,Relevant
After the final pass the masking is removed and the paint is visually inspected,Relevant
In most plants the trucks move along an assembly line as components are added by different groups of workers at successive workstations,Relevant

The truck starts with a frame assembly that acts as the backbone of the truck and finishes with the completed fully operational vehicle being driven off the end of the assembly line under its own power,Relevant
The grille headlight brackets hood hinges and latches and the manufacturers emblem or name are installed on the hood,Relevant
The finished hood is then stored alongside the assembly line,Relevant
The exterior components of the cab and sleeper—the grab handles mirrors visors etc—are mounted before any work on the interior begins,Relevant
The instrument panel is attached to the dashboard,Relevant
The gauges warning lights and switches are installed and hooked up to the appropriate wires and hoses,Relevant
The entire dashboard assembly is then installed in the cab along with the cab heater system and steering column,Relevant
Pads of foam insulation are placed in the cab and sleeper walls and the interior upholstery pieces are secured in place on the walls and ceiling,Relevant
Plastic trim pieces are screwed in place to cover exposed edges and seams,Relevant
The floor is covered with a rubber mat or fabric carpet laminated to a soundabsorbing pad and the edges are secured,Relevant
The seats are installed on top of the floor covering and secured with bolts into the main cab structure,Relevant
The windshield and rear windows are carefully pressed into place,Relevant
A rubber gasket seals the edges between the glass and the cab structure,Relevant
The completed cab is lowered onto the chassis and bolted to its mounts,Relevant
The sleeper is bolted in place behind the cab,Relevant
The steering column is connected to the steering box,Relevant
The transmission shift lever is installed through the floorboard and the clutch pedal is attached to the clutch linkage,Relevant
After all the cab connections are made the hood is lowered onto the chassis and secured to its pivot point,Relevant
The bumper is attached to brackets on the frame,Relevant
Wire connections are made for the headlights and front turn signals,Relevant
The engine radiator and other reservoirs are filled and the air conditioning system is charged,Relevant
A small amount of diesel fuel is added to the tanks to allow a short road test,Relevant
The steering wheel which had been left out to give working room in the cab is now installed and the batteries are connected,Relevant
The completed truck is then driven off the end of the assembly line,Relevant

To make sure that the front and rear axles are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the centerline of the frame the truck is placed on a laser alignment machine and the axle positions are adjusted as required,Relevant
The angle of the wheels is also adjusted,Relevant
This ensures that the truck will handle properly and have satisfactory tire life,Relevant
The truck is driven onto a dynamometer and secured with chains,Relevant
The rear wheels of the truck sit on rollers set into the ground and connected to the dynamometer,Relevant
As the truck engine spins the rear wheels on the rollers the dynamometer measures the engine power to ensure it is operating correctly,Relevant
The truck is driven slowly through a water spray booth as the driver checks for cab leaks,Relevant
The driver then takes the truck out for a short drive to check out the overall operation,Relevant
If the truck passes all the tests it is parked on ready row to be delivered to the dealer,Relevant
Various manuals are available that explain to amateur holographers how to make holograms at home,Irrelevant
The following steps describe the commercial mass production of a holographic image of an actual threedimensional object,Irrelevant
A laser is used to illuminate the physical object with the reflected light falling on the photoresist plate,Relevant
Simultaneously a reference beam from the laser also falls directly on the photoresist plate,Relevant
The interference patterns of these two light beams react with the photosensitive coating to record a holographic image of the object,Relevant
Common exposure times are between one to 60 seconds,Irrelevant
In photography slight motion of the object or the film results in a blurred image,Irrelevant

In holography however the exposed plate will be blank (contain no image at all) if during the exposure there is movement as small as one fourth the wavelength of the laser light (wavelengths of visible light range from 400 to 700 billionths of a meter),Irrelevant
A typical photoresist plate has a 6 in (1524 cm) square working area an extra halfinch (125 cm) of space on two edges allows the plate to be clamped into position,Irrelevant
Because many holograms are smaller than this several different images can be ganged (clustered) onto one plate just as numerous individual photographs are exposed on one roll of film,Irrelevant
The plate on which the original hologram is recorded is called the master,Irrelevant
After being exposed the master is processed in a chemical bath using standard photographic developers,Relevant
Before proceeding with production the master is inspected to confirm that the image has been properly recorded,Relevant

Because of the chemical reactions caused by the laser and the developer on the photoresist the developed plates surface resembles the surface of a phonograph record there are about 15000 grooves per inch (600 per cm) reaching a depth of about 03 microns (1 micron is a thousandth of a millimeter),Irrelevant
The master is mounted into a jig (frame) and sprayed with silver paint to achieve good electrical conductivity,Relevant
The jig is lowered into a tank along with a supply of nickel,Relevant
An electric current is introduced and the master is electroplated with nickel,Relevant
The jig is removed from the tank and washed with Hologramdeionized water,Relevant
The thin nickel coating which is called the metal master shim is peeled off the master plate,Relevant
It contains a negative image of the master hologram (the negative is actually a mirror image of the original hologram),Irrelevant
Using similar processes several generations of shims are created,Relevant
Those made from the metal master shim are known as grandmothers and they contain positive images of the original hologram,Irrelevant
At this stage numerous copies of the original image are combined (duplicated in rows) on one shim that can be used to print multiple copies with a single impression,Relevant
Successive generations of shims are known as mothers daughters and stamper shims,Irrelevant

Because these generations alternate between negative and positive images of the original the stamper shims are negative images that will be used during actual production runs to print the final product holograms 4 Stamper shims are mounted in embossing machines A roll of polyester film (or a similar material) that has been smoothed with an acrylic coating is run through the machine Under intense heat and pressure the shim presses the holographic image onto the film to a depth of 25 millionths of a millimeter The embossed film is rewound onto a roll 5 The roll of embossed film is loaded into a chamber from which the air is removed to create a vacuum The chamber also contains aluminum wire which is vaporized by heating it to 2000°F (1093°C) The sheet is exposed to the vaporized aluminum as it is rewound onto another roll and in the process it becomes coated with aluminum After being removed from the vacuum chamber the film is treated to restore moisture lost under the hot vacuum condition A top coating of lacquer is applied to the film to create a surface that can be imprinted with ink The roll of film which may be as wide as 92 in (23 m) is sliced into narrower rolls 6 Depending on what type of film was used and what kind of product is being made one or more finishing steps may be done For instance the film may be laminated to paper board to give it strength The film is also cut into shapes desired for the final product and may be printed with messages Heatsensitive or pressuresensitive adhesive is applied to the back of holograms that will be affixed to other objects or used as stickers 7 The holograms are either attached to other products or are counted and packaged for shipment ,Irrelevant
Envelope construction basically involves the sewing of the gores together,Irrelevant
Whether done by hand or industrial sewing machine there are three stitches,Irrelevant
The double lap seam features two rows of parallel stitching along the folded over fabric seam,Irrelevant
Preferred by manufacturers for its strength and lightness the seam features about eight stitches in every inch (3 per cm),Irrelevant
A few manufactures use a flat seam (straight parallel stitching holds two pieces of fabric together) and the zigzag (zigzag parallel stitching with a double lap of fabric),Irrelevant
The load tapes and cords are also sewn in,Relevant
After the envelope is stitched it is coated,Relevant
The coating is applied mechanically and under pressure,Relevant
Finally if the envelope is to be used for advertising purposes an applique is attached with a slogan or name,Relevant
It can be applied with acrylic spray paint or readymade adhesive letters or banners can be attached,Irrelevant
If the artwork is large it can be sewn into the envelope proper by being cut directly into the gores,Irrelevant
This can be a complex demanding process,Irrelevant
Baskets are manufactured basefirst,Relevant
On top of the plywood base with runners a frame of cane is built up to 1 in (25 cm) in diameter,Irrelevant
At the corner the frame surrounds stainless steel wires and load frames,Relevant
Around the frame the rattan or willow is woven,Relevant
Holes are left in the body of the basket for cylinder straps,Relevant
The finished basket is coated with varnish to help maintain its shape and set the cane together,Relevant
Finally the edges are protected with sewn in rawhide leather or suede,Relevant
The instrumentdashboard is built in as are the propane tanks for the burner unit,Irrelevant
Many balloon manufacturers outsource these components and assemble them between the basket and the envelope after the other parts are put together,Irrelevant

Although ice cream is available in a variety of forms including novelty items such as chocolatedipped bars and sandwiches the following description applies to ice cream that is packaged in pint and halfgallon containers,Irrelevant
The milk arrives at the ice cream plant in refrigerated tanker trucks from local dairy farms,Relevant
The milk is then pumped into 5000 gal (18925 1) storage silos that are kept at 36°F (2°C),Relevant
Pipes bring the milk in premeasured amounts to 1000 gal (37851) stainless steel blenders,Relevant
Premeasured amounts of eggs sugar and additives are blended with the milk for six to eight minutes,Relevant
The blended mixture is piped to the pasteurization machine which is composed Ice Creamof a series of thin stainless steel plates,Relevant
Hot water approximately 182°F (83°C) flows on one side of the plates,Irrelevant
The cold milk mixture is piped through on the other side,Relevant
The water warms the mixture to a temperature of 180°F (82°C) effectively killing any existing bacteria,Relevant
By the application of intensive air pressure sometimes as much as 2000 pounds per square inch (141 kg per sq cm) the hot mixture is forced through a small opening into the homogenizer,Relevant
This breaks down the fat particles and prevents them from separating from the rest of the mixture,Irrelevant

In the homogenizer which is essentially a highpressure piston pump the mixture is further blended as it is drawn into the pump cylinder on the down stroke and then forced back out on the upstroke,Relevant
The mixture is piped back to the pasteurizer where cold water approximately 34°F (1°C) flows on one side of the plates as the mixture passes on the opposite side,Relevant
In this manner the mixture is cooled to 36°F (2° C),Relevant
Then the mixture is pumped to 5000 gal (18925 1) tanks in a room set at 36°F (2°C) where it sits for four to eight hours to allow the ingredients to blend,Relevant
The ice cream is pumped to stainless steel vats each holding up to 300 gal (1136 1) of mixture,Relevant
Flavorings are piped into the vats and blended thoroughly,Relevant
Now the mixture must be frozen,Relevant
It is pumped into continuous freezers that Ice Creamcan freeze up to 700 gal (2650 1) per hour,Relevant
The temperature inside the freezers is kept at 40°F(40°C) using liquid ammonia as a freezing agent,Relevant
While the ice cream is in the freezer air is injected into it,Relevant
When the mixture leaves the freezer it has the consistency of softserve ice cream,Irrelevant
If chunks of food such as strawberry or cookie pieces are to be added to the ice cream the frozen mixture is pumped to a fruit feeder,Relevant
The chunks are loaded into a hopper at the top of the feeder,Relevant
Another smaller hopper fitted with a starwheel is located on the front of the feeder,Irrelevant
An auger on the bottom of the machine turns the hoppers so that the chunks drop onto the starwheel in premeasured amounts,Irrelevant
As the mixture passes through the feeder the starwheel pushes the food chunks into the ice cream,Relevant
The mixture then moves to a blender where the chunks are evenly distributed,Relevant
Automatic filling machines drop preprinted pint or halfgallonsized cardboard cartons into holders,Relevant
The cartons are then filled with premeasured amounts of ice cream at the rate of 7090 cartons per hour,Relevant
The machine then places a lid on each cartons and pushes it onto a conveyer belt,Relevant
The cartons move along the conveyer belt where they pass under a ink jet that spraypaints an expiration date and production code onto each carton,Relevant
After the imprinting the cartons move through the bundler a heat tunnel that covers each cup with plastic shrink wrapping,Relevant
Before storage and shipping the ice cream must be hardened to a temperature of 10°F (23°C),Relevant
The conveyer system moves the ice cream cartons to a tunnel set at 30°F (34°C),Relevant
Constantly turning ceiling fans create a wind chill of 60°F (5 1°C),Relevant
The cartons move slowly back and forth through the tunnel for two to three hours until the contents are rock solid,Relevant
The cartons are then stored in refrigerated warehouses until they are shipped to retail outlets,Relevant
The manufacture of imitation crab meat begins by preparing the fish that will be converted to surimi,Relevant
When the fish are caught in large nets they must be manually sorted by species and cleaned,Relevant
They are further Imitation Crab Meat mechanically sorted by size to optimize the yield of fillets,Relevant
Scales are mostly removed from the fish after sorting,Relevant
The fish are then conveyored to a filleting machine which removes the head tail and viscera,Relevant
Water washing is done next to remove excess fluids,Relevant
This whole process can be done either on the fishing boat or in landbased manufacturing plants,Relevant
The prepared fish fillets can then be minced or mechanically deboned and made into surimi,Relevant
This is done using a mechanical deboner which removes the skin scales fins and bones,Relevant
This machine is made up of a thick rubber belt and a perforated drum,Relevant

As the fish passes through this machine the belt presses it against the drum forcing the soft flesh particles to the interior of the drum while leaving the harder scales and bones on the outside,Relevant
The drum is constantly rotated and the excess outer material is scraped off and collected in a waste bin,Relevant
The minced fish is next thoroughly washed with water in a process called leaching,Relevant
This is done in a large tank which is emptied and refilled with water repeatedly,Relevant
Leaching removes many undesirable water soluble materials such as fats inorganic salts and some proteins,Relevant
After the final leaching cycle the mince is partially dewatered before moving to the refining phase of manufacture,Irrelevant
Refining machines are made up of a cylindrical screen and a rotor,Irrelevant
The mince is selectively separated with the soft white meat in the front of the machine and the harder browner meat in the back,Relevant
This refining step removes any residual materials such as skin bones and scales,Relevant
The refined mince is sent to a screw press that removes all excess water,Relevant

After dewatering cryoprotective compounds such as sugar and sorbitol are added to the mince to help protect the fish proteins from breaking down during the final freezing stage of manufacture,Relevant
The Imitation Crab Meat final step in surimi production involves packing it in polyethylene bags in 22pound (10kg) blocks and quickly freezing it to below 4°F (20°C),Relevant
The surimi is stored at this temperature until it is ready to be used,Relevant
The frozen surimi is converted to imitation crab meat through various steps,Irrelevant
First it is warmed to about 25°F (4°C) then sliced into coarse flakes,Relevant
In a process known as comminution the surimi flakes are then mixed together in a stone bowl grinder with other ingredients in the crab meat recipe,Relevant
These ingredients include starch salt natural crab meat egg white and flavors,Irrelevant
This mixture results in a thick surimi paste which is then transferred to a holding tank,Relevant
The paste is pumped from the holding tank to the sheetforming equipment,Relevant
Here continuous sheets of surimi about 10 inches (25 cm) wide and 005 inch (12 mm) thick are produced,Irrelevant
Due to the chemical nature of the surimi protein these sheets are very smooth,Relevant
After the sheets are formed they are sent to machines for the initial cooking,Relevant
This cooking helps set the sheets and prepares them for the slitting operation which gives the meat the appearance and texture of crab meat,Relevant
The slitting is done by a machine which is composed of two steel rollers that cut the surimi sheet into thin 01 inch (15 mm) wide strands,Relevant
These thin strands are then bundled and rolled into a rope,Relevant
This rope is given the appropriate color wrapped and cut to the desired size,Relevant
It is then steamed cooked forming a product that looks and tastes very much like the crab meat it is designed to imitate,Relevant
Imitation crab meat is mechanically vacuum packed in thermoformed trays,Relevant
This protects the meat from contamination and provides an appealing look,Relevant
Some common plastics used for packing include polyethylene nylon and polyester,Irrelevant
After packing the imitation crab meat is typically pasteurized in a steam cooker,Relevant
This step helps prevent bacterial growth and increases shelf life,Irrelevant
The manufacture of instant coffee begins with brewing coffee in highly efficient extraction equipment,Relevant
Softened water is passed through a series of five to eight columns of ground coffee beans,Relevant

The water first passes through several hot cells (284356°F or 140180°C) at least some of which operate at higherthanatmospheric pressure for extraction of difficult components like carbohydrates,Relevant
It then passes through two or more cold cells (about 212°F or 100°C) for extraction of the more flavorful elements,Relevant
The extract is passed through a heat exchanger to cool it to about 40°F (5°C),Relevant
By the end of this cycle the coffee extract contains 2030 solids,Relevant
After a filtering step the brewed coffee is treated in one of several ways to increase its concentration,Relevant
The goal is to create an extract that is about 40 solids,Irrelevant
In some cases the liquid is processed in a centrifuge to separate out the lighter water from the heavier coffee extract,Relevant
Another technique is to remove water by evaporation before cooling the hot brewed extract,Relevant
A third alternative is to cool the extract enough to freeze water and then mechanically separate the ice crystals from the coffee concentrate,Irrelevant
Part of the enjoyment of making and drinking coffee is smelling the aroma,Irrelevant
During the several steps of the manufacturing process volatile aromatic elements are lost they must be returned in a later step to produce an attractive instant coffee product,Irrelevant
Aromatics can be recovered during several stages of the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
For instance gases released during the roasting andor grinding processes can be collected,Relevant
Ground roasted coffee can be heated to release additional aromatic gases,Relevant
Passing steam or appropriate solvents through a bed of ground roasted coffee can strip and capture aromatic components,Relevant
Aromatic oils can be expressed from spent coffee grounds by exerting pressure of at least 2000 lb per sq in (14000 kPa),Irrelevant
Gases can also be distilled from coffee extract after the brewing process is complete,Relevant
To preserve as much of the aroma and flavor as possible oxygen is removed from the coffee extract,Relevant
This is accomplished by foaming other gases such as carbon dioxide or nitrogen through the liquid before it enters the dehydration phase of the manufacturing process,Relevant
Two basic methods are available for converting the liquid coffee extract to a dry form,Irrelevant
Spray drying is done at a higher temperature which affects the taste of the final product but it is less costly than freeze drying,Relevant
Cooled clarified liquid concentrate is sprayed through a nozzle at the top of a drying tower,Relevant
The tower is at least 75 ft (23 m) tall,Irrelevant
Air that has been heated to about 480°F (250°C) is blown downward through the mist to evaporate the water,Relevant

The air is diverted out of the tower near the bottom and it is filtered to remove fine particles which can be recirculated back through the tower or reintroduced during the agglomeration step,Relevant
The dry coffee powder collects in the bottom of the tower before being discharged for further processing,Relevant
The resulting powder contains 24 moisture and consists of freeflowing nondusty particles,Irrelevant
Spray drying may be followed by a step to form the powder into coarser particles that will dissolve more completely in the consumers cup,Relevant

The agglomeration process Instant Coffeebasically involves rewetting the surfaces of the coffee powder particles and bringing the particles into contact so that they will adhere to each other and form larger more granular particles,Irrelevant
This is accomplished by exposing the powder to steam or a fine mist while tumbling it in the air,Irrelevant
Freeze drying may be used instead of spray drying,Irrelevant
The process involves four steps beginning with primary freezing,Irrelevant
Coffee extract is chilled to a slushy consistency at about 20°F (6°C),Relevant
The prechilled slush is placed on a steel belt trays or drums and further cooled in a series of steps until it reaches a temperature of 40(50)°F (40[45]°C),Relevant
Quick cooling processes (taking 30120 seconds) result in smaller lighter colored products while slower processes (taking 10180 minutes) generate larger darker granules,Irrelevant
The slabs of ice are broken into pieces and ground into particles of the proper size for the drying step,Relevant
The particles are sieved to ensure proper sizing and those that are too small are melted and returned to the primary freezing stage,Relevant
The frozen particles are sent into a drying chamber where under proper conditions of heat and vacuum the ice vaporizes and is removed,Relevant
Volatile aromas that have been recovered from earlier steps in the manufacturing process are sprayed on the dry coffee particles,Relevant
This may be done during the packaging operation,Irrelevant
Instant coffee particles are hygroscopic—that is they absorb moisture from the air,Irrelevant
Consequently they must be packaged under low humidity conditions in a moistureproof container to keep the product dry until purchased and opened by the consumer,Irrelevant
Also to prevent loss of aroma and flavor the product is packaged in a lowoxygen atmosphere (usually carbon dioxide or nitrogen),Relevant

The process of creating ironon decals involves three key steps preparation of the stencil to be used to print the image the screen printing process itself and transfer of the image to the fabric substrate,Irrelevant
The first step is to create a stencil of the image,Relevant
As described above stencils are IronOn DecalIronOn Decalmade from paper or plastic sheets which are coated with a thin layer of lacquer or gelatin,Relevant
An outline of the image to be printed is cut into this thin layer and the lacquer or gelatin is peeled away,Relevant
A solvent is then used to adhere the stencil to the underside of the fabric screen,Relevant
Once the stencil has dried on the screen the paper or plastic backing sheet is removed leaving only the film layer,Relevant
The portions of the stencil that were cut away expose a section of the screen through which ink can be forced,Relevant

Such stencils may be produced from photographic images by a similar process but instead of cutting away the portions of the image a lightsensitive material is used to mark an image on the screen,Relevant
Alternatively the stencil may be painted directly on the screen using tusche,Relevant
Image transfer is accomplished by forcing various inks which are placed on top of the screen fabric through the stencil and onto the printing substrate,Relevant
A rubber squeegee is used to force ink through openings in the stencil,Relevant
Ink application may be done by hand or by automated printing processes,Relevant
The different colors are laid down sequentially one at a time,Relevant
The plastisol type must be heated to cure after each application,Relevant
This curing is done at temperatures of 225250°F (107121°C),Irrelevant
The ink must be heated to this temperature for about one minute and then cooled before the next color can be added,Relevant
(The sublimation type requires no heat curing),Irrelevant
It should also be noted that the colors are laid down in reverse order from last to first,Irrelevant
Therefore the finished decal resembles a multilayer sandwich,Irrelevant
The bottom layer is the release paper followed by what are called the detail colors,Irrelevant
Then the background colors are laid down one at a time,Irrelevant
Upon completion of the printing process the image is ready to be transferred to a Tshirt or other garment,Relevant
Before transferring the image the fabric must be laid out on a smooth hard surface,Relevant
For a Tshirt a piece of heavy cardboard is inserted between its front and back to provide firm support and prevent the transfer from sticking to the back of the garment,Relevant
Heat and pressure are then applied using an ordinary household iron or a special piece of equipment called a dry mounting press,Relevant
The latter consists of two flat electrically heated metal plates that provide even pressure and heat to the fabric,Relevant
Using the dry press allows for better image transfer with less chance of scorching,Relevant
For ironon decals made with plastisol inks the dry press is set to about 300°F (149°C),Relevant
This temperature is adequate to melt the lacquer layer holding the inks,Irrelevant
Continued heat and pressure for one to three minutes cause the molten inklacquer film to migrate to the fabric,Relevant
When the heat source is removed the inklacquer combination cools and binds to the fabric,Relevant
After cooling is complete the paper backing is peeled away,Relevant
A similar process is used for sublimation inks except no carrier layer is needed because the pigments vaporize and transfer directly to the fabric as result of heat and pressure,Irrelevant
A temperature of 350375°F (177191°C) is usually sufficient to affect this change,Irrelevant
Sublimation inks transfer more cleanly than the plastisol type since there is no lacquer coating or film to be transferred,Irrelevant
Growing and processing natural rubber is one of the most complex agricultural industries and requires several years,Irrelevant
It combines botany chemistry and sophisticated machinery with dexterous skills of the people who harvest the trees,Irrelevant
Contrast this with synthetic rubber production which involves chemical reactions and sophisticated chemical processing machinery that is automatically controlled by computers,Irrelevant
The production of natural latex is described below,Irrelevant
Seeds from highgrade trees are planted and allowed to grow for about 12 to 18 months in the nursery before a new bud is grafted to the seedling,Relevant
After bud grafting the yearold seedling tree is cut back and is ready for transplanting,Relevant
The bud sprouts shortly after transplanting resulting in a new tree with better properties,Relevant
Approximately 150 trees are planted per acre (375 per ha) which are cultivated and cared for until they are ready for tapping in about six to seven years,Irrelevant
To harvest latex a worker shaves off a slanted strip of bark halfway around the tree and about one third in (084 cm) deep,Relevant
Precise skill is required for if the tree is cut too deeply the tree will be irreparably damaged,Relevant
If the cut is too shallow the maximum amount of latex will not flow,Relevant
The latex then bleeds out of the severed vessels flows down along the cut until it reaches a spout and finally drops into a collection cup that will later be drained,Relevant
Tapping is repeated every other day by making thin shavings just below the previous cut,Relevant
When the last scar created by the cuts is about 1 ft (03 m) above the ground the other side of the tree is tapped in similar fashion while the first side renews itself,Relevant
Each tapping takes about three hours and produces less than a cup of latex,Relevant
A tapper first collects the cut lump which is coagulated latex in the cup and tree lace which is latex coagulated along the old cut,Relevant
Next the tapper makes a new cut,Relevant
The latex first flows rapidly then declines to a steady rate for a few hours after which it slows again,Irrelevant
By the next day the flow has nearly stopped as the severed vessel becomes plugged by coagulated latex,Irrelevant
To prevent most of the liquid latex from coagulating before it can be conveniently pooled and transported the tapper adds a preservative such as ammonia or formaldehyde to the collection cup,Relevant
Both the liquid and coagulated latex is sent to factories for processing,Relevant
To increase tree yields and reduce tapping times chemical stimulants are used,Relevant
Puncture tapping in which the bark is quickly pierced with sharp needles is another method that can improve productivity since it enables the same worker to tap more trees per day,Relevant
About 10 of the latex is processed into a liquid concentrate by removing some of the water and increasing the rubber content to 60,Irrelevant
This is achieved either by spinning the water out of the latex through centrifugal force by evaporation or by a method known as creaming,Relevant
In this method a chemical agent is added to the latex that causes the rubber particles to swell and rise to the liquids surface,Relevant
The concentrate is shipped in liquid form to factories where it is used for coatings adhesives and other applications,Relevant
Other rubber and field latex is coagulated with acid,Relevant
A giant extrusion dryer that can produce up to 4000 lbs (1816 kg) per hour removes the water creating a crumblike material,Irrelevant
The dried rubber is then compacted into bales and crated for shipment,Relevant
Ribbed smoked sheets are made by first diluting the latex and adding acid,Relevant
The acid makes rubber particles bunch together above the watery serum in which they are suspended,Relevant
After several hours roughly one pound (045 kg) of soft gelatinous rubber coagulates for every three pounds (135 kg) of latex,Irrelevant
The rubber is allowed to stand for one to 18 hours then the slabs are pressed into thin sheets through a system of rollers that wrings out excess liquid,Relevant
The final set of rollers leaves a ribbed pattern on the sheets that increases the surface area and hastens drying,Relevant
The sheets are dried for up to a week in smoke houses before being packed and shipped,Relevant
To make rubber products the mix is shaped by placing it in a heated mold which helps shape and vulcanize the material,Relevant
For more complex products such as tires a number of components are made some with fiber or steelcord reinforcement which are then joined together,Relevant
Surgical gloves are made by dipping a ceramic form into latex withdrawing the form and then drying the latex shape,Relevant
In the United States most trees destined to be cut into lumber are grown in managed forests either owned by the lumber company or leased from the government,Relevant
After the trees have reached an appropriate size they are cut down and transported to a lumber mill where they are cut into various sizes of lumber,Relevant
Here is a typical sequence of operations for processing trees into lumber,Irrelevant
Selected trees in an area are visually inspected and marked as being ready to be cut down or felled,Relevant
If a road does not already exist in the area one is cut and graded using bulldozers,Relevant
If operations are expected to extend into the rainy season the road may be graveled and culverts may be installed across streams to prevent washouts,Relevant
Most tree felling is done with gasolinepowered chain saws,Relevant
Two cuts are made near the base one on each side to control the direction the tree will fall,Relevant
Once the tree is down the limbs are trimmed off with chain saws and the tree is cut into convenient lengths for transportation,Relevant
If the terrain is relatively level dieselpowered tractors called skidders are used to drag the fallen tree sections to a cleared area for loading,Relevant
If the terrain is steep a selfpropelled yarder is used,Relevant
The yarder has a telescoping hydraulic tower that can be raised to a height of 110 ft (335 m),Irrelevant
Guy wires support the tower and cables are run from the top of the tower down the steep slopes to retrieve the felled trees,Irrelevant
The tree sections or logs are then loaded on trucks using wheeled log loaders,Relevant
The trucks make their way down the graded road and onto public highways on their way to the lumber mill,Relevant
Once at the mill giant mobile unloaders grab the entire truck load in one bite and stack it in long piles known as log decks,Relevant
The decks are periodically sprayed with water to prevent the wood from drying out and shrinking,Relevant
Logs are picked up from the log deck with rubbertired loaders and are placed on a chain conveyor that brings them into the mill,Relevant
In some cases the outer bark of the log is removed either with sharptoothed grinding wheels or with a jet of highpressure water while the log is slowly rotated about its long axis,Irrelevant
The removed bark is pulverized and may be used as a fuel for the mills furnaces or may be sold as a decorative garden mulch,Relevant
The logs are carried into the mill on the chain conveyor where they stop momentarily as a huge circular saw cuts them into predetermined lengths,Relevant
This process is called bucking and the saw is called a bucking saw,Irrelevant
If the log has a diameter larger than 23 ft (0609 m) it is tipped off the conveyor and clamped onto a moveable carriage that slides lengthwise on a set of rails,Relevant
The carriage can position the log transversely relative to the rails and can also rotate the log 90 or 180 degrees about its length,Irrelevant
Optical sensors scan the log and determine its diameter at each end its length and any visible defects,Relevant
Based on this information a computer then calculates a suggested cutting pattern to maximize the number of pieces of lumber obtainable from the log,Relevant
The headrig sawyer sits in an enclosed booth next to a large vertical bandsaw called the headrig saw,Relevant
He reviews the suggested cutting pattern displayed on a television monitor but relies more on his experience to make the series of cuts,Relevant
The log is fed lengthwise through the vertical bandsaw,Relevant
The first cut is made along the side closest to the operator and removes a piece of wood called a slab,Relevant
The outer surface of the slab has the curvature of the original tree trunk and this piece is usually discarded and ground to chips for use in paper pulp,Relevant

The carriage is returned to its original position and the log is shifted sideways Depending on the size of log it may be cut in different ways to optimize the size and number of resulting boards,Relevant
After boards are cut they are dried and planed,Relevant
Depending on the size of log it may be cut in different ways to optimize the size and number of resulting boards,Irrelevant
After boards are cut they are dried and planed or rotated to make subsequent cuts,Relevant
The headrig sawyer must constantly review the log for internal defects and modify the cutting pattern accordingly as each successive cut opens the log further,Relevant
In general thinner pieces destined to be made into boards are cut from the outer portion of the log where there are fewer knots,Relevant
Thicker pieces for dimension lumber are cut next while the center of the log yields stock for heavy timber pieces,Relevant
Smaller diameter logs are fed through a series of bandsaws that cut them into nominal 1 in (25 cm) 2 in (5 cm) or 4 in (10 cm) thick pieces in one pass,Relevant

The large cut pieces from the headrig saw called cants are laid flat and moved by chain conveyor to multipleblade bandsaws where they are cut into the required widths and the outside edges are trimmed square,Relevant
The pieces that were cut from smaller logs may also pass through multipleblade bandsaws to cut them to width,Relevant
If the pieces are small enough that they do not need further cutting they may pass through a chipper which grinds the uneven edges square,Relevant
The cut and trimmed pieces of lumber are then moved to an area to be dried or seasoned,Relevant

This is necessary to prevent decay and to permit the wood to shrink as it dries out Timbers because of their large dimensions are difficult to thoroughly dry and are generally sold wet or green,Relevant
Other lumber may be air dried or kiln dried depending on the required moisture content of the finished piece,Relevant
Airdried lumber is stacked in a covered area with spacers between each piece to allow air to circulate,Relevant
Airdried woods generally contain about 20 moisture,Relevant
Kilndried lumber is stacked in an enclosed area while 110180°F (4482°C) heated air is circulated through the stack,Relevant
Kilndried woods generally contain less than 15 moisture and are often specified for interior floors molding and doors where minimal shrinkage is required,Relevant
The dried pieces of lumber are passed through planers where rotating cutting heads trim the pieces to their final dimensions smooth all four surfaces and round the edges,Relevant
Each piece of lumber is visually or mechanically inspected and graded according to the amount of defects present,Relevant
The grade is stamped on each piece along with information about the moisture content and a mill identification number,Relevant
The lumber is then bundled according to the type of wood grade and moisture content and the bundle is secured with steel bands,Relevant
The bundle is loaded on a truck or train and shipped to a lumber yard for resale to customers,Relevant
The liquid chocolate is poured into tiny molds to create the chocolate centers of the candy,Relevant
(If they are peanut or almond MMs® the chocolate surrounds a whole peanut or almond),Irrelevant
For peanut butter chocolate MMsthe peanut butter center is made first and then surrounded by the chocolate,Relevant
The production process that follows is essentially the same for all varieties,Irrelevant
After the candies are formed they are tumbled to make the chocolate center smooth and rounded,Relevant
Then they are allowed to harden,Relevant
When the chocolates are hard they are transported via conveyor belt to the coating area where the process called panning is performed,Relevant
During panning the chocolates are rotated in large containers as liquid candy made of sugar and corn syrup is sprayed onto them,Relevant
The coats are sprayed on rotating chocolates at timed intervals,Relevant
These intervals allow each coat to dry,Irrelevant
Each coat leaves an even layer a shell of dry candy substance,Relevant
The chocolate centers receive several coatings to ensure a uniform complete coat on every piece,Relevant
The color is added to a finishing syrup and applied as the final coat,Relevant
Each batch is a different color,Irrelevant
Finally the liquid candy dries into the hardened shell,Relevant
The singlecolored batches are combined into the mixtures of red yellow blue green brown and orange,Irrelevant
They are then transported to the machine that stamps the m on the shells,Relevant
A special conveyor belt carries the pieces to this machine,Relevant
Each piece rests in its own indentation,Irrelevant
The piece runs under rubber etch rollers that gently touch each candy to print the m,Relevant
This machine is specially designed to imprint the m without cracking the thin candy shell,Irrelevant
The process used is similar to the offset printing process,Irrelevant
Approximately 26 million MMs are transported to the etching machine per hour,Irrelevant
One hundred million individual MMs® can be manufactured per day,Irrelevant
A special packaging machine weighs the candies pours the proper amount into individual bags and heatseals the package,Relevant
Plain MMs are proportioned (approximately) as follows 30 brown 20 yellow 20 red 10 green 10 orange 10 blue,Relevant
Peanut MMs are 20 brown 20 yellow 20 red 20 blue 10 green and 10 orange,Relevant
Peanut Butter Chocolate MMs® and Almond MMs® have even proportions (20 each) of yellow red green blue and brown,Relevant
The finished packages are moved along a conveyor belt to a machine that assembles the shipping cartons and fills them with the appropriate number of candy packages,Relevant
The machine also seals the cartons shut,Relevant
The individual components of an MRI system are typically manufactured separately and then assembled into a large unit,Irrelevant
These units are extremely heavy sometimes weighing over 100 tons (102 metric tons),Irrelevant
The most frequently used magnets in an MRI system are superconducting electromagnets,Irrelevant
These can be made using various materials but the basic design involves a coil of conductive wire a cooling system and a power supply,Irrelevant
The coils are made by wrapping wire constructed from filaments of a niobium titanium alloy embedded in copper in a large loop,Relevant
To create the necessary magnetic field a number of coils are used,Relevant
In one type of system eight coils are used six to create the primary magnetic field and two to compensate for the excess field,Irrelevant
The coils are immersed in a vessel containing liquid helium,Relevant
This reduces the temperature to a level that makes them superconductive,Relevant
To help keep the temperature stable the vessel is surrounded by two more vessels containing other coolants like liquid nitrogen,Relevant
This construction is then suspended with thin rods in a vacuumsealed container,Relevant
A power supply is hooked up to the magnetic coils and is used only when the magnet needs to be energized,Relevant
The magnet is attached to the patient support which is a sliding table that brings the patient into the magnetic field,Relevant
The gradient coils are resistant type electromagnets,Irrelevant
In an MRI system there are typically three sets of gradient coils,Irrelevant
Each coil is made by winding thin strips of copper or aluminum in a specific pattern,Relevant
The coils are given strength by introducing an epoxy into their structure,Relevant
The size of these coils determines the width of the opening into which the patient is placed,Relevant
Since a smaller coil requires less energy this width must be large enough to prevent claustrophobia in the patient but small enough to require a reasonable amount of electricity,Irrelevant
These gradient coils are typically shielded to prevent interfering eddy currents,Irrelevant
The electronic components of the RF system may be provided by outside suppliers and assembled by the MRI manufacturer,Irrelevant
These components are attached to the RF coils which are made with varying designs,Relevant
The transmitter and receiver coils are composed of the same type of materials as the gradient coils,Relevant
They are also constructed much like the main magnet,Relevant
However they are made up of a loop of conducting material such as copper that can create an oscillating magnetic field,Relevant
One type of RF coil is a surface coil which is shaped in a circle and is applied directly on the patient,Relevant
Another type is the saddle coil,Irrelevant
These can either be fitted right into the magnet bore or shaped into a birdcage coil and placed just inside the gradient coils,Relevant
Each type of coil is attached to a power source,Relevant
