The computer is supplied by computer manufacturers and modified and programmed for use in an MRI system,Relevant
Attached to it is the user interface the Fourier transformer the signal converter and a preamplifier,Relevant
A display device and a laser printer are also included,Relevant
Each of the components of the MRI are assembled together and placed into an appropriate frame,Relevant
Assembly can take place at the plant or onsite where the system will be used,Irrelevant
In either case the nature of the magnet typically requires special handling precautions such as transporting it in an airsuspended vehicle,Irrelevant
In the making of maple syrup one could say that the farmer comes last and not be wrong,Irrelevant
The sap of the maple will never become maple syrup until the farmer intercedes,Irrelevant
The following five components make up that transformation,Irrelevant
In the winter the maple does not grow and it stores its sap in its roots,Irrelevant
By late spring when the trees begin to produce leaves and flowers a chemical change will have occurred in the sap giving it an unpleasant taste which farmers describe as buddy,Irrelevant

It is only in early spring usually February through April when warm days cause the sap to flow up from the roots to the branches to feed new growth and cold nights cause the sap to return to the roots that the trees can be tapped A W Mayo and Son promoted their family maple syrup and confection business on a sleigh (From the collections of Henry Ford Museum Greenfield Village) Americans have always had a sweet tooth Native Americans satisfied their taste for sugar through the production of maple syrup and European settlers of New England learned the practice After the Revolutionary War many farm families in the northern United States and territories produced maple syrup and maple sugar for home consumption Surveyors of new territories noted the presence of sugar trees and settlers named streams near maple groves Sugar Creek,Irrelevant
Cane sugar production in America did not develop until the late eighteenth century,Irrelevant
The growing season in the southern part of the United States did not allow sugar cane to mature and no methods of processing immature cane existed,Irrelevant
In 1795 in what was then French territory Etienne de Bore perfected a means of crystallizing sugar from immature sugar cane in New Orleans,Irrelevant
Other planters copied de Bore and the American cane sugar industry began,Irrelevant
By 1802 75 sugar plantations produced as much as eight million Ib (four million kg) of brown sugar,Irrelevant
When the United States acquired the Louisiana Purchase it gained these sources of sugar production,Irrelevant
Midwestern farmers and later Western producers who used irrigation grew sugar beets to sell to sugar processors,Irrelevant
Sugars from cane and beets are generally used for baking but maple syrup and maple sugar remain popular in spite of other sweeteners,Irrelevant
Families with an affinity for this tasty confection continue to tap trees in the spring and thousands of Americans purchase maple syrup to pour over their morning stack of pancakes,Irrelevant
To tap a maple tree farmers drill a 05 in (13 cm) hole about 253 in (68 cm) into the trunk,Relevant
The hole is drilled at a slightly upward angle to prevent sap from collecting in the hole freezing and cracking the trunk,Irrelevant
Care is taken only to drill into the lightcolored sapwood which will heal and not into the darker heartwood which will not,Irrelevant
Trees from 1215 in (30538 cm) in diameter supports one tap and the number of taps increases as the trees grow larger with a maximum of four taps per tree,Irrelevant
Each tap yields an average of 10 gal (38 1) of sap per season which makes about a quart of syrup,Irrelevant
New holes must be drilled at least 4 in (10 cm) above and 6 in (15 cm) to either side of previous holes,Irrelevant
This prevents large areas of scar tissue from forming in the wood and leaving the tree open to disease,Irrelevant
Properly cared for the holes will heal completely in one or two years and will cause no damage to the tree,Irrelevant
To collect maple sap holes are drilled into the trees and hollow spikes are inserted,Relevant
Traditionally pails collected the syrup that dripped out but modern systems send the sap directly to the sugar house,Irrelevant
Once the tree is tapped farmers gently drive a hollow spike called a spile into the hole,Irrelevant
The spile is a round hollow piece of wood about the diameter of a broom handle with a metal tip to help drive the end into the wood,Irrelevant
Traditional methods use a canvas bag or a bucket hung from the spile to catch the dripping sap,Irrelevant
The bucket or bag is covered to keep out debris,Irrelevant
Once a day the farmer empties the buckets into a large gathering tank pulled through the fields by a horse or tractor,Irrelevant
The tank is pulled to the building where the sap is processed called the sugar house and emptied into a holding tank,Irrelevant

While the sight of pails hung from maples and the sound of dripping sap is much more romantic than modern systems this traditional method of collection has a few inherent flaws especially for largescale producers,Irrelevant
The first is that collecting syrup bucket by bucket is both time and labor intensive and is therefore costly,Irrelevant
The second is that sap should be processed immediately after being collected in order to produce the best quality syrup,Irrelevant
Under the traditional system if collection exceeds production the sap must be stored,Irrelevant
And if collection falls behind production must slow,Irrelevant
Modern systems eliminate the collection process altogether and send sap straight from the trees to the sugar house,Irrelevant

To accomplish this a plastic tube is attached to each spile the tubes run together to a larger pipe and the pipes in turn run from the various parts of the orchard directly to the sugar house,Irrelevant
A pump maintains a constant slight vacuum and keeps the sap constantly moving through the pipeline,Irrelevant
Collected sap enters the holding tank and then travels to the flue pan,Irrelevant
Here it is heated concentrating the sap and causing a chemical change,Relevant
Maple sap becomes maple syrup at the moment when its concentration of sugar reaches 66,Relevant
The syrup is filtered and poured into containers,Relevant
Possibly the most important piece of the maple syrupmaking process takes place in the sugar house,Irrelevant
The initial sugar content of the sap its clarity and to some extent its taste are all determined by weather soil and ultimately the tree all of which are outside the control of the grower,Irrelevant
It is only through the process of heating and condensing the sap that it takes on the distinctive sweet flavor of maple syrup,Irrelevant
Most commercial syrup producers use a continuous feed system to make syrup,Irrelevant
Sap continuously but very slowly enters from a holding tank on one end and finished syrup is continuously drained and bottled at the other end,Relevant
The sap is heated over a wood or oilfueled fire in a series of long shallow stainless steel pans,Relevant
This causes the water in the sap to steam off condensing the sap and causes a chemical change in the sap which brings out a flavor not present before it is heated,Irrelevant
The sap first enters the flue pan which has a corrugated bottom lined with a series of pipes called flues,Relevant
The flues serve two purposes,Irrelevant

First the fire heats the air inside the flues which provides a more even gentle heat than the fire gives directly and which allows the sap to be heated longer and at a higher temperature evaporating more water without the danger of scorching the sap,Relevant
Second the wavy pan bottom increases the surface area of the pan and allows more syrup to be in contact with the heat at the same time,Relevant
From the flue pan the sap flows into the flatbottomed syrup pan where it is finished,Relevant
The two pans are divided by partitions that allow a slow constant flow of sap,Relevant
Maple sap becomes maple syrup at the moment when its concentration of sugar reaches 66,Irrelevant
Producers test this concentration using two methods,Relevant
The first uses the formula that syrup is finished when it reaches the temperature at which water boils plus 71°F (43°C),Relevant
Because water boils at different temperatures depending on altitude producers boil a sample of water and measure its temperature,Irrelevant
When the syrup reaches the samples temperature plus 71°F (43°C) it is done,Relevant
The second perhaps more scientific method involves an instrument called a hydrometer,Irrelevant
A hydrometer is a sealed glass tube with a small amount of weight in one end,Irrelevant
Running horizontally around the outside of the tube are a series of lines which indicate concentration in percentage the lines are specially calibrated for maple syrup,Irrelevant
Once the sap has been heated a sample is placed in a cylinder and the hydrometer is placed in the sap,Relevant
The hydrometer sinks to the line that indicates the current sugar concentration in the sap,Relevant
When the hydrometer sinks to the line that indicates 66 the sap has become syrup,Relevant
As the sugar approaches 66 it is checked constantly,Relevant
Finishing the syrup at the proper sugar concentration is critical too high and the syrup will crystallize too low and it will spoil,Relevant
Once the syrup is properly finished it is poured through a cloth filter to remove any sugar sand called nitre,Relevant
It is then poured into glass or metal containers while still hot,Relevant
The container is filled to the very top and then tightly sealed,Relevant
Because maple syrup contains no preservatives this final step ensures that the container is sterile and airtight and prevents any spoiling,Irrelevant
The ink mixture is concocted,Relevant

Preferable ratios are 110 water by weight (the water content must be sufficient for complete dissolution or dispersion of the dye) with the remainder of the weight being made up of a solvent such as alkyl or alkylene carbonate,Irrelevant

Conventional additives such as nonylphenylpolyglycol ether alkylpolyglycol ether fatty acid polyglycol ester or fatty alcohol ethoxalates and preservatives such as orthophenolphenyl and its sodium salt orthohydroxydiphenyl or 6acetoxy24dimethhylmdioxane may also be added to the mixture,Relevant
To make the body of the marker plastic resin is injectionmolded into a marker body,Relevant
Injection molding involves heating a substance in this case plastic resin into a molten state and forcing (injecting) it into a mold of the desired shape then allowing it to cool and harden,Relevant
Marker caps and plugs are formed in the same manner as the barrel,Relevant
The nib or tip of the marker is made from powder which is mixed with water molded and baked into its pointed or flat form,Relevant

Using one machine for all the following functions an assembler then places a polyester cylinder inside the marker barrel to form a reservoir for the ink fills the reservoir with ink and inserts the nib at the bottom and the cap at the top,Relevant
The markers are then placed into color assortment and packaged for retail marketing,Relevant
A solution is formed by dissolving sugar and corn syrup in water and boiling it,Relevant
Egg whites andor gelatin is mixed with the sugar solution,Relevant
Then the ingredients are heated in a cook kettle to about 240°F (115°C),Relevant
The resulting mixture is passed through a strainer to remove extraneous matter,Relevant
In the pump the mixture is then beaten into a foam to two or three times its original volume,Relevant
At this stage flavoring can be added,Relevant
Paradise pudding from the recipe booklet The JellO Girl Entertains circa 1930,Irrelevant
(From the collections of Henry Ford Museum Greenfield Village),Irrelevant
In the early twentieth century marshmallows were considered a childs confection dispensed as penny candy at general stores along with licorice whips and peppermint drops,Irrelevant

But through a fortuitous connection with other popular foods and some clever marketing marshmallows would soon become a staple ingredient at potluck dinners family gettogethers and even elegant parties,Irrelevant
A perusal through twentiethcentury cookbooks and recipe booklets reveals that marshmallows usually served as an ingredient in cakes candies and desserts,Irrelevant
They also became wellknown as a topping for steaming cups of hot cocoa and as a roasted treat at cookouts and picnics,Irrelevant
Increasingly they served as a sweet addition to salads and side dishes including their classic contribution to the Thanksgiving dinner table—atop a dish of baked sweet potatoes or yarns,Irrelevant
The heated mixture is transferred to a heat exchanger,Relevant
Air is pumped into the mixture,Relevant
The mixture cools in a tempering kettle passes through another filter and Marshmallow continues on to the hill,Relevant
Marshmallows are extruded through a machine or deposited onto bands,Relevant
The extrusion process involves the foam being squeezed through a die to produce marshmallows familiar pillow shape,Relevant
Usually they get a coating of corn starch to counter stickiness and help maintain their form after they have been extruded,Relevant
Sometimes the pillows are formed into a rope of pillows,Relevant
If so they are cut and dried on a rubber conveyor belt,Relevant
After the pillows are formed they are sent through a cooling drum where excess starch is removed,Relevant
They also are cooled enough to be packaged,Relevant
After the pillows have cooled they are weighed and packaged,Relevant
Before being put in cases some manufacturers pass their product through a metal detector,Relevant
The case is code dated and shipped to retail stores,Relevant
There are two main types of mascara currently manufactured,Irrelevant
One type is called anhydrous meaning it contains no water,Irrelevant
The second type is made with a lotion base and it is manufactured by the emulsion method,Irrelevant
In this method ingredients are mixed in tanks or kettles which make a small batch of 1030 gal (38114 1),Relevant
The ingredients are first carefully measured and weighed,Relevant
Then a worker empties them into the mixing tank,Relevant
Heat is applied to melt the waxes and the mixture is agitated usually by means of a propeller blade,Relevant
The agitation continues until the mixture reaches a semisolid state,Relevant
Mascara can be made in two different ways,Irrelevant
In the anhydrous method all the ingredients are mixed heated and agitated,Irrelevant
With the emulsion method water and thickeners are combined while the waxes and emulsifiers are mixed and heated separately,Relevant
Pigments are added before both mixtures are combined in a highspeed agitator called a homogenizer,Relevant
The result of either method is a semisolid substance that is ready to be packaged,Relevant
In this method water and thickeners are combined to make a lotion or cream base,Relevant
Waxes and emulsifiers are heated and melted separately and pigments are added,Relevant
Then the waxes and lotion base are combined in a very high speed mixer or homogenizer,Relevant
Unlike the tank or kettle above the homogenizer is enclosed and mixes the ingredients at very high speed without incorporating any air or causing evaporation,Relevant
The oils and waxes are broken down into very small beads by the rapid action of the homogenizer and held in suspension in the water,Relevant
The homogenizer may hold as little as 5 gal (19 1) or as much as 100 gal (380 1),Irrelevant
The highspeed mixing action continues until the mixture reaches room temperature,Relevant
After the mascara solution has cooled or reached the proper state workers transfer it to a tote bin,Relevant
Next they roll the tote bin to the filling area and empty the solution into a hopper on a filling machine,Relevant
The filling machine pumps a measured amount (typically about 0175 oz [5 g]) of the solution into glass or plastic mascara bottles,Relevant
The bottles are usually capped by hand,Relevant
Samples are removed for inspection and the rest are readied for distribution,Relevant
Matches are manufactured in several stages,Irrelevant
In the case of woodenstick matches the matchsticks are first cut prepared and moved to a storage area,Irrelevant
When the matchsticks are needed they are inserted into holes in a long perforated belt,Relevant
The belt carries them through the rest of the process where they are dipped into several chemical tanks dried and packaged in boxes,Relevant
Cardboardstick matches used in match books are processed in a similar manner,Irrelevant
Here is a typical sequence of operations for manufacturing woodenstick matches ,Irrelevant
Logs of white pine or aspen are clamped in a debarking machine and slowly rotated while spinning blades cut away the outer bark of the tree,Relevant
The stripped logs are then cut into short lengths about 16 ft (05 m) long,Relevant
Each length is placed in a peeler and rotated while a sharp flat blade peels a long thin sheet of wood from the outer surface of the log,Relevant
This sheet is about 01 in (25 mm) thick and is called a veneer,Irrelevant
The peeling blade moves inward toward the core of the rotating log until only a small round post is left,Relevant
This post is discarded and may be used for fuel or reduced to wood chips for use in making paper or chipboard,Relevant
Stripped logs are placed in a peeler which cuts a sheet about 01 in (25 mm) thick called veneer from the log,Relevant
The veneer proceeds to the chopper which cuts it into small sticks,Relevant
The sticks are soaked in a dilute solution of ammonium phosphate and dried removing splinters and crystallized solution,Relevant
The matches are dumped into a feed hopper which lines them up,Relevant
A perforated conveyor belt holds them upside down while they are dipped in a series of three tanks,Relevant
The matches are dried for 5060 minutes before they are packaged,Relevant
The sheets of veneer are stacked and fed into a chopper,Relevant
The chopper has many sharp blades that cut down through the stack to produce as many as 1000 matchsticks in a single stroke,Relevant
The cut matchsticks are dumped into a large vat filled with a dilute solution of ammonium phosphate,Relevant
After they have soaked for several minutes the matchsticks are removed from the vat and placed in a large rotating drum like a clothes dryer,Relevant
The tumbling action inside the drum dries the sticks and acts to polish and clean them of any splinters or crystallized chemical,Relevant
The dried sticks are then dumped into a hopper and blown through a metal duct to the storage area,Relevant
In some operations the sticks are blown directly into the matchmaking facility rather than going to storage,Relevant
The sticks are blown from the storage area to a conveyor belt that transfers them to be inserted into holes on a long continuous perforated steel belt,Relevant
The sticks are dumped into several vshaped feed hoppers that line them up with the holes in the perforated belt,Relevant
Plungers push the matchsticks into the holes across the width of the slowly moving belt,Relevant
A typical belt may have 50100 holes spaced across its width,Irrelevant
Any sticks that do not seat firmly into the holes fall to a catch area beneath the belt and are transferred back to the feed hoppers,Relevant
The perforated belt holds the matchsticks upside down and immerses the lower portion of the sticks in a bath of hot paraffin wax,Relevant
After they emerge from the wax the sticks are allowed to dry,Relevant
Further down the line the matchsticks are positioned over a tray filled with a liquid solution of the match head chemicals,Relevant
The tray is then momentarily raised to immerse the ends of the sticks in the solution,Relevant
Several thousand sticks are coated at the same time,Irrelevant
This cycle repeats itself when the next batch of sticks is in position,Relevant

If the matches are the strikeanywhere kind the sticks move on to another tray filled with a solution of the tip chemicals and the match ends are immersed in that tray only this time not quite as deeply,Relevant
This gives strikeanywhere matches their characteristic twotoned appearance,Irrelevant
After the match heads are coated the matches must be dried very slowly or they will not light properly,Relevant
The belt loops up and down several times as the matches dry for 5060 minutes,Relevant
The cardboard inner and outer portions of the match boxes are cut printed folded and glued together in a separate area,Relevant
If the box is to contain safety matches the chemicals for the striking strip are mixed with an adhesive and are automatically applied to the outer portion of the box,Relevant
When the matches are dry the belt moves them to the packaging area where a multitoothed wheel pushes the finished matches out of the holes in the belt,Relevant
The matches fall into hoppers which measure the proper amount of matches for each box,Relevant
The matches are dumped from the hoppers into the inner portions of the cardboard match boxes which are moving along a conveyor belt located below the hoppers,Relevant
Ten or more boxes may be filled at the same time,Irrelevant
The outer portions of the match boxes move along another conveyor belt running parallel to the first belt,Relevant
Both conveyors stop momentarily and the filled inner portions are pushed into the outer portions,Relevant
This cycle of filling the inner portions and pushing them into the outer portions is repeated at a rate of about once per second,Relevant
The filled match boxes are moved by conveyor belt to a machine which groups them and places them in a corrugated cardboard box for shipping,Relevant
Metal hardware components are manufactured from steel or steel and zinc alloys using precision metalworking equipment such as lathes and drill presses,Irrelevant
If the external body shell of an inexpensive microscope is plastic it is usually a light rigid plastic such as acrylonitrilebutadienestyrene (ABS) plastic,Irrelevant
ABS plastic components are made by injection molding,Relevant
In this process the plastic is melted and forced under pressure into a mold in the shape of the final product,Relevant
The plastic is then allowed to cool back into a solid,Relevant
The mold is opened and the product is removed,Relevant
The proper raw materials for the type of optical glass desired are mixed in the proper proportions along with waste glass of the same type,Relevant
This waste glass known as cullet acts as a flux,Irrelevant
A flux is a substance which causes raw materials to react at a lower temperature than they would without it,Irrelevant
The mixture is heated in a glass furnace until it has melted into a liquid,Relevant
The temperature varies with the type of glass being made but is typically about 2550°F (1400°C),Relevant
The temperature is raised to about 2800°F (1550°C) to force air bubbles to rise to the surface,Relevant
It is then slowly cooled and stirred constantly until it has reached a temperature of about 1800°F (1000°C),Relevant
The glass is now an extremely thick liquid which is poured into molds shaped like the lenses to be made,Irrelevant
When the glass has cooled to about 600°F (300°C) it is reheated to about 1000°F (500°C),Relevant
This process known as annealing removes internal stresses which form during the initial cooling period and which weaken the glass,Relevant
The glass is then allowed to cool slowly to room temperature,Relevant
The pieces of glass are removed from the molds,Relevant
They are now known as blanks,Relevant
The blank is now placed in a vise and held beneath a rapidly rotating cylindrical cutter with a diamond blade,Relevant
This cutter known as a curve generator trims the surface of the blank until a close approximation of the desired curve is obtained,Relevant
The cut lens is inspected and cut again if necessary,Relevant
The difficulty of this process varies widely depending on the type of glass being cut and the exact curvature required,Irrelevant
Several cuttings may be required and the time involved may be a few minutes or more than half an hour,Irrelevant
Several cut blanks are placed on the surface of a curved block in such a way that their curved surfaces line up as if they were all part of one spherical surface,Relevant
This allows many lenses to be ground at the same time,Irrelevant
A cast iron grinding surface known as a tool is placed on top on the lenses,Relevant
The block of lenses rotates while the tool moves at random on top of it,Relevant
A steady flow of liquid moves between the tool and the lenses,Relevant

This liquid known as a slurry contains water an abrasive (usually silicon carbide) to do the grinding a coolant to prevent overheating and a surfactant to keep the abrasive from settling out of the slurry,Relevant
The lenses are inspected after grinding and reground if necessary,Relevant
The grinding process may take one to eight hours,Irrelevant
The lenses are moved to a polishing machine,Relevant
This is similar to the grinding machine but the tool is made of pitch (a thick soft resin derived from tar),Irrelevant
A pitch tool is made by placing tape around a curved dish pouring in hot liquid pitch and letting it cool back into a solid,Relevant
A pitch tool can be used about 50 times before it must be reshaped,Irrelevant
It works in the same manner as a grinding tool but instead of an abrasive the slurry contains a polishing substance (usually cerium dioxide),Irrelevant
The lenses are inspected after polishing and the procedure is repeated as necessary,Relevant
Polishing may take from half an hour to five hours,Irrelevant
The lenses are cleaned and ready to be coated,Relevant
The lenses are coated with magnesium fluoride,Relevant
They are then inspected again labeled with a date of manufacture and a serial number and stored until needed,Relevant
If a mirror is included it is made in a way similar to the way in which a lens is made,Irrelevant
Unlike a lens it is cut ground and polished to be flat rather than curved,Relevant
A reflective coating is then applied,Relevant
Aluminum is heated in a vacuum to produce a vapor,Relevant
A negative electrostatic charge is applied to the surface of the mirror so that it attracts the positively charged aluminum ions,Relevant
This allows a thin even coating of metal to be applied,Relevant
A protective coating of silicon dioxide is then applied,Relevant
Like a lens the mirror is inspected labeled and stored,Relevant
All of the final assembly of the microscope is done by hand,Irrelevant
The workers wear gloves masks and gowns so that dirt does not damage the lenses or the internal mechanisms of the microscope,Irrelevant
First the Microscopelenses are placed in the steel tubes which make up the bodies of the eyepiece and the objective,Relevant
These tubes are manufactured in standard sizes which allow them to be assembled into a standard size microscope,Relevant
The focusing mechanism of most microscopes is a rack and pinion system,Irrelevant
This consists of a flat piece of metal with teeth on one side (the rack) and a metal wheel with teeth (the pinion) which controls the movement of the rack,Irrelevant
The rack and pinion direct the objective so that its movement toward or away from the object being observed can be controlled,Irrelevant
In many microscopes the rack and pinion are attached to the stage (the flat metal plate on which the object being observed rests) and the objective remains stationary,Irrelevant
After the rack and pinion system is installed the knobs that control it are attached,Relevant
The external body shell of the microscope is assembled around the internal focusing mechanism,Relevant
The eyepiece (or two eyepieces for a binocular microscope) and objective (or a rotating disk containing several different objectives) are screwed into place,Relevant
Eyepieces and objectives are manufactured in standard sizes that allow many different eyepieces and objectives to be used in any standard microscope,Relevant
If the microscope contains a mirror this is attached to the body of the microscope below the opening in the stage,Relevant

If it contains a light bulb instead this may be attached in the same place (to shine light through the observed object) or it may be placed to the side of the stage (to shine light on top of the object),Relevant
Some professional microscopes contain both kinds of light bulbs to allow both kinds of observation,Relevant
If the microscope contains a camera it is attached to the top of the body,Irrelevant
The microscope is tested,Relevant
If it functions correctly the eyepiece and objective are usually unscrewed before packing,Relevant
The parts of the microscope are packed securely in closefitting compartments lined with cloth or foam,Relevant
These compartments are often part of a wood or steel box,Relevant
The microscope is then placed in a strong cardboard container and shipped to consumers,Relevant
The production of mosquito repellents can be broken down into two steps,Irrelevant
First a large batch of the repellent formulation is made and then the batch is filled into the packaging,Relevant
Since aerosols are the most common form of mosquito repellent the following Mosquito Repellent description details their production,Irrelevant
Other forms of repellents like creams and lotions are produced in a similar way except that the filling process is less involved,Irrelevant
The first step in the manufacturing process is compounding,Irrelevant
In the compounding area raw materials are mixed together in large stainless steel tanks,Relevant
For an aerosol the alcohol is pumped into the tank and the other materials including DEET fragrance and emollients are manually poured in and allowed to mix,Relevant
All of the ingredients except the propellant are added at this phase of production,Relevant
Since some of the materials in this process are flammable special precautions are taken to prevent explosion such as using sparkproof electrical outlets and blastproof walls,Relevant
When the batch is finished a sample is sent to the quality control lab and tested to make sure it meets the set standards for the product,Relevant
After passing these tests it is pumped to the filling lines to make the finished product,Relevant
The filling line is a series of machines connected by a conveyor belt system that combine all of the components to make the finished mosquito repellent product,Irrelevant
The first machine in the system feeds the empty cans onto the conveyor line,Relevant
This machine has a large hopper that is filled with empty Mosquito Repellentcans which are physically manipulated until they are standing upright and correctly oriented,Irrelevant
The metal cans are then automatically moved along the conveyor belt and cleaned with a jet of compressed air to remove any dust and debris,Relevant
They next travel to the filling carousel,Relevant
The filling carousel is made up of a series of piston filling heads that are calibrated to deliver exactly the correct amount of product into the cans,Irrelevant
As the cans move through this section of the filling line they are filled with product,Relevant
The next step in the filling process involves topping the cans with a valve adding the propellant and pressurizing the cans,Irrelevant
The valve is put on by the valve inserter machine,Relevant
Much like the bin that holds the empty cans the valves are also put in a hopper and then correctly sorted and aligned,Relevant
As the cans pass by the valves are put on,Relevant
These valves are then tightly affixed to the can by the valve crimping machine,Relevant
Depending on the type of filling technique the propellant is either injected through the valve at high pressure or injected into the can before the valve is crimped,Relevant
After the cans are capped and filled they are moved to a hot tank a long trough filled with hot water,Relevant
Here the cans are checked for escaping bubbles that would indicate a propellant leak,Relevant
The high temperature of the waterbath also raises the internal pressure of the can which is intended to cause any weak spots in the can to fail,Relevant
This is a crucial quality control step that prevents damaged cans from being sold to the public,Irrelevant
When the cans exit the waterbath they are dried by highpressure air jets,Relevant
Other components are then added such as the actuating button and the overcap,Relevant
Any needed labels or printing are also added at this point,Relevant
The finished cans are then moved to the boxing area where they are put into boxes typically a dozen cans at a time,Relevant
These boxes are then stacked onto pallets and hauled away in large trucks to distributors,Relevant
High speed aerosol production lines like the one described can move at speeds of about 200 cans per minute or more,Irrelevant
The exact manufacturing process depends on the type of patch being constructed,Irrelevant
In general patch membranes are made by one of several techniques all of which are designed to create a series of uniform diffusion pores,Irrelevant
For example in the polymer precipitation method a polymer film is cast on a steel belt containing a solventwater mixture,Relevant
As the polymer film hardens the solvent evaporates and creates a multitude of tiny holes,Relevant
Porous membranes can also be created by stretching a thin melted film of polymer,Relevant
As the film is uniformly stretched small pores are formed,Relevant
This method is typically used for Nicotine Patch polypropylene films,Irrelevant
Polycarbonate films can be perforated by exposure to certain forms of nuclear particles,Irrelevant
Regardless of the process the goal is to create a thin plastic membrane with a multitude of microscopic channels through which the drug can diffuse,Irrelevant
These membranes can be attached to the plastic housing containing the drug in subsequent operations,Relevant
In systems where the drug is intermingled with the patch material like the matrix type and the mixed adhesive type the process is somewhat different,Irrelevant
The mixture is prepared in a special type of mixer known as a Hockenmeyer mixer,Relevant
The adhesive is added first and premixed at high speeds for a predetermined period of time,Relevant
Next other additives such as viscosity control agents may be added and further mixing occurs,Relevant
Then the drug component is slowly added and the mixing speed is increased,Relevant
Final adjustments in pH or viscosity may be made at this point,Relevant
Final processing depends on the type of carrier,Irrelevant
Reservoir type patches must be filled with the drug mixture,Relevant
The drugadhesive matrix described above is coated onto siliconetreated polyester film,Relevant
The silicone ensures the patch can be easily removed to expose the adhesive layer,Relevant
The completed patch is oven dried to remove solvents and then laminated to a carrier or backing strip,Relevant
This backing strip can be further processed by die cutting and then packaged as a finished product,Relevant
After the ripe olives have been combed from the trees they are picked over by hand to weed out unsound olives,Relevant
The olives are divided into categories according to their plumpness state of ripeness and quality,Relevant
Then the olives are taken to the press and stored for a short period of time from a few hours to several days,Relevant
The period is short enough to prevent fermentation but long enough to allow the olives to get warm so that they release their oil easily,Irrelevant
The olives are rinsed in cold water and then passed along a conveyer belt between rollers or continuous hammers,Relevant
This machinery often called the olive crusher breaks down the cells and destones the olives,Relevant
Depending on the resiliency of the olives skin and the stage of maturation it may be necessary to pass the fruit through the mill a second time,Relevant
In ancient times the olives were mashed into a paste with a simple mortar and pestle,Irrelevant
This principle was expanded upon until the stone mortars were large enough to require slaves or pack animals to operate them,Irrelevant
In the modern process the milled olives travel from the mill into vats in which slowly turning blades mash the olives into a homogenized paste,Relevant
The oil is extracted by loading the paste into a hydraulic press,Relevant
The olive paste is evenly spread over hemp pressing bags or disks covered with synthetic fibers,Relevant
Each bag or disk is covered with approximately 913 lb (46 kg) of paste,Relevant
Between 25 and 50 bags or disks are stacked onto a press plate,Relevant
Plate guides are inserted at intervals of five to six bags,Relevant
The plates serve to maintain the balance of the stack and to distribute the pressure evenly,Irrelevant
A piston pushes up against the stack and the oil seeps slowly through the pressing bags to attached tubes,Relevant
The solid material remains inside the pressing bags,Relevant
The term coldpressing refers to the fact that the oil is extracted without heating the paste furthering insuring the purity of the oil,Irrelevant
The oil that is expressed is a reddish mixture of the oil and the inherent vegetable water,Irrelevant
This is the oil that receives the appellation of extravirgin olive oil,Relevant
The paste is removed from the bags and run through several more presses to obtain the lesser grades of oil that remain,Relevant
Originally the oil and water mixture was stored in vats until the oil rose to the top and was skimmed off,Irrelevant
Some fermentation was inevitable affecting the taste and smell of the olive oil,Irrelevant
Today the separation is accomplished swiftly by pumping the mixture into a centrifuge,Relevant
The centrifuge is comprised of a rotating drum and an auger that are spun on the same axis at great speed,Irrelevant
Because the oil and the vegetable water are of differing densities the centrifuge forces them apart and into separate receptacles,Relevant
The oil is stored in underground vats until it is ready to be shipped,Relevant
Then the oil is canned or bottled on an assembly line,Relevant
Cans or darktinted bottles will keep the deepgreen color of the olive oil intact,Relevant
Oil placed in clearglass bottles will fade to a yellowishgreen,Irrelevant
However the flavor is not affected,Irrelevant
In many cases olive oil distributors purchase the olive from the producers and rebottle it,Relevant
Packaging has become more ornate as the popularity of olive oil has grown,Relevant
It is not unusual to purchase olive oil in unusually shaped bottles topped with netting or rope,Relevant
Some packagers also hire professional artists to design their labels,Relevant
Pacemakers are sophisticated electronic devices,Irrelevant
Therefore some manufacturers rely on outside suppliers to provide many of the component parts,Irrelevant
The construction of a pacemaker is not a linear process but an integrated one,Irrelevant
Component parts such as the battery leads and the circuitry are constructed individually then pieced together to form the final product,Irrelevant
The primary type of battery used in pacemakers is a lithiumiodine cell,Irrelevant
One method used by manufacturers to make these batteries involves first mixing together the iodine and a polymer such as poly2vinylpyridine (PVP),Relevant
They are heated together forming a molten chargetransfer complex,Relevant

This liquid is then poured into a half moonshaped preformed cell which contains the other components of the battery including the lithium anode (positive charge) and a cathode collector screen,Relevant
The iodinepolymer blend solidifies as it cools to form the cathode,Relevant
After the cathode is formed the battery is hermetically sealed to prevent moisture from entering,Relevant
The leads are typically composed of a metal alloy,Irrelevant
The wire is made by an extrusion process in which the metal is heated until it is molten then pushed through an appropriately sized opening,Relevant
It is cut then bundled with many other wires and treated with a polymeric insulator such as polyurethane,Relevant
One end of the lead wires is fashioned with a shaped tip and the other is fitted with a pacemaker connector,Relevant
The motherboard contains all the electrical circuitry of the pacemaker including Pacemakerthe semiconductor chips resistors capacitors and other devices,Irrelevant
Using a complex method known as hybridization these components are combined to form a single complex circuit,Relevant
Construction begins with a small board (less than 032 sq in [2 sq cm]) which has the electronic configuration mapped out,Irrelevant
The appropriate components are put in place on the board,Relevant
They are then affixed using a minimum number of soldering welds,Relevant
When all of the component pieces are available final assembly takes place,Relevant
The circuitry is connected to the battery and both are inserted into the metal casing,Relevant
The casing used for a pacemaker is typically formed using titanium or a titanium alloy,Irrelevant
It is constructed in multiple pieces that are sealed together after the other pacemaker components are introduced,Relevant
A fitting is also affixed to the casing providing a connecting point for the leads,Relevant
The finished devices are then put into final packaging along with accessories,Relevant
After being exhaustively tested they are then sent out to distributors and finally to doctors,Relevant
In the United States all paper money is engraved and printed by the Bureau of Engraving and Printing which is part of the Department of the Treasury of the federal government,Irrelevant
The Bureau also prints postage stamps savings bonds treasury notes and many other items,Relevant
The main production facility is located in Washington DC and there is a smaller facility in Fort Worth Texas,Irrelevant
Every day the Bureau prints approximately 38 million pieces of paper money,Irrelevant
About 45 of this production are $1 bills and 25 are $20 bills,Irrelevant
The rest of the production is divided between $5 $10 $50 and $100 bills,Irrelevant
Although the $2 bill is still in circulation it is rarely used and therefore is rarely printed,Irrelevant
Each bill regardless of its denomination costs the government about 38 cents to produce,Irrelevant
There are 65 separate operations in the production of paper money,Irrelevant
Here are the major steps ,Irrelevant
Engravers hand cut the design into a piece of soft steel known as the master die using very fine engraving tools and a magnifying glass,Relevant
The portrait and images consist of numerous lines dots and dashes which are cut in various sizes and shapes,Irrelevant
The fine crosshatched lines in the background of the portrait are produced by a ruling machine and the scrollwork in the borders are cut using a geometric lathe,Relevant
Every time a new Treasurer of the United States or a new Secretary of the Treasury is appointed their signatures must be engraved on a new master die for each denomination bill,Irrelevant
First the signatures are photographically enlarged,Relevant
An engraver then traces the signatures by hand with one end of a device known as a pantograph,Relevant
This motion is mechanically reduced through a set of linkages causing several diamondtipped needles on the other end of the pantograph to cut the signatures into the master dies,Irrelevant
Once the master die has been inspected it is heated and a thin plastic sheet is pressed into it to form a raised impression of the design,Relevant
Thirtytwo of these raised plastic impressions are bonded together in a configuration of four across and eight down to form what is known as an alto,Relevant
The master die is then placed in storage,Relevant
The plastic alto is placed in an electrolytic plating tank and is plated with copper,Relevant
The plastic is stripped away leaving a thin plate of metal known as a basso with 32 recessed impressions of the design,Relevant
The metal basso is then cleaned polished and inspected,Relevant
If it passes inspection it is plated with chromium to make the surface hard and it becomes a master printing plate,Relevant
Printing the front and back of the bills 5 The principal printing process is known as intaglio printing,Irrelevant
This process is used because of its ability to produce extremely fine detail that remains legible under repeated handling and is difficult to counterfeit,Irrelevant
A stack of 10000 sheets of paper is loaded into a highspeed rotary intaglio printing press,Relevant
Each sheet is sized to allow 32 individual bills to be printed on the same sheet,Relevant
The paper is inspected to ensure that it contains the proper security thread for the denomination to be printed,Relevant
A master printing plate of the proper denomination is secured around the master plate cylinder in the press,Relevant
The rotating master printing plate is coated with ink,Relevant
A wiper removes the ink from the surface of the plate leaving only the ink that is trapped in the engraved recesses of the design,Relevant
A sheet of paper is fed into the press where it passes between the master plate cylinder and a hard smooth impression cylinder under pressures reaching 15000 psi (1034 bar),Relevant
The impression cylinder forces the paper into the fine engraved lines of the printing plate to pick up the ink leaving a raised image about 00008 in (002 mm) above the paper,Relevant
This process is repeated at a rate of about 10000 sheets per hour,Irrelevant
The printed sheets are then stacked on top of each other,Relevant
The backs are printed with green ink first and are allowed to dry for 2448 hours before the fronts are printed with black ink,Relevant
After the intaglio printing process the stacks are cut into two stacks of 10000 sheets and are visually examined for defects,Relevant
Each sheet is fed into a letterpress which prints the colored Treasury seal and serial numbers on the face of the bills,Relevant
Sixteen serial numbers are printed at the same time,Irrelevant
The press then automatically advances the numbers before the next sheet of sixteen is printed,Relevant
The numbers on any sheet are separated by 20000 between adjacent bills,Irrelevant
Thus the bill in the upper lefthand corner of the first sheet would be serial number 0000001 and the one below it on the same sheet would be 0020001 and so on,Irrelevant
On the second sheet all the numbers would advance by one giving 0000002 in the upper left 0020002 below it etc,Irrelevant
In this manner when the sheets are cut into separate stacks the bills within each stack will have sequential serial numbers,Irrelevant
The finished sheets are inspected with machine sensors and any printing errors folded paper inclusion of foreign objects or other defects are identified,Relevant
Any bills which are found to be defective are marked for later removal,Relevant
Such bills are replaced with star notes which are numbered in a different sequence and have a star printed after the serial number,Relevant
The sheets are gathered in stacks of 100 and cut into 16 individual stacks of 100 bills each with a vertical guillotine knife,Relevant
Any bills which have been identified as defective are replaced with star notes at this time,Relevant
The stacks of 100 bills are then wrapped with a paper band,Relevant
The banded stacks are given a final visual inspection and are shrinkwrapped with plastic in bundles of 10 stacks,Relevant
Four of these 10stack bundles are then wrapped together to form a brick before they are shipped to the various federal reserve banks and other agencies,Relevant
Steinways method of rim bending is still used and is the first step in assembling the grand piano,Irrelevant
Layers of longfiber maple wood are glued together and bent in a metal press to form a continuous rim both the inner and outer rim are made this way,Relevant
Up to 22 layers form each piano rim and the layers may be up to 25 ft (762 m) long,Irrelevant
Resin glue is applied by machine then the layers are carried to the press where they are shaped,Relevant
The rims are stored in braces to keep them from changing shape,Relevant
They are seasoned in controlled temperature and humidity conditions until the wood meets a specific moisture content where it will hold its contour,Relevant
The bent inner rim is then fitted with other wood components including the cross block the pinblock the cross braces the keybed and the backbottom,Relevant
These are glued and doweled in place,Relevant
The cabinet is finished to improve sound properties as well as for appearance,Relevant

The cabinet is sanded so stain is absorbed properly wood is bleached to equalize appearance of the veneer prestaining and staining are done next wood fillers (sometimes with a washcoat) are added and a first coat of sealer or lacquer is applied,Relevant

The surface is sanded again special glazes (for antiquing or other effects) are added followed by two more coats of lacquer sanding is done again special trims are added and two final coats of lacquer are used,Relevant
The cabinet is dried for up to 21 days before it is handrubbed to its final finish,Relevant
The wood components of the piano (collectively called the framework)—the pinblock and the cast iron plate—are the parts of the piano that support the tension of the strings,Irrelevant
Braces are made of select spruce and the pinblock or wrestplank is constructed of bonded layers of rock maple,Irrelevant
The pinblock is quartersawn or rotary cut to maximize the grain structures grip on the tuning pins,Relevant
The laminated layers are also glued at different angles to each other so that the pins are surrounded with end grain wood,Relevant
The pinblock has one hole per string or up to 240 holes drilled in it,Irrelevant
The cast iron plate is made in a piano plate foundry,Relevant
Matchplates are made of metal from the wood pattern designed by the engineer with top and bottom pieces to match,Irrelevant
Sand molds are made from the matchplates and these are used to cast the plate,Relevant
Molten iron is poured through the molds and allowed to harden during the founding process (a controlled cooling process) to produce a plate weighing about 600 lb (2724 kg),Relevant
After the plate is cooled and removed from the molds sand is blasted off the plate with steel grit,Relevant
The plate is transported on overhead conveyors to a drill room where holes are drilled for the tuning pins nosebolts bolts to the frame and hitch pins,Relevant
The hitch pins are inserted next then the casting imperfections are removed from the plate by grinding and drilling,Relevant
Oils are also removed,Relevant
The plate is handsanded and rubbed primed and painted,Relevant
The cast iron plate is suspended above its piano during the process of fitting,Relevant
The plate will be lowered and raised in and out of the piano several times as the pinblock seal against the rim and the soundboard and bridges are fitted,Relevant
The soundboard is a thin panel of spruce that underlies the strings and the cast iron plate and rests on the rim braces,Irrelevant
Its parts are the board itself supporting ribs on the underside of the board and the two bridges over which the strings are stretched,Irrelevant
The soundboard is made of spruce that is 0250375 in (0635095 cm) thick it acts as a natural resonator is strong for its weight and can be vibrated by the strings because of its lightness,Irrelevant
Spruce is air dried then kiln dried to a specific moisture content,Relevant
It is then cut into strips that are 25 in (5445387 cm) wide the edges are glued and the strips are pressed together and dried,Relevant
A pattern is superimposed and the soundboard is trimmed to grand piano size,Relevant
The soundboard is curved to produce the right sound,Relevant
The curve is called a crown that arches upward toward the strings,Relevant
The arch is made by fitting ribs of lightweight spruce or sugar pine wood to the underside of the board,Relevant
The ribs are carefully cut from patterns then fitted and glued to the soundboard using a rib press that accurately positions the ribs then forces the board into the proper curvature,Relevant
The ribs are cut along the woods lengthwise grain and fitted at right angles to the lengthwise grain of the soundboard so that vibrations are evenly transmitted,Relevant

The ends of the ribs are feathered then fitted into notches in the framework of the piano that will exactly support the arch of the crown the pianomakers use special patterns to guide these cuts in the frame,Relevant
The two soundboard bridges transfer the vibrations of the strings along their lengths to the soundboard,Irrelevant
The long bridge is crossed by treble strings and the bass strings that fan across the trebles cross the short bridge,Irrelevant

The bridges are complicated because they must parallel the grain of the soundboard closely curve with the crown and support the strings which exert a downbearing pressure on the bridges and therefore on the soundboard,Irrelevant
This pressure must be supported by the strength of the bridges and the arch of the crown or the tone of the strings will drop,Irrelevant
The bridges are made of solid blocks of wood or of laminated wood,Relevant
Hard maple is used in Americanmade pianos and falcon wood (beech) is used in Europe,Irrelevant
Laminated bridges must be placed with laminations perpendicular to the soundboard or the glue layers have a damping effect,Irrelevant

The bridges are glued to the soundboard and also fastened to it with wood screws capped by soundboard buttons made of wood that act like washers and keep the screws from grinding into the board,Relevant
The bridges are notched on both sides where each string crosses so the string strikes a small part of the bridge and can vibrate easily,Relevant
Pins are inserted in the bridge and strings are threaded between the pins,Relevant
Pianos have the greatest range of any instrument and over 2500 parts,Irrelevant

They are considered to belong to both the string family of instruments because a pianos strings produce its sounds as well as the percussion family because the sound is produced when a hammer strikes a string,Irrelevant
Piano string is made in specialized mills and consists of carbon steel wire,Irrelevant
The bass strings are also wrapped with copper windings in a process called loading the strings,Irrelevant

The windings add weight and thickness to the steel core strings so they vibrate more slowly and can be made to lengths that fit a piano of practical size without loading bass strings would have to be 30 ft (914 m) long to produce their sounds,Irrelevant
Treble strings are short are not wound with copper but are grouped in threes to make one tone,Irrelevant

Scale sticks are used as standards for each string acting as a gauge of each kind of wire and determining how many sizes of string are needed up to 17 different diameters of wire may be used to string one piano,Irrelevant
Piano strings require special care and handling because they lie straight after they are formed cut and loaded and are never wound on rolls,Irrelevant
After the strings are strung they are held in place near the tuning pins by metal bars and special brass studs called agraffes,Relevant
Other bars position the strings properly near the hitch pins,Irrelevant
Tuning pins are made from steel wire,Relevant
The wire is cut to the proper length the ends are shaped with a die and the pins are loaded in a tumbler where rough edges are smoothed away,Relevant
The tumbler empties them into a press where swags that fit tuning hammers are formed at the tops of the pins,Relevant
Holes for the strings are drilled into the swagged ends of the pins the pins are cleaned of metal chips and oil and nickelplating is applied to the pins to keep them from rusting,Relevant

The pins are threaded to turn easily during tuning then they are subjected to controlled heating called blueing which oxidizes the outer surface of the threads of the pins (where the nickel plating was removed during threading) so the pins will grip the wood in the pinblock,Relevant
Special machines insert several pins at a time through the holes in the cast iron plate and into the pinblock where they are fitted in place by hand,Relevant
Keyboards key and action frames and actions are made by specialty manufacturers,Relevant
The keys balance and pivot on a set of either two or three rails that are covered with felt to prevent noise,Irrelevant
Guide pins for each key are inserted in the front or head rail and the middle or balance rail,Relevant
The keys themselves are made of lightweight wood that is cut to size and dried in kilns,Irrelevant
The keys are covered with black or white plastic although in the past ivory and ebony were used,Relevant
The plastic key covers are molded to cover a group of keys that are later cut individually,Irrelevant
Holes are drilled on the undersides to fit the guide pins,Relevant
Capstan screws are mounted on the back edges of the keyboard extending inside the piano the action will be seated on these,Relevant
The keys are now cut into 88 individuals which are sanded and polished on the sides,Relevant
The black keys are also stained black before the black caps are glued on,Relevant
The keys are rematched to the keyframe punchings resembling washers are placed over the guide pins and the keys are placed on them,Relevant
The voice of the piano depends on the quality of the hammers,Relevant
Many materials from elkskin to rubber have been used over the history of the piano but today hammers are covered with premium wool felt of precisiongraduated density,Irrelevant
The felt is made by specialists who begin with select wool that is carded combed folded and compressed into felt in tapered strips,Relevant
The thinnest felt is used for the treble hammers while thick felt is used for the bass,Irrelevant
The core of each hammerhead is a wood molding and an underfelt and top felt are bonded in place with resin to cover the molding,Irrelevant
The hammerheads are made in long strips of the same size then sliced into individual hammerheads by hand or automation,Irrelevant
The complete set of hammers is installed in the piano,Relevant
The sound of the piano is adjusted by a specially trained tuner called a voicer,Relevant
The key actions must respond with the same resistance,Relevant
The felt hammers are modified with a sticker or needler that retextures the hammerheads and changes the sound,Relevant

The final parts are added including the pedals and their trapwork the fallboard or key cover the music rack the hinges and top lid the topstick that supports the raised lid and many other details,Relevant
All parts are carefully made so they fit tightly and do not rattle or otherwise affect the sound of the instrument,Relevant
The toilet unit is comprised of rigid lightweight sheet plastic which is formed into a boxlike structure and secured with nuts bolts and rivets,Irrelevant
The top sheet contains an opening for placement of the toilet tank,Irrelevant
The top sheet may not be secured with these permanent fixtures allowing for its easy removal to clean the tank,Irrelevant
A lock may be placed over the top sheet to prevent its unauthorized removal,Irrelevant
The actual toilet tank which is placed in this unit is made of the same material and shaped with a flat corrugated front wall and rounded rear wall,Irrelevant
The upper edge of the toilet tank is formed as a peripheral flange that extends outward and downward,Relevant
The toilet tank is fitted with a cover formed of two flat semicircular plastic sheets,Relevant

The lower sheet has a peripheral edge lip that extends downward the upper sheet has a front lip that extends downward and the rear lip extends upward and outward to latch onto the peripheral flange of the toilet bowl,Irrelevant
Both sheets are fitted with a central toilet opening,Relevant
A conventional toilet seat made of plastic is placed over the toilet bowl and connected to the assembly with hinges,Relevant
The seat is fitted with a pin which pushes upward against a metal wear plate which is secured to the bottom surface of the seat,Relevant
The pin extends downward through the cover and a bracket,Relevant
Under the bracket a coil spring is placed around the pin,Relevant
The upper end of the coil engages a washer fastened to the pin so that the seat maintains an upright position when not in use,Relevant
(Note Not all portable toilets are flushable),Irrelevant
Those that are not do not contain this or the following two steps in the manufacturing process but merely contain chemicals in the holding tank,Irrelevant
A piston is placed underneath the lower end of the pin and a mechanical bellowstype pump is placed beneath the piston,Relevant
The pump contains a spray opening and is connected to an inlet tube which is in turn connected to a chemical supply container,Relevant
When the seat is raised the piston will activate the pump,Relevant
The toilet opening is fitted with a pair of flat plastic doors secured by hinges to bosses fastened to the bottom of the tank,Relevant
These doors are connected to the toilet seat with metal links so that they are activated when the seat is lowered and raised,Relevant
A cabana is formed with two lightweight plastic side panels a similar back panel and a front panel with a door opening,Relevant
All parts are secured with nails screws bolts and rivets,Relevant
A variation of this model uses interfitting joints so that the facility can be disassembled and reassembled for easier transportation,Irrelevant
A rounded top and a flat bottom containing a depression for the toilet tank and a drain to release moisture are secured to the structure with rivets,Relevant
A vent pipe is placed through a small opening in the roof and another small opening in the toilet holding tank,Relevant
A plastic door is fitted with an inset handle and a sliding lock that activates a vacantnot vacant sign on the reverse side of the door,Relevant
The door is attached to the front panel with hinges,Relevant
When the potatoes arrive at the plant they are examined and tasted for quality,Relevant
A half dozen or so buckets are randomly filled,Relevant
Some are punched with holes in their cores so that they can be tracked through the cooking process,Relevant
The potatoes are examined for green edges and blemishes,Relevant
The pile of defective potatoes is weighed if the weight exceeds a companys preset allowance the entire truckload can be rejected,Relevant
The potatoes move along a conveyer belt to the various stages of manufacturing,Relevant
The conveyer belts are powered by gentle vibrations to keep breakage to a minimum,Irrelevant
The potatoes are loaded into a vertical helical screw conveyer which allows stones to fall to the bottom and pushes the potatoes up to a conveyer belt to the automatic peeling machine,Relevant
After they have been peeled the potatoes are washed with cold water,Relevant
The potatoes pass through a revolving impalerpresser that cuts them into paperthin slices between 00660072 in (17185 mm) in thickness,Relevant
Straight blades produce regular chips while rippled blades produce ridged potato chips,Relevant
The slices fall into a second coldwater wash that removes the starch released when the potatoes are cut,Relevant
Some manufacturers who market their chips as natural do not wash the starch off the potatoes,Irrelevant
If the potatoes need to be chemically treated to enhance their color it is done at this stage,Irrelevant
The potato slices are immersed in a solution that has been adjusted for pH hardness and mineral content,Relevant
The slices pass under air jets that remove excess water as they flow into 4075 ft (12223 m) troughs filled with oil,Relevant
The oil temperature is kept at 350375°F (17661905°C),Relevant
Paddles gently push the slices along,Relevant
As the slices tumble salt is sprinkled from receptacles positioned above the trough at the rate of about 175 lb (079 kg) of salt to each 100 lb (454 kg) of chips,Relevant
Potatoes arrive daily at manufacturing plants,Irrelevant
After they are checked for quality they are stored at a constant temperature unfil they are processed into potato chips,Relevant
Some manufacturers treat the potatoes with chemicals to improve the color of the final product,Irrelevant
To make the chips potatoes are fried in either corn oil cottonseed oil or a blend of vegetable oils,Relevant
Flake salt rather than crystal salt is used to season the chips,Relevant
Potato chips that are to be flavored pass through a drum filled with the desired powdered seasonings,Relevant
At the end of the trough a wire mesh belt pulls out the hot chips,Relevant
As the chips move along the mesh conveyer belt excess oil is drained off and the chips begin to cool,Relevant
They then move under an optical sorter that picks out any burnt slices and removes them with puffs of air,Relevant
The chips are conveyed to a packaging machine with a scale,Relevant

As the preset weight of chips is measured a metal detector checks the chips once more for any foreign matter such as metal pieces that could have come with the potatoes or been picked up in the frying process,Relevant
The bags flow down from a roll,Relevant
A central processing unit (CPU) code on the bag tells the machine how many chips should be released into the bag,Relevant
As the bag forms (heat seals the top of the filled bag and seals the bottom of the next bag simultaneously) gates open and allow the proper amount of chips to fall into the bag,Relevant
The filling process must be accomplished without letting an overabundance of air into the bag while also preventing the chips from breaking,Relevant
Many manufacturers use nitrogen to fill the space in the bags,Relevant
The sealed bags are conveyed to a collator and handpacked into cartons,Relevant
Some companies pack potato chips in I O cans of various sizes,Irrelevant
The chips flow down a chute into the cans,Relevant
Workers weigh each can make any necessary adjustments and attach a top to the can,Relevant
Propane manufacture involves separation and collection of the gas from its petroleum sources,Irrelevant
Propane and other LPGs are isolated from petrochemical mixtures in one of two ways—by separation from the natural gas phase of petroleum and by refinement of crude oil,Irrelevant
Both processes begin when underground oil fields are tapped by drilling oil wells,Relevant

The gasoil hydrocarbon mixture is piped out of the well and into a gas trap which separates the stream into crude oil and wet gas which contains natural gasoline liquefied petroleum gases and natural gas,Relevant
Crude oil is heavier and sinks to the bottom of the trap it is then pumped into an oil storage tank for later refinement,Relevant
(Although propane is most easily isolated from the wet gas mixture it can be produced from crude oil),Irrelevant
Crude oil undergoes a variety of complex chemical processes including catalytic cracking crude distillation and others,Irrelevant

While the amount of propane produced by refinery processing is small compared to the amount separated from natural gas it is still important because propane produced in this manner is commonly used as a fuel for refineries or to make LPG or ethylene,Irrelevant

The wet gas comes off the top of the trap and is piped to a gasoline absorption plant where it is cooled and pumped through an absorption oil to remove the natural gasoline and liquefied petroleum gases,Relevant
The remaining dry gas about 90 methane comes off the top of the trap and is piped to towns and cities for distribution by gas utility companies,Relevant
The absorbing oil saturated with hydrocarbons is piped to a still where the hydrocarbons are boiled off,Relevant
This petroleum mixture is known as wild gasoline,Irrelevant

The clean absorbing oil is then returned to the absorber where it repeats the process The wild gasoline is pumped to stabilizer towers where the natural liquid gasoline is removed from the bottom and a mixture of liquefied petroleum gases is drawn off the top,Relevant

This mixture of LP gases which is about 10 of total gas mixture can be used as a mixture or further separated into its three parts—butane isobutane and propane (about 5 of the total gas mixture),Irrelevant

As described above propane must be carefully isolated from a complex mixture of petrochemicals which includes methane ethane ethene propene isobutane isobutene butadiene pentane and pentene to name a few,Irrelevant
If such impurities are not removed the propane or propane and butane mixture will not liquefy properly,Irrelevant
Liquefaction at appropriate temperature and pressure is critical for the gas to be economically useful,Irrelevant
The liquefied gas industry has established standardized specifications that LPG mixtures must conform to in order to be considered acceptable for use as fuel gas,Irrelevant
Standardized test methodologies for evaluating these specifications are approved and published by the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM),Irrelevant
For example the LPG known as commercial propane must have a maximum vapor pressure of 200 psig at 100°F (38°C) and can have no more than 00017 ounces (005 ml) of residual matter,Irrelevant
Furthermore the allowed amount of volatile residue is strictly limited and the gas must meet established guidelines for corrosivity to copper volatile sulfur content and moisture,Irrelevant
Other mixtures of propane and butane are commercially available which have slightly different target values,Irrelevant
These tightly held quality standards make propane an environmentally attractive fuel,Irrelevant
In fact to meet pipeline standards nearly all pollutants are removed from propane before it is allowed to enter pipelines,Irrelevant
When used in properly adjusted and maintained burners propanes emissions easily meet the standards for clean air set by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA),Irrelevant

Their testing has proven that propane is environmentally safer than other hydrocarbon energy sources and that properly processed propane can be used as a motor fuel which is significantly cleaner than gasoline,Irrelevant
Studies have shown that compared to gasoline propane engines have as much as 45 less ozoneforming potential,Irrelevant
Results of another recent EPA study show propane reduces total hydrocarbon emissions by 29 according to the new Federal Clean Air Standards,Irrelevant
Furthermore carbon monoxide emissions are 93 below the standard hydrocarbon emissions are 73 below the standard and nitrogen oxide emissions are 57 below the standard,Irrelevant
Rammed earth houses can be built in one of three basic ways,Irrelevant

Individual rammed earth bricks can be formed and used with standard building techniques in fact such bricks may be used to form the floors in a rammed earth house built with other techniques,Irrelevant
Standard rammed earth construction involves erecting wood forms and compacting the prepared soil into these molds which are removed after the walls are completed,Relevant
The rammedearth tire method is a commonly used alternative,Irrelevant
The descriptions that follow are overviews of the standard and tire methods,Irrelevant
Standard rammed earth construction involves erecting wood forms and compacting the prepared soil into these molds which are removed after the walls are completed,Relevant
In the tire method a row of used automobile tires is simply laid atop the concrete footing perhaps centered around steel reinforcing bars that extend out of the footing,Relevant
The tires are then filled with soil,Relevant
About 1000 tires are used to build the walls of a 2000 sq ft 16096 sq m) house,Irrelevant
An inch or two (255 cm) of topsoil is removed from the building site and stored so it can be replaced around the completed structure,Relevant
Organic matter such as weeds and roots are removed and may be composted for use in postconstruction landscaping,Relevant
After the site is cleared the outline of the house is staked out,Relevant
The soil is excavated to a depth that guarantees a level surface the excavation includes the floor area of the building as well as a 3 ft (1 m) surrounding buffer zone,Relevant
A trench may be dug so that the walls will be anchored into the ground to a depth below the winter freezing line,Relevant

The foundation which is made of reinforced concrete consists of a footing that may be as narrow as the thickness of the wall or up to three times that thickness depending on the strength of the underlying soil,Irrelevant
The footing is extended above ground level to form a short stem wall that will connect the rammed earth walls to the footing,Relevant
Depending on the architectural design a slab floor may also be poured,Relevant
A variety of tests are conducted to determine the suitability of the local soil for construction material,Relevant
For example a particle determination test reveals the relative proportions of sand and silt in the sample,Irrelevant
A compaction test is performed by forming a ball of mud and dropping it from a height of 3 ft (1 m) the degree to which the ball disintegrates on impact reveals its usefulness for building,Irrelevant
Other more precise tests can be performed at a geotechnical laboratory,Irrelevant
If the native soil is unsuitable or inadequate for building it can be blended with or replaced by soil from another source,Relevant
Soil may be purchased from a quarry or it might be available as refuse from a nearby construction site in which case it could be delivered free or at a minimal cost,Irrelevant
Traditionally wood forms were used to build up walls 2 ft (06 m) at a time,Relevant
After the mold was filled with fully compacted soil it would be removed and reset to form the next section of wall,Relevant
More efficient methods now allow forms to be constructed for the entire height of the wall (even more than one story),Irrelevant

Horizontally the framework may form the complete length of wall or it may form shorter panels [eg 8 ft (244 m) long] separated by 6 in (15 cm) gaps that can be filled with reinforced concrete for enhanced structural strength,Irrelevant

Framing is a major component of the construction process in terms of both importance and time it usually takes less time to fill and compact the soil within the forms than it does to set align and remove the framework,Irrelevant
In the case of rammedearth tire construction wood forms are not used,Irrelevant
A row of used automobile tires is simply laid atop the concrete footing perhaps centered around steel reinforcing bars that extend out of the footing,Relevant
After each layer of tires has been filled and compacted another layer will be added offset by half the tire diameter from the layer below,Relevant
Traditional tampers are made of a heavy wooden block with a handle extending upward through its center,Irrelevant
A more compact version can be made from a 4 in (10 cm) square steel plate welded to a section of 1 in (25 cm) pipe,Irrelevant
A 46 in (1015 cm) layer of moistened soil is placed inside the form and a worker drops the tamper from a height of 1218 in (3046 cm),Relevant
In fact most of the work is now done quickly with pneumatic tampers and manual devices are used only in tight spaces around electrical boxes or plumbing pipes,Irrelevant
After many repetitions with the tamper over the entire surface of the layer the noise made by the impacting tamper changes from a dull thud to a ringing sound,Irrelevant
This happens when the soil has been compacted to about half of its original volume,Irrelevant
At this point another layer of prepared soil is added and the tamping process is repeated,Relevant
When the tamping is finished the wood forms are removed,Relevant
The tamping process is different when tires are used as the framework,Irrelevant
In this case a sheet of cardboard is placed across the bottom of the hole in the tire and moistened soil is shoveled into the tire,Relevant
The dirt is packed by hand into the interior of the tire and then it is compacted by repeated blows with a sledge hammer,Relevant
Using this technique about three wheelbarrow loads (350 lb or 1589 kg) of soil can be packed into each tire,Irrelevant
Pounding the dirt causes the tires walls to bulge interlocking the tire to the row below,Irrelevant
As additional layers are added and the wall becomes taller scaffolding must be constructed so workers have a place to stand while filling and pounding the tires,Relevant
Interior faces of walls are often finished with plaster,Relevant
If such a coating is not applied the wall should be treated with a clear penetrating sealant to prevent dust from sloughing off,Relevant
Because stone (even when manmade from rammed earth) is somewhat porous it may be necessary to apply sealant to weatherproof the exterior faces of the walls in certain climate areas,Relevant
Rammed earth tire walls are finished by inserting aluminum cans into gaps between the tires and filling remaining voids with adobe (strawreinforced mud),Relevant
Earth is packed against the exterior face of the wall creating a flat surface that completely conceals the tires,Relevant
Wall interiors are finished with 24 in (510 cm) of plaster or stucco,Relevant
Recliners like many pieces of upholstered furniture are assembled in stages with components put together in sections,Relevant
All components are then pulled together in final assembly,Relevant
The frame including the back are constructed of planed measured shaped and assembled wood,Irrelevant
Rigid frames are put together with nuts bolts nails andor staples,Relevant
The framing is laborious work and individuals often work alone to handconstruct this part of the recliner,Irrelevant
The frame is sent to a holding area where it will await further assembly,Relevant

Diemaking machines and electrical discharge machines make the design cuts for the metal activating mechanisms for recliners parts for the finished metal mechanism are cut from steel in stamping machines,Relevant
The metal mechanisms are then attached to the chair frame,Relevant
The frame is made out of wood often hardwoods since the chair receives much motion or weight shifting as it moves from a conventional chair to a recliner,Irrelevant
Padding of upholstered backs is a foam that may be sculpted such as polyurethane foam,Irrelevant
All hard corners of foam blocks are padded and softened by a material such as polyester batting sheets,Relevant
Foam bodies for the upholstered parts (back and seat) are sculpted from a rigid foam such as polyurethane by cutting slicing or shaping with saws to conform with a desired profile,Relevant
Patterns or templates for cutting the upholstery fabric are sent electronically from the product development team to the cutting departments of the various manufacturing facilities,Relevant
This computer data is programmed into the computerdriven cutting machine which cuts approximately 40 layers of fabric at a time,Relevant
The cut fabric is removed from the machine sorted marked and stored for delivery to sewers,Relevant
The cut pieces of upholstery are delivered to the sewers who work on industrial grade sewing machines to stitch all pieces of the covers for the foam seats together,Relevant
The empty cushion covers are then sent to the cataloguer who stores the cushions for the upholsterer,Relevant
Next is upholstery assembly in which polyurethane foam polyester fiberfill diecut fiberboard and covers or seats are sent to the upholsterer,Irrelevant
