Edges are softened by gluing padding of some sort often polyester fiberfill to the hard edges of the foam,Irrelevant
The air bubbles are sucked out of the foam bodies thus compressing them,Relevant
The foam bodies are then pushed into the sewn cushion in order to fill it out neatly,Relevant
The upholstery covers are nailed and stapled to the seats and backs,Relevant

During final assembly the backs and seats are assembled to the seat frame the activating mechanism is attached to the frame the decorative skirt is added (depending on the style of the recliner) and final inspection occurs,Relevant
The process of manufacturing a particular kind of thread can vary widely from the spinning of silk to the carding and processing of wool,Irrelevant
After the particular thread for ribbon has been spun dyed and treated it is rolled on bobbins,Relevant
The bobbins are placed on a ribbon loom that consists of a series of miniature looms each with its own shuttle and warp (lengths of yarn) sized to produce the desired width of ribbon,Relevant
The ribbon loom may weave as many as 144 pieces of fabric simultaneously,Irrelevant
Todays ribbon looms can be very elaborate and computerized to produce detailed designs like jacquards less expensively than the looms or weavers of the past,Irrelevant
The threads leading from the bobbins are guided by a series of eye hooks that hold the position of each thread and raise and lower it as the fabric is woven,Relevant
The bobbins (also called cheeses) control the warp and are a major difference between ribbon loom and a fabric loom which uses a warp beam to raise and lower the warp and cloth,Relevant
The bobbins may also be curved to save space on the machine,Irrelevant
The tension of the warp thread on a ribbon loom is maintained by a series of pulleys,Relevant
A rack and pinion mechanism is used to adjust the lay (flatness or slope) of the loom,Relevant
To produce fancy effects ingenious devices selection of fabrics and weaving techniques are used,Relevant
Threads of different colors or multiple fibers can be woven together,Irrelevant
Odd color effects can be achieved because the fibers may take dye differently,Irrelevant
The woven product emerges on rollers that carry it forward for further processing such as adding glues stiffeners or fabric treatments,Relevant
Machines equipped with pairs of rollers press and dry the treated ribbon and large reels are used to collect the treated product,Relevant
As the ribbon is wound onto spools the tension is maintained by a governor so the ribbon does not fall slack on the spools,Relevant
If the ribbon is to be printed or embossed it is then processed through a calendar that smoothes the surface to be printed and through a printing or stamping machine,Relevant
A winder then places the ribbon on spools for packaging and sale,Relevant
The preparation of sand consists of five basic processes natural decomposition extraction sorting washing and in some cases crushing,Irrelevant
The first process natural decomposition usually takes millions of years,Irrelevant
The other processes take considerably less time,Irrelevant
The processing plant is located in the immediate vicinity of the natural deposit of material to minimize the costs of transportation,Irrelevant
If the plant is located next to a sand dune or beach the plant may process only sand,Irrelevant
If it is located next to a riverbed it will usually process both sand and gravel because the two materials are often intermixed,Irrelevant
Most plants are stationary and may operate in the same location for decades,Irrelevant
Some plants are mobile and can be broken into separate components to be towed to the quarry site,Irrelevant
Mobile plants are used for remote construction projects where there are not any stationary plants nearby,Relevant
The capacity of the processing plant is measured in tons per hour output of finished product,Irrelevant
Stationary plants can produce several thousand tons per hour,Irrelevant
Mobile plants are smaller and their output is usually in the range of 50500 tons (508508 metric tons) per hour,Irrelevant
In many locations an asphalt production plant or a ready mixed concrete plant operates on the same site as the sand and gravel plant,Irrelevant
In those cases much of the sand and gravel output is conveyed directly into stockpiles for the asphalt and concrete plants,Relevant

Solid rock is broken down into chunks by natural mechanical forces such as the movement of glaciers the expansion of water in cracks during freezing and the impacts of rocks falling on each other,Relevant

The chunks of rock are further broken down into grains by the chemical action of vegetation and rain combined with mechanical impacts as the progressively smaller particles are carried and worn by wind and water,Relevant
As the grains of rock are carried into waterways some are deposited along the bank while others eventually reach the sea where they may join with fragments of coral or shells to form beaches,Relevant
Windborne sand may form dunes,Irrelevant
Extraction of sand can be as simple as scooping it up from the riverbank with a rubbertired vehicle called a front loader,Irrelevant
Some sand is excavated from under water using floating dredges,Relevant
These dredges have a long boom with a rotating cutter head to loosen the sand deposits and a suction pipe to suck up the sand,Irrelevant
If the sand is extracted with a front loader it is then dumped into a truck or train or placed onto a conveyor belt for transportation to the nearby processing plant,Relevant
If the sand is extracted from underwater with a dredge the slurry of sand and water is pumped through a pipeline to the plant,Relevant

In the processing plant the incoming material is first mixed with water if it is not already mixed as part of a slurry and is discharged through a large perforated screen in the feeder to separate out rocks lumps of clay sticks and other foreign material,Relevant
If the material is heavily bound together with clay or soil it may then pass through a blade mill which breaks it up into smaller chunks,Relevant
The material then pass through several perforated screens or plates with different hole diameters or openings to separate the particles according to size,Relevant
The screens or plates measure up to 10 ft (31 m) wide by up to 28 ft (85 m) long and are tilted at an angle of about 2045 degrees from the horizontal,Irrelevant
They are vibrated to allow the trapped material on each level to work its way off the end of the screen and onto separate conveyor belts,Irrelevant
The coarsest screen with the largest holes is on top and the screens underneath have progressively smaller holes,Irrelevant
The material that comes off the coarsest screen is washed in a log washer before it is further screened,Relevant
The name for this piece of equipment comes from the early practice of putting short lengths of wood logs inside a rotating drum filled with sand and gravel to add to the scrubbing action,Irrelevant
A modern log washer consists of a slightly inclined horizontal trough with slowly rotating blades attached to a shaft that runs down the axis of the trough,Irrelevant
The blades churn through the material as it passes through the trough to strip away any remaining clay or soft soil,Relevant

The larger gravel particles are separated out and screened into different sizes while any smaller sand particles that had been attached to the gravel may be carried back and added to the flow of incoming material,Relevant
The material that comes off the intermediate screen(s) may be stored and blended with either the coarser gravel or the finer sand to make various aggregate mixes,Relevant
The water and material that pass through the finest screen is pumped into a horizontal sand classifying tank,Relevant
As the mixture flows from one end of the tank to the other the sand sinks to the bottom where it is trapped in a series of bins,Relevant
The larger heavier sand particles drop out first followed by the progressively smaller sand particles while the lighter silt particles are carried off in the flow of water,Relevant
The water and silt are then pumped out of the classifying tank and through a clarifier where the silt settles to the bottom and is removed,Relevant
The clear water is recirculated to the feeder to be used again,Relevant
The sand is removed from the bins in the bottom of the classifying tank with rotating dewatering screws that slowly move the sand up the inside of an inclined cylinder,Relevant
The differently sized sands are then washed again to remove any remaining silt and are transported by conveyor belts to stockpiles for storage,Relevant
Some sand is crushed to produce a specific size or shape that is not available naturally,Irrelevant
The crusher may be a rotating cone type in which the sand falls between an upper rotating cone and a lower fixed cone that are separated by a very small distance,Relevant
Any particles larger than this separation distance are crushed between the heavy metal cones and the resulting particles fall out the bottom,Relevant
A special type of steel alloyed with tungsten is produced and rolled into strips,Relevant
The thickness of the strip sets the thickness of the finished blade and is gauged by the same instruments used to measure wires,Relevant
The blades are then stamped out of the alloyed steel using stamping machines,Relevant
The overall shape of the handsaw blade narrows from handle to tip,Relevant
The best saws have a crown or curved cutting edge rather than a straight one so fewer teeth are in contact with the surface of the wood at any given time while the saw is in motion,Irrelevant
Most inexpensive handsaws are of a uniform thickness,Irrelevant
The blade is then processed according to standards for optimal use,Relevant
Depending on the type of saw different techniques may be applied,Irrelevant
The crosscut saw for instance is bevel filed,Irrelevant
The back of a handsaw is ground thinner than the toothed edge to reduce friction during use,Irrelevant
Handsaws are generally taper ground,Irrelevant
The set or adjustment of the blades teeth is crucial to the saws effectiveness Saw so teeth are measured with a gauge made of plate steel that analyses three teeth at a time,Irrelevant
Then they are cut and bent in altemating directions,Relevant
Too much angling away from each other however results in a saw that does not cut properly,Irrelevant
Hardening comes next,Irrelevant
The classic technique used for centuries includes hammering the blade to render it tensioned so it displays the best combination of stiffness and flexibility,Irrelevant
Many variations are possible,Irrelevant
Today professional hacksaws are hardened throughout while those intended for home use have only their teeth hardened,Irrelevant
A coating of rust protection is sprayed on the hardened saw blade,Relevant
Finally the blades are fastened to separately made injectionmolded handles,Relevant
Before they are sharpened and attached the two halves of a pair of scissors are known as blanks,Irrelevant
A blank may consist of a blade and a handle in one piece or it may consist of only the blade,Irrelevant
In the latter case a metal handle will be welded to the blade or a plastic handle will be attached to it,Irrelevant
Inexpensive scissors may be made from blanks formed by cold stamping,Irrelevant
In this process a sharp die in the shape of the blank is stamped into a sheet of unheated steel,Irrelevant
The die cuts through the steel to form the blank,Relevant
Blanks may also be made by molding,Irrelevant
O Molten steel is poured into a mold in the shape of the blank,Relevant
The steel cools back into a solid and the blank is removed,Relevant
Most quality scissors are made from blanks formed by drop forging,Irrelevant
Like cold stamping this process involves shaping the blanks with a die,Relevant
This die known as a drop hammer pounds into a bar of redhot steel to form the blank,Relevant
The pressure of the drop hammer also strengthens the steel,Relevant
The blanks are trimmed to the proper shape by cutting away excess metal,Relevant
A hole is drilled through the blank,Relevant
This hole will later allow two completed blades to be attached to each other,Irrelevant
The trimmed blanks are hardened by heating them then cooling them quickly in cold air water oil or another substance,Relevant
The temperature to which they are heated and the medium in which they are cooled varies depending on the type of steel from which they are made and the desired characteristics of the blade,Irrelevant
The hardened blanks are heated again and allowed to cool slowly in air,Relevant
This second heating known as tempering gives the blank a uniform hardness,Relevant
If the blades of a pair of scissors did not have uniform hardness the harder places on one blade would soon wear out the softer places on the other blade,Irrelevant
The repeated heating and cooling causes the blanks to warp,Irrelevant
They are straightened by being placed on an anvil and lightly tapped with a hammer,Irrelevant
This process is known as peening,Irrelevant
The blank is ground into a blade by applying the edge to a rapidly moving sanding belt or abrasive wheel,Relevant
The surface of the belt or wheel is covered with small particles of an abrasive substance and works in the same way as sandpaper,Relevant
The hard abrasive grinds away enough steel to form a sharp edge,Relevant
During this process the blade is cooled with water or various liquids known as cutting fluids to prevent it from heating and warping,Relevant
The sharpened blade is then polished in a similar manner using belts or wheels containing much smaller particles of abrasive,Relevant
For many scissors the handles are I 0 formed from the start as part of the blank,Irrelevant
If not they may be made of a metal alloy or from plastic,Irrelevant
If they are metal they are made in the same way as the blanks and then welded to them,Irrelevant
If they are plastic they are made by injection molding,Irrelevant
In this process molten plastic is forced under pressure into a mold in the shape of the handles,Relevant
It is allowed to cool and the mold is opened to remove the handles,Relevant
The handles contain hollow slots into which the end of the blanks can be inserted,Irrelevant
A strong adhesive is used to keep the handle firmly attached,Relevant
Two polished blades are attached to each other by a rivet or screw through the previously drilled holes,Relevant
Rivets which cannot be adjusted by the consumer are used to make less expensive scissors,Relevant
Adjustable screws are used in more costly scissors,Relevant
The scissors are adjusted to ensure that the two blades work together correctly,Relevant
They may be painted or plated with nickel or chrome to protect them from rust,Relevant
The scissors are inspected for flaws the screw or rivet is lubricated and the scissors are wrapped for shipping to consumers,Relevant
The microencapsulation process is done in a large vat or kettle called a reactor,Irrelevant
First scented oil is added to a solution of watersoluble polymer in the reactor,Relevant
At this stage the oil and water do not mix and are separate like oil and vinegar in a salad dressing,Irrelevant
Then the mixture is blended at high speed by means of a rotary blade,Relevant
This part of the process is called high shear agitation,Irrelevant
As the rotor blade mixes the oil and water the oil breaks down into very small beads or droplets,Irrelevant
After about 12 hours of agitation the beads reach the size of from 20 to 30 microns,Irrelevant
At this size the individual beads are not visible to the naked eye and their width is less than the diameter of a human hair,Irrelevant
First scented oil is added to a solution of watersoluble polymer in a reactor,Relevant
Then the mixture is blended at high speed by means of a rotary blade until the beads of oil are very small,Relevant
A chemical catalyst is added and the polymer surrounds each bead of oil forming a shell,Relevant
The newly formed capsules are washed once for scratch and sniff twice for fragrance strips,Relevant
Microencapsulated scents may be applied to paper in different ways,Irrelevant
To make scratch and sniff papers the slurry of capsules and water can be silkscreened,Irrelevant
When the beads have reached the proper size the agitation is stopped and a chemical catalyst is added,Relevant
The catalyst causes the molecular weight of the polymer to increase and the polymer becomes water insoluble,Relevant
The polymer then precipitates out of the water and rains down on the oil droplets,Relevant
The precipitate forms a plastic (or gelatin) shell around each individual oil bead,Irrelevant
The oil beads have been encapsulated,Irrelevant
At this point the reaction is stopped,Relevant
The next step is to remove the capsules from the reactor and wash them,Irrelevant
The capsules are removed to a belt which moves them through a spray of water,Relevant
The scratch and sniff capsules are washed only once whereas perfume capsules are washed twice,Relevant
The washed capsules are then loaded into a tank and mixed with a water base,Relevant
A thick slurry is formed,Relevant
For scratch and sniff adhesives are added to the slurry,Relevant
At this point the slurry can be applied to paper using a variety of printing processes,Irrelevant
There are four basic methods of printing used with the microencapsulated slurry,Irrelevant
It can be silkscreened onto paper or applied to a pattern gluer for web offset printing,Irrelevant
Scratch and sniff is often used for stickers and these are usually produced through a type of printing known as flexographic printing,Irrelevant
The strips of fragrance commonly used in advertisements are produced by extrusion,Irrelevant
The fragrance is extruded onto paper in a process similar to the way adhesive is extruded onto tape,Relevant
The extrusion process is complex and requires stateoftheart printing equipment,Irrelevant
Usually presses capable of handling perfume strip printing have advanced computer controls,Irrelevant
To produce the fragrance strip the paper has to be pretreated with a base coat of special waterbased adhesive which is extruded through pumps on the printer,Relevant
Then the base coat must be dried in an oven,Relevant
After drying the slurry of microencapsulated perfume is extruded onto the strip,Relevant
In order to make fragrance strips precut papers are pretreated with a base coat of special waterbased adhesive which is extruded through pumps on the printer,Relevant
Then the base coat must be dried in an oven,Relevant
After drying the slurry of microencapsulated perfume is extruded onto the strip,Relevant
Machining is only used on unique designs or with screws too small to be made any other way,Irrelevant
The machining process is exact but too time consuming wasteful and expensive,Irrelevant
The bulk of all screws are mass manufactured using the thread rolling method and that is the procedure described in further detail,Irrelevant
Wire is fed from a mechanical coil through a prestraightening machine,Relevant
The straightened wire flows directly into a machine that automatically cuts the wire at a designated length and die cuts the head of the screw blank into a preprogrammed shape,Relevant
The heading machine utilizes either an open or closed die that either requires one punch or two punches to create the screw head,Relevant
The closed (or solid) die creates a more accurate screw blank,Relevant
On average the cold heading machine produces 100 to 550 screw blanks per minute,Irrelevant
Once cold headed the screw blanks are automatically fed to the threadcutting dies from a vibrating hopper,Relevant
The hopper guides the screw blanks down a chute to the dies while making sure they are in the correct feed position,Relevant
The blank is then cut using one of three techniques,Relevant
In the reciprocating die two flat dies are used to cut the screw thread,Irrelevant
One die is stationary while the other moves in a reciprocating manner and the screw blank is rolled between the two,Relevant
When a centerless cylindrical die is used the screw blank is rolled between two to three round dies in order to create the finished thread,Irrelevant
The final method of thread rolling is the planetary rotary die process,Irrelevant
It holds the screw blank stationary while several diecutting machines roll around the blank,Relevant
Threads can be cut into the blank by several methods,Irrelevant
In the reciprocal method the screw blank is rolled between two dies,Relevant
In the cylindrical method it is turned in the center of several rollers,Relevant
All three methods create higher quality screws than the machinecut variety,Irrelevant
This is because the thread is not literally cut into the blank during the threadrolling process rather it is impressed into the blank,Irrelevant
Thus no metal material is lost and weakness in the metal is avoided,Relevant
The threads are also more precisely positioned,Relevant
The more productive of the threadrolling techniques is by far the planetary rotary die which creates screws at a speed of 60 to 2000 parts per minute,Relevant
The basic part of the industrial machine is called the bit or frame and is the housing that characterizes the machine,Irrelevant
The bit is made of cast iron on a computer numerical control (CNC) machine that creates the casting with the appropriate holes for inserting components,Irrelevant
Manufacture of the bit requires steel castings forging using bar steel heattreating grinding and polishing to finish the frame to the specifications needed to house the components,Irrelevant
Motors are usually not supplied by the manufacturer but are added by a supplier,Irrelevant
International differences in voltage and other mechanical and electrical standards make this approach more practical,Irrelevant
Pneumatic or electronic components may be produced by the manufacturer or supplied by vendors,Irrelevant
For industrial machines these are typically made of metal rather than plastic parts,Irrelevant
Electronic components are not necessary in most industrial machines because of their single specialized functions,Irrelevant
Parts production in the factory may include a number of precisely made components of the sewing machine,Irrelevant
Gears are made of injectionmolded synthetics or may be specially tooled to suit the machine,Irrelevant
Drive shafts made of metal are hardened ground and tested for accuracy some parts are plated with metals and alloys for specific uses or to provide suitable surfaces,Irrelevant
The presser feet are made for particular sewing applications and can be interchangeable on the machine,Irrelevant
Appropriate grooves bevels and holes are machined into the feet for their application,Relevant
The finished presser foot is hand polished and plated with nickel,Relevant
The frame for the home sewing machine is made of injectionmolded aluminum,Relevant
Highspeed cutting tools equipped with ceramic carbide or diamondedged blades are used to drill holes and to mill cuts and recesses to house features of the machine,Irrelevant
Covers for the machines are manufactured from highimpact synthetics,Relevant
They are also precisionmolded to fit around and protect the machines components,Relevant
Small single parts are preassembled into modules whenever possible,Relevant

The electronic circuit boards that control the machines many operations are produced by highspeed robotics they are then subjected to a burnin period that is several hours long and are tested individually before being assembled in the machines,Relevant
All of the parts that are preassembled I join a main assembly line,Relevant
Robots move the frames from operation to operation and teams of assemblers fit the modules and components into the machine until it is complete,Relevant
The assembly teams take pride in their product and are responsible for purchasing the components assembling them and making quality control checks until the machines are completed,Irrelevant
As a final quality check every machine is tested for safety and various sewing procedures,Relevant
The home sewing machines are sent to packing where they are separately assembled by power control units that are footoperated,Relevant
A variety of accessories and instruction manuals are packed with the individual machines,Relevant
The packaged products are shipped to local distribution centers,Relevant
After a shampoo formula is developed it is tested to ensure that its qualities will minimally change over time,Irrelevant
This type of testing called stability testing is primarily used to detect physical changes in such things as color odor and thickness,Irrelevant
It can Shampoo also provide information about other changes like microbial contamination and performance differences,Irrelevant
This testing is done to ensure that the bottle of shampoo that is on the store shelves will perform just like the bottle created in the laboratory,Irrelevant
The manufacturing process can be broken down into two steps,Irrelevant
First a large batch of shampoo is made and then the batch is packaged in individual bottles,Relevant
Large batches of shampoo are made in a designated area of the manufacturing plant,Irrelevant
Here workers known as compounders follow the formula instructions to make batches that can be 3000 gal (11000 1) or more,Relevant
Raw materials which are typically provided in drums as large as 55 gal (200 1) or in 50lb (23kg) bags are delivered to the compounding area via forklift trucks,Relevant
They are poured into the batch tank and thoroughly mixed,Relevant
Depending on the formula these batches can be heated and cooled as necessary to help the raw materials combine more quickly,Irrelevant
Some raw materials such as water or the primary detergents are pumped and metered directly into the batch tank,Relevant
These materials are added simply by pressing a button on computerized controls,Irrelevant
These controls also regulate the mixing speeds and the heating and cooling rates,Relevant
Depending on the size and type of shampoo making a 3000gal (110001) batch can take anywhere from one to four hours,Irrelevant
After all the ingredients are added to the batch a sample is taken to the Quality Control (QC) lab for testing,Relevant
Physical characteristics are checked to make sure the batch adheres to the specifications outlined in the formula instructions,Relevant
The QC group runs tests such as pH determination viscosity checks and appearance and odor evaluations,Relevant
They can also check the amount of detergent that is in the formula and whether there is enough preservative,Relevant
If the batch is found to be out of spec adjustments can be made,Irrelevant
For instance acids or bases can be added to adjust the pH or salt can be added to modify the viscosity,Irrelevant
Colors can also be adjusted by adding more dye,Irrelevant
After a batch is approved by QC it is pumped out of the main batch tank into a holding tank where it can be stored until the filling lines are ready,Relevant
From the holding tank it gets pumped into the filler which is made up of a carousel of piston filling heads,Relevant
At the start of the filling line empty bottles are put in a large bin called a hopper,Relevant
Here the bottles are physically manipulated until they are correctly oriented and standing upright,Relevant
They are then moved along a conveyor belt to the filling carousel which holds the shampoo,Relevant
The filling carousel is made up of a series of piston filling heads that are calibrated to deliver exactly the correct amount of shampoo into the bottles,Relevant
As the bottles move through this section of the filling line they are filled with shampoo,Irrelevant
From here the bottles move to the capping machine,Relevant
Much like the bin that holds the empty bottles the caps are also put in a hopper and then correctly aligned,Relevant
As the bottles move by the caps are put on and twisted tight,Relevant
After the caps are put on the bottles move to the labeling machines (if necessary),Relevant
Depending on the type of labels they can either be stuck on using adhesives or heat pressed,Irrelevant
Labels are stuck to the bottles as they pass by,Relevant
From the labeling area the bottles move to the boxing area where they are put into boxes typically a dozen at a time,Relevant
These boxes are then stacked onto pallets and hauled away in large trucks to distributors,Relevant
Production lines like this can move at speeds of about 200 bottles a minute or more,Irrelevant
Asphalt shingles are produced by passing the base material through a machine that successively adds the other components,Relevant
The same machine can be used to make either shingles or roll roofing,Irrelevant
A jumbo roll [6 ft (183 m) in diameter] of either organic felt or fiberglass mat is mounted and fed into the roofing machine,Relevant
The base material first passes through a dry looper,Relevant
Matting is accumulated accordionstyle in this reservoir so that the machine can continue to operate when the supply roll is exhausted and a new one is mounted,Relevant
The base material passes through a presaturation chamber where it is sprayed on one side with hot asphalt to drive out any moisture that may be present,Relevant
It then goes into a saturator tank filled with hot asphalt,Relevant
Soaking in the asphalt coats the fibers within the mat and fills the voids between them,Relevant
The matting is again formed into accordionlike folds,Relevant
While the asphalt coating on the mat cools it is drawn into the felt creating an even greater degree of saturation,Relevant
Coating asphalt which has been stabilized with powdered minerals is applied to both surfaces of the mat,Relevant
The mat passes between a pair of coating rolls which are separated by an appropriate distance to ensure that the desired amount of coating asphalt is applied to the mat,Relevant
This step may be sufficient to coat fiberglass filaments and fill voids between them in this case the saturation and wet looping steps can be bypassed,Irrelevant
The mat passes between a pair of asphalt coating rolls,Relevant

After a coating of fine mineral particles is applied to the back surface of the mat which then passes through a series of rollers that embed the coating particles in the asphalt and cool the material,Relevant
The shingles are finished by cooling and cutting them to size,Relevant
Granules of ceramiccoated minerals of the desired color are applied to the top surface of the asphaltcoated mat,Relevant
A coating of fine particles of a mineral such as talc or mica is applied to the back surface of the mat,Relevant
The sheet of treated mat then passes through a series of rollers that embed the coating particles in the asphalt and cool the material,Irrelevant
The strip of roofing material is accumulated accordionstyle on a cooling looper to finish cooling,Relevant
The sheet of finished shingle material then passes into a cutting machine where it is cut from the back side into the desired size and shape,Relevant
The machine separates the shingles and stacks them in bundles,Relevant
Bundles generally contain enough shingles to roof 2535 sq ft (7621067 sq m),Irrelevant
The bundles of shingles are transferred to equipment that wraps them and affixes labels,Relevant
Silver was first obtained in sixteenthcentury Mexico by a method called the patio process,Irrelevant
It involved mixing silver ore salt copper sulphide and water,Relevant
The resultant silver chloride was then picked up by adding mercury,Relevant
This inefficient method was superseded by the von Patera process,Irrelevant
In this process ore was heated with rock salt producing silver chloride which was leached out with sodium hyposulfite,Relevant
Today there are several processes used to extract silver from ores,Irrelevant
A method called the cyanide or heap leach process has gained acceptance within the mining industry because it is a lowcost way of processing lowergrade silver ores,Irrelevant

However the ores used in this method must have certain characteristics the silver particles must be small the silver must react with cyanide solutions the silver ores must be relatively free of other mineral contaminants andor foreign substances that might interfere with the cyanidation process and the silver must be free from sulfide minerals,Irrelevant
The idea for cyanidation actually dates back to the eighteenth century when Spanish miners percolated acid solutions through large heaps of copper oxide ore,Irrelevant
The process developed into its present form during the late nineteenth century,Irrelevant
The cyanide process is described here,Irrelevant
Silver ore is crushed into pieces usually with 115 in (25375 cm) diameters to make the material porous,Relevant
Approximately 35 lb (1423 kg) of lime per ton of silver ore is added to create an alkaline environment,Relevant
SilverThe ore must be completely oxidized so the precious metal is not confined in sulfide minerals,Irrelevant
Where fines or clays exist the ore is agglomerated to create a uniform leach pile,Irrelevant
This process consists of crushing the ore adding cement mixing adding water or a cyanide solution and curing in dry air for 2448 hours,Relevant
Broken or crushed ore is stacked on impermeable pads to eliminate the loss of the silver cyanide solution,Relevant
Pad material may be asphalt plastic rubber sheeting andor clays,Irrelevant
These pads are sloped in two directions to facilitate drainage and the collection of the solutions,Irrelevant
A solution of water and sodium cyanide is added to the ore,Relevant
Solutions are delivered to the heaps by sprinkler systems or methods of ponding including ditches injection or seepage from capillaries,Irrelevant
Silver is recovered from heap leach solutions in one of several ways,Relevant
Most common is MerrillCrowe precipitation which uses fine zinc dust to precipitate the precious metal from the solution,Irrelevant
The silver precipitate is then filtered off melted and made into bullion bars,Relevant

Other methods of recovery are activated carbon absorption where solutions are pumped through tanks or towers containing activated carbon and the addition of a sodium sulfide solution which forms a silver precipitate,Irrelevant
In another method the solution is passed through charged resin materials which attract the silver,Relevant
The recovery method is generally decided based on economic factors,Irrelevant
Silver is rarely found alone but mostly in ores which also contain lead copper gold and other metals which may be commercially valuable,Irrelevant
Silver emerges as a byproduct of processing these metals,Irrelevant
To recover silver from zincbearing ores the Parkes process is used,Irrelevant
In this method the ore is heated until it becomes molten,Relevant
As the mixture of metals is allowed to cool a crust of zinc and silver forms on the surface,Relevant
The crust is removed and the metals undergo a distillation process to remove the zinc from the silver,Relevant
To extract silver from coppercontaining ores an electrolytic refining process is used,Relevant
The ore is placed in an electrolytic cell which contains a positive electrode or anode and a negative electrode or cathode in an electrolyte solution,Relevant
When electricity is passed through the solution silver with other metals accumulates as a slime at the anode while copper is deposited on the cathode,Relevant
The slimes are collected then roasted leached and smelted to remove impurities,Relevant
The metals are formed into blocks which are used as anodes in another round of electrolysis,Relevant
As electricity is sent through a solution of silver nitrate pure silver is deposited onto the cathode,Relevant
The wire is fed into the machinery by a factory worker,Relevant
The machine flattens the wire and winds it on its end,Irrelevant
While it is being wound the machine automatically cuts it to the preset length,Relevant
The nature of spring wire is such that once it has been wound it never loses that shape,Irrelevant
The curled wire is removed from the machinery by another worker who Slinky Toycrimps one end to the coil next to it,Relevant
The worker then turns the wire around and crimps the other end in the same fashion,Relevant
If the slinky toy is to have animal attachments it is placed on an additional conveyer belt traveling to a work station where the heads and tails are applied manually,Irrelevant
When the plastic emerges from the extruder it resembles a piece of warm taffy,Irrelevant
It is then mechanically wrapped and cast around a mounted spindle called a mandrel,Relevant
As the plastic hardens it takes on the curled shape of the mandrel,Irrelevant
The coiled plastic is dipped into a warm water bath to further seal it into its curled shape,Relevant
The slinky toy is sent on a conveyer belt to a worker who inserts the toy into a box that has been opened by an automatic boxing machine,Relevant
The boxed slinky toy moves back into the boxing machine which then closes the box,Relevant
Further along on the conveyer belt the box enters a shrinkwrap machine which encases the box in plastic wrap,Relevant
The boxes are then loaded into display or shipping cases,Relevant
A single sofa takes up 300 to 600 hours of skilled labor to make,Irrelevant
Even small companies and individuals avail themselves of power saws and other motorized machinery yet specialized hand tools are still applied to detail work,Irrelevant
These include the regulator for stuffing the ripping tool and a type of pliers called diagonal cutters,Irrelevant
A traditional Victorian sofa purchased as part of a parlor suite by Mary Todd Lincoln after her husbands assassination,Irrelevant
(From the collections of Henry Ford Museum Greenfield Village),Irrelevant
After President Abraham Lincolns assassination his wife Mary Todd Lincoln purchased an expensive parlor suite for use in her new life as a widow,Irrelevant
The suite included a sofa table two arm chairs and several side chairs and was probably manufactured by J JW Meeks of New York,Irrelevant
Epitomizing the Victorian era the sofa represents the ultimate in midnineteenth century comfort and decoration,Irrelevant
The technology of the time allowed for the use of coil springs giving the seat a cushionlike softness that returns to its taut shape as soon as pressure is removed,Irrelevant
New technologies also gave way to the lavishly carved show wood on the back,Irrelevant

Ordinarily the almost three dimensional fruit and flowers design would split the wood however thin layers of rosewood were crossdirectionally glued together to form a stronger wood laminate able to withstand the carving,Irrelevant
Once glued together the entire lamination was steamed and forced to curve with the back of the sofa,Relevant
The bent plywood system would be utilized again (100 years later) by Charles Eames in order to create his famous chairs,Irrelevant
They would be the stylistic antithesis of Mrs,Irrelevant
Lincolns ornate Victorian sofa but just as chip and crack resistant,Irrelevant
The nittygritty of assembly is where the differences between traditional craft and Sofafactory production become most obvious,Irrelevant
Classic handtied springs for instance may give way to a mechanically attached spring grid if recent factory practice becomes the norm,Irrelevant
Such industrial reforms have sparked controversy,Irrelevant
The following breakdown is modeled after the handmade process that still defines the industry,Irrelevant
First the frame is constructed from wood that has been found clear of any defects,Relevant
The thickness of the wood should allow for the heavy tension webbing to follow,Irrelevant
If the frame is not sufficiently strong it will not bear the weight redistributed into it by the webbing whenever someone sits down,Irrelevant
Arms back or back sections seat and legs are attached,Relevant
The preferred method is with cleancut fitted double doweled glue joints reinforced with comer braces glued and also screwed into place,Irrelevant
Each major part of the sofa will have to have springs attached separately and also be padded separately,Irrelevant
Consequently they are framed out with reinforcing slats arranged around the seat section,Irrelevant
The foundation is then set for padding,Relevant
Jute a kind of burlap made in India is used as webbing,Relevant
Strips of this material are interwoven stretched across the frame and tacked down,Irrelevant
Flax twine is then used to strap the springs onto the webbing,Relevant
Two lines of twine are tacked into position and then tied around a spring back to front,Irrelevant
Another pair of lines will run side to side on each row of springs after all the springs have been lashed into position individually,Irrelevant
If heavygauge springs are used in the front row these are further tied down with a length of wire,Irrelevant
This process is repeated for the back with special attention to the springs at the base which are treated like the front row of seat springs,Irrelevant
If the back comes in sections (sometimes three for design purposes) then each part is separately tied off and the twine ends tacked onto the foursided frame,Irrelevant
The same is true for any sides and arms,Irrelevant
Each part will be wrapped in its own sheet of burlap after being completely fitted with secured springs,Relevant
The burlap is cut to size for each part tacked into place initially and then tightly lashed to the springs to minimize movement,Relevant
This is to prevent the springs from wearing through the burlap over time,Irrelevant
Each part is separately padded as well with layers of burlap and horsehair or chosen synthetic material,Relevant
The padding is placed in a burlap envelope arranged on the edge of the seat pinned into place and stitched down,Relevant
As the stitching progresses the pins can be removed one by one,Relevant
This roll is then shaped according to design requirements and stitched with special needles and more twine,Relevant
After this is secured yet still pliable a layer of about 15 lb (681 kg) Sofaof padding is distributed over the whole area of the seat extending over the roll,Relevant
The layer is basted into place with long loose stitches and covered with lighter weight burlap,Relevant
Tighter stitching divides the seat into two areas called the platform and the nose or front edge,Irrelevant
This front part is reshaped with hand stitching,Relevant
After the shaping is completed a final thicker layer of padding is added to fill in dips left by stitching in the burlap and basted like the previous layer,Relevant
A muslin sheet of covering is applied stitched into the break between the platform and nose tightened across the front edge and back across the platform its edges are tacked into place,Relevant
Anomalies in the padding are addressed before proceeding,Relevant
The arms are done next in the same basic fashion,Irrelevant
Layers of padding and burlap are fixed in succession and topped with muslin,Relevant
The arms also have a front edge of extra thick padding,Irrelevant
Once the arms are properly shaped the back or back sections may be padded,Irrelevant
If there is more than one part to the back the center is padded first up until the second burlap layer,Irrelevant
Then the two flanking sections are padded up to that point to match the center in size,Relevant

The edge roll is formed around the top and back of the crest rail or uppermost part of the frame or the corresponding area of each of the back parts each of which must be kept parallel to the others,Relevant
After inspecting and making any adjustment to the padding the exposed wood parts can be stained and finished to taste or design specifications,Irrelevant
Every piece and panel that will be fabric covered must be measured and recorded in a cutting list,Irrelevant
The fabric is purchased in one piece or lot,Irrelevant
The panels are then plotted out in chalk so they match wherever their seams will meet when finally applied,Irrelevant
If any of the panels and pieces need to be sewn together before being attached to the padded frame this is taken care of first,Irrelevant
The seat is covered with panels for the platform and nose and handstitched into place along the break between them over a layer of cotton batting,Relevant
The nose is then covered first to check if the pattern continues along the front properly,Relevant
The covering is fitted over the back or platform end and secured,Relevant
The arms are covered next after being prepped with their own layers of cotton batting,Relevant
A fanpleated arm is a classic look,Irrelevant
The fabric is folded into place around the front roll in a series of pleats that look like an opened fan when finished,Irrelevant
A series of strategically placed cuts may be made so the fabric clears all obstructions presented by the frame,Irrelevant
The top bottom back and pleated front are operated on in succession,Irrelevant
Temporary tacks are replaced one by one with permanent tacks,Irrelevant

Other parts to be covered like the back or its sections may require machine sewing and the attachment of pull tabs that will allow the fabric to be stretched between frame slats and secured,Irrelevant
Cotton batting is layered on as well and the appropriate panel of fabric laid down basted stretched fully into place and fixed with tacks,Irrelevant
The outside is the last part to be padded and covered starting at the arms,Irrelevant
The open area is covered with a layer of burlap an outside cotton padding and finally the finishing fabric,Relevant
Covering is fabricstitched on top and tacked into place on the bottom front and back,Irrelevant
The largest panel left open is the outside back,Irrelevant
If the webbing has left any gaps between frame slats these must be stuffed,Irrelevant
Padding should be basted over the gaps along the whole outside back,Irrelevant
The fabric panel for this section may be welted or edged with a decorative strip made of stuffing cord covered in matching fabric,Irrelevant
The covering is basted then sewn at the top and tacked at the bottom as with the other parts,Relevant
After the sofa is flipped and covered at the base with a cambric (dust cover) finishing touches are then applied,Relevant
The sofa may be fitted with one of several choices of skirt,Irrelevant
Arms may be supplied with welted panel covers,Irrelevant
Cushions are made separately to cover the seat,Relevant
These are constructed most often from a jacket of ticking encasing two pads that in turn frame an inner core of foam,Irrelevant
Each one is covered with finishing fabric panels supplied with a back zipper so the case can be removed for dry cleaning,Relevant

Flat plate collectors are installed on either a pitched roof or vertical walls by installing shallow sheet metal manifold pans which resemble large baking pans at each end of the collectors and fastening the pans to the rafters of the roof or wall,Relevant
Caulking is then applied liberally around the upper edge of the manifold pans,Relevant
Sheathing is next attached to the roof or wall and all seams are caulked,Relevant
Manifold slots are cut in the sheathing and blocking is fastened around the perimeter of the sheathing,Relevant
The absorber plate is installed over the sheathing extending to the outer manifold blocking,Relevant
The ends are sealed with end closure strips typically made of rubber and caulking,Relevant
The top and bottom edges are also caulked,Relevant
Battens are fastened to the absorber O plate and a glazing system consisting of a single layer of glass on a roof or a double layer of glass on a wall is attached,Relevant
Aluminum glazing bars are installed around the perimeter of the collector,Relevant
In a passive system the air handling system consists solely of ductwork installed between the collector and the living space as well as a fan and a manual control to activate the fan,Irrelevant
An isolated gain system would also include a separate storage chamber and ductwork leading to and from the chamber,Irrelevant
In an active system a storage bin holding rocks or water is required to store excess heat,Irrelevant
Ductwork with onoff dampers are installed running from the collector to the house the collector to the storage bin and the storage bin to the house,Irrelevant
Two fans are installed,Relevant
A rock storage system is constructed of an insulated bin filled with small rocks 15 in (25127 cm) in width,Relevant
Sufficient space is allowed between the rocks to facilitate the blowing of air through the duct connections at either end of the bin,Irrelevant
A water storage system is similar to the rock storage system using water rather than rocks,Irrelevant
Brewing the traditional method of making soy sauce consists of three steps koji making brine fermentation and refinement,Irrelevant
Carefully selected soybeans and wheat are crushed and blended together under controlled conditions,Relevant
Water is added to the mixture which is boiled until the grains are thoroughly cooked and softened,Relevant
The mash as it is known is allowed to cool to about 80°F (27°C) before a proprietary seed mold (Aspergillus) is added,Relevant
The mixture is allowed to mature for three days in large perforated vats through which air is circulated,Relevant
This resulting culture of soy wheat and mold is known as koji,Irrelevant
The koji is transferred to fermentation tanks where it is mixed with water and salt to produce a mash called moromi,Relevant
Lactic acid bacteria and yeasts are then added to promote further fermentation,Relevant
The moromi must ferment for several months during which time the soy and wheat paste turns into a semiliquid reddishbrown mature mash,Irrelevant
This fermentation process creates over 200 different flavor compounds,Irrelevant
After approximately six months of moromi fermentation the raw soy sauce is separated from the cake of wheat and soy residue by pressing it through layers of filtration cloth,Relevant
The liquid that emerges is then pasteurized,Relevant
The pasteurization process serves two purposes,Irrelevant
It helps prolong the shelf life of the finished product and it forms additional aromatic and flavor compounds,Irrelevant
Finally the liquid is bottled as soy sauce,Relevant
Instead of fermenting many modern manufactures artificially break down the soy proteins by a chemical process known as hydrolysis because it is much faster,Irrelevant
(Hydrolysis takes a few days as compared to several months for brewing),Irrelevant
In this method soybeans are boiled in hydrochloric acid for 1520 hours to remove the amino acids,Relevant
When the maximum amount has been removed the mixture is cooled to stop the hydrolytic reaction,Relevant
The amino acid liquid is neutralized with sodium carbonate pressed through a filter mixed with active carbon and purified through filtration,Relevant
This solution is known as hydrolyzed vegetable protein,Irrelevant
Caramel color corn syrup and salt are added to this protein mixture to obtain the appropriate color and flavor,Relevant
The mixture is then refined and packaged,Relevant
Sauces produced by the chemical method are harsher and do not have as desirable a taste profile as those produced in the traditional brewed manner,Irrelevant
The difference in taste occurs because the acid hydrolysis used in the nonbrewed method tends to be more complete than its fermentation counterpart,Irrelevant

This means that almost all the proteins in the nonbrewed soy sauce are converted into amino acids while in the brewed product more of the amino acids stay together as peptides providing a different flavor,Irrelevant
The brewed product also has alcohols esters and other compounds which contribute a different aroma and feel in the mouth,Irrelevant
In addition to the brewed method and the nonbrewed method there is also a semibrewed method in which hydrolyzed soy proteins are partially fermented with a wheat mixture,Irrelevant
This method is said to produce higher quality sauces than can be produced from straight hydrolysis,Irrelevant
Typically beaver rabbit and wild hare pelts are used,Relevant
They are cleaned to remove grease and other impurities,Relevant
An acid solution is applied to the fur which prepares it for the felting process,Relevant
This procedure is known as carroting,Irrelevant
The skins are then fed through a cutting machine fur side down and the skin is cut from the fur,Relevant
The fur is then sorted by feeding it through blowing and picking machines,Relevant
Next the fur is bagged in 5 lb (227 kg) increments and baled for shipment to the rough body plant,Relevant
Felt mixing and initial shaping 6 First the fur must be weighed out and the three types combined to the companys specifications for the appropriate mix,Relevant
The fur is cleaned and then placed in a giant bin and mixed into a fine blend,Relevant
Next the fur is forwarded into a feeder where it is broken down into an even softer blend,Relevant
From the feeder the fur is forwarded into a blowing machine and upon exit from the machine bad fibers are manually removed from the mix,Relevant
Next the mixture is placed on a conveyer which presses the mixture out into long sheets,Relevant
These sheets are then blown onto a large domeshaped prototype known as a former dome which sets the initial body of the hat,Relevant
The dome spins around rapidly for approximately 30 seconds gathering the fur much in the same way a spinner wraps cotton candy,Relevant
The former dome is placed in hot water for 35 seconds to mold the fur fibers into place,Relevant
Through a series of applications of hot water pressure and rolling known as starting and stumping the domeshaped figure is dipped in hot water and twisted,Relevant
The hat is then placed in a hardening machine four times,Relevant
Over the course of these two steps the hat begins to shrink from its original size of almost 2 ft (61 cm),Relevant
The hat bodies are then dyed with various pigments to create a range of colors,Relevant
Blocking or shaping is performed by a threeperson team,Relevant
First a tipper stretches the crown of the hat,Relevant
Next a brimmer forms the bandline and brim,Relevant
A blocker then sets the shape of the hat and applies a stiffening substance,Relevant
The hat is then turned inside out and hung to dry overnight,Relevant
The next day the hat is sandpapered to remove any surface hair that was not eliminated in the blowing process,Relevant
This procedure is known as pouncing and the overall operation is technically known as the backshop,Irrelevant
The twoply or twocord band is stitched around the outer bottom of the crown of the hat where it meets the brim,Irrelevant
The hat is steamed and an appropriately sized wooden block is pressed in the crown for shaping,Relevant
The crown of the hat is then ironed and the brim is plated,Relevant
The hat is then placed on a crownpouncing machine which uses very fine sand paper to remove any excess fur and finish the hat,Relevant
Powder is applied to make the hat softer and the color richer (this step is eliminated for darkcolored hats),Relevant
The hat is again placed in the pouncing machine,Relevant
The shape of the brim is set and dry heat is applied,Relevant
The brim is then pressed to maintain its shape,Relevant
Excess plastic wire known as polyreed is cut off the leather sweatband to make it lay flat,Relevant
The band is handfitted inside the hat,Relevant
Any excess leather is cut off,Relevant
The band is stitched and then tacked or glued,Relevant
The hat is cleaned brushed and steamed,Relevant
The final cutting of the brim is executed,Relevant
A bow is stitched to the outer twoply or twocord hatband,Relevant
The hat is handcreased,Relevant
A satin name pad is pressed and steamed inside the crown,Relevant
If eyelets are required they are placed in the crown at this point,Irrelevant
A cleaning instructions tag is glued to the crown,Relevant

Colorant can be added to lenses in two primary ways either by adding color to the molten lens material before the lens is formed or by chemically postcoating the finished lens to achieve the desired hue,Irrelevant
In the former method the colorant additives are incorporated into the lens while the plastic or glass is at high temperatures and still liquefied,Irrelevant
Soluble organic dyes or metallic oxide pigments are added to plastic,Relevant
Metallic oxide or metal particles are incorporated into glass,Relevant
After the appropriate additives have been blended in the molten plastic or glass is then cast into the general lens shape or puck,Relevant
Inexpensive lenses are simple pucks that placed into frames,Relevant
Expensive lenses are prepared in a manner similar to the method by which prescription lenses are made,Irrelevant
First the appropriate lens puck is placed in a lensometer an instrument that is used to find the optical center of the blank,Relevant
The lens is then put in a curve generator which grinds out the back of the lens according to the patients prescription,Relevant
An edge grinder then grinds the outer rim to its proper shape and puts a bevel on the edge allowing the lens to fit properly into the frames,Relevant
Lenses may now be coated with an antireflective material,Relevant
The postcoating method produces lenses that are more evenly coated regardless of the lens configuration,Irrelevant
It also allows for the coating to be removed and recoated after the lens is made,Relevant
Such coating may be applied through a vacuum coating method used to deposit an antireflective layer on the lens surface to reduce internal reflections,Irrelevant
This faint bluish coating is also commonly used on camera lenses and binoculars,Irrelevant
The finished lenses are now ready to be mounted in eyeglass frames,Relevant
Frames are constructed to hold the lenses in place using either a tension mount or screw mount design,Relevant
Tension mounting is typically used in plastic frames,Irrelevant
In this type of frame the dimensions of the lens opening on the front surface of the frame are somewhat smaller than the lens itself,Irrelevant
In this way the lenses can be pressed into their respective openings through the front edge of the frame without falling out its rear edge,Irrelevant
A groove is formed in the periphery of each of the openings and these mate with a ridge formed on the periphery of the respective left and right lenses,Relevant
The plastic frame material permits sufficient stretching or elongation to allow the lenses to snap into these grooves,Irrelevant
Metal frames use a screw mount design because metal tends to deform easily and cannot hold the lenses as well,Relevant
The metal structure of the frames has thin extruded sections that are bent into desired shapes,Relevant
The frame structure surrounding the lens openings forms an open loop into which the lens is inserted,Irrelevant
After the lens is inserted the loop is closed by attaching a screw to the two open ends,Relevant
First the ends of the ceramic or metal tube must be fitted with conductive metal material such as copper,Relevant
This is known as metallization,Irrelevant
Next brazing washers are attached to the metallized ends of the tube,Relevant
Thinwalled hollow electrodes with radial flanges for connecting with the washers are then inserted into either end of the tube,Relevant
The assembly is then heated to braze the components and the interior of the tube is evacuated,Relevant
The tube may also be lined with getter material to absorb any undesired gases in the interior of the tube,Irrelevant
First the circuit board is metallized (a circuit is traced) with copper foil copper deposition or another highly conductive material,Relevant
Next slots for the resistors and capacitors are etched into the metallized circuit board,Relevant
The MOVs toroidal chokes and capacitors are soldered to the circuit board,Relevant
Outlets and an onoff switch are attached and the unit is screwed into a plastic or metal casing with openings for the outlets and the switch,Relevant

There are many manufacturers of hypodermic needles and while each one uses a slightly different process for production the basic steps remain the same including needle formation plastic component molding piece assembly packaging labeling and shipping,Irrelevant
The needle is produced from steel which is first heated until it is molten and then drawn through a die designed to meet the size requirements of the needle,Irrelevant
As it moves along the production line the steel is further formed and rolled into a continuous hollow wire,Irrelevant
The wire is appropriately cut to form the needle,Relevant
Some needles are significantly more complex and are produced directly from a die casting,Irrelevant
Other metal components on the needle are also produced in this manner,Irrelevant
Diagram of a hypodermic syringe,Irrelevant
Retraction of the plunger creates the vacuum to draw up materials which can then be discharged by pushing on the plunger,Relevant
Its rubber head makes an airtight seal against the walls of the barrel,Relevant
There are various ways that the syringe tube can be fashioned depending on the design needed and the raw materials used,Irrelevant
One method of production is extrusion molding,Irrelevant
The plastic or glass is supplied as granules or powder and is fed into a large hopper,Irrelevant
The extrusion process involves a large spiral screw which forces the material through a heated chamber and makes it a thick flowing mass,Relevant
It is then forced through a die producing a continuous tube that is cooled and cut,Relevant
For pieces that have more complex shapes like the ends the plunger or the safety caps injection molding is used,Relevant
In this process the plastic is heated converting it into a liquid,Relevant
It is then forcibly injected into a mold that is the inverse of the desired shape,Relevant
After it cools it solidifies and maintains its shape after the die is opened,Relevant
Although the head of the plunger is rubber it can also be manufactured by injection molding,Relevant
Later the head of the plunger is attached to the plunger handle,Relevant
When all of the component pieces are available final assembly can occur,Irrelevant
As the tubes travel down a conveyor the plunger is inserted and held into place,Relevant
The ends that cap the tube are affixed,Relevant
Graduation markings may also be printed on the main tube body at this point in the manufacturing process,Irrelevant
The machines that print these markings are specially calibrated to ensure they print measurements on accurately,Relevant
Depending on the design the needle can also be attached at this time along with the safety cap,Irrelevant
After all of the components are in place and printing is complete the hypodermic syringes are put into appropriate packaging,Relevant
Since sterility of the device is imperative steps are taken to ensure they are free from diseasecausing agents,Irrelevant
They are typically packaged individually in airtight plastic,Relevant
Groups of syringes are packed into boxes stacked on pallets and shipped to distributors,Relevant
After the design is accepted it is transferred to a blueprint from which paper patterns are made,Relevant
The shapes are cut out and pinned to fabric,Relevant
Many layers of plush may be stacked with the pattern pinned on the top and a cutter with a blade much like a band saw is used to cut out many pieces at one time,Relevant
Rows of workers sit behind industrial sewing machines,Irrelevant
Each is responsible for one style of bear,Irrelevant
He or she will assemble the small pieces first add the eyes and grommet attachments to the face and then stitch the parts together,Relevant
The bears are inside out with their seams exposed and openings down the long seam in the back,Relevant
Finally the bears are pulled right side out and dispatched to be stuffed,Relevant
The volume a worker produces depends on the type of bear one may produce 35 to 45 baby bears in one day or eight or nine larger species,Relevant
The stitched bear is then stuffed,Relevant
The manufacturer purchases polyester fiber in 500 lb (227 kg) bales in which the fiber is tightly packed,Relevant
The fiber is dual density with a very fine fiber and a thicker slightly wavy fiber together these fibers have the most desirable packing quality for stuffing animals,Irrelevant
Because the polyester comes so tightly packed batches of it are tossed into a picker which is a barrel lined with spikes that fluffs the stuffing,Irrelevant
The fluffed material is blown by air into a stuffing machine,Relevant
These machines have evolved little since World War H when the machines were used to stuff flight jackets for the United States Navy and Army Air Force,Irrelevant
Air pressure blows the stuffing into the bear through a small diameter tube,Relevant
The operator can manipulate the bear to direct the stuffing to various parts of the toy,Irrelevant
A pedal release on the stuffing machine controls the puffs of stuffing,Irrelevant
Two pushes on the pedal for example may be needed to pump enough stuffing from the machines nozzle into the nose of the bear which needs to be firm,Irrelevant
The head feet and paws also need to be firm but the body should be squeezably soft,Irrelevant
The operator can always apply the hug test to evaluate satisfactory cuddliness and provide quality control from bear to bear,Irrelevant
The stuffed bear is then passed to another worker a bear surgeon who stitches up the opening in the back of the bear,Relevant
The whole bear is then groomed,Relevant
Because the plush fabric was stitched inside out fur is caught in the seams and must be pulled out so the seams do not show,Irrelevant
An electrically powered wire brush is used to fluff the seams and the bear is then blown through an array of air jets to remove the loose fuzz and brush the fur,Relevant
Final details like costumes ribbons and accessories are added before the bear is packaged for transport and sale,Relevant

Almost all television housings are made of plastic by the process of injection molding in which precision molds are made and liquid plastic is injected under high pressure to fill the molds,Irrelevant
The pieces are released from the molds trimmed and cleaned,Relevant
They are then assembled to complete the housing,Relevant
The molds are designed so that brackets and supports for the various components are part of the housing,Relevant
The television picture tube or cathode ray tube (CRT) is made of precision glass that is shaped to have a slightly curved plate at the front or screen,Relevant
It may also have a dark tint added to the face plate glass either during production of the glass or by application directly to the inside of the screen,Irrelevant
Darker face plates produce improved picture contrast,Irrelevant

When the tube is manufactured a water suspension of phosphor Television chemicals is allowed to settle on the inside of the face plate and this coating is then overlaid with a thin film of aluminum that lets electrons pass through,Relevant
The aluminum serves as a mirror to prevent light from bouncing back into the tube,Irrelevant
Glass for picture tubes is supplied by a limited number of manufacturers in Japan and Germany,Relevant
Quantities of the quality of glass needed for picture tubes are limited and the emergence of largescreen sets has created a shortage in this portion of the industry,Irrelevant
The large screens are also very heavy so flatpanel displays using plasmaaddressed liquid crystal (PALC) displays were developed in the 1980s,Irrelevant

This gas plasma technology uses electrodes to excite layers of neon or magnesium oxide so they release ultraviolet radiation that activates the phosphor on the back of the television screen,Irrelevant
Because the gas is trapped in a thin layer the screen can also be thin and lightweight,Irrelevant
Projection TVs use digital micro mirror devices (DMDs) to project their pictures,Relevant
A shadow mask with 200000 holes lies immediately behind the phosphor screen the holes are precisely machined to align the colors emitted by three electron beams,Relevant
Todays best picture tubes have shadow masks that are manufactured from a nickeliron alloy called Invar lesser quality sets have masks of iron,Irrelevant
The alloy allows the tube to operate at a higher temperature without distorting the picture and higher temperatures allow brighter pictures,Relevant
Rareearth elements have also been added to the phosphor coating inside the tube to improve brightness,Relevant
The electrons are fired by three tubular metal electron guns that are carefully seated in the neck or narrow end of the tube,Relevant
After the electron guns are placed inside the tube the picture tube is evacuated to a near vacuum so air does not interfere with the movement of the electrons,Relevant
The small opening at the rear of the tube is sealed with a fitted electrical plug that will be positioned near the back of the set,Relevant
A deflection yoke consisting of several electromagnetic coils is fitted around the outside of the neck of the picture tube,Relevant
The coils cause pulses of high voltage to direct the scanning electron beams in the proper direction and speed,Relevant
The housing also contains fittings for speakers wiring and other parts of the audio system,Relevant
The speakers are usually made by a specialized manufacturer to the specifications of the television manufacturer so they are assembled in the set as components or a subassembly,Relevant
Electronic sound controls and integrated circuitry are assembled in panels in the set as it travels along the assembly line,Relevant
The electrons are fired by three tubular metal electron guns seated in the neck or narrow end of the picture tube,Relevant
After the electron guns are placed inside the tube the picture tube is evacuated to a near vacuum so air does not interfere with the movement of the electrons,Relevant
A color selection filter with 200000 holes lies immediately behind the television screen the holes are precisely machined to align the colors emitted by three electron beams,Relevant
When the picture tube and the audio speakers and attachments are assembled in the set other electronic elements are added to the rear of the set,Relevant

The antennae cable jacks other input and output jacks the electronics for receiving remote control signals and other devices are prepared by specialty contractors or as subassemblies elsewhere on the assembly line,Relevant
They are then mounted in the set and the housing is closed,Relevant
Most rackets sold in the United States are mass produced at one of several large factories in Japan or elsewhere in Asia,Irrelevant
So regardless of the brand chances are the racket was made by one of the methods described below,Irrelevant
Rackets with unusual features might be exceptions,Irrelevant
Also top of the line rackets are often sold unstrung and the buyer has it strung to his or her specifications at a pro shop,Irrelevant
So in this case the stringing step at the factory would be skipped,Irrelevant
There are two methods for forming aluminum rackets,Irrelevant
The aluminum may be melted and forced through a die in the shape of the racket frame,Irrelevant
Or the metal may first be melted and extruded into a tube and then the tubing drawn through a die,Irrelevant

The rough racket is then placed in a drilling machine and holes are drilled for the yoke—the throat piece that holds the bottom of the strings—on the sides for the strings and at the base of the stick,Relevant
The drilling machine uses multiple spindles each holding a drill bit in position for each string hole,Relevant
The racket is held in place horizontally in the center of the machine,Relevant
The drills are then activated and all the holes are drilled simultaneously,Relevant
The frames are then placed in a sander to smooth out sharp edges left from the drilling,Relevant
At this stage the rackets are O tempered that is subjected to heat and rapid cooling,Irrelevant
This process hardens the aluminum giving the racket additional strength,Relevant
The rackets are placed on a tray in an oven and heated to whitehot,Relevant
Then the tray is removed from the oven and the rackets are immersed in water,Relevant
After tempering the rackets may also be anodized,Relevant
They are immersed in a mild sulfuric acid solution and an electric current is passed through the bath,Relevant
This treatment changes the surface of the aluminum and gives the rackets a shiny finish,Relevant
A grommet strip is inlaid in the groove around the edge of the head,Relevant
The flexible grommet strip usually plastic has been predrilled so that its holes fit over the string holes in the frame head,Relevant
Then the yoke is fitted into the base of the racket head,Relevant
Now the racket is ready for stringing,Relevant
Each racket is strung individually by a worker seated at a stringing machine,Relevant
The worker first clamps the racket into the machine which holds it horizontally,Relevant
The worker forces the strings through the holes using a powerful threader mounted on a movable bar above the racket,Relevant
The lengthwise strings are pulled through first then Tennis Racket the cross strings are woven through and the tension is adjusted,Relevant
To finish the racket a worker cuts the end of the handle and inserts a cap called the butt cap,Relevant
Next the worker wraps strong doublestick tape around the handle followed by vinyl grip tape,Relevant
After this the strings may be imprinted with a logo and the frame may be stamped with a decal,Irrelevant
Inspectors check the racket for nicks and mars and make sure it conforms to size and weight specifications,Relevant
Rackets may then go through a final cleaning stage,Irrelevant
Then workers place them in protective covers the rackets are packaged and finally sent to a warehouse for distribution,Relevant

Composite rackets are made out of layers of different materials usually graphite and fiberglass and perhaps other layers containing boron kevlar or a material similar to fiberglass that contains ceramic particles,Relevant
The racket manufacturer begins by assembling the layers as a flat sandwich,Relevant
The sandwich is then cut into strips and the strips rolled around a hollow flexible tube,Relevant
The wrapped tube is then placed into a racketshaped mold,Relevant
The tube extends all the way through the racket and is connected to a pump,Relevant
Then the mold is heated and air pumped into the tube,Relevant
The pressure of the air in the tube along with the heat bond the layers of the sandwich,Relevant
Alternately the hollow tube may be filled with polyurethene foam,Irrelevant
The foam expands as the mold is heated consolidating the materials,Relevant
Workers release the rackets from the molds and carry them to an inspection area where any defective ones are removed,Relevant
The end of the frame is cut and then the rackets are placed in a drilling machine and the string holes are drilled as above,Relevant
After drilling the rackets are brushed with a polymer coating and placed in a dryer,Relevant
This step is repeated several times and then the rackets are sanded,Relevant
Before the final coating the brand name decal is applied,Relevant
The next steps are the same as for the aluminum racket previously described,Relevant
A grommet strip and yoke are fixed in the appropriate grooves and workers string the rackets one at a time on stringing machines,Relevant
A logo or brand name may be screen printed on the strings,Irrelevant
Workers insert the butt cap then wind doublestick tape and grip tape around the handle,Relevant
Then the rackets are cleaned inspected packaged and sent to a warehouse,Relevant
A variety of specialized equipment is used to press the pulp mixture or furnish into a nonwoven sheet of fabriclike paper,Irrelevant
Nonwoven fabrics are different from traditional fabrics because of the way they are made,Irrelevant
Traditional fabrics are made by weaving fibers together to create an interlocking network of fiber loops,Irrelevant
Nonwovens are assembled by mechanically chemically or thermally interlocking the fibers,Relevant
There are two primary methods of assembling nonwovens the wet laid process and the dry laid process,Irrelevant
The wet laid process is employed for making the type of nonwoven used in tissue production,Relevant
The slurry flows into a device known as a headbox which in turn spreads it on a moving wire mesh known as a Fourdrinier,Relevant
The Fourdrinier is a continuous wire belt approximately 50 feet (15 m) or more in length which is stretched out like a table,Irrelevant
As the fibers are travel down this belt much of the water drains through the holes in the wire mesh,Irrelevant
The wet sheet of fibers is carried by a series of woolen blankets called felts between several sets of rolls which further compress it and remove more water,Relevant
At this point the sheet is strong enough to be transferred to a drying machine that is especially adapted for making tissue papers,Irrelevant
The tissue paper drier is called a Yankee Dryer and consists of a steamheated highly polished roller 1012 feet (34 m) in diameter,Irrelevant
The wet sheet is carried by a heavy canvas felt which is threaded over and around the rollers,Relevant
With each successive pass the rollers remove more water until the paper is adequately dried,Relevant
If desired a pattern may be imprinted in the tissue by juxtaposing the web on an array of supports during the dewatering process,Irrelevant
(Alternately the web can be dewatered and transferred to a separate imprinting line),Irrelevant
The raised supports on the line create bumps and valleys on the fabric,Relevant
These are regions of varying fiber density and are visible as tiny patterned pillows on the final sheet,Irrelevant
If necessary these high bulk areas can be densified even further by applying a vacuum to selected portions of the sheet,Irrelevant
After the fabric been compressed to the desired thickness it is referred to as a web,Irrelevant
The web is now ready for additional processing,Relevant
It may be coated or stored on large vertical rollers known as calendar stacks to await further operations,Relevant
The lotion is prepared in steamheated batch tanks equipped with high speed mixing blades,Relevant
The oils and water may be preheated and are blended together with high shear to form an emulsion,Relevant
The completed lotion is ready to be applied to the paper surface and is pumped from the batch tanks to a holding vessel connected to the coating equipment,Relevant
The nonwoven web is fed onto a series of papermaking belts,Relevant
As it travels over the belts the web comes into contact with an emulsion distributing roller which pulls lotion out of the holding tank and coats a thin film onto the web,Relevant
Ideally low amounts of lotion are applied (03 or less) to prevent the web from being overcoated,Relevant
However higher levels can be used if the coating is designed with additional surfactants that will act as wetting agents to help the tissue absorb moisture through its hydrophobic layer,Irrelevant
After passing through the coating rollers the web continues along the belts to other rollers which strip excess lotion from the fabric,Relevant
In between processes the belts are kept clean by beltcleaning showers that remove paper fibers adhesives and other additives,Relevant
The web passes through a series of rotating knives that cut it to the desired width,Relevant
The coated tissue is then sliced at tissuesized intervals folded and packaged in boxes or cellophane wrap,Relevant
