After transporting the raw materials into the factory the ingredients are both manually and mechanically weighed,Relevant
This ensures accuracy in the ingredients proportions,Relevant
Then the ingredients are mixed together,Relevant
Usually the glycerinwater mixture is done first,Relevant
All the ingredients are mixed together in the mixing vat,Relevant
The temperature and humidity of vat are watched closely,Relevant
This is important to ensuring that the mix comes together correctly,Relevant
A commonly used vat in the toothpaste industry mixes a batch that is the equivalent of 10000 fourounce (118 ml) tubes,Relevant
Before tubes are filled with toothpaste the tube itself passes under a blower and a vacuum to ensure cleanliness,Relevant
Dust and particles are blown out in this step,Relevant
The tube is capped and the opposite end is opened so the filling machine can load the paste,Relevant
After the ingredients are mixed together the tubes are filled by the filling machine,Relevant
To make sure the tube is aligned correctly an optical device rotates the tube,Relevant
Then the tube is filled by a descending pump,Relevant
After it is filled the end is sealed (or crimped) closed,Relevant
The tube also gets a code stamped on it indicating where and when it was manufactured,Relevant
After tubes are filled they are inserted into open paperboard boxes,Relevant
Some companies do this by hand,Irrelevant
The boxes are cased and shipped to warehouses and stores,Relevant
(Most trampolines intended for home use are packed to be assembled by the consumer),Irrelevant
Therefore this section will describe the process of fabricating individual components,Irrelevant
When the tubing arrives at the trampoline factory it is bent into an arc on the bending jig,Relevant
Holes are punched into the sides for the springs,Relevant
Sockets are welded so that the Ushaped legs can fit into the frame,Relevant
The tubing often comes in four pieces,Relevant
When connected all four create a circular design,Relevant
One end of each arc is swaged—squeezed down—so that the pieces can be put together,Relevant
Once delivered to the factory the fabric for the jumping mat is cut to size,Relevant
Using industrial sewing machines the fabric is edged and reinforced web strapping is sewn on,Relevant
Drings are also sewed into the fabric to hold the mat to the frame,Relevant
Around the foam core of the safety pads a vinyl cover and pie straps are sewn to increase durability,Relevant
The springs do not require any additional manufacturing processes at the factory,Irrelevant
They are packaged along with the other parts for final shipment,Relevant
It takes about 80 people working an eighthour shift in the trampoline factory to make 500 to 600 trampolines,Irrelevant
A vitamin manufacturer purchases raw vitamins and other ingredients from distributors,Relevant
Raw vitamins from a reputable distributor arrive with a Certificate of Analysis stating what the vitamins are and how potent they are,Relevant
In many cases the manufacturer will nevertheless test the raw materials or send samples to an independent laboratory for analysis,Irrelevant
If herbs are to be an ingredient in the vitamin capsule these must be tested for identity and potency and for possible bacterial contamination as well,Irrelevant
Often the raw vitamins arrive at the manufacturer in a fine powder and they need no preliminary processing,Irrelevant
However if the ingredients are not finely granulated they will be run through a mill and ground,Irrelevant
Some vitamins may be preblended with a filler ingredient such as microcrystalline cellulose or maltodextrin because this produces a more even granule which aids further processing steps,Irrelevant
Laboratory technicians may run test batches when working with new ingredients and determine if preblending is necessary,Irrelevant
For vitamin tablets particle size is extremely important in determining how well the formula will run through the tabletting machine,Irrelevant
In some cases the raw vitamins arrive from the distributor milled to the appropriate size for tabletting,Irrelevant
In other cases a wet granulation step is necessary,Irrelevant
In wet granulation the fine vitamin powder is mixed with a variety of cellulose particles Vitamin then wetted,Relevant
The mixture is then dried in a dryer,Relevant
After drying the formula may be in chunks as large as a dime,Irrelevant
These chunks are sized by being run through a mill,Relevant
The mill forces the chunks through a small hole of the desired diameter of the granule,Relevant
These granules can then be weighed and mixed,Irrelevant
When all the vitamin ingredients are ready a worker takes them to the weigh station and weighs them out on a scale,Relevant
The required weights for each ingredient in the batch are listed on a formula batch record,Relevant
After weighing the worker dumps all the ingredients into a mixer,Relevant
The volume of a typical mixer may be from 1530 cu ft (042084 cu m) though in a large manufacturing facility it may be many times that large,Irrelevant
The ingredients spend from 15 to 30 minutes in the mixer,Relevant
At this point samples are taken from different sides of the mixer and checked in the laboratory,Relevant
The lab technicians verify that all the ingredients are distributed in the same proportion throughout the mix,Relevant
If the manufacturer is making a large batch workers may check the first three or four lots in the mixer and then only recheck periodically,Irrelevant
After mixing is complete workers take the vitamin formula to either an encapsulating or a tabletmaking machine,Relevant
If the lot in the mixer has been approved workers tote the mixture to the encapsulating machine and dump it in a hopper,Relevant
At the beginning of a batch workers will testrun the encapsulating machine and check that the capsules are the proper and consistent weight,Relevant
Workers also check the capsules visually to see if they seem to be splitting or dimpling,Relevant
If the test batches run correctly workers run the entire batch,Relevant
The vitamin mixture flows through one hopper and another hopper holds whole gelatin capsules,Relevant
The capsules are broken into halves by the machine,Relevant
The bottom half of the capsule falls through a funnel into a rotating dosing dish,Relevant
Then the machine measures a precise amount of the powdered vitamin mixture into each open capsule half,Relevant
Tamping pins push the powder down,Relevant
Then the top halves of the capsules are pushed down onto the filled bottoms,Relevant
The finished vitamin mixture can be compressed into tablets sometimes with a coating or encapsulated in preformed gelatin capsules,Relevant
The filled vitamin capsules are next run through a polishing machine,Relevant
The vitamins are circulated on a belt through a series of soft brushes,Relevant
Any excess dust or vitamin powder is removed from the exterior of the capsules by the brushes,Relevant
The polished capsules are then poured onto an inspection table,Relevant
The inspection table has a belt of rotating rods,Relevant
The vitamins fall in the grooves between the rods and the vitamins rotate as the rods turn,Relevant
Thus all sides of the vitamin are visible for the inspector to see,Relevant
The inspector removes any capsules that are too long split dimpled or otherwise imperfect,Relevant
The vitamins that pass inspection are then taken over to the packaging area,Relevant
Vitamin tablets are made in a tableting machine,Relevant
After the vitamin blend has been mixed in the mixer workers dump it into a hopper above the machine,Relevant
The vitamin powder then flows through the hopper to a filling station beneath and flows from there to a rotating table,Relevant
The rotating table may be 24 ft (0612m) in diameter or even bigger and is fitted with holes on its outside edge that hold dies in the shape of the desired tablet (oval round animal etc),Irrelevant
The dies are interchangeable so the same table can produce whatever shape the manufacturer wishes as long as the proper dies are installed,Irrelevant
The vitamin powder flows from the filling station to fill the die,Relevant
When the table rotates the filled die moves into a punch press,Relevant
When the upper and lower halves of the punch meet 410 tons (369 metric tons) of pressure is exerted on the vitamin powder,Relevant
The pressure compresses the vitamin powder into a compact tablet,Relevant
The punch releases and the lower punch lifts to eject the tablet,Relevant
Some tableting machines may have two punches one on each side so two tablets are made simultaneously,Irrelevant
The speed of the rotation of the table determines how many tablets are made per minute,Relevant
The tablets eject onto a vibrating belt which vibrates any loose dust off the tablets,Relevant
The tablets then are moved to the coating area,Relevant
Vitamin tablets are usually coated for a variety of reasons,Relevant
The coating may make the tablet easier to swallow,Irrelevant
It may mask an unpleasant taste and it may give the tablet a pleasant color,Irrelevant
A manufacturer may coat in two different colors tablets that are the same size and shape for identification,Irrelevant
Tablets may also be given an enteric coating—a pH sensitive chemical coating that resists gastric acid,Irrelevant
Tablets with an enteric coating will not break open in the stomach but move to the intestine before dissolving,Relevant
Other coatings determine the timing of the tablets dissolution so the vitamins can be absorbed slowly or all at once depending on what is appropriate to that tablet,Irrelevant
Once the tablets are taken from the tableting area they are placed in the coating pan,Relevant
The coating pan is a large rotating pan surrounded by one to six spray guns operated by pumps,Relevant
As the tablets revolve in the pan the pumps spray coating over them,Relevant
Many tablets also receive a second coating of carnauba wax,Relevant
After air drying the tablets are ready for packaging,Relevant
The packaging step is the same for tablets as for capsules,Relevant
Packaging the vitamins takes several steps and different machines carry out these steps,Relevant
So in the packaging area the vitamins pass through a row of machines,Relevant
Once the vitamins are dumped in the hopper of the first machine no human touches them,Relevant
The worker sets the machine to count out the required number of capsules or tablets per bottle and the rest is done automatically,Relevant
The capsules or tablets fall into a bottle and the bottle is passed to the next machine to be sealed capped labelled and shrinkwrapped,Relevant
The finished bottles are then set in boxes and are ready for distribution,Relevant
Ground wood sheets of paper are produced by using an entire tree removing the bark and pressing the tree against a revolving tread which grinds the wood into slurry,Relevant
The slurry is used to make a ground wood sheet—a relatively inexpensive wallpaper backing,Relevant
Wood pulp sheets are made by debarking a tree and chipping the tree into a slurry,Relevant

The mixture is run through a pulp mill where chlorine dioxide and oxygen are added to separate the lignin (which cements the woody cell walls together) from the rest of the wood pulp and bleaches the pulp,Relevant
Wood pulp sheets with fibers can have synthetic fibers added to give the paper additional texture,Irrelevant
A roll of paper from the paper mill is 65 in (165 m) wide possibly as long as 22000 ft (6706 m) and weighs approximately one ton,Irrelevant
Once sold to a printer each paper roll is cut into six subrolls which are 21 in (53 cm) wide by 10000 ft (3048 m) long,Relevant
Before the pattern is printed the backing must be coated with a ground color,Irrelevant
Ground wood sheets are coated with colored vinyl (PVC) which varies in thickness depending on the durability and strippability of paper under production,Relevant
Vinyl may also be laminated to backings for exceptional serviceability,Irrelevant
Wood pulp sheets are coated with one or all of the following kaolin clay for drapability titanium dioxide for opacity and latex for ease in handling and color,Relevant
Metal rollers impregnated with a raised rubber pattern are mounted on a single machine,Relevant
Ink is applied to the surface roller and the ink lays in the hills or rubber pattern sitting above the surface of the roller,Relevant
The ink is then pressed onto the paper,Relevant
Each color of the pattern is printed with a single roller,Relevant
Copper cylinders are laseretched then chromeplated for durability,Relevant
Large gravureprinting machines hold a maximum of 12 cylinders that together create the whole pattern,Irrelevant
The paper roll moves to one cylinder a back roller picks up color and pushes it against an engraved roller,Relevant
A steel doctor blade pushes against the engraved cylinder forcing ink into the etched detail,Relevant
A rubber roller then presses paper against the cylinder enabling it to pick up the ink in the valleys of the engraving,Relevant
Finally rollers carry the paper away from the cylinder into a dryer where the ink is set,Relevant
Once the ink is dry the process begins again with the next cylinder,Irrelevant
Stencils for each color present in the pattern are created from silk mesh screen using a photographic process,Relevant
First a photographic negative is made of the pattern,Relevant
Then a silk screen approximately 36 in (91 cm) long is stretched taut over a magnesium or wood frame,Relevant
The screen is coated with a light sensitive emulsion and the negative is placed on top of the screen,Relevant
Once hit with bright light the emulsion hardens in the areas not covered by the negative forming a stencil,Relevant
Patterns can be printed onto wallpaper by one of several printing methods including gravure printing rotary printing and silkscreen printing,Irrelevant
Paper is set upon a long table a screen stencil is placed on top and ink is applied by a scraper or squeegee,Relevant
Color is deposited on the paper where the screen permits the ink to pass through to the paper,Relevant
The stencil is picked up moved down the paper and inked again along the entire length of the paper roll,Relevant
Before the next color is applied the ink is thoroughly dried,Relevant
Each screen is carefully put down with blocks guides etc,Relevant
so that the pattern is aligned and repeats without breaks,Relevant
Hand printing produces patterns with thick evenly applied color,Relevant

Theoretically the number of colors used in the screening process is limitless however the high cost of hand printing necessarily limits the number of colors companies can include in the pattern,Irrelevant
This type of printing process combines the mechanics of gravure printing with the precision of photographically produced stencils,Irrelevant
Mesh stencils are wrapped around hollow tubes mounted within a machine,Relevant
Ink continuously flows through the filmwrapped tubes and onto paper imparting a tremendous amount of color (a maximum of 12 colors),Relevant
This technique resembles the more expensive silkscreening but it can print much more quickly—approximately 80 yd (7312 m) of wallpaper per minute,Irrelevant
Printed wallpaper is rolled with a wet cornstarch or wheat starchbased coating and then dried,Relevant
Residentialuse wallpapers are cut down from 3000 yd (2742 m) rolls to 15 yd (1371 m) rolls,Relevant
Commercialuse rolls are generally packaged in 30 45 and 60 yd (27 41 and 55 m) rolls,Relevant
A printed label run number and hanging instructions are placed against each roll and shrink wrapped together,Relevant
Rolls are stored in a warehouse until final shipment,Relevant
The following description reflects the making of a full customfitted handtied humanhair wig,Irrelevant
Such a wig would take four to eight weeks to make and would sell for approximately $2000 to $4000,Irrelevant
The wigmaker must first make sure that the individual hairs are lying in the same direction,Irrelevant
This is done by holding a small bunch of hair in the hand and rubbing the ends between the finger and thumb,Irrelevant
The tips (uncut ends) turn back during the rubbing while the cut ends (which were closer to the hairs root) lie straight,Relevant

If the hairs in the bunch are running in both directions they must be turned by sorting the root down hairs into one pile and the root up hairs into another before recombining them into a single organized bunch,Irrelevant
Very short hairs less than 3 in (75 cm) long are separated out by drawing the bunch through a hackle (wire brush) that is clamped to the workbench,Relevant
After hackling the usable hairs are tied together into bundles of convenient size,Relevant
Fine string is used to tie the bundles tight enough to hold them securely but loose enough to allow the string to be shifted while washing the hair,Relevant
The hair is carefully inspected for nits (louse eggs),Relevant
If any are found they are removed by boiling the hair in an acetic acid solution and combing it through a steeltoothed nitting machine,Relevant
Each bundle of hair is gently but thoroughly hand washed in a bowl of hot soapy water that contains a disinfectant,Relevant
The hair is then rinsed several times in clear water,Relevant
The bundles are carefully squeezed in a towel and allowed to dry either in open air or in an oven set at 176°212°F(80°100°C),Relevant
Bundles of clean dry hair are again hackled to straighten them,Relevant
They are then passed through a set of drawing brushes so the wigmaker can sort them into bunches of equal length which are tied near the root end,Relevant
If desired hair can now be permanently curled or waved,Irrelevant
After the hair is wound onto curlers it is boiled in water for 15 to 60 minutes (depending on the tightness desired) and then dried in a warm oven for 24 hours or more,Relevant
Heads of growing hair are not uniform in color,Irrelevant
The wigmaker may prepare hair for a specific wig by blending as many as five or more slightly different shades of hair together to produce a more natural look,Relevant
In order to get the best possible fit the foundation of a custom wig is made as close as possible to the shape of the clients head,Relevant
This can be accomplished either by measuring several aspects of the head directly or by making a plaster cast of the head and using it as a model,Relevant
Six basic measurements are taken of the customers head,Relevant
The circumference is measured a half inch (127 cm) above the hairline at the nape of the neck above each ear and across the front of the head a half Wiginch (127 cm) above the hairline,Relevant
For adults this measurement ranges from 1924 in (4861 cm),Irrelevant
The second measurement is from the hairline at the front of the head to the hairline at the nape of the neck,Relevant
The third is taken between points just in front of each ear along the hairline at the front of the head,Relevant
The fourth goes across the crown of the head from just above one ear to just above the other,Relevant
The fifth runs straight across the back of the head from one temple to the other,Relevant
Finally the sixth measurement traces the nape of the neck,Relevant

In addition the wigmaker must note such information as any unusual shape of the head the length and location of any desired parting of the hair and the desired style of the hair on the finished wig,Irrelevant
A pattern is drawn and cut from lightcolored paper,Relevant
The edge of the wigs foundation is cut from finemesh silk netting that matches the desired hair color,Relevant
This piece varies in width from two or more inches (5 cm) in the front to one inch (25 cm) in the back,Irrelevant
The crown of the foundation is cut from a coarser net made of silk cotton or nylon,Relevant
If a part is to be incorporated in the wig a strip of very fine silk net (white or fleshcolored) is cut and inserted in the appropriate location on the foundation,Relevant
The paper pattern is carefully positioned on an appropriate size block (a wooden headshaped form),Relevant
With this paper lying under the net foundation the mesh of the net is easier to see and knotting is facilitated,Irrelevant
The pieces of the net foundation are joined together on the block by sewing them to pieces of galloon (fine strong silk ribbon that matches the color of the foundation netting),Relevant
The foundation is held in place on the block by cotton thread sewn through the galloon and laced through anchoring points (steel loops hammered into the block),Relevant
Springs sewn into the foundation at strategic locations will hold the completed Wigwig in place on the customers head,Irrelevant
These devices 152 in (3851 cm) long are often made from steel watch springs or elastic bands and are encased in galloon,Irrelevant
Hairs are attached to the net foundation by a procedure called knotting,Irrelevant
Although various wigmakers use at least three types of knotting the single or full V knot is the most common,Irrelevant
It is similar to the knot used in making a latchhook rug,Irrelevant
Using this knot hairs 25 in (635 cm) long must be used to make a wig with 12 in (305 cm) long hair,Irrelevant
Different sizes of ventilating needles can be used depending on the number of hairs that are to be tied together in one knot,Irrelevant
Along parts and the front edges of the wig knots are usually made with single hairs while in the crown up to eight hairs may be knotted together,Irrelevant
A full wig requires 30000 to 40000 knots which take a total of about 40 hours of tying,Irrelevant
When the wig is fully ventilated (ie all the hair is attached) it is removed from the wooden block and mounted wrongsideout on a soft block made of canvas stuffed with sawdust,Relevant
A final row of knotting is done around the edge,Relevant
The inside surface of the wig is pressed with a heated iron to secure the knots,Relevant
The completed wig is pinned to a soft block for styling,Relevant
The hair is gently dampened by combing through with a wet comb,Relevant
Curls are formed as pincurls or on rollers or cotton forms,Relevant
The wig is covered with a net and dried in a warm oven,Relevant
The curls are then unpinned and the hair is combed and styled,Relevant
A net is carefully placed over the finished style and the wig is returned to the oven to set the style,Relevant
There are three major spinning processes cotton worsted or longstaple or wool,Irrelevant
Synthetic staple fibers can be made with any of these processes,Irrelevant
Since more yarn is produced with the cotton process than the other two its manufacture is described below,Irrelevant
Fibers are shipped in bales which are opened by hand or machine,Relevant
Natural fibers may require cleaning whereas synthetic fibers only require separating,Irrelevant
The picker loosens and separates the lumps of fiber and also cleans the fiber if necessary,Relevant
Blending of different staple fibers may be required for certain applications,Irrelevant
Blending may be done during formation of the lap during carding or during drawing out,Irrelevant
Quantities of each fiber are measured carefully and their proportions are consistently maintained,Relevant
The carding machine is set with hundreds of fine wires that separate the fibers and pull them into somewhat parallel form,Relevant
A thin web of fiber is formed and as it moves along it passes through a funnelshaped device that produces a ropelike strand of parallel fibers,Relevant
Blending can take place by joining laps of different fibers,Irrelevant
When a smoother finer yarn is required fibers are subjected to a further paralleling method,Relevant
A comblike device arranges fibers into parallel form with short fibers falling out of the strand,Relevant
After carding or combing the fiber mass is referred to as the sliver,Relevant
Several slivers are combined before this process,Irrelevant
A series of rollers rotating at different rates of speed elongate the sliver into a single more uniform strand that is given a small amount of twist and fed into large cans,Relevant
Carded slivers are drawn twice after carding,Relevant
Combed slivers are drawn once before combing and twice more after combing,Relevant
The sliver is fed through a machine called the roving frame where the strands of fiber are further elongated and given additional twist,Relevant
These strands are called the roving,Irrelevant
The predominant commercial systems of yarn formation are ring spinning and openend spinning,Irrelevant
In ring spinning the roving is fed from the spool through rollers,Relevant
These rollers elongate the roving which passes through the eyelet moving down and through the traveler,Relevant
The traveler moves freely around the stationary ring at 4000 to 12000 revolutions per minute,Relevant
The spindle turns the bobbin at a constant speed,Relevant
This turning of the bobbin and the movement of the traveler twists and winds the yarn in one operation,Relevant
The sliver is fed through a machine called the roving frame where the strands of fiber are further elongated and given additional twist,Relevant
The predominant commercial systems of yarn formation are ring spinning and openend spinning,Irrelevant
Openend spinning omits the roving step,Irrelevant
Openend spinning omits the roving step,Irrelevant
Instead a sliver of fibers is fed into the spinner by a stream of air,Relevant

The sliver is delivered to a rotary beater that separates the fibers into a thin stream that is carried into the rotor by a current of air through a tube or duct and is deposited in a Vshaped groove along the sides of the rotor,Relevant
As the rotor turns twist is produced,Relevant
A constant stream of new fibers enters the rotor is distributed in the groove and is removed at the end of the formed yarn,Relevant
The first yoyos manufactured in the United States were carved out of solid blocks of maple,Irrelevant
This was a timeintensive but straight forward process,Irrelevant
Lumber was first dried in huge kilns,Relevant

This step is critical in the making of a wooden yoyo because wood warps and shrinks as it dries which is something that should happen before it is carved into the specific balanced shape of a yoyo,Irrelevant
Once dried the lumber was cut down to size,Relevant
It was then put on a lathe and using a master pattern to ensure the correct dimensions it was shaved with a variety of chisels into a yoyo,Relevant
The yoyo was either stained with wood stain or painted and then it was finished with clear lacquer,Relevant
Today most manufacturers of wooden yoyos still use this process except that very few make solid yoyos anymore,Irrelevant
Most drill into the wooden halves and connect them with a steel axle,Relevant
However the majority of yoyos made today are of plastic,Irrelevant
That process has nine steps,Irrelevant
Each half of a plastic yoyos is composed of two parts the outer shell and the inner disc,Irrelevant
These two pieces are snapped together and an axle joins two halves to form a yoyo,Relevant

Each half of a plastic yoyo begins as two pieces the flat inner piece that will take the axle is called the disc and the rounded outer piece is called the shell (the butterfly type yoyo is opposite with a rounded disc and a flat shell,Irrelevant
It is made via the same process but on a separate assembly line),Irrelevant
The plastic used to make the discs and shells is fed in the form of solid pellets into a huge funnel with an equally huge screw inside,Relevant
The outside of the funnel is wrapped with flexible strips called heater bands which are like narrow electric blankets for the funnel,Relevant
Each band gets progressively warmer as the funnel gets narrower and as the screw pushes the pellets toward the bottom of the funnel they become more and more liquid,Relevant
This process ensures that the pellets will melt evenly and completely which is critical to the next step,Relevant
At the bottom of the funnel the screw pushes the liquid plastic into a mold through a tube called a gate,Relevant
Inside the mold are the shapes of four discs and four shells all connected by gates,Relevant

The mold has a valve which allows hot air to be pushed out ahead of the plastic and ensures that the mold is completely Wooden yoyos are made from lumber that has been dried to ensure the finished yoyo will not change shape,Irrelevant
Modern wooden models have two wooden halves that are connected by a metal axle,Irrelevant
Wooden yoyos are made from lumber that has been dried to ensure the finished yoyo will not change shape,Irrelevant
Modern wooden models have two wooden halves that are connected by a metal axle,Irrelevant

Because the mold is completely filled and because the plastic has been entirely and evenly melted each shell and each disc will always be perfectly round and have perfectly even weight distribution,Irrelevant
Once the mold is filled it holds the plastic for 17 seconds and cools it with waterfilled tubes running along the outside of the mold,Relevant

Then the mold which is actually two halves clamped tightly together releases the shells and halves all connected by the plastic that filled the gates onto an assembly line to be fashioned into yoyo halves,Relevant
While the molding line is making yoyo halves a separate machine is cutting the axles to connect them,Relevant
The machine is fed long pieces of round metal,Relevant
The exact length of metal to make an axle is fed into a clamp where it is cut,Relevant
The cut piece is then notched at each end so that it will grip the plastic,Relevant
Once the mold releases the flat of shells and discs a worker clips them apart removes any extra plastic and snaps them together to make halves,Relevant
Each shell and disc has a lip that fits into its complimentary piece,Irrelevant
When the plastic is still slightly warm from the mold these lips will snap together,Relevant
Once fastened they will not release,Irrelevant
The halves are sent down a belt to a machine called the hot stamper,Relevant
The hot stamper has a circular tray with cuplike holders around its edge,Irrelevant
Each holder takes a yoyo half and rotates it to a heated press,Relevant
The press feeds a roll of whatever logo the yoyo will display onto the top of the yoyo half,Relevant
It then presses the logo onto the half and heats it affixing the logo,Relevant
Other designs use a round insert displaying the logo which fits into the disc and a clear shell so the insert can be seen,Irrelevant
The halves continue down the line to a worker who places an axle in one half and sets it with a mallet,Relevant
The next worker places the other half on top and sets it with a mallet,Relevant
Then the assembled yoyo is placed in an airdriven press,Relevant
The press has a tray in the shape of the yoyo and a metal plate that fits between the yoyo halves,Relevant
The metal plate has a groove cut out to fit around the axle and is the exact thickness of the manufacturers specified gap between the halves,Irrelevant
When the press fires it both permanently secures the two halves to the axle and sets the correct gap between the halves,Relevant
The finished yoyo is now placed on a table with a spool of string and a cutter at one end and an upright with several notches in it at the other,Relevant
The distance between the cutter and the upright is exactly the length of the manufacturers desired length of string for each yoyo,Irrelevant
The string is pulled down from the spool through the notch in the upright where it is looped around the axle of the yoyo,Relevant
Then it is pulled back to the cutter cut and tied,Relevant
The yoyo is then allowed to hang from its string held by the notch in the upright to twist onto the axle,Relevant
The strung yoyo moves down the line to a machine that resembles a miniature turntable,Relevant
A worker places the yoyo on the wheel holds it down with one hand holds tension in the string with the other hand and with a footoperated switch spins the string onto the yoyo,Relevant
The most common packaging for a yoyo is called a skin card,Irrelevant
The skin card is the cardboard sheet with the product attached to it with what appears to be melted plastic wrap you see hanging on store displays,Irrelevant
To package a yoyo this way a sheet of several cards is slid under a piece of wood with holes in it corresponding to the cards below,Relevant
A yoyo is dropped through each hole onto the card,Relevant
This assures correct placement on the card,Irrelevant
The sheet then moves on rollers to a machine that feeds plastic film over the entire sheet of cards and yoyos,Relevant
The film is made from a special plastic that conforms to any shape and shrinks when heated but does not melt,Irrelevant
The machine heats the plastic which tightly seals the yoyos to the cards,Relevant
The machine then cuts the sheet into individual cards and rolls them into a basket where they are collected and boxed for shipping,Relevant
